loans.name: Ramona Beatriz

texts.es:
La señora Ramona tiene 26 años de edad, es soltera, aún no tiene hijos. Ramona es muy trabajadora, tiene su propia Peluquería en el centro de la ciudad de Caacupé. Su Peluquería comenzó con un pequeño capital y con un crédito obtenido de la fundación paraguaya y acompañado del buen trato con sus clientes el negocio fue  creciendo de manera gradual.
Comenta que tiene muchos clientes y clientas los cuales siempre asisten a su salón. Ella se considera una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, comenta que por medio de su negocio ha podido salir adelante y darle un mejor estilo de vida a su familia. Dentro de sus proyectos está ampliar su local y de esa forma dar trabajo a más personas y generar un poco de ingresos extras.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra al por mayor de Producto de belleza, como ser tintes, gel, y otros químicos para satisfacer los gustos de sus clientes para aumentar sus ventas y por ende aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Sra. Ramona is 26 years old, single and does not yet have children. She is very hardworking and has her own beauty shop in downtown Caacupé. Her beauty shop began with a little capital and with a loan obtained from Fundación Paraguaya. Due to good relations with her customers, the business gradually grew

Ramona notes that she has many men and women customers who always frequent her salon. She is considered a very determined and hardworking woman. She states that through her business she has been able to get ahead and provide a better lifestyle for her family. Among her plans is the expansion of her business so that she can provide jobs for more people and generate a little extra income.

She is requesting this loan to buy beauty products wholesale, such as hair dyes, gels and other chemicals, in order to satisfy the tastes of her customers and thereby increase her sales and her income.

loans.use: to buy beauty products wholesale to supply her shop.

loans.name: Rosa Lastenia

texts.es:
la sra. Rosa Lastenia tiene 40 años de edad,  cuenta con una carnicería, tiene 4 años de experiencia en dicha actividad, misma que le genera ingresos para cubrir las necesidades y obligaciones que tiene en su hogar, Rosa es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijas, todas estudian en el centro educativo público del municipio de las Trojes.   
La Sra. Rosa Lastenia utilizara el credito para la compra de reses vivas para sacrificarlas y ponerlas a la venta en sus carnicería.
su meta es graduar a sus hijas de la universidad.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa Lastenia is 40 years old.  She has a butcher shop.  Rosa has four years of experience in this line of work.  She is able to generate income to cover the needs and obligations of her household.  Rosa is a single mother with three daughters, all of whom are studying at a public school in the town of Las Trojes.  

Sra. Rosa will use this loan to buy beef cattle that she will sacrifice and sell in her butcher shop.  Her goal is to see her daughters graduate from the university.

loans.use: to buy beef cattle.

loans.name: Farhodjon

texts.ru: Фарходчон проживает в районе Шахринав. Ему 33 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Фарходчон имеет среднее образование. Он два года как занимается производством кирпичей. Кредит берет для покупки оптом песка. Фарходчон хочет расширить свою деятельность.
texts.en: Farhodjon lives in the Shahrinav district.  He is 33 years old, married and has four children.  Farhodjon has a secondary education.  He has been involved in brick-making for two years.  He is requesting this loan for the whole purchase of sand.  Farhodjon wants to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase sand wholesale

loans.name: Wangnigninan Group

texts.fr: Le groupe WANGNIGNINAN est formé de trois personnes qui résident toutes dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Sidonie Micheline, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Sidonie Micheline est âgée de 58 ans et est mariée à un commerçant du nom de Justin. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux sont à leur charge. Sidonie Micheline vit ensemble avec sa famille dans une ville du Bénin. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Sidonie Micheline a arrêté l'école à l'Université. Il y a près de dix ans que Sidonie Micheline mène comme activité la vente de divers produits (maïs, farine de manioc, huile végétale, pétrole, etc.) dans son quartier. Sidonie Micheline achète ses produits dans l’un des marchés du Bénin. C’est la troisième fois que Sidonie Micheline et les autres membres du groupe WANGNIGNINAN  sollicitent de crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur servira à renforcer leur activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
The 3 members of the Wangnigninan group all live in the same neighborhood in Benin. The group's representative, Sidonie Micheline, has her hand raised in the photo. She is 58 years old and married to a retailer named Justin. The couple has 3 children, all of whom have received schooling, and of whom 2 are in their care. Sidonie Micheline lives together with her family in a town in Benin. Together, the couple takes care of family expenses. 

Sidonie Micheline stopped her schooling at the university level. For about ten years she has been selling various items (corn, cassava flour, vegetable oil, gasoline, etc) in her neighborhood. She buys her products at one of Benin's markets. 

This is the third time that Sidonie Micheline and the other members of the Wangnigninan group have asked for a loan from ALIDé. This loan will allow them to expand their business, so that they can better meet their customers' needs.

loans.use: to buy corn, barrels of  vegetable oil, and gasoline.

loans.name: Cesaria Rosalia

texts.en: Cesaria Rosalia is 53 years old, married and has seven children. She works hard to provide for her family, buying and selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. She has applied for a loan for PHP 12,000 from NWTF to buy more items to sell to her customers. This will be her 15th loan, and she has been in this line of work for eight years. Her goal is to build and expand her business so that her family can have a secure future.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Gregoria; la socia tiene 51 años de edad, la socia es conviviente, La socia tiene 5 hijos,la socia tiene un negocio de venta de comida,ella anteriormente tenia un restaurant pero ahora vende comida en forma ambulatoria desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de comida. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo,carne y verduras al por mayor.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The borrower is Gregoria. She is 51 years old, lives with her common law husband, and has five children. She has a business selling food. Previously she had a restaurant, but now she sells food on foot from 8:00 am until 6:00 pm. She would like to expand and improve her business. She asks for a loan to buy ingredients like chicken, meat, and vegetables in bulk. 

She is thankful for the support granted to her, and she is committed to making her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients like chicken, meat, and vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana is widowed and blessed with two children. She has been selling goats for the last 13 years to support her family. She also does farming to supplement her income. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. She has requested a loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings to buy goats for resale.

loans.use: To buy  goats.to sell

loans.name: Sharif

texts.en: Sharif is a 28-year-old Lebanese man, who is engaged and lives with his parents and two siblings. He has owned a computer and networking shop since 2006. He really likes his occupation. With his requested loan of $600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will be able to renovate his shop in order to attract more customers. Each day he looks for things to add that are of value so that his business can become more attractive, and he is sure that this Kiva loan will help him fulfill his business needs.

loans.use: to renovate his shop.

loans.name: Baye

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié et père de 7 filles et 3 garçons dont trois vont à l'école.Il exerce l'activité d'élevage notamment l'embouche ovine.Il fait également de la culture de l'arachide et du mil en saison des pluies.Il entretient sa famille avec les revenus tirés de l'embouche et prend en charge les frais de scolarité de ses enfants.Pour relancer son activité, à la sortie des travaux champêtres, il sollicite un pret de 200000f afin d'acheter 20 moutons qu'il va engraisser et revendre au bout de quatre mois. Son ambition est de se lancer dans l'embouche bovine.
texts.en:
Baye is married and the father of seven girls and three boys. Out of them, three attend school. His business consists in raising livestocks, mainly sheep.

He also grows peanuts and millet during the rainy season. He provides for his family with the income earned from his business, and takes care of the school expenses of his children.

To bolster his business at the end of the farm works, he's seeking a loan of XOF 200'000 in order to buy 20 sheep to fatten and resell after four months.

He ambitions to start raising cattle.

loans.use: to buy 20 sheep

loans.name: Bruno

texts.es: Bruno se dedica a la venta de CDs grabados con películas, canciones y otros. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de una máquina selladora para mejorar la calidad de los videos que vende, y también para la compra de CDS en blanco. Bruno es soltero y sin hijos. Vive en la Zona de San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz. Esta es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo de IMPRO y de Kiva.
texts.en:
Bruno sells recorded CDs containing movies, songs, and other media. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a sealing machine so that he can improve the quality of the videos that he sells. He also wants to buy blank CDs. Bruno is single and has no children. He lives in the District of San Pedro in the city of La Paz.

This is the first he has requested a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a sealing machine and blank compact discs.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: Hilda es una mujer de 62 años, que después de haber salido pensionada de una empresa se dedicó al negocio de confecciones en el año 2003, oficio que aprendió desde sus 16 años de edad y despues cuando trabajó de operaria, en una importante empresa de ropa masculina. En su taller elabora toda clase de prendas de vestir, especialmente ropa industrial y en cada época diseños especiales como los disfraces del carnaval; sus principales clientes son empleados, empreas, vecinos   En la actualidad está aplicando a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará telas, correderas e insumos de confección, para responder a solicitudes de conjuntos de blusa y pantalón femenino, multiusos, y juegos de ropa de cama, con diseños de la época navideña. Lo cual hace que esta inversión sea exitosa y que garantice la ampliación de su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Hilda is 62 years old. After retiring with pension, she opened a tailoring business in 2003. Hilda learned to sew when she was 16, and later worked as a textiles worker in a major men's clothing factory. 

She makes a variety of clothing in her workshop, including industrial uniforms and seasonal clothing like Carnaval costumes. Her customers are industrial workers, businesses, and neighbors. 

Hilda is currently applying for a loan from Kiva. It will be her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy fabric, spools, and sewing supplies that she will need to fulfill customer orders for matching women's blouses and slacks, multipurpose uniforms, and Christmas-themed bed linens. She hopes this investment will be profitable and expand her working capital.

loans.use: To buy fabric, spools, and other sewing supplies.

loans.name: Maria Ursula

texts.es:
María, vive en casa propia, con su esposo y tiene tres hijos mayores de edad; María se dedica a la venta de tostadas de plántanos, tiene 4 años en el negocio, surgió por iniciativa propia, trabaja de lunes a sábado.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de aceite por mayor cantidad y plátanos verdes, para tener abastecido el negocio, esto le ayudara para mejorar  y aumentar la producción.
Su aspiración es que su negocio sea cada vez más prospero, para mejorar las situación de su familia.
texts.en: María lives in her own home with her husband and has three older adult children.  María sells roasted plantains and has 4 years in the business, which she started on her own initiative, working Monday to Saturday.  She is requesting a loan to buy a large quantity of oil and green plantains to supply the business.  This will help to improve and increase production.  Her hope is that her business is more prosperous to improve the situation of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of oil and green plantains.

loans.name: Rebir

texts.es: Rebir de 23 años convive con Nery de 22 años, fruto de esta relación tienen 01 hijo. Juntos viven en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de sivia. Rebir es un joven entusiasta y trabajador, nos comenta que antes de dedicarse al servicio de taxi, trabajaba en la agricultura cultivando cacao juntamente con su querida esposa. Ahí es cuando ahorró un pequeño capital, logrando comprarse un mototaxi, que ahora es su herramienta de trabajo. Él realiza el servicio en la localidad de sivia, que para obtener un buen ingreso debe de sacrificarse y trabajar en la madrugada, porque el mayor movimiento de personas es desde las 5.30 de la mañana hasta después de las 8:00; es en este lapso de  tiempo que debe aprovechar para captar un buen ingreso. De esta manera Rebir se gana la vida con el único fin de mantener  a su querida familia. El está feliz con su trabajo, pero mas adelante desea abrir una tienda de abarrotes para que su querida esposa pueda dedicarse a ello. Éste será su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles amueblara su local para abrir su tienda y con el restante comprará repuestos para su moto taxi.
texts.en:
Rebir is 23 years old lives with his wife Nery, 22, with whom he has one child. They live together in their own home, in the district of Sivia. Rebir is an enthusiastic and hard working young man. 

Before starting his taxi business Rebir worked in agriculture, cultivating cacao together with his beloved wife. He was able to save a little money, with which he bought a motorcycle taxi that is now his business tool. He carries out his service in the village of Sivia. To earn a good income he must make sacrifices and work early in the morning, because most people require his service from 5.30 am until after 8:00, therefore he must work during this period to earn money. 

Through his business, Rebir earns a living with the sole purpose of looking after his dear family. He's happy with his work, but also wants to open a grocery store for his wife to work in. This is Rebir's first loan with MFP, and he agrees to make punctual payments. With the 2,000 nuevos soles, he will furnish his premises so that he can open the shop, and invest the remainder in buying spare parts for his moto-taxi.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his moto-taxi, and also buy furniture to set up a shop.

loans.name: Fulgencio Sabino

texts.es: Fulgencio es un hombre trabajador de 65 años que vive junto a su pareja en la localidad rural de Maca, que está ubicada en Arequipa. Él trabaja como obrero agrícola y además se dedica a la agricultura y a la cría de ganado vacuno orgánico, poniendo siempre mucha atención en el cuidado y en la alimentación que les brinda, que está constituida por la alfalfa orgánica que cultiva. Solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar cuatro vacas orgánicas, espera poder vender su leche a un mejor precio por ser orgánica. En el futuro espera poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y seguir contando con buena salud, razón por la cual apuesta por lo orgánico.

loans.use: Para comprar cuatro vacas orgánicas para vender la leche que producen y así aumentar sus ingresos

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.en:
Maria lives in Monterrey Nuevo Leon. She is married and has four children. Two years ago she decided to started a small business selling food and handmade products according to the season in order to support her husband and offer to her children a better quality of life. At that time, they had serious economic problems. After two years or continuous work, she now sells Christmas snacks and Christmas-themed gifts. Maria has been able to give her children what they need and with her oldest daughter working with her, the business will be a success.

The Christmas season is coming to a close, and her orders to his Christmas articles are increasing. Maria requires a loan of $925 USD to purchase a sewing machine and raw materials to cover her great demand for her handmade products, and to help her to maintain and grow up her business.

**This text has been translated from the following original business description

María vive en la localidad de Monterrey, Nuevo León, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos, hace dos años ella decidió emprender un pequeño negocio vendiendo comidas y elaborando manualidades según la temporada, esto con el fin de apoyar a su esposo en la economía del hogar y brindarle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida, ya que se encontraban con algunos problemas en ese momento. Luego de dos años, Maria Victoria continúa con lo que hace tiempo emprendió, ahora tiene un snack y elabora artículos navideños, gracias a esto, Ma.ria ha logrado darles a sus hijos todo lo necesario, con la colaboración activa de su hija mayor en el negocio.

Dado que se acerca las fechas navideñas y los pedidos aumentan, María requiere un préstamo de $925 USD para comprar una maquina de coser y materias primas para hacer frente a la gran demanda de manualidades, ayúdala a mantener y hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase a sew machine and raw materials

loans.name: Sanah

texts.en:
Sanah, a member of MBK, is requesting for a loan of $150. Sanah and her husband have been selling fried food. Sanah and her husband can generate a daily revenue of IDR150,000 with a profit of IDR30,000. Currently, Sanah is able to secure credit terms for the purchase of a motorcycle.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Selling fried food

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora L. makes cows-milk cheese and sells it in the city of El Alto. She also tends dairy cows. These two activities give her the income to provide for her two dependent children. She lives in the rural area of La Paz in the municipality of Achica Baja in Ingavi Province. This loan will go towards the purchase of a cow so Flora can make more cheese. This is her second loan with IMPRO. Her good borrowing history gives her access to this new loan so she can increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Alexis Hult

Flora L., es productora de queso de leche de ganado vacuno que comercializa en la Ciudad de El Alto, también trabaja como ayudante de crianza de ganado constituyendo esta actividad su fuente de ingreso económico que le permite la manutención de sus dos hijos que depende de ella. Flora vive en la Área Rural de La Paz, localidad Achica Baja Provincia Ingavi. El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una Vaca productora de leche, misma que le permitirá producir mayor cantidad de quesos. Es el segundo crédito con IMPRO, su buen antecedente le permite acceder a otro crédito para mejorar sus ingresos económicos.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Maria De Jesús

texts.es:
Maria de Jesus is married with three children; they are 7, 13, and 21 years old. Five years ago her husband lost his job to a disability, making it difficult for him to find another job. The family's debt began to accumulate. For this reason Maria decided to start her own business selling foods. So as not to neglect her children, Maria started preparing various dishes in her home, and little by little client's requests and demands for greater quantities began to increase. Now she has incorporated the service of banquet halls for special events and has received great praise from her clients.

To keep up with client demands, Maria asks for a loan of 825 dollars to purchase necessary supplies for the production of her various dishes, as well as to purchase kitchen utensils. This loan will help her increase her production and her quality of service. By contributing to this business you will be helping this family. They sincerely appreciate your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria de Jesús es casada y tiene tres hijos, de 7, 13 y 21 años de edad. Hace cinco años su esposo perdió su empleo a causa de una incapacidad física, esto también le dificultó para encontrar otro trabajo y las deudas de su hogar comenzaron a acumularse, fue así como juntos decidieron emprender su propio negocio con la venta de comidas, para no descuidar a sus hijos Maria empezó a preparar diversos platillos en su casa y poco a poco se fueron incrementando sus pedidos y las cantidades que demandaban sus clientes, ahora han incorporado el servicio de banquetes para eventos especiales y ha recibido muy buena respuesta de sus clientes.

Para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes Maria necesita un crédito de $ 825 dólares que destinará a la compra de los insumos que requiere en la elaboración de sus platillos, así como para comprar utensilios de cocina, esto le permitirá incrementar su producción y la calidad del servicio que ofrece. Forma parte de este negocio, tu contribución será de mucha ayuda para esta familia. Ellos agradecen sinceramente el apoyo que puedas brindarles.

loans.use: To purchase supplies and work equipment

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
Mrs. Bun Sokunthear, 27, lives in Kampong Cham with her husband and 2 children. She currently earns $15 a day raising and selling ducks and chickens. Her husband is a mechanic and earns $3 a day.

Mrs. Sokunthear has applied for this loan so that she can purchase more ducks to raise and sell, and thus increase their income.

loans.use: Purchase more ducks

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
My name is Maria A. and as of 4 years ago, I've I dedicated myself to making and selling tortillas. Sales have improved during these past few months, and that is why I need to produce more in order to grow my inventory. I also need to hire a person who will be dedicated to the distribution of tortillas, now that the demand has increased and I want to keep my customers happy. In my country, tortillas are a main staple in every family's meal. With the money that I make, I am able to sustain my family (my mother and my siblings).

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Me llamo Maria A. me dedico a la produccion y venta de tortillas desde hace 4 años. En estos ultimos meses la venta de tortillas ha mejorado por lo que ncesito tener mas inventario, tambien necesito contratar 1 persona para la distribucion de las tortillas ya que la demanda es grande y deseo quedar bien con mis clientes, en mi pais la tortilla es uno de los ingredientes necesarios en cada comida. con las ganancias que obtenga poder sostener mi familia (mi madre y hermanos).

loans.use: To purchase cornmeal, salt, matches, water, gas, and coal.

loans.name: Blanca Juliana

texts.es:
Blanca is a member of the Comunal Bank “La Familia”, and lives at 2381 Yarina Avenue in the Yarina Cocha district, department of Ucayali. She is 29 years old and is the mother of three children whom she adores. She is separated, and her small income doesn’t cover the household expenses. With her first loan of 300 soles (US $100) from Manuela Ramos, Blanca decided to begin selling toys, clothes, shoes, and braids and tassels for drapes and upholstry.

She is currently selling toys from her home, where she attends her clients all day. She wakes up very early to take care of her young children and drop them off at school, and then she returns home to attend to her business, as her products are already popular.

With this loan of 1,500 soles (approximately US $502), which she will repay in 4 months, she will increase the variety of her products with the purchase of 3 dozen toys. She will also take advantage of the approaching Christmas season and will buy 50 Christmas decorations.

Blanca feels very calm and has a great desire to keep working at her business in order to make it grow, as well as realize one of her dreams, to have a happy family that she can watch progress and succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Blanca pertenece al Banco Comunal La Familia, vive en la Av. Yarina 2381, del distrito Yarina Cocha, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 29 años D. edad y es madre D. 3 hijos que son su adoración, está separada y sus pocos ingreso no alcanza para los gastos en casa, es así que Blanca, con el primer préstamo D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300.00 (US$100.00) deciD. invertir en la venta D. juguetes, ropa, zapatos y artículos D. pasamanería.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta D. juguetes, su negocio se ubica en su misma casa, donD. atienD. todo el día. Se levanta muy temprano para atender a sus pequeños hijos y dejarlos en la escuela, luego se dirige a su negocio para atender a sus clientes, ya que sus productos tienen una buena aceptación.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 1,500 (US$ 502.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 4 meses, incrementará su variedad D. productos con la compra D. 3 docenas D. juguetes, aprovechando que se acerca las fiestas naviD.ñas, también comprará medio ciento D. adornos naviD.ños.

Blanca se siente muy tranquila y con muchas ganas D. seguir trabajando en su negocio para que éste crezca y pueda realizar algunos sueños que tiene, su familia está feliz D. verla progresar y salir adelante.

loans.use: Buy toys and Christmas decorations

loans.name: Christine's Group

texts.en: Christine would like to use her profits to start breeding local poultry for sale.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Mohammad Nasir

texts.en: Mohammad Nasir lives in district 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is the only one to support his family  -  he is married.  He was in Iran for about 7 years where he had a dress shop. When he came back two years ago he decided to open dress shop in Kabul and now he wants to expand his business so he has requested an individual loan to import new designs of clothes for teenagers to attract a good numbers of clients. This way, he can make a good income and help his family.

loans.use: To import new designs of clothes

loans.name: Zonia Blanca

texts.en:
Zonia has been a member of the community bank “Buena Suerte” for 12 years. She was one of the founding members. Through her work with the community bank Zonia has leaned to save and to live her life according to her personal values.

Zonia is 60 years old. She is a widow and has seven children, two of whom live with her. Zonia is a tailor; she makes dress clothes to order for established clients. Her workshop is located in her house. Zonia also knits beautiful sweaters and baby clothes which she sells to friends and family members.

In addition, Zonia sells cosmetics from a catalogue. She brings these products from Lima and sells them to friends and family.

Zonia needs a loan of 3000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will invest in buying things such as fabrics, lotions, and shampoo.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest earning savings account each associate has. Zonia plans to use her savings to pay for her daughter and niece’s education. Her dreams are to be successful, travel to another country, and to ensure that her daughter will have a better life.

loans.use: Zonia needs a loan of 3000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will invest in buying things such as fabrics, lotions, and shampoo.

loans.name: Duong Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Duong Thi T., 46 years old, is one among 20 first members of TYM Fund. In 1992, TYM Fund of the Vietnamese Women Union came to Minh Phu town to put their microeconomic programs to help Vietnamese women into trials. With 20USD borrowed money, Mrs. T. invested in breeding pigs. Even though she did not earn a lot of profit at first, she realized the convenience in being able to repay weekly and she also appreciated the knowledge she learned from their meetings. She continued to be a member of the Fund and borrowed more more money. Her family situation got better over time and she was able to send her children to school. Her oldest child is now the Director of a software company. Because of the current trend, together with the help of her oldest child, she invested in opening an Internet café. Mrs. T. had lots of customers, especially young people. Her current income is 220-250 USD/ month. In the future, she wants to expand her Internet café to serve more customers. This time she intends to borrow 1200 USD to buy more computers

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Dương Thị T., 46 tuổi, là 1 trong số 20 thành viên đã đi vào lịch sử của Quỹ Tình thương. Năm 1992, Quỹ Tình thương của Hội liên hiệp phụ nữ Việt Nam đã về với xã Minh Phú nơi chị sống để thử nghiệm mô hình cho phụ nữ nghèo vay vốn phát triển kinh tế. Với 20USD vay được từ Quỹ, chị T. đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Sau vòng vốn đầu tiên, số lãi T. được tuy không nhiều nhưng chị T. nhận thấy được sự T.ận lợi trong việc hoàn trả tuần cũng như những kiến thức chị học được trong những buổi sinh hoạt cụm. Các vòng vốn tiếp theo chị tiếp tục tham gia và xin vay những mức vốn cao hơn. Đời sống gia đình dần được nâng lên, chị có điều kiện nuôi con ăn học tử tế. Đến nay 2 con chị đều đỗ đại học và có công ăn việc làm ổn định. Cháu lớn hiện là Giám đốc công ty xúc tiến thương mại chuyên về lĩnh vực phần mềm. Trước nhu cầu tìm hiểu thông tin của thị trường và sự T.ận lợi khi có con làm trong lĩnh vực này chị T. đầu tư vốn mở cửa hàng internet. Khách hàng đến với cửa hàng của chị rất đông, đặc biệt là giới trẻ. T. nhập hàng tháng của chị T. khoảng từ 220-250USD. Trong tương lai chị muốn cửa hàng của mình ngày càng mở rộng để phục vụ nhân dân được tốt hơn. Vòng vốn này chị đề nghị xin vay 1200USD để mua thêm máy tính.

loans.use: Buy computers

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es:
When she was in her second year of college studying education Blanca suffered the loss of her husband. The obligation to look after the support and attention of her children made her abandon her studies in order to look for a job. She managed to work in a school as a teacher for a couple of years and it was going well for her but she also need to look after her house and children. For this reason it occurred to her to set up a daycare center in her own home since she loves children. There she takes care of children from 3 to 10 years of age. She has been offering this service (Mondays-Saturday) for five years.

The goal that Blanca is pursuing is seeing her children finish school and college. The children have for their part promised that when they grow up and have a good job she will not have to work anymore. Until that time, she will continue giving her all in her work.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Cuando cursaba el segundo año de su carrera de Pedagogía Blanca sufrió la pérdida de su esposo. La obligación de ocuparse del mantenimiento y atención de sus tres hijos hizo que abandonara sus estudios para poder buscar un trabajo. Llego a trabajar en un colegio como profesora por un par de años, le iba bien pero también debía ocuparse de su casa y de sus hijos. Es así que se le ocurrió poner una guardería en su propia vivienda ya que le gustaban los niños. Ahí ella cuida de niños desde tres años hasta diez años de edad. Actualmente lleva cinco años ofreciendo este servicio de lunes a sábado.

La meta que persigue Blanca es ver a sus hijos terminar sus estudios escolares y universitarios. Ellos por su parte le han prometido que cuando ellos crezcan y tengan un buen trabajo ella no tendrá la necesidad de trabajar más. Hasta ese momento ella seguirá dando todo de si en su trabajo.

loans.use: Buying educational materials for her child care center

loans.name: Adeola

texts.en: Adeola A. is 35 years old and is married with 4 children. She lives at Iyano_ Ajamgbadi, Lagos State, Nigeria. She has been a secretary in a lending group for the past 3 years. She sells cooked food, and has been doing so for the past 10years. She needs a loan of $350 to buy more cooking items so that she can meet the demands of her numerous customers. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more cooking items

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es:
The mother of Milagros is a nurse. It was from this that the idea arose to start a pharmacy. Milagros takes advantage of the fact that she has to remain at home with her small son, to take charge of the pharmacy. She has tended the business for 3 years.

The loan that she has requested will serve to buy the medicines that she offers in the pharmacy.

Milagros would like the business to grow more.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La mamá de Milagros es enfermera, fue así que surgió la idea de poner una farmacia. Milagros aprovecha que tiene que quedarse en casa, por su hijo pequeño, para hacerse cargo de la farmacia. Ella atiende allí desde hace 3 años.

Los préstamos que ha solicitado le han servido para comprar los medicamentos que ofrece en la farmacia.

A Milagros le gustaría que el negocio crezca más.

loans.use: To buy medicines to sell in her pharmacy.

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: Gifty is a 24-year-old business woman and is married with two children. Her two kids are currently in school. She has been a seamstress for seven years. She sews many types of female clothing including kaba and slit, wedding dresses, funeral clothes, and much more. She also sells women's jeans, skirts, tops and other clothing. She wants to use the loan to buy increased supplies of sewing materials like linen, threads, thimbles, etc. to increase her output and efficiency. She hopes to double her savings to provide her children with a quality education. She is a member of the community group Platinum Group. In this group, members guarantee one another as social collateral to access and repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy increased supplies of sewing material like linen, threads, thimbles, etc.

loans.name: Jemilatu

texts.en:
Jemilatu B. lives in Sabo Oniba, Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 45 years old and married with six children. Since 2000, Jemilatu has been selling vegetable oil as well as producing nylon in her house.

Jemilatu is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. She is requesting a loan of $700 USD to buy a deep freezer so that she can start selling sachet water. She will also use the money to buy a generator so that she can have a constant supply of electricity. She extends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy a deep freezer and a generator

loans.name: Precious

texts.en:
Precious, 36 and married with five children, is a yam seller at the New Benin Market, one of Benin City's largest markets. Precious has been buying yams from wholesalers and selling to people who visit her market stall since 2005. She likes the business because she enjoys building relationships with her customers, and considers good service a key element to business success.

Precious now needs a loan of $425 to purchase more yams to keep her stock up. While she is getting by, she hopes that the extra profit will enable her to take better care of her family and support the growth of her business. She is thankful for assistance from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more yams to sell

loans.name: Irma Aracely

texts.es:
Irma inició el negocio para completar los gastos familiares y poder ofrecerles mejor calidad de vida a sus 2 pequeños: Genaro de 9 años y Karina de 2. Comenzó su negocio de venta de ropa hace mas de 2 en su casa, después busco un mercado donde se instalo y con las ganancias que ha obtenido ahora desea establecerse en un local comercial.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $375 que pagara en 6 meses para compra de ropa de temporada para la próxima época navideña.
texts.en:
Irma started her business to help with the family expenses and provide her two children a better quality of live: Genaro, nine and Karina, two. She started selling clothes from home more than two years ago, then she looked for a market where to sell and with the profit made until now she wishes to establish the business in a commercial location. She needs a loan of US$375 to be repaid in six months to purchase clothing for the upcoming Holiday season.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Parviz

texts.en: Parviz was born in 1973. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from Fuzuli town in an Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, now settled in Baku city. He is married and has one child. He makes fireplaces and has been in this business for eight years. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy necessary items for making fireplaces.

loans.use: To buy items for making fireplaces

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes A. is a 35-year-old local restaurant operator. She is married and has three kids; two of them attend school. She prepares and sells local foods like banku, which is prepared from milled maize grains and is eaten with hot pepper or soup. She says prices of raw materials have gone up significantly, and she needs the support of a loan to enable her to pay her costs. With the loan, she plans to purchase more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood to prepare meals. He would be grateful for this assistance.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for making food for his restaurant

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah C. sells clothing and fabric in Elmina. She has been engaged in this business since 2005.  The loan she requests will be used to purchase of clothing and fabric for resale. She hopes to use the profits from her business to reinvest back into the business and increase her capital base.

Hannah has received up to a junior high school education.  She is married and has one child.   She is responsible for supporting her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic family expenses.  Her husband is a teacher.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and fabric for resale

loans.name: Gladys Gloria

texts.es:
La señora Gladys es socia del Banco Comunal “La Juleñita” del distrito de Juli, Provincia de Chuchito, en el departamento de Puno; tiene 33 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y con 03 hijos a su cuidado, posee estudios de secundaria completa 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 5.5 (cinco años y medio) años, ella refiere que su negocio es la compra y venta de y los bordados en bayeta; su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo adquirir maíz como insumo básico en la preparación de sus platos.
Con este préstamo de S/ 700.00 nuevos soles el mismo que se compromete a pagar en 06 cuotas mensuales; dicho préstamo le será útil en la compra de maíz; por otro lado también podrá adquirir bayeta para seguir haciendo bordados; ella tiene el sueño de tener su propio local de comida al paso; por ello viene juntando todas sus ganancias a fin de lograr sus sueños. 
Ella se muestra muy agradecida a los créditos que viene otorgando Manuela Ramos para el desarrollo de las mujeres.
texts.en:
Gladys is a member of the "La Juleñita” Community Bank of the Juli district, Chuchito province in the Puno department. She is 33 years old, lives with her partner and three children. She has a high school education. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for five and a half years. She notes that her business is buying and selling embroidered cloth. Her first loan was for 300 soles with which she was able to acquire maize as her basic ingredient for the preparation of her dishes. With this loan of 700 soles, she has promised to repay it in six monthly installments. This loan will be useful to purchase maize. It will also let her acquire cloth so she may continue embroidering. She has a dream to have her own restaurant. For this, she is gathering all of her earnings to achieve her dreams. She demonstrates that she is grateful for the loans that Manuela Ramos has granted for the development of women.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase maize and also to allow her to acquire cloth to continue making embroidery.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en:
Mrs. Genoveva B. hails from the beautiful province of Antique. She is 53 years old, widowed, and blessed with 4 children.

She is engaged in food vending business in front of her house. She is requesting a loan amounting to P5,000 as initial capital for purchasing 3 kilos pork, 2 sacks of rice, bananas and assorted vegetables. She will pay the loan in 50 weeks. She already established this business before but it stopped because of capital constraints. This loan is very importan in order for her to realize her dream of expanding her business in the future. She hopes that her children will finish their studies.
	
She is thankful to ASHI for giving the opportunity to have capital for her business and to the Kiva lenders who will support her loan.

loans.use: Buy and sell-Food

loans.name: Saye

texts.fr: Madame SAYE D. est une femme mariée qui habite au quartier Medinatoul de Diourbel.  Son activité principale est le commerce de céréales locales comme les arachides transformées en huile.  Avec ce prêt elle renforce ses marchandises qu’elle revend au marché de Diourbel.  Elle aide son mari à entretenir sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. D. SAYE is a married woman who lives in the Medinatoul neighborhood in Diourbel. Her main business consists in selling local cereals, such as peanuts, transformed into oil. With this loan, she wants to bolster her stock, that she sells at the market in Diourbel. She helps her husband to provide for the family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy local cereals

loans.name: Rosa Graciela

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Graciela, pertenece al Banco Comunal “San Marcelo II”, vive en el Jr. Tupac Amaru  Nº 139, Distrito de Tarapoto, Departamento de San Martín. Es casada, tiene 54 años y es madre de 04 hijos, todos independientes. 

Se inicio con un préstamo de S/. 100.00, por iniciativa propia emprendió la construcción de ambientes para alquiler de dormitorios.
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio, y también se dedica a la venta de marcianos de frutas y bebidas como chichas, gaseosas en todos los sabores y diferentes tamaños.

Con el préstamo de S/. 600.00 que cancelara a un plazo de 04 meses, lo invertirá comprando maíz y azúcar en kilos, para la preparación de sus chichas, también comprará gaseosas en paquetes y frutas como pifayos, cocos, uvas, para la elaboración de sus marcianos.

Ella, toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio, en lo personal, se siente más independiente, segura y capaz.

Rosa Graciela; manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Rosa Graciela belongs to the San Marcelo II community bank. She lives at 139 Tupac Amaru Avenue, Tarapoto District, San Martín Department. She is married, 54 years old and the mother of four grown children. Beginning with a loan of 100 Peruvian nuevos soles, at her own initiative she began construction of dormitory rooms to rent out. She has continued the practice to the present and has branched out into the sale of marcianos (fruit ice cream treats), and beverages like chichas (a maize-based, non-alcoholic fermented drink), as well as soft drinks in all flavors and sizes. With this loan of 600 Peruvian nuevos soles to be repaid in four months, Rosa Graciela will make an investment in purchasing corn and sugar in bulk to make chichas. She will also buy soft drinks by the case and fruit such as peach-palm fruit, coconut and grapes to prepare marcianos. Making business decisions has allowed her to feel more independent, secure and capable personally. Rosa Graciela expresses her thanks to Manuela Ramos for permitting her to grow as a female entrepreneur and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn, sugar, soft drinks and fruit

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Djekafo ont en  moyenne 40 ans. Le groupe est composé  de 6 femmes mariées (dont 5 monogames) qui vivent toutes dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec en moyenne 6 enfants dans le quartier Bamanan kin de Kirango Markala (4ème Région administrative de Ségou).
Le besoin d’augmenter leurs fonds  de commerce  amena le groupe à s’organiser et adhérer au programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son 4ème prêt solidaire, après avoir bien remboursé les trois premiers prêts.
Ce prêt sera utilisé pour acheter,  8 sacs de mil, 7 corbeilles de poisson. Elles s’approvisionnent en mil au marché hebdomadaire de Diamarabougou, en poisson au bord du fleuve Niger à Kirango dont une partie est séchée avant sa vente. Elles effectuent leur vente  à domicile, au marché journalier de Kirango Markala et quelques fois au marché hebdomadaire de Diamarabougou Markala, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée  d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles  comptent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 23.500FCFA par mois  qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour la prise en charge des besoins de la famille (soins de santé des enfants, nourritures, frais scolaires etc.) Elles ont pour ambition d’acheter du matériel agricole (notamment des bœufs de labour, des charrues) afin d’assurer l’autosuffisance alimentaire et de pérenniser leurs activités commerciales.
texts.en:
The members of the group Djekafo have an average age of 40. The group is composed of six married women (including five monogamous) who all live in large traditional families with an average of six children in the Bamanan Kin district of Kirango Markala (fourth administrative region of Ségou).

The need to augment their capital has lead the group members to organize themselves and to join the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which they are now on their fourth solidarity loan, after having repaid the first three loans.

This loan will be used to buy 8 sacks of millet and 7 baskets of fish. Supplies of millet are gotten at the weekly market of Diamarabougou. The fish is gotten on the banks of the Niger River in Kirango, and a portion of the fish will be dried and then sold. Sales are made to customers composed of men and women, at the house, at the daily market of Kirango Markala, and sometimes at the weekly market of Diamarabougou Markala, cash or credit accepted.

The group members each plan to realize an average profit of 23,500 francs CFA each month. The profits will be used essentially to meet family needs (health care for the children, food, school fees, etc.). Their ambition is to buy agricultural supplies (notably oxen and carts) in order to ensure self-sufficiency in food and to continue their commercial businesses indefinitely.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy millet and fish

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca M. is married with 4 dependents.  She has received an education through junior high school. Rebecca sells fried plantain chips at Siwdo, which she has done since 2004. Her husband is a mechanic. Rebecca uses her income to pay for school fees, utilities and food. She will use the loan to purchase more plantain to increase her trade. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rebecca plans to reinvest back into her enterprise.

loans.use: To purchase more plantain to increase her trade.

loans.name: Sulaiman

texts.en: Mr. Sulaiman T., a 36-year-old proud father of five children, all in school, is a Kampala businessman dealing in Irish potatoes and sweet potatoes. In business for over 17 years, he brings in truckloads of potatoes from the villages and supplies them to the various marketplaces around town.  Since the demand is high, Sulaiman is now requesting a loan to purchase larger quantities of Irish potatoes and sweet potatoes. His future plans include educating his children and building rental houses to generate more income.

loans.use: To purchase Irish potatoes and sweet potatoes in large quantities.

loans.name: Inoyatkhon

texts.en: Inoyatkhon is a sharp, energetic entrepreneur from Dushanbe, Tajikistan. She started her own clothing business sixteen years ago and has been building a successful enterprise. She has a good location in the market for her sales and creates an attractive display of clothing for passing customers. She is a married woman with two children. The income she is able to make is a help to her to support her children with a proper education. Inoyatkhon has requested a loan of 12,000 Somoni so that she can purchase an inventory of new clothing. This loan will allow her to increase her income by having the right clothing available to meet seasonal demand. Over the last four years, She has proven to be a great loan client with IMON International. We are glad to have this new opportunity to continue assisting her with her business. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Marco Antonio M. es padre de familia y tiene tres hijos los cuales están estudiando.
A la vivienda del señor Marco Antonio le está haciendo falta las protecciones en las  ventanas y puestas en los cuartos de su hijo en la planta alta, pero no cuanta con el dinero necesario para pagarle a la persona que realizara las protecciones. 
El está solicitando un préstamo y planea pagarlo con los ingresos que recibe como maestro de una universidad.
texts.en:
Marco Antonio M. has three children who go to school. Marco Antonio’s house lacks protection on the windows and doors of his children’s rooms on the second floor. But, he does not have the money to pay someone to install the protection. He is asking for a loan, and he plans to repay it with his income from being a university teacher.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install protection on the windows and doors

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia O. is 59 years old, married with 5 adult children, and a resident of Hacienda Danao Ramona, Brgy. Haguimit, La Carlota City. For years, she and her family lived in house made of bamboo with Nipa (palm leaves) for roofing. Her family lived a hand-to-mouth existence: her husband worked in the sugarcane fields of the sugarcane plantation where they lived. During off-season, she and her husband made charcoal to sell. Since she had some knowledge in hairstyling and sewing she supplemented their income by doing odd haircuts and curls, and some sewing on the side. With their determination to move out of poverty, they were able to send all 5 of their children to finish High School.

Alicia joined NWTF- Project Dungganon in October 2002. She used her first loan to put up a small general store, and raised pigs to sell. Later, she and her husband were able to rent a 5-hectare land where they planted sugarcane and rice.  Subsequent loan cycles also enabled her to purchase a carabao and other equipment that they used in their farming ventures. With the profits from farming and her general store she was able to build a concrete house for her family. With  more stable sources of income, she was able to send her 2 youngest children to college until both graduated, but they are currently unemployed and are helping their parents in their business ventures. 

At present Mrs. Alicia is on her 10th Loan Cycle with a loan of PHP 20,000.00. She needs this additional capital to help her purchase additional goods to resell  in her general store.

It is Mrs. Alicia's greatest dream to help her children improve their status in life, and continue breaking the cycle of poverty that she and her husband started in the family by the sweat of their brow.

About NWTF:  
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon

loans.use: Additional goods to resell in thier general store

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita A. is from the village of Dolores, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old. Margarita is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Margarita owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Margarita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1,500.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Margarita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Margarita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Margarita is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Margarita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy seeds for her crops

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena is a member of the Ngome borrower group in Kihesa, Iringa. She is 28 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 4 children. Her children are 13, 8, 7,  and 4 years old.

Helena has owned a food business selling Vegetable for 1 year, she works 12 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 110,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Helena`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to cultivate more vegetable for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from using this loan, Helena hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy  cultivate more vegetable

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna C.'s an entrepreneur who values her time - she says that time is gold so she does not waste any of it, if she can do something to earn money to achieve her dream faster. She is a 50-year-old widow who lives in the town of Valladolid, Negros Occidental. She has one big long-term dream and several smaller ones. Her biggest dream is to be able to renovate her house, improve her living standards and help her granddaughter afford higher education.

Her smaller, and maybe more immediate dream, is to be able to buy a tricycle (a motorcycle with a side car for passengers or goods) so that she can easily travel from town to town in pursuit of her business. Edna, or "Nanay Edna" (Mother Edna) as most people call her, has an ambulatory business selling fruits in different towns during their market day. She is so focused on her goals that she does not mind the rain or the heat of the sun if her efforts bring her one step nearer to the achievement of her dreams.

Nanay Edna joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 to increase the volume of fruits she offers for sale – in effect also increasing her income potential. She now earns an average monthly income of 10,000 pesos for her tireless efforts. She is very prompt in her payments, and follows all the rules, depositing her payment in the bank a day before the scheduled weekly NWTF-PD Center meeting. She pays directly to the bank to avoid any untoward incidents.

For her previous loan, she got 19,500 pesos which was quite a lot of capital for her, but she was able to fully pay her loan on time and within the term set. This time around, for her ninth loan cycle, she has requested the same amount, 19,500 pesos, to be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital for her business. Income from the business will be used for house improvements.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to realities surpassing their dreams. They have learned to live a life that can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon!

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Melchora

texts.en:
Melchora S. is from the village of Colonia, Valencia Bukidnon. She is 54 years old and married with two grown children. To make a living, Melchora owns and operates a business making and selling snacks like rice cakes, banana cue (fried and sugared or carmelized bananas) and other delicacies in the local community. Melchora has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $75 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Melchora joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melchora is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients to make snacks to sell

loans.name: Juvenal

texts.en:
Juvenal N. is 34 years old and single. He lives in Nyamagabe, which is approximately a 3-hour drive from Kigali, the capital of Rwanda. Juvenal has a successful, small, local grocery store where he sells a variety of goods to a loyal customer base. This is his 3rd year in the grocery business and he employs one person as a helper. His store requires that he work from 6 AM to 7 PM every day. Juvenal enjoys his life as a self-employed man with a successful business.

Juvenal is requesting his first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company. He wants to expand his grocery business by purchasing some additional inventory, such as jam, sodas, juices, and delicious breads. With the sale of additional goods and his improved capital situation, Juvenal will strengthen his business and begin to build a more secure future for himself and his (eventual...hopeful!) family.

loans.use: To expand his general inventory and buy jams,margarine, fruit juice and a variety of bakery products

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de pagnes, elle maîtrise son commerce et a appris cela de sa maman qui était une revendeuse. Son mari est à la retraite et ce qu’elle gagne comme bénéfice lui permet de contribuer aux dépenses de sa famille. Elle s’approvisionne à lomé.La période des fêtes approche et elle souhaiterait gonfler son stock qui est épuisé pour vendre plus,raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 30 pagnes HI-TARGET, 30 pagnes PHOENIX, 25 pagnes WAX.
texts.en:
This woman has a revenue-generating business selling pagnes (colorful West African cloth).  She is mastering her commerce, which she learned from her mom, who was a retailer.  Her husband is retired, and what she earns in profits enables her to help cover family expenses.  She supplies herself in Lomé.  The holiday period is approaching, and she would like to expand her inventory, which is exhausted, in order to sell more.  These are the reasons for her request for a WAGES loan, so as to buy 30 lengths of HI-TARGET pagnes, 30 of PHOENIX, and 25 of WAX.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy "pagne" cloth

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
La socia GLADIS pertenece al banco comunal “LLANKACHINAPAC”.  

La socia tiene 23 años de edad y tiene un hijo varón de dos años. La socia, su esposo Felipe y su hijo viven en la provincia de Urubamba que se encuentra ubicada al norte de la ciudad del Cusco. Nuestra socia tiene una pequeña tienda donde vende celulares (teléfonos móviles). Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo, nuestra socia es una madre joven, trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar y vender más accesorios de celulares para estas fiestas navideñas, así poder aumentar el capital del negocio y así tener mejores ingresos y darle a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida. 

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Gladis belongs to the Llankachinapac communal bank. She is 23 years old and has a 2-year-old son. She lives with her husband Felipe and their son in the province of Urubamba, which is north of Cusco.

Gladis has a small store where she sells cell phones. She has been doing this for several years and it gone very well, thanks to the determination she has devoted to her work. Gladis is a hard-working and enterprising young mother who wants to help her children get ahead in life.

Gladis requires this loan to buy more cell phone accessories to sell during the Christmas season. This will increase her working capital, bring better income, and allow her to give her son a better quality of life.

Gladis is grateful for the opportunity provided by this loan, and commits to making her payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cell phone accessories to sell during Christmas season

loans.name: Batjargal

texts.en: Batjargal is 41-year-old and lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Batjargal sells dairy products at the Narantuul market, the largest outdoor market in the city. She does the business with her husband and their oldest daughter. Although her daughter goes to a local university, she helps in her parents' business whenever she gets some time. Batjargal purchases various dairy products, including cheese, curds, and milk cream from Bayanhongor province, where she and her husband were born. She said that it is easier and more convenient to purchase dairy products from the people they know. She has been selling dairy products for almost two decades at the market and has many repeat customers. Her husband usually goes to the countryside to purchase dairy products and she  sells the products at the market. She says that this business is the main source of her family income and she would like to expand her business as capital allows. Batjargal says that she and her husband hope to see their two children grow up well and obtain a good education. She requests a loan to purchase more dairy products for his family business.

loans.use: to purchase more dairy products

loans.name: Elicita

texts.en: Elicita A. is from the village of Lao Proper, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old. Elicita is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Elicita makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Elicita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Elicita joined GDMPC, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elicita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. Elicita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the second loan taken out by Elicita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Angel Maria

texts.es: Don Angel de 53 años de edad es casado, tiene 5 hijos, todos mayores de edad los cuales ya tienen su propia familia, trabaja como Jefe de Fiscalizacion en la Administracion de Rentas de Chontales desde hace 11 años, su esposa trabaja y le apoya con lo gastos de la casa.  Por medio de un proyecto obtuvo la oportunidad de tener su casa propia, la cual esta pagando y desea realizarle algunas mejoras, como es ponerle ceramica, pues las viviendas las entregan unicamente embaldozadas.  Espera contar con el apoyo de AFODENIC y Kiva para la realizacion de este pequeño proyecto, pues de esta manera su casa se vera mas bonita.  En el futuro espera seguir contanto con el apoyo de esta institucion para seguir mejorando su casa.
texts.en:
Angel is 53 years old, married, and has 5 adult children who each have their own families. He has worked as Chief Auditor in the Revenue Office of Chantales for 11 years. His wife also works and helps out with the household expenses. Through a housing project, he got an opportunity to have his own house, which he is paying for. He wants to make some improvements, such as adding ceramic tile, as the house was delivered with only concrete flooring. He is counting on the support of AFODENIC and Kiva in order to carry out this small project, since in this way he can make his home more beautiful. In the future he hopes to continue working with this institution in order to continue to improve his home.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to put ceramic tile in his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cereals in bulk for resale

loans.name: Liberata

texts.es:
Liberata, es una mujer emprendedora, vive en el Distrito D. Yarina cocha, región Ucayali, tiene 56 años, es madre D. cinco hijos y uno todavía depenD. D. ella.
Liberata se dedica a la modistería (costura), esta actividad la realiza en su casa, es viuda. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Dinámicas”, desD. hace 9 años, el primer crédito que recibió fue D. 300 soles, que fue invertido en la compra D. materiales para lencería.
Ahora necesita un crédito D. 500 soles que será invertido en la compra D. materiales para su negocio y así cumplir con sus pedidos D. costura y tejido. La meta D. Liberata es poner un negocio D. confección y venta D. lencería en su casa.
texts.en:
Liberata is an enterprising woman who lives in Yarina Cocha district, in the Ucayali region. She is 56 years old, is the mother of five children, and one is still dependent on her. Liberata works in dressmaking (sewing). She does this work in her house. She is a widow. She has been part of the “Las Dinámicas” ("Dynamic Women") communal bank for 9 years. The first loan she received was for 300 soles, which was invested in the purchase of materials for lingerie. Now she needs a loan of 500 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of materials for her business so she can fill her sewing and knitting orders. Liberata's goal is to have a business making and selling lingerie from her house.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will use her loan to purchase materials for making clothing

loans.name: Janeth

texts.es:
La señora Janeth vive con su esposo e hijos en la casa de los suegros en la zona de Cotahuma de la ciudad de La Paz; ella y su esposo se dedican a la costura, trabajan con los comerciantes mañaneros (se denominan así por que abren sus puestos de venta muy temprano en las mañanas, de 6 a 9).

El crédito que solicita es para comprar material (tela, botones, cierres e hilo) y confeccionar uniformes para los colegios.

Es cliente de impro y paga muy bien, por lo que puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Janeth lives with her husband and children in her in-laws' house in the Cotahuma neighborhood of La Paz. She and her husband are tailors. They work with the "comerciantes mañaneros" (morning merchants, so-called because they open for business very early in the morning, from 6-9). She will use the funds to buy supplies (fabric, buttons, zippers and thread) to manufacture school uniforms. She is an Impro client and repays well so she qualifies for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric, buttons, zippers and thread.

loans.name: Nora Del Socorro

texts.es: La Sra. Nora del Socorro C. B. profesora de secundaria, tiene 27 años de ser maestra de educación, soltera, tiene un hijo menor en edad escolar, el dinero lo solicita para compra de materiales de construcción como hierro, soldadura y pago de mano de obra, es el sexto crédito que ha tenido con ceprodel y si le han ayudado muchísimo porque solo así ha podido salir adelante con su familia y su casa.
texts.en:
Nora del Socorro C. B. is a high-school teacher. She has 27 year of experience in education. Nora is single; she has a school-age son. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase construction materials such as iron as well as to pay for labor and welding services. This is her sixth loan with Ceprodel. The previous loans have been a tremendous help since they were the only means to move forward for her family and her home.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials such as sand, cement, and stone blocks

loans.name: Sally's Group

texts.en: Sally M. runs a general store selling a variety of different products in her community. She is 40 years old, married and has four school-age children. They are from the town of Luttuad Diffun, Quirino. Sally has been in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Sally joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Sally is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase products to sell. This will be her first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. Sally is the leader of a 5 member group accessing a loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Sally M.'s Group". About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sergio Antonio

texts.es:
Don Sergio es un hombre trabajador de edad de 41 años, vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos, su negocio es una pizzería en donde vende los ricos calzones de pan, pues hace varios años logro hacer su propio negocio ya que tenía la experiencia por que trabajo en una pizzería. Así como también trabajo de albañil, panificador, para llevar el sustento de su familia. Ahora con su esposa atienden  junto el negocio pues no solo pizza vende.
Vende chorizo en el mercado el cual el mismo lo hace por que tiene un molino en donde el muele la carne  y hace cereal pues para el mover el dinero es obtener mejores resultado en su economía. Con este financiamiento comprara cerdos, y materia prima para hacer mas grande el negocio de elaboración de chorizo y entregar al mercado. Entre sus planes es lograr mejorar el local de su negocio para dar una mejor visión a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Don Sergio is a hardworking gentleman who is 41 years old and lives with his wife and two children. He has a pizzeria where he sells delicious baked calzones. It took him several years to establish his own business. Prior to that, he gained experience working at another pizzeria. Sergio also works as a mason and a baker in order to support his family. Now his wife manages the business so that they do not have to rely on just selling pizza.

Sergio sells chorizo sausage at the market. He also owns a mill that he uses to grind meat and process grain so that he can generate extra income to improve his finances. Sergio will use this loan to buy pigs and raw materials needed to expand his sausage business. His plans include improving the location of his business so that his customers will have better visibility.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pigs & supplies for making sausage

loans.name: Chuch

texts.en: Mr. T. is an old, married father blessed with six children. He cares for the two children who attend school. The others are now married and have started new homes. To help with the family’s living expenses, T. owns a horse with a cart attached that he uses to provide a taxi service.  From this, he has been getting a suitable profit to resolve the family's financial problems. T. has a life partner in his wife who appears in the photo here. She stays at home to hold a daily job, which is to raise pigs and cultivate a rice crop. T. will be using his first loan to help to accumulate capital from his wife’s farming business by buying piglets, fertilizer, and crop seeds.

loans.use: To buy piglets, fertilizer, and crop seeds.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina  A. is 54 years old and married. She has 8 children, ages 15 - 31.  She owns a business where she sells ice-cakes: flavored ice in styrofoam cups.  Lina has 3 years of experience in this business.  Lina  needs a loan of WST $2450 to buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2007, Lina  joined SPBD.  This is her 4th loan from SPBD. SPBD loans are Lina 's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags

loans.name: Ayele

texts.en: Madame Ayele A. is married with four children. She works as a merchant selling 'pagnes', lengths of traditional West African cloth, through the streets of Lomé. She’s been working at this business for 3 years and is requesting her first loan from WAGES of 200,000 CFA to purchase more merchandise.

loans.use: To purchase 'pagnes' to sell, walking in the streets

loans.name: La Fe 3,4,5 Group

texts.en:
Rosaura is the coordinator of her group, La Fe (The Faith), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Rosaura’s group is located in the Samana peninsula, a lush, rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure as a single mother with her eight children.
