Rosaura is excited to be taking her seventh loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling clothes by purchasing skirts and pants to sell.

Rosaura will use the profits to purchase a computer for her children to learn on as well as construction materials to finish her home. She thanks you all for your support. 

Although the photo shows some of the faces of more than 15 people this is because this loan was disbursed with a group of 20 people; one group, however, was not (completely) visible in the picture and are therefore excluded from the profile.

loans.use: To buy skirts and pants to sell

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Dominga tiene 44 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a su madre y dos hermanos en el caserío Hornitos una zona rural perteneciente al distrito de Mórrope, provincia de Lambayeque, se encuentra ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
 
Se ha dedicado desde que era muy joven a criar animales en casa de su madre para venderlos a los negociantes de la zona y desde hace más de tres años empezó a comercializarlos en la ciudad de Chiclayo. Ella cría pavos, patos, cuyes y carneros hasta que ya han alcanzado un desarrollo correcto. Usualmente viaja dos veces por semana a la ciudad para ofrecerlos en venta. 

Dominga trabaja arduamente para porgresar y sacar adelante a su familia, con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación su negocio ha ido creciendo con el tiempo y cada vez su demanda aumenta, actualmente ella ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de mas animales para seguir adelante con su negocio de crianza y venta.

Dominga ya ha trabajado anteriormente con el Fondo Kiva con un préstamo otorgado por medio de Nuestra Institución, ella se encuentra muy agradecida con las personas que colaboraron con ella y su negocio. Por ahora su sueño es seguir creciendo para brindarle a los suyos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Dominga is 44 years old, single, and lives with her mother and two siblings in the village of Hornitos. This rural area is part of the district of Mórrope in Lambayeque Province and is located 45 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

Ever since she was a young woman, Dominga has been raising animals at her mother’s house and selling them to local merchants. Three years ago, she began selling them in the city of Chiclayo. She raises turkeys, ducks, guinea pigs, and sheep until they reach the right stage of development. Dominga usually travels twice a week into the city in order to sell her animals.

Dominga has worked hard to make progress and move her family forward. With great effort and dedication, she has grown her business over time and has been able to create more demand. She is currently requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN so that she can invest in the purchase of more animals to raise and sell. This will allow her to continue her business.

Dominga received a previous Kiva loan through Edpyme Alternativa. She is very grateful to everyone who helped her with her business. Right now her dream is to continue growing so that she can provide her family with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more animals

loans.name: Pask

texts.en: Pask N. is currently in the business of selling charcoal out of her home and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Pask is 53 years old and is widowed.   She has 6 children and her children do not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to send three of her children to school.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela lives in a historic city called Lahore, which is located in the Punjab province of Pakistan and is also known as the heart of Pakistan. She has given birth to three children: two daughters and a son. Her eldest daughter studies in 10th standard and her youngest daughter is in 5th standard, while her son reads in 9th standard.
 
A very talented lady, Shakeela is involved in a boutique business where she specifically prepares bridal dresses. Bridal dresses have a high demand, particularly in marriage season, and a very good profit potential.

She purchases cloth and bridal material from Faisalabad, which is famous for its textile industry, and books the orders from different boutiques. She has hired some workers who do the stitching work for her. 

Her husband lives abroad; he works there and sends money every month for the financial survival of his family here. 

Shakeela has applied for a loan from Asasah for her business. With the loan amount, she will buy material such as cloth, beads and tassels in bulk and improve her business condition. She will also hire another worker, which will help her in fulfilling larger orders on time.  

She is very optimistic that she will be able to successfully upgrade her business and increase her income with the help of this loan investment. She has five years of experience in this field and she is very confident about her success. She is a second year loan user of Asasah. In her first year loan, she paid her installments on time and never missed any meetings.

loans.use: Purchase embroidered material for preparing bridal dresses for her boutique business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 27 year old married man with one child. He is the main income provider for his family. He has five years of experience working as a farmer. He has been running his own farm since 2008.

He cultivates all types of vegetables and fruits according to the season. He uses plastic tents to grow his products. These tents also allow him to better monitor product quality as well as grow his products for more months during the year. He works independently in his business.

Today, he is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l.  to purchase needed supplies for his agricultural work.  In the future, he plans to further expand his business and cultivate exotic fruits.

loans.use: to purchase needed supplies

loans.name: Ros

texts.en:
Ros K., 52, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. K. sells traditional cakes for an income of around $1.60 per day. Her husband grows banana trees, earning an income of approximately $7 per day. 

K. is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike for the children to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a motorbike for the children to commute to work

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES UNIDAS”; este banco está situado en el distrito de San Sebastian en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Victoria;  La socia tiene  60 años de edad;  ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos,  La socia se dedica a trabajar desde su casa ella es cesante de la carrera de educación;  La socia ahora está en casa trabajando en impresiones y fotocopiadora, ella implemento un pequeño espacio en casa y puso una fotocopiadora ahora ella comprara una impresora. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar una impresora para su negocio.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member is part of the Mujeres Unidas (United Women) Communal Bank; this bank is located in the San Sebastian district in the province and department of Cusco.

The member is Victoria; she is 60 years old; she is married and has three children. The member works from home; she lost her job in education. The member is now doing printing and photocopying out of her home. She set up a small area in her home and installed a photocopier; now she will buy a printer. The member is requesting this loan to purchase a printer for her business.

The member is grateful for this loan, which was authorized through this system. She promises to make her regular payments in the established time period.

loans.use: Purchase a printer for her business

loans.name: Duve Esther

texts.es:
Duve M. R. es una mujer de 50 años que vive en el barrio Siape y que no se queda quieta porque le da curso a su talento emprendedor; siempre está en función de mirar las oportunidades, comprar, vender  y conocer nuevas personas para convertirlas en sus clientes.
Así ha venido trabajando durante muchos años,  porque desde hace 7,  se dedica a viajar Maicao,  un municipio fronterizo con Venezuela,  para  comprar  víveres como arroz, aceite,  fab, Jabón, leche en polvo, salchicha, refrescos y hasta sabanas.  Cuando inició esta actividad, lo hizo con muy escaso capital y poco a poco ha ido incrementándolo. Duve viaja con su hermana cada 8 días, compra productos que le encargan y los distribuye a crédito  semanalmente, para luego recoger su cartera cada quince; sus principales clientes son sus vecinos del barrio San Salvador  y también tiene en su propia comunidad. Últimamente ha encontrado  muchos de estos artículos a buen precio en Barranquilla y entonces los compra en esa ciudad. Duve  adicionó a su negocio la venta de  calzado a través de guías especializadas y este dinero lo recoge cada quince días y vende por encargos.
Duve es una mujer  muy creativa y dinámica, siempre está en movimiento, le saca mucho provecho a sus capacidades y constantemente permanece identificando nichos de mercado donde pueda ella ganar con su trabajo; se ha dedicado siempre a lo que le gusta y ahí radica su éxito. En época de carnavales, Duve vende camisetas estampadas con lentejuelas que ella misma decora y este es un potencial al cual le saca dinero también, igualmente vende cerveza, sopas y hayacas, ya que aprovecha que en el sector donde vive es justamente por donde se dan los grandes desfiles del carnaval, comparsas  y es  un escenario  de gran aglomeración de personas para disfrutar de estos eventos importantes en la ciudad de Barranquilla. Ella y su familia  conformada por su esposo, pensionado de una empresa, e hijos y nietos, viven en su propia casa  donde ella y su esposo permanecen  siempre unidos  y en todas las decisiones de su hogar. Este es su tercer financiamiento y Duve planea comprar víveres, en un mayor volumen porque tiene encargado, arroz, aceite, fab, jabón, leche en polvo embutidos; ella siente que ha cambiado su vida desde que recibió su primer crédito,  porque ha tenido la posibilidad de dinero   disponible para comprar y responder  muy pronto a sus clientes. Su sueño es ampliarlo  adicionándole prendas de plata porque tiene un potencial de clientes  que conoció en Maicao y así se lo han solicitado, este es justamente su desafío,  pues requiere un poco mas de capital y está trabajando para ello
texts.en:
Duve M. R. is a 50-year-old woman who lives in the Siape neighborhood, and who does not just sit around, because she is giving expression to her entrepreneurial talent: she is always busy looking for opportunities, buying, selling, and getting to know new people in order to make them her customers.

She has been working in this way for many years; 7 years ago, she started traveling to Maicao, a municipality on the border with Venezuela, to buy groceries such as rice, oil, detergent, soap, powdered milk, sausages, soft drinks and even bedsheets. When she began this business, she did it with very little capital, and little by little she has been increasing it. Duve travels with her sister every 8 days, buying products which her customers request, and distributing them on credit each week; she later collects her payments every two weeks. Her main customers are her neighbors in the San Salvador neighborhood and also in her own community. Recently, she has found many of these items for a good price in Barranquilla, and thus she buys them in that city. Duve added to her business the sale of shoes through specialized guides; she sells them on order and collects the money every 15 days. 

Duve is a very creative and dynamic woman who is always on the move. She takes great advantage of her skills, and she is constantly identifying market niches where she can earn money with her work. She has always done what she enjoys, and that is the root of her success. During the Carnival season, Duve sells shirts decorated with sequins, which she makes herself, and this is another source of income for her. She also sells beer, soup and hayacas [a kind of tamale], taking advantage of the fact that the area where she lives happens to be the place where the great Carnival parades take place, so it is a place where great crowds gather to enjoy these events that are so important for the city of Barranquilla. She and her family, made up of her husband, who is retired from work with a company, along with children and grandchildren, live in their own house, where she and her husband always remain united in all of the decisions related to the household. 

This is her third loan, and Duve plans to buy groceries in greater volume, because she has orders for rice, oil, detergent, soap, powdered milk, and sausages. She feels that her life has changed since she received her first loan, because she has had the opportunity to have money available to buy merchandise and respond very quickly to her customers. Her dream is to expand her business, adding silver jewelry, because she has potential customers she met in Maicao, and they have requested this. This is her current challenge, since she needs a little more capital, and she is working toward this goal.

loans.use: Buying groceries in greater volume, because she has orders for rice, oil, detergent, soap, powdered milk and sausages

loans.name: Edisa's Group

texts.en:
Edisa K. is the leader of the group. She is 36 and a widow. Edisa has to raise three children by herself; all of them are in school. Today, this businesslike woman supports her family financially by renting a shop; she sells drinks, foodstuffs, dairy products, and cigarettes. This business was started a year ago. During this time Edisa has aimed to develop and extend her business, and by now she has managed to increase her inventory. She needs a loan in order to purchase more goods to increase her assortment of goods. In the future she is planning to give her children a university education, and then purchase a car.

Edisa’s partners:

Munduk B. is the treasurer of the group. She is 47 and married. All of her four children are already adults. The family budget is being enlarged with cattle trading and with the help of pension benefits. In order to develop their cattle business, the family hopes to obtain a loan.

Jyldyz T., 23, is not married. She earns her livelihood by working as a café bartender in Tokmok City. The main source of income for her family is from cattle breeding. The loan purpose is to purchase more cattle to increase the total number of animals.

Jazgul B., 29, is married. Together with her husband she is raising a son. The mother has the profession of part-programming engineer, and her spouse receives a disability pension. The loan purpose is to obtain a mobile phone. In the future Jazgul wants to purchase a flat.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our lending team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase goods for sale

loans.name: Albina

texts.es: Albina, de 40 años, convive con Rolando, de 40 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos, pero solo viven con 2 de ellos: Cleris, de 17 años y Fiorella, de 7 años. En su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Yaroka. El trabajo al que se dedica es la agricultura, su siembra de gladiolo, arvejas y hortalizas, le brinda a ella una estabilidad económica. Albina tiene más de 7 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas, en las que constantemente siembra y después de cada cosecha. Los comercializa en el mercado central de su ciudad y en temporadas agrícolas de mayor demanda; viaja a la capital del país para poder obtener mayores ganancias. Pero lo que más le agrada a ella es poder ver a sus hijos realizados, Witson, su hijo mayor está cursando estudios superiores en la capital, por ello cada mes le envía una considerable suma de dinero y para más adelante ella desea invertir en la educación de sus hijos, ya que considera que es el “mejor regalo que les puede brindar”. Albina, es una mujer muy responsable y, eso lo demuestra en cada cuota con MFP. Ya es el tercer crédito con su banco comunal, donde se siente contenta por su grupo unido y solidario. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará semillas de espinaca, como también abono orgánico para su cultivo de gradiolos, que en este mes tienen mucha demanda.
texts.en:
Albina is 40 years old and lives with Rolando, also 40. They have three children but only two of them (Cleris, 17, and Fiorella, 7) live with them in their own house, located in the town of Yarok.

Her work is devoted to agriculture: the planting of gladioli, peas and vegetables provides her with economic stability. Albina has over 7 hectares (approximately 18 acres) of arable land, where she is constantly planting, particularly after each harvest.

She sells her products in her town’s central market, and when seasonal demand is high, she travels to the capital of the country to obtain higher profits.

But what she loves most is to witness their children’s achievements. Her eldest son Whitson is pursuing higher studies in the capital, so each month she sends him a considerable sum of money. Later she wants to invest in their other children’s education, as she believes this to be "the best gift you can offer".

Albina is a very responsible woman, which she demonstrates at each MFP installment. This is her third loan with the community bank, and she is satisfied with the group’s unity and solidarity. She will use the requested loan to buy spinach seeds, as well as organic fertilizer for her gladioli plantings, which are in high demand this month.

loans.use: Buy spinach seeds and bags of organic fertilizer for the gladioli plants

loans.name: Khân

texts.en:
Khân S., 51, is a village woman living in Kompong Cham Province. She is a local crop farmer, growing rice, vegetables, and some fruit on her own farmland. To help meet the family's daily expense needs, her husband assists with the farming business as well. The couple is blessed with six children, three of whom are single and the other three are married and work in various jobs. 

Her farm is  large and some farmland is not plow yet.  Khân S. is applying for a loan to hire a machine to plow farmland in order to plant a  dry-season rice field.

loans.use: To hire a machine to plow farmland in order to plant a dry-season rice field.

loans.name: Liene

texts.en:
Liene G. is from the village of Comon, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 26 years old. Liene is widowed and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Liene owns & operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling native food viands like jackfruit salad & mongo soup in the local community. Liene has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 5000, Liene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Liene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional ingredients. Liene is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional raw ingredients for making the viands. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Liene from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients to make food dishes to sell

loans.name: Luís Alberto

texts.es:
Luís Alberto Q. C. tiene 27 años, Es casado, vive con la  compañera   y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Ventanas Provincia los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SEÑOR DE LA SALUD  se encuentra ubicada  en el recinto Soloma, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandia, esta ventanilla se dedica a lobores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, maracuyá esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Luís Alberto se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, maracuyá . Compra sus productos en el Comercial Viscarra y vende los  productos en el Comercial Escudero.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arroz, maracuyá. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un terreno.

Le gusta el deporte.
texts.en: Luís Alberto Q. C. is 27. He is married and lives with his wife and children in the Ventanas Provincia los Rios canton. He has 2 children. The members of the V.R.C. SEÑOR DE LA SALUD  are located in the Soloma region, belonging to the Echeandia Canton. This region is dedicated to short-cycle agricultural labour; the sowing of corn, rice, and passion fruit. They spend a lot of time doing this. Luís Alberto works in agriculture, sowing corn, rice and passion fruit. He purchases his products in the Viscarra Market and sells them in the Escudero Market. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of agricultural inputs and fertilizers for the cultivation of corn, rice and passion fruit. With the support of this loan the institution will help him economically to supply his needs. He has to overcome challenges such as plagues and diseases and the varied climate. His dream is to purchase a plot of land. He likes sports.

loans.use: agricultural inputs and fertilizers

loans.name: Yolanda Beatriz

texts.es:
Yolanda Beatriz S. C., tiene 26 años, es casada, vive con el esposo y con los hijos en el  Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 2  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NARCISA DE JESUS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Temistocles perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto de siembre de maíz y arroz.

Yolanda se dedica a la agricultura a la siembre de maíz y arroz, compra y vende los productos en ventanas en comercial Peña y vende en la casa o en el mercado de ventadas todos los días.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una finca.

Le gusta salir a pasear con la familia.
texts.en:
Yolanda Beatriz S. C., age 26, is married. She lives with her husband and children in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios province. She has 2 children.

The members of the V.R.C. Narcisa de Jesus are located in the San Temistocles region, belonging to the Ventanas Canton. This region is dedicated to short-cycle agricultural labour, sowing corn and rice.

Yolanda works in agriculture, sowing corn and rice. She buys and sells her products in stalls in the Peña shopping center and also sells them at home or in the market every day.

She is requesting this loan for sowing corn and buying supplies and seeds. The support of this loan will help her economically to supply her needs. She confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. Her dream is to buy a farm.
She enjoys going out for walks with her family.

loans.use: the purchase of supplies and seeds

loans.name: Jeanette Joy

texts.en:
Jeanette Joy M. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 30 years old. Jeanette Joy is married and has three children aged 10, 8 and 2. To make a living, Jeanette Joy owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Jeanette Joy also grows hogs for fattening and sale.

Jeanette Joy joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jeanette Joy is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs and pig feed. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and pig feed

loans.name: Nizomidin

texts.ru: Исмаилов Низомидин проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Возраст, 45 лет. Женат. Имеет троих детей. Образование среднее. Он работает парикмахером в мужском салоне. В этой области имеет богатый опыт. Кредит берет для покупки новых инструментов и аксессуаров.
texts.en: Nizomidin I. lives in the J.Rumy Region. 45 years of age. Married, with three children. Education: secondary. He works as a hairdresser in a barber shop. He has a lot of experience in this area. He is taking out a loan to purchase new instruments and accessories.

loans.use: Purchasing new instruments and accessories

loans.name: Mesrop

texts.en: Mesrop Mrtirosyan is from the village of Tufashen in the Shirak region of Armenia.  He is happily married with two sons (fifteen and twenty years old).  He has been working on the family farm for the past fifteen years.  He is proud of his high school education and considers himself a hard-working person.  He would like to continue supporting his twenty year old son’s university studies.  With a loan to purchase livestock and renovate his barn he is planning to earn additional funds for the family.  In addition to supporting his family Mesrop also provided his relatives with agricultural produce from the farm.  He enjoys his life in Tufashen surrounded by good neighbors and relatives.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Hao

texts.en: Hao T. T. V. is 30 years old and has two children who attend primary school.  Being a tailor, she opened a shop that makes trousers and t-shirts. Her shop is always busy with customers' orders. She earns 3,500,000 VND profit per month. Her shop improved when she borrowed from the SEDA credit program and invested her loans in her business.  Currently, she is requesting a loan of 8,502,000 VND to buy clothes to meet the demand of customers.

loans.use: To purchase clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fertilizer

loans.name: Mrs. Nget Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. N. is a village bank president who has been selected by fourteen members who make up this village bank loan. Their portion of the loan will be used for different purposes that can improve their family's standard of living. She was born in 1971. She is a pig breeder who can earn some profit to support her family, and besides this she is also a string maker. Since her business is getting on well, she wants to expand. 

So to improve her business, Mrs. N. is applying for a loan to buy some more supplies to make string to sell. Her husband, Mr. Yoeun, is a construction worker. Through these activities, they support three children who are attending the local public school.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making string to sell

loans.name: Mehrab

texts.en:
Mehrab B. was born in 1987. He lives in Lchashen village, area of Sevan, with his grandfather, his father and his sister. Members of Mehrab’s family have been engaged in farming for a long time.   

On his farm, Mehrab raises cows, sheep, a horse, ducks and chickens. With his business profit Mehrab keeps his family and also he was able to buy a truck, which he uses for his farm’s needs.

Mehrab needs a 700,000 AMD loan to buy a cow and some calves for his farm. Cattle enlarging will allow Mehrab to increase his family’s income in the future.

loans.use: To buy a cow and some calves for his farm

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther A. is married and has four children. She lives in Acha, a small farming village in the North West Region of Cameroon. Due to ill health, she spent much of her business capital in the hospital. Motivated by other GHAPE members in her community, she joined the program in 2008. Since then, she has been trying to support her family through the loans she received form GHPAE. With this new loan, she plans to buy more palm oil and beans (cheap this season) to resell in the coming months when the prices will have gone up. This is a business she has been doing for a long time; palm oil is an indispensible commodity used in the preparation of almost every meal. Members of her community will no longer have to wait untill market day to have palm oil as most of them always buy in small quantities as needed. She will use the profit from the loan to pay school fees for her children and provide food and medication for her family. 

About GHAPE: The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil and beans

loans.name: Senzakahle Group

texts.en:
Lindiwe is 36 years old and married with four children between the ages of 16 and 19, three of whom attend school. For two years she has run a business selling live chickens from her home in Kwa Zulu Natal of Empangeni, South Africa and also receives income from the government's child grant program. In the photo she is pictured rasing her hand.

Lindiwe is requesting this loan through WDB and Kiva to buy more chickens to sell. She says that customers who take her products on credit and fail to pay on time are her main business challenge. The extra income arising from this loan will help her business grow and enable her to better support her family.

loans.use: to buy chickens for her business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca, a 50-year-old married mother of five children, lives in Mayor Village Lapasan, Clarin Mis. Occ. where for the past three years she has had a business selling dried fish to earn a living. Earning Php 10,000 each month, she is now requesting a loan of PhP 20,000 to purchase more dried fish to sell. Rebecca, who has been a member of PMPC for one year, will use the extra income for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchased more dried fish for her retail store.

location.town: Tudela-Mayor Village Lapasan, Clarin Mis Occ

loans.name: Reina Atifany

texts.es:
Reina, vive con su esposo y su hija de 5 años de edad, administra una tienda de productos de consumo, la tiene en su propia casa, no tiene un horario definido para atenderla, la inicio hace un año, con poca mercadería únicamente con sus ahorros.
Ella requiere de un préstamo para comprar aceite, azúcar, detergentes, embutidos, para surtir el negocio, ofreciendo a los clientes más productos necesarios para el hogar, con esto estará fortaleciendo el negocio y dándole vida para mucho tiempo más.
Reina quiere tener el negocio fuerte en mercadería, con mucha clientela y con la esperanza de mejorar cada día junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Reina lives with her husband and 5-year-old daughter.  She runs a grocery store located in her home.  She does not have a fixed work schedule.  She started it a year ago with little merchandise using only her savings.

She needs a loan to buy oil, sugar, detergents and cured meats to stock the store to offer customers more products needed in the home.  With this, she’ll be strengthening the business and lengthening its life for much more time.

Reina wants to have a business that’s strong in merchandise and that has many customers with the hope of improving together with her family every day.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Marilyn has a shop that sells candies, canned goods, breads & snacks. She has had this business for 6 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy beverages, breads & canned goods. The picture shows Marilyn and her 2 daughters (one is inside the shop).

Marilyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Marilyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy beverages, breads & canned goods.

loans.name: Nati

texts.es: La Sra. Nati  tiene como actividad la venta de calzados deportivos y chompas de lana, la primea actividad la realiza los días jueves y domingo en la populosa feria de la zona 16 de julio de la ciudad de el alto, la segunda la realiza los demás días en la ceja de el alto, esta actividad que realiza es la principal fuente de ingreso para ella y su hija ellas viven juntas y son personas muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras el destino del crédito solicitado es para la compra de mercadería (calzados y chompas) por mayor y así poder surtir los  puestos de venta que atiende.
texts.en:
Sra. Nati has businesses selling athletic shoes and wool sweaters. Selling sweaters is her main business activity, which she conducts on Thursdays and Sundays at the busy July 16th fair in the city of El Alto. On the remaining days, she operates her second business in the neighborhood of La Ceja in El Alto. Her businesses provide the main source of income for Nati and her daughter, who live together. They are both hardworking and enterprising individuals.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise, shoes and sweaters, in bulk so that she can keep both of her vending posts stocked.

loans.use: to purchase sweaters and athletic shoes in bulk.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha sells fried plantain and beans (red-red) at Takoradi in the western Region of Ghana. She has received a senior high education. She is married and has three children. Her husband is into fitting (repairing spoiled cars). Martha has been selling plantain and beans for eight. She helps her companion to pay utility bills and other household expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more plantain and beans to cook to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shade for the business.

loans.use: to buy more plantain and beans to cook to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. She has been in this business for the past seven years and earns additional income from selling charcoal. Rose has been sustaining her business through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF.

Rose is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional fruits and vegetables to sell. In the future, she dreams of expanding her business to secure her family’s future.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: El Quesillo Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Quesillo está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras. La coordinadora es la señora Rosa Carolina quien se dedica al comercio de ropa y calzado desde hace varios años. Ella tiene una venta aproximada de 20,000 córdobas mensuales y una inversión de 18,000 córdobas mensuales. 
Ella con el crédito comprará mercadería en especial blusas ya que tiene mayor demanda.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Ivecta comerciante de ropa y calzado,  y Rosa quien también vende ropa desde hace 8 años.
texts.en:
The Quesillo group is made up of three hard-working and enterprising people. The coordinator is Señora Rosa Carolina, who has sold shoes and clothing for several years. She has monthly sales of approximately 20,000 córdobas, and invests 18,000 córdobas monthly.
With this loan she will purchase merchandise, especially blouses, because these are in the greatest demand.

The other group members are Ivecta, a shoe and clothing merchant; and Rosa, who has also sold clothing for eight years.

loans.use: to buy merchandise; clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Jicaro En Accion Group

texts.es:
El grupo JICARO EN ACCION estta integrado por cinco miembros, todos se conocen muy bien. El señor Arturo  líder de este grupo se dedica a la venta de leche, leña y compra/venta de ganado,  sus principales clientes son de los alrededores de Jicaro Galán y Valle, es un negocio que le da mucha rentabilidad y ganancias.
El señor Arturo se siente muy bien con su negocio, el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ganado para producir leche y otros derivados.
Los otros integrantes de este grupo son: Melecia que se dedica a la venta de tortillas, Deysi Elizabeth  que se dedica a la sastrería y costura, Rosa Araceli que se dedica a la venta de tortillass y refrescos y Mirna Lorena que tiene como negocio un molino y venta de leña.

El sueño de este grupo es que siempre sus familas esten bien de salud.
texts.en:
The JICARO EN ACCION group has five members who all know each other well. Señor Arturo, leader of the group, earns his living by selling milk, firewood, and buying and selling livestock. His biggest customers live in the vicinity of Jicaro, Galán, and Valle. His business is very profitable and he has a good income from it.

Arturo is happy with the way his business is going. He plans to use the money from the loan to buy cows so he has milk and other products to sell.

The other members of the group are Melecia who sells tortillas, Deysi Elizabeth who has a sewing and tailoring business, Rosa Araceli who sells tortillas and soft drinks, and Mirna Lorena who has a mill and also sells firewood.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Mahfotha

texts.en:
Mahfotha is a 54 year old hardworking mother. She decided to work with her husband in making and selling a specific type of candy which is called “A. Anbar candy”; it is basically made of apples dipped in colored sweet dip.

Mahfotha makes the candy and her husband sells it on a motor bike around their neighborhood. They have applied for a loan in order to buy a small distributing bus.

loans.use: To buy a small distributing bus to sell candy.

loans.name: Brenda Guadalupe

texts.es: Brenda tiene 23 años es casada y tiene una niña pequeña de 4 meses, ella se dedica a vender frutas y legumbres de temporada en el mercado de su población, tiene con su negocio aproximadamente 3 años y dice que emprendió el negocio por que primero le ayudaba a sus papas con los gastos de la casa y ahora que esta casada a su esposo, platica que a ella le gusta tener su propio dinero por cualquier imprevisto, ella vende aguacates, nopales, uvas, capulines, zarzamoras etc. Brenda dice que es la primera vez que trabaja con la financiera y le esta agradando como trabajan, ella pidió un crédito para comprar fruta y venderla y surtirá parte la corta de sus árboles y parte la compra en la central de abastos de la población donde vive, el sueño de Brenda es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda ya que es de madera y cultivar aguacates.
texts.en:
Brenda is 23 years old, married, and has a four-month-old daughter. She sells seasonal fruits and legumes at the local market. Brenda has been in business for approximately three years. She says that she started this business at first because she wanted to help her parents with the household expenses. Now that she is married, she says that she likes having her own income for any unexpected emergencies. Brenda sells avocados, cactus pads, grapes, cherries, blackberries, and other items. She says this is the first time she has received financing and is pleased with how the loans work.

Brenda is requesting a loan to buy fruit to sell. Some of the fruit will come from her own trees and the rest will come from the central supply depot in the town where she lives. Brenda’s dream is to improve the condition of her wooden house and to cultivate avocados.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 61 years old and widowed with three children. She works hard to provide for her family.

Letecia runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her store. Prior to this loan, Letecia has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for 13 years, and also earns an income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing.

Letecia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Erwin Silvio

texts.es: El Sr. Erwin es soltero, es un hombre responsable, trabajador y empeñoso en querer salir poco a poco adelante, el se dedica a brindar el servicio de taxi para lo cual alquila un auto, eligió este tipo de trabajo porque le gusta servir a la gente, ya lleva en el negocio mas de 4 años y gana aproximadamente S/. 230 nuevos soles semanales. El crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de su propia moto para brindar el servicio que viene realizando. El Sr. Erwin tiene el sueño de tener su propio auto para ganar más dinero y así mejorar su calidad de vida. El esta agradecido por haberle otorgado el crédito ya que contribuye a buscar su desarrollo económico.
texts.en:
Erwin is single; he’s a responsible, hardworking, enterprising man who wants to get ahead little by little.  He provides taxi services in a car he leases.  He chose this type of work because he likes to be of service to people. He’s been in business over four years and earns about 230 new soles per week.

The loan is to buy his own motor vehicle to provide the service.  Erwin’s dream is to own a car of his own to earn more money and improve his quality of life.  He’s grateful for having been granted the loan that contributes to his search for economic development.

loans.use: to buy his own motor vehicle.

loans.name: Loise

texts.en:
Loise is 54 years old, married and they are blessed with three children.

She is a greengrocer in the area of Kakuyuni where there is a good flow of customers. She has been in this business for the last four years and earns an income of KES 11,000 per month.

Loise has a good credit history with KADET. She is applying for her fifth loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD with which she plans to buy cereals like maize and beans. She will use the anticipated profit to pay school fees.

Loise is very hardworking and hopes to own her own cereal threshing board.

loans.use: To buy cereals.

loans.name: 29 De Setiembre Group

texts.es:
El comité “29 de Setiembre” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso.  Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, pero también actividades en conjunto que fomentan su compañerismo.  Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido, trabajador y emprendedor.
La Señora Myrian es una de las integrantes del comité, ella tiene una familia muy unidad con 1 hija y su marido, quien es empleado. Nos comenta que ella se dedica a la venta de prendas para damas, con lo cual ayuda a su marido con los gastos de la casa y con la manutención de su hija. Dice que gracias al tiempo que lleva en esto, ha podido formarse una clientela bien definida que siempre le hace pedidos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas para damas, como ser polleras, pantalones, jeans y demás, lo cual la ayudará a surtirse y tener más variedad que ofrecer a sus clientas.
texts.en:
The September 29th Committee was formed as a result of several neighbors from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso joining together. All of the committee members have developed independent businesses, but they also participate in activities together as a group in order to strengthen their camaraderie. The members have formed a group that is united, hardworking, and enterprising.

Sra. Mirian is one of the committee members. Her family consists of her daughter and her husband who is employed. She says that she sells women’s clothing, which helps her husband with the household expenses and supporting their daughter. Mirian says thanks to the time she invests in her work, she has been able to establish a good customer base who always place orders.

She is requesting a loan to buy clothes for women such as skirts, trousers, jeans, and other items. This will help restock her inventory so that she can offer more variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing for eventual resale.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a 49 year old married woman with four children who are all grown up. Her husband is a farmer who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Mwanasha has operated as a weaver (weaving coconut roofing thatches) for the past ten years. Her potential clients are the local area hotel owners. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase weaving materials like coconut leaves for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials like coconut leaves for her business.

loans.name: Marvin Antonio

texts.es: Marvin está por finalizar sus estudios de Ingeniería en Computación, el préstamo solicitado será para pagar el curso para poder obtener su título. En un futuro el se ve trabajando en el área de informñatica de una empresa. Con esto optará a desarrollarse en otros ámbitos de mayor exigencia en informática. Para el la mejor satisfacción es poder servir al prójimo, es una persona responsable y emprendedrora. Para Marvin el hecho de haber egresado de su carrera fue un gran desafío para él.
texts.en:
Marvin is finishing his studies in Computer Engineering. The loan he is requesting will be used to pay for a course that he needs to obtain his degree. In the future, he sees himself working in the information technology department of a company. This will give him the option to develop in other areas of computer science that are in great demand. Serving others gives him the greatest satisfaction.

Marvin is a responsible and enterprising individual. Graduating and earning his degree will be a challenging accomplishment for him.

loans.use: to pay for a course needed to earn his degree.

loans.name: Napoleon

texts.es:
Napoleón, de 35  años de edad, es un hombre  luchador, carismático, es conviviente con Zoila quien es ama de casa, vive con su pareja ya varios años y fruto de ésta unión  tiene 4 hijos, vive en su casa propia, la cual construyó con mucho esfuerzo. El trabajo que realiza Napoleón, es medio de trasporte que lo realiza en su mototaxi, dedicándose a ésta actividad desde hace 07 años, cuando compró su primer mototaxi con un crédito privado. Y todo ese tiempo le ha permitido hacerse muy conocido por la calidad del servicio que brinda, recorriendo por todas la calles de la ciudad. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que es independiente, no  tiene un horario de trabajo, así recibe un ingreso económico, y con ello puede apoyar en la economía de su hogar, y ver que a sus hijos no les falte nada. Sin embargo, comenta que no le gusta cuando llueve muy seguido pues le dificulta el trabajo y su mototaxi se llega a malograr más rápido. Tiene muchas ganas de seguir progresando y con esfuerzo lograr abrir una tienda de repuestos de mototaxi. Este será el préstamo numero 06 con la institución MFP, está agradecido, por  el apoyo financiero, que le permitirá avanzar en su negocio. 
Con el monto solicitado 1000 nuevos soles, comprará repuestos para arreglar su mototaxi, pues comenta le faltan llantas y amortiguadores y con el saldo mandar a pinta toda la estructura de su mototaxi.
texts.en:
Napoleón is 35 years old; he is a hardworking man, charismatic and lives with Zoila who is a housewife. He has lived with his partner for several years and out of their relationship they have 4 children, they live in their own home, which Napoleón build with a lot of hard work. Napoleón works in transportation with his motorcycle taxi which he has done for 7 years when he bought his first motorcycle taxi in a private loan. All of that time has allowed him to be very well known by the quality of the service that he provides by going through the city streets. What Napoleón enjoys of his work is that he is independent, he has no work schedule, he has an income that allows him to support his family and see that his children don’t lack in anything. Although he comments that he does not like when it rains a lot since it makes his job harder and his motorcycle taxi breaks down quicker. Napoleón has a lot of drive to keep progressing and wants to open a spare parts store for motorcycle taxis. This is his sixth loan with MFP and is grateful for the financial support that will allow him to keep getting ahead in his business.

With the amount of 1000 nuevos soles he will buy spare parts to repair the motorcycle taxi since he says that he needs tires and shock absorbers, with the remaining amount he will paint the motorcycle taxi as well.

loans.use: buy tires, shock absorbers, and paint his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Olga Lidia

texts.es: Olga lidia, tiene la edad  de 50 años, está casada,  vive con su esposo e hija actualmente que son su prioridad. Ella con el crédito lo que quiere comprar es los insumos como abonos y otros materiales para su siembra. Ella quiere asistir su siembra de la mejor forma para así tenerla en buenas condiciones de producción. Ella tiene como meta vender todos sus productos y a su vez generar el máximo de ganancias para su bienestar familiar y ayudarle a su esposo con las responsabilidades del hogar. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Olga Lidia is 50 years old, married, and lives with her husband and daughter who are her top priority.  With this loan she wants to buy supplies like fertilizers and other materials for planting.  She wants to help her seeds in the best way possible to have better conditions for production.  Her goal is to sell all her products and in turn generate maximum profits for her family’s well being and to help her husband with household responsibilities.  This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR.  She has not had any other loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR has given her this loan conveniently and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: buy materials to plant vegetables.

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: Saul Hipolito

texts.en:
My name is Saul and I run a small tailor store from my home, located in the center of my neighborhood. I have several years experience and my income allows me to cover family expenses. Now, I need more material as the holidays are approaching and this Christmastime will probably be the highest demand I have seen in a long time.

Mi Nombre es Saul, cuento con una pequeña sastreria en mi casa de habitacion, ubicada en el centro de mi comunidad, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares, actualmente necesito mas material ya se aproximan las clausuras y la Navidad para aprovechar al maximo estas epocas.

loans.use:
To buy khaki fabric, Sasimir, pins, needles, gloves, buttons, thread and other items

Compra de tela kaki, Sasimir, broches, hilo, ganchos, botones, pelun y otros

loans.name: Nikolai

texts.en:
Nikolai is divorced with one child. He is a taxi driver and has been in business for five years. Driving is his only source of income. Sometimes he ends up working 24 hours a day to provide for himself and his family. Presently, he makes around $30-40 per day. Nikolai is a focused, hard-worker. He started his first business selling groceries in the market. However, after his divorce and changing family situation, Nikolai decided to work in a different business sphere and began driving a taxi. The nine loans that Nikolai has received from “Nadiya Ukraine” have helped him to expand his business. Nikolai is requesting a loan of $600 to help buy a newer car with improved diesel efficiency that will be both quieter and smoother running. A reliable vehicle operating on bio methane fuel, with eco-friendly fuel consumption, good emissions characteristics and better refinement will not only help Nikolai reduce his overhead costs, but will also lessen the amount of pollution produced and will increase the resource-saving capability of his vehicle. Nikolai is also getting married in May, 2007. He is planning to use income generated by his business to cover some of the expenses of his wedding.

Микола – розлучений, в нього одна дитина. Він – водій таксі, займається цим бізнесом 5 років. Це єдине джерело прибутку для його родини. Іноді він працює по 24 години на добу для того, щоб забезпечувати власну родину. Зараз Микола заробляє приблизно 30-40 доларів. Микола – дуже цілеспрямований та працьовитий. Він починав з торгівлі харчами на ринку. Однак, після розлучення його сімейна ситуація кардинально змінилася. Отже, Микола вирішив почати працювати в іншій сфері та став водієм. Дев’ять позик, які Микола отримав від „Надії України”, допомогли йому розширити власний бізнес. Микола просить про позику в 600 доларів для того, щоб купити новіше авто з кращим дизельним мотором, що робить пересування тихішим та приємнішим. Надійне авто, яке працюватиме на стиснутому метані, що знизить викиди в атмосферу, та більш якісною системою очищення не тільки допоможе Миколі знизити витрати, але й допоможе зменшити масштаби забруднення та покращити ресурсномісткі показники його автомобіля. Микола одружується в травні 2007 року. Він планує використати отриманий від бізнесу прибуток для того, щоб оплатити весільні витрати.

loans.use: To buy a newer vehicle

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria I. lives with her husband, Samuel Quispe, and her son, Reinaldo, who is 20 years old, in a small house with two rooms in the Tiwiña zone, on the western slope of the city of La Paz. Her husband works as a public transport driver and Mrs. I. is still without a job. Wither their savings, the couple bought a metal kiosk that requires fixing up before it can be used as a hamburger stand. The loan will be used for repairs to the kiosk and for working capital, with which Mrs. I. will be able to work and thereby help with the family economy. This is the first time she has requested a loan with our institution, and her economic evaluation shows us that she will be able to meet her loan obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria I. vive con su esposo, Samuel Quispe y su hijo Reinaldo de 20 años, en una pequeña vivienda de dos habitaciones en la zona Tiwiña, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz. Su esposo trabaja de chofer asalariado en el transporte urbano y la señora se encuentra aun sin trabajo. Con sus ahorros los esposos Quispe I., compraron un Kiosco metálico a medio uso, que requiere arreglo para poder ser habilitado como puesto de venta de hamburguesas. El crédito servirá para la reparación del kiosco y para capital de arranque con el que la señora Maria I. podrá trabajar y así ayudar en la economía de su familia. Es la primera ocasión que solicita un préstamo en nuestra institución, y la evaluación económica nos muestra que podrá cumplir con sus obligaciones crediticias.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ángel

texts.es:
Señor Ángel C. is 45 years old, married, and has one son who is six years old. His wife is a teacher and works in a public city high school, supporting her husband with the household income. Ángel finished his secondary studies, but due to a lack of economic stability for his parents, Ángel had to move to the capital in search of new opportunities for work, and there he was also able to study. He studied three years in a technical school, where he learned the trade of a radio technician. Later, this helped him start his own business, and he was able to return to Ybycuí to be with his family. Señor Ángel is doing very well. He has formed a clientel and he works for big businesses that come to him to repair all types of televisions, radios, cameras, closed circuits, etc. He also does maintenance for these products. Every day new models and products are entering the market, and don Ángel needs to modernize the instruments that he uses for repairing these machines. For this reason, Ángel requests a loan of $200, which he will use to acquire a box of new tools and various spare parts, which he can only acquire in the capital.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

El señor Ángel C. tiene 45 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo de 6 años. Su esposa es docente, trabaja en un colegio público de la ciudad y ayuda a su marido con los ingresos de la casa. Ángel culminó sus estudios secundarios, pero debido a la falta de estabilidad económica de sus padres, Ángel, tuvo que emigrar a la ciudad capital en busca de nuevas oportunidades de trabajo y así poder solventar el mismo sus estudios complementarios. Estudió durante 3 años en una escuela Técnica, donde aprendió el oficio de la Radiotécnica; posteriormente, esto le ayudó a montar su propio negocio, y pudo volver a Ybycuí junto a su familia. Al señor Ángel le va muy bien, tiene una clientela formada y trabaja para grandes empresas que llevan a su negocio para reparar todo tipo de televisores, radios, cámaras, circuitos cerrados, etc. y también realiza los mantenimientos de los mismos. Como día a día salen al mercados nuevos modelos de productos electrónicos, don Ángel necesita modernizar sus elementos de trabajo que utiliza para el reparó de las máquinas; para ello, Ángel solicita un crédito de $ 200 que lo utilizará para adquirir una caja nueva de herramientas y repuestos varios, que solo puede conseguirlos en la ciudad capital.

loans.use: Buy a box of tools and spare parts.

loans.name: Ni Nengah Wentri

texts.id:
Mrs. Nengah Wentri owns a grower pig farm. Currently Mrs. Nengah Wentri farms 3 pigs. Each day she feeds her pigs for about 4 hours, morning, afternoon and evening. After four to five months, she can harvest her pigs for $40-$45 each. With $150 loan, Mrs. Nengah Wentri can earn $80 in profit. each month she can earn $20 to her income.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva volunteer

Ibu Nengah Wentri mempunyai usaha ternak babi penggemukan. Saat ini Ibu Nengah Wentri memelihara 3 ekor ternak babi. Setiap hari ia meluangkan waktunya untuk memberi makan babinya kira –kira 4 jam perhari dari pagi, siang dan sore. Empat sampai lima bulan babinya sudah bisa dipanen dengan harga berkisar Rp. 400.000,- s/d Rp. 450.000,-. Dengan modal 1.400.000,- selama 4 bulan Ibu Nengah Wentri bisa mendapatkan keuntungan Rp. 800.000,-. Setiap bulan ia bisa mendapat penghasilan Rp.200.000,- untuk tambahan biaya hidupnya.

loans.use: Adding Growing Pigs

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es:
Description of Business

Isidro Daniel and his wife sell basic goods at a store, which is also their home. In addition, he also sells shoes in a nearby city ,and on the weekends, his wife sells sausages and roasted buffalo wings. All of their income from these activities have supported their business's growth.

Use of Loan

He needs the loan to buy more merchandise so he can be well-stocked for the year-end sales when he is very busy.

Personal Details

He is 46 years old and has five children, four of whom are students. His wife takes cares of the cement home they live in. Their plans are to grow and flourish their business so it can secure their family's future.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Don Isidro Daniel junto con su esposa tiene a la venta productos de primera necesidad en local que acondicionaron en su mismo domicilio. Ademas el vende prendas de vestir como zapatos en una ciudad cercana y su esposa los fines de semana vende embutidos y alitas de pollos asados, todos estos ingresos han hecho que el negocio de ellos crezca.

Uso del Préstamo

El necesita el credito para adquirir mas mercaderia y asi estar abastecido para la temporada de fin de año donde se vende mucho mas.

Información Personal

El tiene 46 años y cinco hijos de los cuales cuatro estudian su esposa le ayuda en el hogar y su casa es de cemento. Sus planes son de hacer prospero su negocio para asi asegurar el futuro de su familia.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.en: Mrs. A. Afiwa is a married woman with three children.  She has been selling food for years to children at school, but with little profit. She is requesting  a loan of $400 so she can buy more food, resell it, and hopefully make more profit to then pay back her loan within 12 months. She will also use the profit to take care of her family's needs. Thank you for your support of her business. She is also a member of a group called Djidjole Group, sponsored by HELP Africa.

loans.use: To buy food and resell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam! This is 32-year-old Joyce M.. She is married with five children, aged 1, 3, 7, 10, and 12.

In 2006, Joyce established a general store. Joyce has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a loan of $725 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock in bulk.

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Mr. S. has been married since 1993 and has only one son who is studying in a primary school in the village.   He and his wife raise pigs at home. Mr. S. is also a Reumork driver ( a motorbike that has the caravan behind) where he earns four dollars a day.  His wife stays at home to look after the house, her son, and the pig. They live about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. In the future they plan to build a pond to raise fish.     
Mr. S. is requesting a loan for the second time in the amount of $500 to buy more pig food.

loans.use: To purchase more pig food

loans.name: Truong Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Truong Thi B., now 47 years old, has been with TYM since 1997. She currently lives with her husband at Y Yen District of Nam Dinh Province. She has two children who have both grown up and have a job of their own. In the previous loans, Mrs. B. put the money in her pig-breeding and recycling materials businesses. The majority of her own money was used for the pig-breeding business, which is also the main source of her family's income. Normally she would be able to sell each farrow of pigs for about 500 to 700 USD. At the same time, by collecting recycling materials and resell it, she got enough money to pay the monthly payment (for TYM) as well as for the household daily activities. In 2004, seeing that her age would not allow her to continue with this work anymore, she moved into the husking rice business. This business has been doing quite well, with her monthly income of around 150 USD. In this loan cycle, she would like to ask for a loan of 450 USD to buy petroleum and repair her machines.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Trương Thị Bích, 47 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 1997. Chị sống cùng chồng tại huyện ý Yên, Nam Định. Hai con chị đã trưởng thành và có công ăn việc làm. Trước kia chị Bích vay vốn về đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn và buôn bán phế liệu. Tiền vốn được chị dành chủ yếu cho việc chăn nuôi lợn. Đây cũng là nguồn thu chủ yếu của gia đình. Sau mỗi lần bán lợn chị thu về 500-700USD. Chị cũng dành một số ít vốn cho việc thu mua phế liệu. Nguồn thu nhập từ công việc này giúp chị có tiền trả tuần và trang trải chi phí hàng ngày. Năm 2004, cảm thấy việc đi mua phế liệu không còn phù hợp với tuổi nên chị chuyển sang làm máy xay xát gạo. Công việc tiến triển thuận lợi, thu nhập hàng tháng chị Bích khoảng 150USD. Vòng vốn này chị tiếp tục xin vay 450USD về sửa sang và mua dầu chạy máy.

loans.use: Buy petroleum, repair machine

loans.name: Juana Laura

texts.es:
Juana Laura is hard-working and optimistic. She is separated from her husband and has a 10 year old daughter, who attends elementary school. She started her business buying and selling used clothing and selling household products because she needed extra income, since the money she receives from her husband for their daughter's expenses, is not enough.

Her business begun in December 2006, while she lived in the city of Reynosa. It was there that she began selling used clothing, but later her husband was relocated to the city of Altamira, and so she took up the business of selling in the town's markets (on the experience she had gained in the city of Reynosa). It was at this time that she also initiated the sale of household products through catalogues. This is going very well because her customer base is growing all the time.

Now, she is requesting a loan of $ 300 USD, which she will repay in three months. She'll use this loan to purchase bales of used clothing, which will allow her to offer more variety of garments to her clients. This will also help her introduce the sale of sandals and sneakers into her product offering. She plans to also purchase additional household products for resale. With your help, Laura will be able to move her business forward.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Juana laura es una persona muy trabajadora y optimista. Esta separa de su esposo y tiene una hija de 10 años que cursa la primaria, inició el negocio compra y venta de ropa usada y venta de productos para el hogar por la necesidad de obtener un ingreso extra ya que se separo de su esposo y con lo que él le da para los gastos de la niña no le alcanzaba, entonces decidió iniciar su propio negocio.

Comenzó en Diciembre de 2006, ella vivía en la ciudad de Reynosa y fue allí en donde empezó a vender ropa usada, pero después cambiaron a su esposo a la ciudad de Altamira y allí retomé el negocio vendiendo en los mercados ambulantes de la localidad aprovechando la experiencia que había adquirido en la ciudad de Reynosa. También esta iniciado la venta de productos para el hogar por catálogo y le esta yendo muy bien pues cada vez tiene más clientes

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $300 que pagara en 3 meses para adquirir pacas de ropa usada que me permita tener mas variedad de prendas para sus clientes, introduciendo también sandalias y tenis, así como para la compra de productos para el hogar. Con tu ayuda laura continuara su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to sell through her business (Comprar mercancia)

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Señor A. has worked with our institution since three years ago when he was granted four credits that he used to invest in the purchase of hardware products. He began with a small business which he has grown remarkably. He is a young entrepreneur , and he is married with a young child. It should be emphasized that in addition to his business, the client also studies law on the weekends, and his business has an employee.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor A. trabaja con nuestra institución desde hace tres años donde se le han otorgado cuatro credito los que ha utilizado para invertir en la compra de productos de ferreteria, el comenzo con un pequeño negocio el cual ha crecido notablemente, es un joven emprendedor casado con un hijo menor cabe destacar que el cliente ademas de tener su negocio estudia los fines de semana la carrera de derecho en su negocio tiene un empleado.

loans.use: Capital to buy hardware products

loans.name: Deego De Djirack Group

texts.fr:
We live in the ecovillage of Djirack, left to fend for itself since the beginning of the 80’s because of the armed conflict that raged in the southern region of Sénégal. For a very long time, we remained victims of this situation that largely contributed to the impoverishment of this village’s population.  However, this region is rich in natural resources and mostly fishery products (oysters, shellfish, shrimps, cymbium and fish) . This is why we came to sollicit SEM so they could find us financing from Kiva in order for us to work. Our work will consist of fishing and transformation of fishery production (smoking, drying and salting of fish). We are also planning on selling fresh fish, because Djirack is a very important fishing harbor in the region situated nearby the resort of Cap Skirring. 
Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Nous habitons l'écovillage de Djirack qui a été laissé à son sort depuis le début des années 80, à cause du conflit armé qui sévissait dans la région Sud du sénégal. Très longtemps, nous sommes restées victimes de cette situation qui a contribué largement à la paupérisation des populations de cette localité, pourtant riche en ressources naturelles et surtout, halieutiques (huîtres, coquillages, crevettes, cymbium et poissons). C'est pour cela que nous venons solliciter le SEM pour qu'il nous trouve un financement auprès de Kiva, afin que nous puissions travailler. Notre travail consistera à la pêche et à la transformation( fumage, sèchage et poissons salés) des produits halieutiques. La vente de poissons frais aussi est prévue, car Djirack est un port de pêche très important dans la zone qui se trouve non loin de la station balnéaire de Cap Skirring.

loans.use:
Purchase and sale of fresh fish and fishery products

Achat et vente de poissons frais, pêche produits halieutiques

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela has been dedicated to the sale of sandwiches for 6 years. Every night she sets up her tables and chairs outside of her house and begins to sell until midnight. It was her sister who transferred the business to her, since Gabriela previously had a convenience store, but she had to close it due to problems.

In addition, Gabriela has sold clothes to order to her acquaintances for 2 years. Her husband, who is in the northern part of the country, offers clothes for sale in that zone.

The loans that she has requested served to buy wholesale the ingredients that she needs to make the sandwiches.

She would like to have her own house and to setup a soda fountain.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Gabriela se dedica a la venta de sánguches desde hace 6 años. Todas las noches saca sus mesas y sillas afuera de su casa y empieza a vender hasta la medianoche. Fue su hermana quien le traspasó el negocio, ya que antes Gabriela tenía una bodega, pero por problemas, tuvo que cerrarla.

Además, Gabriela vende ropa por pedidos a sus conocidos desde hace 2 años. Su esposo, quien es del norte del país, le ofrece la ropa por esa zona.

Los préstamos que ha solicitado le han servido para comprar por mayor los ingredientes que necesita para hacer los sánguches.

A ella le gustaría tener su casa propia y poner una fuente de soda.

loans.use: To buy wholesale the ingredients to make sandwiches.

loans.name: Nike

texts.en: Nike A. is 47 years old and married with two children.  For many years, she has managed a business in Lagos, Nigeria, that rents out chairs, pots, and coolers for social gatherings.  Nike's business also decorates halls and caters some of these occasions.  In order to expand her business, she requires a loan of $700, which will allow her to purchase more goods to rent to customers.

loans.use: To purchase more rentable goods.

loans.name: Thi Thao's Group

texts.vi:
chị Ngô thị Thảo Ms 09020015 năm nay 29 tuổi, chị đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con nhỏ. Gia đình chị có rất nhiều hoạt động tạo thu nhập như : Làm ruộng, bán thịt lợn, gà, vịt, chim....còn chồng chị thì làm nghề mộc, nên mức thu nhập của gia đình chị thu nhập từ 150.000 VND đến 200.000 VND / ngày. Chị đã tham gia vay vốn qua một chu kỳ và hoàn trả vốn rất tốt, chu kỳ này chị đăng ký vay mức 4.256.000 VND để thêm vốn đi chợ và mua máy để cho chồng làm mộc. Trong nhóm chị có các thành viên :

  • chị Đỗ thị Thu Ms 09020019 vay mức 4.256.000 VND để mua thức ăn gia súc
  • chị Lê thi Hương Ms 09020017 vay mức 4.256.000 VND để sửa quán bán hàng và chăn nuôi gà đẻ
  • chị Lê thị Mơ Ms 09020036 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để chồng phát triển nghề mộc
  • chị Nguyễn thị Ngân Ms 09020020 vay mức 590.000 VND mua vải may quần áo bán.
  • chị Vũ thị Thuý Ms 09020014 vay mức 4.256.000 VND để mở rộng cửa hàng thuốc
  • chị Nguyễn thị Loan Ms 09020018 vay mức 3.808.000 VND để đi chợ
  • chị Ngô thị Hiến Ms 09020016 vay mức 3.808.000 VND để phát triển nghề mộc
texts.en:
Mrs Ngô thị Thảo is 29 years old. She is married and has 2 young children. She and her husband do all kind of things to generate income: farming, sell pork, chicken, ducks ...her husband is a carpenter. Her family income is 150.000 - 200.000 VND a day. She has already paid back successfully her first loan. This time she is requesting 4.256.000 VND to buy goods and tools for her husband. Other members in her group are:
  • Mrs Đỗ thị Thu Ms, she is seeking 4.256.000 VND to buy feed for her livestock
  • Mrs Lê thi Hương, she is eeking 4.256.000 VND to repair her store and to raise chickens
  • Mrs Lê thị Mơ Ms, she is seeking 3.186.000 VND for her husband to expand his wood shop
  • Mrs Nguyễn thị Ngân, she is seeking 590.000 VND to buy fabric to make clothes
  • Mrs Vũ thị Thuý, she is seeking 4.256.000 VND to expand her store
  • Mrs Nguyễn thị Loan, she is seeking 3.808.000 VND. She sells basic goods
  • Mrs Ngô thị Hiến, she is seeking 3.808.000 VND. She is a carpenter

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: vay vốn kinh doanh buôn bán

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
Este grupo del Barrio Arroyo Pora surgió por medio de otro comité formado en el mismo barrio. Todas las señoras realizan actividades productivas, como ser venta de artículos comestibles, elementos de limpieza, venta de ropas, otras señoras tienen negocios propios en su domicilio (taller de costuras, despensa, ) y otro grupo se dedica a la fabricación y venta de manualidades y hay una señora que se dedica a la plomería. El monto que recibe cada señora es de 300.000, todas las señoras destinan el crédito para comprar mercaderias para las actividades que ya estan realizando actualmente. 
Las actividades que desarrollan cada una son:
1.	Norma Isabel B.-Venta de Ropas 
2.	Agustina R.-Modista
3.	Elba N.-Venta de Ropas
4.	Ramona P.-Venta de Manualidades
5.	Analía C.-Venta de Ropas
6.	Norma González-Despensa
7.	Aida Núñez-Venta de mercaderías comestibles
8.	Gladys González-Venta de Manualidades
9.	Antonia Cespede-Despensa
10.	Celestina F.-Modista
11.	Mirta Núñez-Modista
12.	María Cristina F.-Venta de Ropas
13.	Epifania González-Venta de Mercaderías em el Puente Internacional
14.	Lucía F.- Venta de Productos de limpieza
15.	Claudia F.-Modista
16.	Ignacia Benítez-Venta de Ropas
17.	María Elisa N.- Plomería
texts.en:
This group from the Barrio Arroyo Pora was formed from another group in the same area. All the women are productive: some sell food, cleaning supplies, clothes; others have their own businesses (seamstresses, grocery stores); and still others make and sell crafts and there is one woman who works as a plumber. The amount requested by each woman is 300,000 guaranies and all the funds will be invested in purchasing merchandise for each of the activities: 1. Norma Isabel B.-Clothing Sales 2. Agustina R.-Seamstress 3. Elba N.-Clothing Sales 4. Ramona P.-Crafts Sales 5. Analía C.-Clothing Sales 6. Norma González-Grocery store 7. Aida Núñez-Food Sales 8. Gladys González-Crafts Sales 9. Antonia Cespede-Grocery store 10. Celestina F.-Seamstress 11. Mirta Núñez-Seamstress 12. María Cristina F.-Clothing Sales 13. Epifania González-Sales of merchandise on the international bridge 14. Lucía F.- Sales of cleaning supplies 15. Claudia F.-Seamstress 16. Ignacia Benítez-Clothing Sales 17. María Elisa N.- Plumber

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restocking supplies of clothing, lingerie, foodstuffs (flour, oil, pasta, cigarretes) , materials for crafts (thread, fabric, needles), and more

loans.name: Roum

texts.en: Mr. Rom P., 56, is a carving wood seller. He sells carving wood by horsecart to customers's homes and earns approximately $3 per day. Rom married to Mrs. Khen Roeurn, 36, raises pigs. He has nine children, one of whom is married and eight are single. With his large family, Rom and his wife work hard every day. Rom and his wife request a loan of $250 to purchase a new horsecart for his business.

loans.use: To purchase a new horsecart for his business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy more firewood to make palm sugar

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Angelica is a member of the Maria Antonieta Village Bank.  Angelica is 23 years old, single, and lives with her parents. Angelica sells earrings and accessories to her friends and family members.
