She and her mother also run a dry goods store from their home.  Angelica needs a loan of 1200 PEN to buy fruitcake and wine.  Angelica dreams of owning her own home, having a motorcycle, and expanding her business. 
 
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Angelica es socia del Banco Comunal Maria Antonieta. 
Angelica es  soltera, tiene 23 años y vive con sus padres, Angélica vende aretes, accesorios que ofrece a amigos y familiares, sus productos los ofrece a amigos y familiares, Además junto a su mama tienen una tienda de abarrotes en su casa. 
Angelica necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de panetones, vinos. 
Angelica sueña con tener una casa propia, una moto y ampliar su negocio.

loans.use: Buy fruitcake and wine

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort A. sells food supplies at Akotobisin in Elmina. Comfort has received no formal education.  She is married and has 4 dependants. Her husband is a commercial driver. Comfort has been selling food supplies since 1994. She is responsible for paying rent, utility bills and other financial expenses of the family. Her loan will be used toadditional increase her inventory of food products for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to add to her husband's savings and acquire a piece of land to build their family house.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to increase her inventory of food products for sale.

loans.name: Dinora Elena

texts.es:
La señora Dinora pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Paz II”, vive en el pasaje Leoncio Prado s/n – AAHH. Las Brisas del Cumbaza, distrito de Tarapoto, departamento de San Martín. Tiene 22 años y es madre de una niña. Es conviviente, su pareja trabaja como docente quien le ayuda con los gastos del hogar. Con el primer prestamo de S/ 300 decide invertir en un  teléfono para brindar atención de llamadas a los vecinos del lugar. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco.

Actualmente cuenta con un locutorio un su propia casa, brinda atención de llamadas a celular y teléfono fijo aprovechando que en el lugar no existe un servicio como este, esto le permite un ingreso diario para poder pagar las cuotas del banco.

Con el prestamo de S/. 1,500 que será pagado en 4 meses comprara tarjetas para teléfono celular  y otro celular que le permita dar mayor atención a sus clientes ya que solo cuenta con uno.

Dinora agradece la oportunidad al Banco Comunal de realizarse como persona y poner su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Dinora belongs to the Community Bank 'La Paz II', and she lives in the pasaje Leonicio Prado s/n - AAHH. Las Brisas del Cumbaza, in the district of Tarapoto, in the department of San Martin. She is 22 years old and she has a daughter. She lives with her partner who works as a teacher and whom she helps with the household costs. With the first loan of 300 soles she decided to invest in a telephone to offer a telephone service to her neighbors. She has been working with the Bank for 2 years.

She currently has a telephone booth in her house and takes calls from cell phones and landlines, taking advantage of the fact that there is no other service like this in the area. This gives her a daily income so that she can pay the Bank's installments.

With the loan of 1500 soles, which she will repay over a period of 4 months, she will buy phone cards for cell phones and another phone which will allow her to serve her clients better as she currently only has one phone.

Dinora is grateful for the opportunity that the Community Bank has given her to fulfill herself as a person and in having her own business.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cell phone cards and another cell phone which will allow her to serve her clients better as she currently only has one phone/Comprar tarjetas para teléfono celular  y otro celular que le permita dar mayor atención a sus clientes ya que solo cuenta con uno.

loans.name: Musodjon

texts.ru:
Мирбабаев Мусоджон родился 1987 года, еще не женат, живет с родителями. Год назад он открыл лавку, где продает хозтовары. В его ассортименте имеются часы, лампочки, батарейки, щетки, лак для обуви, включатели, … Товары закупает на оптовом рынке «Корвон». Мусоджон также является мастером по ремонту мобильных телефонов и  радио-телеаппаратуры.  Теперь его знают во всей округе как мастера своего дела. Для оказания своих услуг Мусоджон часто ездит в город Душанбе, где в фирме ООО «Голубой экран» закупает запчасти. Местом его деятельности является Центральный рынок города Вахдат.
Мусоджон узнав о программе Кива решил участвовать в ней и получить займ на сумму 3000 сомони сроком на 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Musodjon M. was born in 1987, he is not married yet and lives with his parents. One year ago he opened a small shop where he sells household goods. In his assortment there are clocks, light bulbs, light switches, batteries, shoeshine. He buys the merchandise on the wholesale market Korvon. Musodjon also specializes in mobile phone and radio and telephone repairs. Now he is famous in his area as a professional in this field. Musodjon often travels to the city of Dushanbe to provide his services and to buy supplies and spare parts in the firm Blue Screen. The place of his business is the Central market in the town of Vahdat.

Musodjon found out about the Kiva program and decided to participate and apply for a loan for 3000 somoni (US$825) for a six months term.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy household goods

loans.name: Huseynali

texts.en: Huseynali S. has always been a hard-working man who has made sure, from a young age that his family never went without their daily bread. He is married and has two children. Huseynali has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of foodstuffs. With a loan from AqroInvest and his perseverance and dedication, he began this enterprise six years ago. He recommended himself as a trusted client. Today this has become a family business and his children and wife are engaged in the business. Today Huseynali needs to buy additional foodstuffs to increase his range of goods for sale.  He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in awhile to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: To purchase more goods for sale

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
El señor Jorge H. se dedica a su negocio de venta de pollo en piezas y entero ofertándolo en su propia casa de habitación local donde tiene su establecimiento. Es de importancia destacar que el señor Jorge es muy visitado por los clientes que compran el producto.

A pesar de las difíciles situaciones económicas que ha atravesado, ha logrado salir adelante en el negocio y esto gracias al apoyo brindado por Ceprodel por medio de la entrega de los créditos. Hoy en día una vez más ha acudido esperando respuesta positiva para obtener el crédito y así proceder a la compra del producto como lo es el pollo para comercializarlo en su establecimiento.
texts.en:
Jorge H. sells partial and whole chickens, working from his own home, where his business is located. It is important to note that Jorge is visited very often by his customers. Despite the difficult economic situations he has experienced, he has been able to get ahead in his business thanks to the support of Ceprodel loans. Now he is once again awaiting a positive response to his request for credit so he can purchase more chicken to sell in his establishment.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens to sell

loans.name: Bibizilol

texts.en:
M. Bibizilol has been selling a big variety of foodstuffs in her grocery store for the past 9 years. She is married and has a son. A true entrepreneur, she studies the market to determine client needs and preferences. Industrious and enterprising, Bibizilol is focused on expanding her business. Presently, she has a monthly income of about $400.

Bibizilol is currently seeking a loan for US $3000 for the term of 12 months. She plans to use the loan to increase her assortment of fresh merchandise and expand her business. With the increased sales and profits, Bibizilol hopes to expand her grocery and improve the living standards of her family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Expand store inventory

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is 40-year-old Rukia M. from Dar es Salaam. She is single with two children aged 15 and 17. Rukia has been running a used-clothing business since 2006. She works at the business for nine to 12 hours per day, six days per week. Rukia currently earns about $200 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase additional clothes. In the future, she plans to open another business. Rukia thanks you for your support!

SELFINA, a Kiva partner, has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of clothing

loans.name: Mohammad Asef

texts.en: The man who is pictured is M. Asef, the son of M. N.. He lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is forty-five years old and married with four children, two sons and two daughters. In his shop where he sells fuel, he is very busy every day all week except Friday. He would like to make some changes to his business and to purchase what he needs to improve it.  He has requested a loan and would like to say that this loan process supports entrepreneurs very effectively.

loans.use: To buy needed materials for improving his business

loans.name: Abdumanon

texts.en: A. Abdumanon is 42, and lives with his wife and two children in a house they own. For seven years he has worked in agriculture. Currently he works taking care of livestock and supervising crop land. Abdumanon eagerly waits for harvest season to see the results of his family’s hard work. Everyone helped out. The expectations for a good harvest are more clear for Abdumanon, because the weather doesn't seem to be against his wish. Later on, he wants to spend more time working with livestock and growing his own feed for the cattle, which will allow him to save on costs. This is the ninth time that Abdumanon has requested a loan from IMON International. He is committed, once more, to keep getting ahead with hard work. The money requested will be used to buy seeds and fertilizer for his harvest. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es: José Luis M. de 60 años de edad reside en el municipio de Zaragoza del departamento de La Libertad. José vive en casa propia con su esposa y dos hijos mayores de edad  profesionales universitarios. José y su esposa se dedican a su negocio que es una tienda ubicada dentro de su casa, cuenta con un inventario total de 700$ dólares en su negocio, el deseo de José es tener más variedad de productos en su tienda ya que carecen de muchos productos que son demandados por sus clientes es por eso que José solicita un crédito para surtir su negocio y generar mayores ganancias a través que sus ventas incrementen.
texts.en:
José Luis M. is 60 years old, and lives in the Zaragoza municipality of the La Libertad department (state). José lives in his own home with his wife, and two grown children who are at university. José and his wife have a store inside their home with $700 of inventory. His wish is to increase his inventory, and his store lacks some of the products requested by his customers. For this reason, José requests a loan in order to stock his store, and increase his revenue by selling more goods.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock his business.

loans.name: Anthony's Group

texts.en: Anthony is twenty-seven years old. He is married and has no children at the moment. He is a trader. He deals in game meat. He supplies local chop bar operators. Anthony is the leader of a trust bank group called "Shalom." He is the young man seated in front in the group photograph. The members of this group are mostly traders, food vendors, and farmers. They work very hard to support their spouses and to provide for their families. They buy their raw materials, wares, or goods from Kumasi, and sometimes from nearby communities, and sell at the market square in the community they live in. Some trek to other towns to sell their products. The members have been in business for some time and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. They guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan. They are requesting the loan to procure more goods and raw materials to be able to expand their businesses and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Ajentina

texts.en:
Ajentina is a member of the Idunda in Kihesa,Iringa,she is 40 years old woman,she is married.she cares for 3 dependents.

 Ajentina started her own grocery business selling beer 10 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Ajentina first loan from BRAC-Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 in order to buy more beer.

With the profit she gain from the use of this loan Ajentina hopes to save more money for family and expand her business

loans.use: To buy more beer

loans.name: Adom Bi Apuei Group

texts.en:
Enoch is thirty (30) years old he is married and father of two children. One is currently in school whiles his last born is still breastfeeding. He currently lives with his family and he is a trader who trades in assorted footwear’s. He takes stock of goods from Togo and some time Accra in Ghana. He makes sure he purchased good ones to attract customers. He needs the support of the loan to buy additional stock of footwear’s. With the loan he believes he can have variety of them to retain his customers. He would be grateful for your assistance.

He is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Adom Bi Apuei’. He is the one sitting in the group photograph. The members of this group are petty traders, food vendors etc. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy bulk supply of footwear’s.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en: Rogelio L. is from the village of Del Carmen, Iligan City. He is 47 years old, is married, and has one school-aged child. Rogelio owns and operates a business providing motorcycle services to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over seven years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Rogelio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Peniel, Group 7

texts.en:
Patria is 28 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Samana.  She is the coordinator of the Banco de Esperanza (Bank of Hope) Peniel.  Her story is representative of the other women in her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients.  Samana is a community with unreliable electricity and running water. 

This is Patria's first loan with Esperanza.  She came to Esperanza for a loan because she wants to open a cafe and work for herself. She plans to use the loan to buy food to sell in her cafe including: cookies, cheese, and juice.  She will also buy a toaster. 

Patria wants to start a business so that she can improve the living conditions for her family.  She would like to buy a house, a washing machine and shoes for her children. She hopes to continue to invest in her business in the future.

loans.use: Items to sell in a cafe including: cookies, cheese, and juice

loans.name: Augusto

texts.es:
Augusto, de 38 años, es padre de un hijo de 4 añitos de edad y vive junto a su esposa quien lo apoya mucho. Desde hace 2 años cuenta en su casa con un pequeño negocio de venta de comida, donde brinda desayuno y almuerzo de lunes a viernes, mientras que los sábados y domingos prepara parrilladas y bebidas heladas, para lo cual cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien es la encargada de estos preparativos, y es él quien atiende a los clientes

Adicionalmente, Augusto trabaja para una entidad privada dedicada a la erradicación de la hoja de coca, labor que viene efectuando desde hace 7 años. Lo que más le gusta de sus labores es que se relaciona con muchas personas y se entretiene, además le es muy rentable porque ambas cosas le producen buenos ingresos con los que mantiene tranquilamente a su familia.   

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y lo que le gusta de su grupo es que son personas trabajadoras y responsables. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mesas, sillas y utensilios de cocina (platos, tazas y cubiertos) para su negocio.
texts.en:
Augusto, 38 years old, is father of a four-year-old son and lives with his wife who is very supportive of him. For two years now, he has been running a small restaurant business out of his house, where he sells breakfast and lunch Monday through Friday, while on Saturdays and Sundays he makes barbecue and cold drinks. His wife is in charge of making the food and he is the one who serves the customers. Additionally, Augusto works for a private entity dedicated to the eradication of coca leaves, which he has been doing for seven years. What he likes most about his work is that he interacts with many people and has a good time. In addition, it is very profitable because both jobs produce good income which keeps his family comfortable. This is his first loan with MFP and what he likes about his group is that they are very hardworking and responsible people. With the money that he is now requesting he will buy tables, chairs, and kitchenware (plates, cups, and utensils) for his business.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy furniture for his business

loans.name: Moises

texts.es:
El señor Moisés W.  vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Faro Murillo, área periférica de la ciudad de La Paz, con sus tres hijos pues su esposa falleció hace dos años.
El señor Moisés tiene un puesto de reparadora de calzados en un mercado de esta ciudad, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la refacción del muro perimetral de su casa, que por su antigüedad se encuentra deteriorado y esta por caer.
Esta es la segunda vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Moisés Karachi lives in his own house in the Faro Murillo area, which is outside the city of La Paz. He lives with his three children. His wife died three years ago. He has a shoe repair stand in the market in this city. This income supports his family. The loan he is asking for is to repair the walls of his house. Due to the aged structure, the walls have deteriorated and at risk of falling. This is the second time he has asked for a loan. The socioeconomic analysis favorably qualifies him, and he is able to accept a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair the walls of his house

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is divorced. She has a grown son. Irina has been in the clothing sales business for 10 years. She sells children’s jean clothing in one of the biggest marketplaces in Zaporozhye. Since Irina launched her trade, she has managed to expand her small venture and purchased a vending kiosk and a vending tent in the same market. Both clients and fellow entrepreneurs recognize the wise pricing policy Irina has established. She has about 30,000 grivnyas in working capital. Her monthly net profit amounts to 2,500 grivnyas.

Irina is seeking a loan of 13,800 grivnyas to increase her working capital. She is planning to purchase seasonal clothing in bulk to widen her assortment of inventory for the cold season. Irina understands the value of having readily available resources to help her business grow and succeed and is very grateful for the given opportunity.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of Beans and Maize

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita Q. is from the village of Corrales in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old. Perlita is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Perlita sells vegetable and spices in the market. Perlita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000.00 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2005, Perlita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000.00 PHP from GDMPC. She used her previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Perlita is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP to expand her business. This will be Perlita's 6th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Benkelema Group

texts.fr:
Les  quatre membres du groupe Benkelema sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et 3 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et  résident dans la ville de Fana, quartier Banankabougou, sous préfecture de Fana, Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage et de parentés. Elles exercent le commerce d’articles divers. 
Ces femmes collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de satisfaire leur clientèle qui ne cesse d’accroître du jour en jour. 
Elles sont à leur septième  prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter,  8 sacs de petit mil pour la préparation de la bouillie à vendre, 3 sacs de savon  de 300 morceaux avec les fabricants de la place et beaucoup d’articles divers. Les marchandises sont achetées dans la ville de Fana. La vente de ces produits s’effectue aux domiciles des femmes et dans le marché de Fana à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles comptent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 35 000FCFA par mois. Les bénéfices sont d’une part réinvestis dans l’activité et d’autre part dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille. 
Elles ont pour ambition d’élargir leur secteur d’activité en embrassant l’élevage des ovins et caprins.
texts.en:
The four members of the Benkelema group are married women, who are on average 37 years of age and have three children. They live together with their husbands and children in traditional large families in the city of Fana, in the area of Banankabougou, Fana district, in the region of Koulikoro, Republic of Mali. They met through neighbors and relatives and have a business selling various items. These women work together with the microfinance insititution Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to respond to the daily growing demand of their customers. This is their seventh group loan and all the previous ones have been fully repaid. With this loan they want to buy eight sacks of millet for the preparation of slurry to sell, three sacks of soap of 300 pieces each from the local manufacturers, as well as other different items. They buy their supplies in the city of Fana and they sell door to door as well as at the market place in Fana; their customers are men and women. They hope to achieve an average monthly revenue of 35000 FCFA each. They will invest part of the revenue in their business and use the rest for their families' daily expenses. Their ambition is to expand their field of activity to include the raising of sheep and goats.

Translated from French by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various items

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is married and the mother of six children who are all currently in school. She is 45 years old and lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in one of the mining towns in Ghana. She works hard to help her husband provide for the family. Grace is a food vendor. She prepares and sells rice with stew. She sells on a tabletop by the roadside in her community. She buys her raw materials from nearby towns. Grace has been in business for over 20 years and wants a loan to buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: To buy ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Devine Grace Group, Mukono

texts.en:
M. Jane is 47 years old and married with 6 children, aged 21 – 14 years, all in school; she also takes care of 3 orphans. Jane is a business lady with a poultry business in Kireku for the past 2 years, as well as dealing in the sale of flowers from the same area. She says that although her business is mostly affected by the bad debtors, she is able to make 150,000/= as profits a week and this is basically due to the quality of her chickens and the eggs that she sells.

Jane hopes to expand her gardens so that she can have more flowers to sell as well as building her own house in the near future. She needs a loan to be able to boost her flower garden business as well as buying more feed for her poultry farm.

loans.use: Buying more chicken feed and boosting her flower garden business with more fertilizer

loans.name: Mercedes Del Carmen

texts.es: Mercedes Del Carmen tiene la edad de 44 años, su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general, por lo que tiene 3 años de dedicarse a este negocio. Por lo que no es la primera experiencia que obtiene con los financiamientos, ella distribuye sus productos por encargos pues es así que obtiene más clientes. Ya que sus inicios fueron muy difíciles porque no tenía el capital suficiente. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de calzado, perfumes y ropa en general.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 44 year old and has been selling general merchandise for three years. This is not her first experience with credit, as she distributes her products to order because this allows her to have more customers. Starting was challenging for her because she did not have enough capital. She is asking for this loan in order to buy shoes, perfumes, and general clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: Amy D. est une femme de 57ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DAROU-KOUDOSS depuis 3ans et demi et a eu à bénéficier de 7 prêts qu'elle a toujours bien gérés et remboursés régulièrement. Elle développe un petit commerce de céréales, elle vend du mil, du maïs et du riz. Par ailleurs, elle commercialise également du sucre. Son activité lui a permis de s'équiper par l'achat d'un réfrigérateur et son objectif est de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Amy D. is a 57 year-old married mother of three. She has been a member of the Darou-Koudoss credit association for three and a half years and has received seven loans that have all been successfully managed and repaid. She is developing her small cereal business, and currently sells millet, corn and rice as well as sugar. She has been able to use the proceeds from her business to purchase a refrigerator and her ultimate aim is to improve her family's quality of life.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying and selling cereals

loans.name: Aku Eunice

texts.fr: Cette dame de 42 ans est très dynamique, elle est mariée et mère de 03 femmes, elle a commencé en 2007 le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, ce qu’elle gagne  de ce commerce lui permet de contribuer aux dépenses de son foyer. Faisant face à une baisse de son stock de marchandises, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour se réapprovisionner en produits d’alimentation générale
texts.en:
This 42-year old lady is very dynamic. She is married and mother to three children. She began a business selling general food products in 2007 and the money she earns from this business allows her to contribute to her household expenses. In light of a fall in her stock of general food products, she is applying to WAGES for a loan in order to rebuild this stock.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of general food products

loans.name: Chay

texts.en:
Mrs. Chay N. was born in 1975 and has been established in a small family home located in Sotnikom district, Siem Reap province, where she lives with her husband and children. To generate a daily income, Chay N. distills rice wine and sells it to people who order and buy directly from her home. Additionally, she sometimes uses the leftover from distilling wine to feed a few pigs, which she will sell when they come to maturity. 

Chay N. has been relying on the income from her husband’s job, planting sesame and peanut crops. He owns a machine that he uses to mill rice for a fee. This couple has been married for many years. They are blessed with two young school-aged children. To improve the investments and daily profit, Chay N. is applying for a loan to buy a new milling machine for service. She intends to use some of the loan towards raising pigs and crops.

loans.use: To buy a new milling machine and to raise pigs and crops.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To puchase phone recharge cards.

loans.name: Bou

texts.en: Mrs. T. is a 56-year-old fish catcher and the mother of seven children. Two of them are employed: one is a boat driver and one works on the massage staff for a club. Every day in the early morning, Mrs. T. and her husband fish in and around the river, and they quickly bring the fish they have caught to retail at the market. Now, the family needs more tools to use for fishing, but they don’t have the money yet to fulfill their need. Therefore, Mrs. T. decided to request a loan of $300, which she will use to purchase many sets of accessories to use for fishing operations.

loans.use: To purchase accessories for fishing operations

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam S., 49, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples.

S. is a farmer who grows rice and flowers to sell, earning an income of about USD $2 per day. Her husband is a driver for an organization, earning an income of USD $4 per day.

S. is requesting a loan of USD $1000 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair the house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a motorbike

loans.name: Happy Corner Success Group

texts.en:
Tamba J., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers. He is 30 years old, single, and has one child who is 15 months old. He was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to financial constraints. For 12 years, he has been operating a tailoring shop at Happy Corner Market, downtown Monrovia, Liberia. 

Tamba plans to use his 24,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 77,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more cloth to sew more school uniforms and garments. He describes himself as a determined and hard-working man.  His dream is to improve his business and travel abroad to import goods.

loans.use: To buy more cloth to sew more school uniforms and other garments

loans.name: Evelia Del Socorro

texts.es: Evelia Del Socorro tiene 49 años, este no es el primer financiamiento que solicita, por lo que su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos. Ella utiliza una chaqueta que la cubra del inmenso sol por lo que tiene que recorrer lugares lejanos y tiene que hacerlo caminando, esto no la detiene para seguir adelante con su negocio. el crédito lo utilizara para la compra de perfumes, cremas, colonias, lápiz labial, polvos y algunos tratamientos.
texts.en:
Evelia Del Socorro is 49 years old. This is not the first loan that she has requested. Her economic activity is the sale of cosmetics. She uses a jacket with a large sunshade, since she has to travel to distant places and has to go on foot. This does not stop her from continuing ahead with her business. The credit will be used to purchase perfumes, creams, colognes, lipstick, powder and some treatments.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Totonata

texts.en:
Totonata A. W. is 20 and married with 2 children (ages 1 month and 2 years).  She owns a business venture selling ice-cakes (flavored ice in styrofoam cups).  Totonata has 1 year of experience in this business.  Totonata needs a loan of 1000 Samoan tala (WST) to buy sugar, styrofoam cups, and codial (flavoring).  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 200 talas or US $83 per week) to improve and expand it.

In 2010, Totonata joined SPBD.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Totonata's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  

http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to buy sugar, styrofoam cups, and codial (flavoring)

loans.name: Modoukpe

texts.en:
Madame Modoukpe A. is 26 years old and lives in her hometown of Lomé, Togo. She is married and has one child.
Modoukpe sells cosmetics in her neighborhood in Lomé. She has been selling these products since 2005. Modoukpe has requested her first loan from Kiva partner, WAGES, of 180,000 XOF in order to purchase more products to sell. With this loan she will invest more into her business, hopefully increasing her profits and providing a better life for her family.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetic products

loans.name: Marcelline

texts.fr: Née en 1978 à Grand-Popo au Bénin, G. Marcelline est mariée à ANATO Emile, un électricien. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés. La famille s'est installée depuis quatre ans au quartier Godomey Salamey dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi. Marcelline subvient ensemble avec son mari, aux divers besoins de sa famille, grâce au revenu de son activité. Marcelline n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Il y a deux ans environs que Marcelline a commencé la vente de produits de soins pour bébé et aussi des vêtements bébé. Marcelline achète ses produits à Lomé au Togo et les vend dans sa boutique. C'est la première fois que Marcelline sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un prêt, en vue de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born in 1978 in Grand-Popo in Benin, Marcelline G. is married to Emile Anato, an electrician. The couple has three children, all of whom go to school. The family has been living for four years in the Godomey Salamey district in the community of Abomey Calavi. Marcelline provides for the family needs alongside her husband, thanks to her enterprise. Marcelline did not go to school. About two years ago, Marcelline started selling baby care products and baby clothing. Marcelline purchases her goods in Lomé in Togo and resells them in her store. This is the first time that Marcelline is seeking a loan from ALIDé, in order to expand her business and better respond to customer needs.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing 5 cartons of baby powder and 10 dozen sets of baby clothing

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
This is Nenita C., 58, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. Predeceased by her husband Ernesto C., she struggles to work hard to survive and be able to help her family, her siblings and their own families.

Nenita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store retailing groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Her store is located adjacent to her house, and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php350 in sales everyday.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php24,000 loan to buy more quantities of products such as groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her enterprise.

Nenita fervently prays for her mother to recover from a lingering sickness. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. Each fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more quantities of products such as groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Floralie

texts.en: Floralie E. is a married woman who lives in Treplin, Barangay Binaobao, Bantayan, Cebu. She earns her living from a vegetable-vending business. Her husband, Lumelo E., who is 34 years old, is a businessman and also helps in his wife's business. They have four children who are from 6 to 14 years old and are currently going to school. Floralie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she wished for something better for her family. With the help of her past six loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, uplifting her family's standard of living. This time, for her 7th loan, Floralie is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use as an additional capital to buy stock so that she can continue to save for the future to buy a delivery truck. Floralie is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue in its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of flour, oil, butter, baking powder, yeast, etc.

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en: Ashraf A. has been able to support his family in an honorable way by selling different kinds of food items in his grocery store. He is married and has two children. In order to improve the quality and quantity of his products, he wants to buy more food items. For this purpose he needs a loan of 1000 AZN. Ashraf has put a lot of effort into developing his business; he would like to keep growing as a micro-entrepreneur and, with your help, this could be possible.

loans.use: To buy more food items.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of used sneakers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of gold, silver, plaster, and stones for graduation rings

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
We need to do something extra to make out of the ordinary something that is extraordinary. Rosita B. knows that and applies it daily. Rosita's life might seem ordinary: a CCT community partner at 56; married to a driver named Domingo; the mother of two children. But Rosita is ready to do something extra to make her life more than ordinary. 
 
Rosita's extra effort comes in the form of small-scale businesses. At present, she rents out bed spaces to boarders. She also runs a side-car business, a means of transportation where the family lives, in Pasay City, Philippines.  Aside from that, Rosita is also a vegetable dealer. Putting these together, Rosita is able to earn around Php400 per day.

To help her continue operation of her businesses, Rosita would like to apply for a Php20,000 loan. This would be beneficial as it would enable her to buy extra double-deck beds and increase the number of bed spaces to rent out. The loan would also help her grow her vegetable business as she can then buy more varieties of vegetables to sell. Rosita wants to add more to the number of small-scale businesses she is presently managing. She particularly wants to put up a big business like a grocery store.

Rosita did not note any present challenges except for her health condition. She believes that doing extra things now such as saving up and living a healthy lifestyle will make a difference in her future and, more importantly, in her family's future.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase additional facilities for rental

loans.name: Cerelina

texts.en:
Cerelina S. is from the village of Yumbing, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 40 years old. Cerelina is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Cerelina owns & operates a business venture in the food sector butchering and selling meat in the market. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from butchering and selling beef and pork in the market. Cerelina has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Cerelina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cerelina is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional pigs and cows to butcher for meat. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Cerelina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pigs & cow to butcher for meat

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
40-year-old Arlene B. is from the town of Sikatuna. She is married and has a 16-year-old child. To make a living, Arlene owns & operates a general store selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Arlene also has a small piggery in her backyard. She grows the pigs for fattening and sale.

Arlene joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arlene has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Arlene is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to buy feed, piglets and additional merchandise to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her child's tuition fee.

loans.use: To buy feed, piglets and additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.es: Susan, de 29; convive con su pareja Octavio con el que tiene un hijo y están viviendo en su casa que es propia.Le gusta levantarse muy temprano para compartir su tiempo con la cocina y la venta de ropa. Desde  10 años trabaja como cocinera y vendedora de prendas de vestir.  Susan está contenta con su labor, y sobre todo le gusta preparar variedad de exquisitos platos y comercializar novedosas prendas de vestir,  que son de agrado para sus clientes, y de ese modo sus clientes optan por lo que ofrece. En la temporada de verano no le gusta mucho caminar; porque se sofoca demasiado con el calor de la ceja de selva peruana, por eso prefiere ofrecer la ropa  a partir de las cuatro  de la tarde, y de ese modo no pierde a sus clientes. Su mayor aspiración es tener otro ingreso para poder brindar un bienestar mejor a mi familia.Este es su tercer crédito que tiene con MFP y se compromete una vez más a pagar en las fechas exactas, ya que su banco comunal extiende el apoyo cuando se necesita.Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, invertirá en la compra de un motocarro  y así desea obtener otro ingreso más para  su hogar; además comprara algunas prendas pues tiene algunos pedidos por cumplir.
texts.en: Susan, 29, lives with her partner, Octavio, and their son in a house that they own.  She likes to get up early so that she can work at her two jobs, as a cook and as the operator of a clothing business.  She has worked at both for 10 years.  She is happy with the work, cooking delicious food, on one hand, and selling original and unique items of clothing, on the other.  Her customers appreciate what she has to offer and come to her for what they need.  In the summer, the heat in the Peruvian jungle is suffocating so Susan's customers avoid going out when they can.  Consequently, she generally works selling clothes after 4:00pm so that she doesn't miss anyone.  Her greatest wish is to have another source of income so that she can better provide for her family.  This is her third MFP loan and she is committed to repaying it on the agreed-upon dates because the community bank provides much-needed financing.  With the three-thousand new soles loan, she will buy a motorized cart, an investment that will help her increase her family's income.  She will also buy items of clothing to fill existing orders.

loans.use: Buy a motorized cart and merchandise for clothing sales business.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes qui composent le groupe BENKADI sont toutes mariées, ont une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans,  3 enfants et vivent dans des familles conjugales nucléaires avec leurs  époux et enfants à Hèrèmakono, l’un  des quartiers centre de la ville de BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles se sont connues par des liens de parenté, de voisinage et font le commerce de condiments, de charbon de bois et des articles divers. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire leurs clientèles et augmenter la taille de leur commerce, elles ont décidé d’adhérer pour la première fois au programme de crédit Soro Yiriwaso 
Avec ce prêt  Hawa K., compte acheter, 5 sacs d’arachides auprès des paysans dans les villages environnants. 
La vente se fait en détail, au comptant et à crédit, au marché de Bougouni et à son domicile à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Avec ce prêt Hawa K. espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 15.000 FCFA  dont une partie sera utilisée dans son entreprise et l’autre partie pour les frais de santé.
texts.en:
The women in the BENKADI group are all married, and average 32 years of age and three children. The live in nuclear families with their husbands and children in Hèrèmakono, one of the central neighborhoods in the city of BOUGOUNI (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They got acquainted through community and kinship bonds, and sell food condiments, charcoal, and various other items.

Eager to meet customer demand and bolster their business, they decided to join the credit program of Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso for the first time.

With this loan, Hawa K. intends to buy 5 sacks of peanuts from farmers in the neighboring villages. She retails for cash and on credit, at the Bougouni market and at her home, to a clientele comprising both women and men. 

Thanks to this loan, Hawa K. hopes to turn a monthly profit of XOF 15'000 (ca US$ 30), to be used in part in her business, and in part for health expenses.

loans.use: To buy and resell peanuts

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert, aged 25 years, is a married man living in a semi-permanent house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. Five years ago he sold his goats and got initial capital. He deals in buying and selling coffee and maize. He dreams of educating his children, building a permanent house, and having a permanent farm. Robert wants a loan to buy coffee and maize for resale.

loans.use: Buying coffee and maize for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pots and clay piggybanks.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon K. is 50 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  He is a widower and has seven children.  None of his children is currently in school.  Simon has a small retail shop, which he has had for over 10 years.         

To help expand his business, Simon has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more sugar and soap for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Simon hopes to generate greater profits and buy food and take care of himself.  In the future, Simon hopes to expand his business into a big wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar and soap, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Nulu

texts.en:
Nulu K. lives in the Mengo Mackay neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has four children, all of whom are in school. 

Nulu has a business of selling charcoal and bunches of bananas. She has been in this business for six years, and she works seven days out of every week. Nulu sells her products at the market, by means of retail. 

She has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal and bunches of bananas. She also generates additional income through rental rooms. 

The main business challenges for Nulu include thieves, transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling at wholesale only. Nulu lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal and bunches of bananas

loans.name: Vath

texts.en:
Mrs. Vath was born in 1974.  She is married to Mr. Sambath.  They are farmers who own a small piece of land where they grow rice to sell and earn income as well as to feed their family.  Mr. Sambath is also a cow middleman.  Through these activities, they support two children -- one is a laborer and the other is studying in the local public school.  

Since her husband’s cattle trading business is going well, Mrs. Vath wants to expand it.  To achieve this purpose, she is applying for a loan to add their savings to buy a cow to resell.

loans.use: To buy a cow to resell

loans.name: Jonadamu

texts.en: Jonadamu is 33 years old and married with two children who are ages 11 months and 6 years. He owns a shop with different items that are commonly used at home such as matches, salt, sugar, candles etc and he works together with her wife. He is requesting a loan to buy more items such as salt, sugar, candles etc and fill his shop so that she wins the clientele around and makes more profits. He plans to save all her profits until she is able to build a family house.

loans.use: To buy more inventory.

loans.name: Magbesseh Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Magbesseh” group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are petty businesswomen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, in order to seek a loan of SLL 1,200,000 for each in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group is Fatmata B.. Fatmata was born in the village of Massang forty years ago. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a trader and one of her children is attending primary school while four are in secondary school. Fatmata has been selling peppers, flour, palm oil, rice, etc. for the past six years now. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy the above-mentioned items in bulk to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy peppers, flour, palm oil, rice, etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Sambo

texts.en: Sambo, age 34, is married and resides with her husband and children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Sambo produces traditional baskets and sells souvenirs, earning an income of $6 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband who is a construction worker, earning an income of $5 per day. Their standard of living has been improved since Sambo and her husband have had these businesses. She is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase rice to stock for sale. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy rice in stock for sale

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
For the past three years, Sammy has been operating a welding business in Mulolongo town. He also manages a hardware shop. Sammy earns a monthly income of 22,000 KES from his businesses. 

This is Sammy’s first loan from KADET LTD. He will purchase another welding machine and hardware and tools to sell. Sammy plans to use the anticipated profit from his loan to enlarge his store and open another branch at Athi River.

In the future, Sammy would like to expand his business and open a large hardware and metals shop.

loans.use: to purchase a welding machine and tools

loans.name: Sonia Carolina

texts.es:
Sonia, vive con su familia, su madre y dos hijos, tiene casa propia, ella es comerciante D. ropa, zapatos y accesorios, el negocio lo estableció desD. hace dos años por iniciativa propia, solo con el apoyo D. su madre, no tiene un horario D. trabajo establecido.
Ella requiere financiamiento para comprar diversidad D. zapatos y ropa para ambos sexos, la inversión le ayudara a tener mejores estilos D. zapatos y blusas, faldas, short, esto le permitirá atender D. la mejor manera a la clientela.
Su objetivo es montar su propia empresa, que tenga mayor rentabilidad para garantizar una mejor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Sonia lives with her family: her mother and her two children.  She owns her own home.  Sonia is a saleswoman who sells clothes, shoes and accessories.  She set up her business two years ago, on her own initiative and with her mother's support.  She does not work fixed hours.

Sonia needs a loan to buy a range of shoes and clothes for both sexes.  This investment will help her to have better styles of shoes, blouses, skirts and shorts available.  This will enable her to better serve her customers.

Sonia's goal is to set up her own company that is more profitable so that she can guarantee better comfort for her family.

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothes such as blouses, skirts and shorts

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah is 36 years old.  She is married and with four children.  She runs a retail store to earn a living.  She works hard in her business to help pay for her children's education.  Being a member of Faulu Kenya, she has been trained on savings and business management.  This has helped her to grow her business hence improving her financial status.

Veronicah hopes to grow her business into wholesale in the future.  She has requested for 60 000 Kenyan shillings to buy maize flour, soda, sugar and rice.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, soda, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Thelma Fabiola

texts.es: La señora Thelma fue integrante del banco de emprendimiento "buenas emprendedoras" que culminaron su ciclo sin ningún problema de mora ni atrasos. Se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por mayor y menor de diferentes casas de belleza, vive con su hija en la casa de sus papas. El crédito esta destinado a la compra de cosméticos por pedidos que ya los realizo y como maneja grupos de promotoras de ventas de cosméticos necesita comprar una computadora para el registro y envió de información a sus proveedores tanto de sus productos como de sus clientes todo esto lo maneja en el mismo domicilio donde vive la cliente, mas adelante piensa en ampliar su gama de ventas con otros productos de línea blanca y electrodomésticos.
texts.en: Thelma was a founding member of the "Buenas Emprendedoras” entrepreneurial bank, which completed a cycle without any problems, defaults, or falling behind in payments.  She sells cosmetics in large and small quantity to different beauty shops and lives with her daughter at her parents’ house.  She will use the money from this loan to fill cosmetic orders and, since she manages groups of salespersons, she needs to buy a computer to manage orders and send information about her products and customers to her suppliers.  She works out of her home and, in the future, plans to expand her range of sales to include major and small appliances.

loans.use: to fill orders and buy a computer

loans.name: Godfrey Omondi

texts.en:
Godfrey is forty-one years old, married, and they have four children aged between eighteen years old and four years old whom they wish to give a good education to the university level. He makes and sells tea and doughnuts by the roadside in a residential area in Nairobi. He has been running this business for the last four years.

He says that the business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. He is using his loan of Kes. 20,000 to buy flour to grow his business and meet the demand of his customers. He hopes to grow his business to a big restaurant in future. He describes himself as respectful and God-fearing.

loans.use: to purchase flour.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring and dressmaking business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for the past 10 years and also earns an income from laminating wood. Judith has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF.

Judith is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional linens and other materials for her business. In the future, she dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase linens and materials for her business

loans.name: Dolores Imelda

texts.es:
Dolores Imelda tiene 44 años de edad, es soltera vive sola en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. 

La V.R.C SAN JACINTO, se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia San José del Tambo Recinto San Jacinto Perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de maíz, cacao, plátano, naranja y crianza de animales.

Dolores se dedica al cultivo de maíz, cacao, plátano, naranja y crianza de animales. Compra el productor en el local de Agro Insumos María y vende sus productos en el mercado de San José del Tambo cada fin de semana. 

Solicita el crédito para compra de abonos, semillas, insumos, fertilizantes, urea y otro tipo de abonos y líquidos para evitar la plaga en los cultivos para mantener los productos en buenas condiciones y poder comprar  comida para los animales que tiene para la crianza para lo posterior venderlos en un mejor precio. 

El crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar la calidad del producto y sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como la caída de precios de los productos que comercializa, así como los intermediarios. Su sueño es poderse comprar un terreno para poder sembrar un poco más para obtener mayores utilidades para el bienestar de la familia.

Se caracteriza por ser tranquila, honrada, responsable, puntual en los pagos, le gusta salir a pasear  y le gustan las fiestas en especial el Carnaval.
texts.en:
Dolores Imelda is 44 years old, single, and lives alone in the canton of Chillanes in Bolívar Province.

The San Jacinto Communal Bank is located in the parish of San José del Tambo in the neighborhood of San Jacinto, which is part of the canton of Chillanes. The members of this Communal Bank engage in agriculture, primarily the cultivation of corn, cacao, bananas, and oranges. They also raise animals.

Dolores grows corn, cacao, bananas, oranges, and raises animals. She buys her inputs from María Agricultural Supplies and sells her products at the market in San José del Tambo every weekend.

Dolores is requesting a loan to buy compost, seeds, supplies, fertilizers, urea, and other items to combat pests that attack her crops so that they remain in good condition. She will also buy food for the animals she raises so that she can sell them later at a good price.

This loan will serve as financial support to supply her with what she needs to improve the quality of her crops and her farming activities. She also deals with challenges, such as falling prices for the products she sells, especially the prices offered by brokers. Her dream is to buy a plot of land so that she can grow a little more, which will generate more profits for the welfare of her family.

Dolores is known for being calm, honest, responsible, and punctual with her payments. She enjoys going out for walks and attending parties, especially during Carnival.

loans.use: to buy compost, seeds, supplies, fertilizers, urea, and other items for her crops, as well as feed for her animals.

loans.name: Elmer Eudoro

texts.es:
Eudoro de 55 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, la cual no cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.   Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Eudoro desde hace 8 años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (ovejas y cabras), sus corrales se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para poderlos ofrecer en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos de su casa.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles  para la compra de alimento balanceado para si
us animales, con las ganancias que obtenga con la venta de sus animales podrá cubrir su crédito como tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Eudoro es una persona que con esfuerzo y mucho empeño ha sabido sacar adelante a su familia, brindándoles otras comodidades.
texts.en:
Eudoro is 55 years old. He lives with his family in his own house, which has only electricity. The house is located in the rural district of Tambogrande which belongs to the department of Piura. This area is known for its agriculture, livestock and crafts.

Eudoro has worked in the rearing and sale of livestock (sheep and goats) for 8 years. His corals, which are suitable and large, are located at the back of his house. He feeds the animals with nutritionally balanced food and fodder so that his animals reach their optimum size. Then he can put them up for sale at the different markets in the area and thus obtain a good profit to cover his household expenses..

He has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles (PEN) to buy nutritionally balanced food for his animals. With the profits he will obtain from the sale of his animals, he will be able to cover his loan as well as have a better quality of life. Eudoro is a person who with a lot of hard work and effort has managed to raise his family, providing them with other comforts.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced food for his animals.

loans.name: Kachena B Group

texts.en:
John is the facilitator of Kachena B group. John and his group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
	
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important farming inputs to distribute to John and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

John takes care of nine children at home. He joined One Acre fund in order to get money, to educate his children and to buy livestock .In the recent 2011 season, John had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 8 bags on a half acre piece of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, John was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on a half acre of land.

With the income from maize sales, John intends to buy livestock and to get food for his family.

In 2012, members of Kachena B group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the picture above, John and his group members are displaying some maize cobs from the recent harvest.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Gastelu

texts.es: Gastelu, de 28 años es un hijo responsable. Vive en compañía de su mamá Esperanza y su papá Cecilio. A los que quiere mucho y protege en su casa propia. A pesar de su corta edad, trabaja con ahínco para su futuro, de su pequeña hija “Mariela” y el de sus padres. Su principal actividad económica es la “agricultura”, ahí siembra café y maíz en los terrenos de cultivo de sus padres, los cuales cuida con mucho esmero en sus tiempos libres. Pues cuenta que otra de sus actividades, es la pesca de peces de agua dulce. Cuenta que tres veces a la semana con sus instrumentos de pescar,  ingresa al río en busca de peces “chupadora”, “mota” y “liza”, los cuales vende en le mercado de la ciudad de Pichanaki, donde obtiene 10 soles por cada kilo. Su record es pescar 30 kilos al día. Su objetivo es obtener instrumentos industriales y una lancha con lo que pueda alcanzar mayor cantidad de peces y así tener mayores ganancias. Además de ahorrar suficiente dinero para comprar sus propios terrenos agrícolas. Sabe que con constancia lo logrará. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Los Naranjales” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde agradece la oportunidad que le brindan. Por ello promete ser puntual con sus cuotas. Gastelu de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de semilla de maíz para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Gastelu, age 28, is a responsible son.  He lives with his mother, Esperanza, and his father, Cecilio.  He loves them very much, and he takes care of them in their own house.  In spite of his young age, he works extremely hard for the future of his daughter, Mariela, and his parents.

His main business activity is agriculture.  He grows coffee and corn on his parents’ fields.  He takes care of them with great dedication in his free time.  

He has another business activity, fishing for freshwater fish.  He says that three times a week he takes his fishing gear and gets in the river looking for “chupadora”, “mota”, and  “liza” (types of freshwater fish in Peru).  He sells them in the market in the city of Pichanaki.  He gets ten soles per kilo.  His record is catching 20 kilos a day.

His objective is to get industrial tackle and a small boat, which he will use to be able to get a greater quantity of fish.  This way he will have greater income.  He will also save enough money to buy his own fields.  He knows that with perseverance he will do it.

He belongs to the “Los Naranjales” (The Orange Groves) communal bank.  This is his first loan with MFP, and he is grateful for the opportunity they are giving him.  He pledges to make his payments punctually.  Upon receiving your support Gastelu will use the money to buy corn seeds for the next planting cycle.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds.

loans.name: Bainga

texts.en:
Bainga is 34 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a ger—a Mongolian yurt— in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife is a kindergarten teacher's assistant and his two kids are elementary school students. 

He was a bus driver from 2002-2010. Seven months ago he bought a van for his own business. Unfortunately, his new van is having some mechanical issues. He is a strong and diligent man who says: "I am very experienced in my field and have a very bright vision of my business." He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to buy parts to repair his vehicle and get tires.

loans.use: To buy parts and tires to fix his van for his transportation business.

loans.name: Gladys Yolanda

texts.es:
La Señora Gladys es socia del banco comunal Emprendedores del Futuro, vive  en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad desde diciembre de 1999 es patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, tiene una gran belleza arquitectónica y natural, su gente es muy amable, gentil y de un corazón muy cálido, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres.

Doña Gladys tiene 33 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos  de 7 y 6 años de edad que estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión mecánico automotriz y labora en su propio taller, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.

La Señora. Gladys se dedica a los quehaceres de su casa y a  cuidar a sus hijos, también trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo y ella se dedica a la venta de repuestos de vehículos hace 2 años.

Este es su segundo crédito que realiza en la banca comunal al cual fue invitada por una amiga y vecina, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de repuestos automotrices para  su negocio.
 
Su meta es acabar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Sra. Gladys is a member of the Communal Bank “Emprendedores del Futuro” (Entrepreneurs of the Future). She lives in the city of Cuenca, which was named a World Heritage Site in December 1999. It has great architectural and natural beauty. The people are extremely friendly, gentle, and have very warm hearts. They have maintained the culture and traditions of their ancestors.

Doña Gladys is 33 years old, married, and has two children (ages 7 and 6) who attend a school in the city. Her husband is an automobile mechanic and works in his own shop. They own the house in which they live.

Sra. Gladys performs the household chores and takes care of the children. She also works with her husband and has been selling vehicle parts for two years.

This is her second loan with the Communal Bank after she was invited to join by a friend and neighbor. Her new loan will be invested in the purchase of auto parts for her business. Her goal is to finish the construction of her house.

loans.use: to buy auto parts.

loans.name: Philip B.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers of a primary school in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone.  This school, established in 1976, is staffed with 19 employees and has about 400 pupils. The staff of this institution, like many other schools’ staff within SMT’s operational areas, comes to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise be unable to accomplish merely with their salaries. Some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy furniture, land or house-building materials; others invest in businesses. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on the teachers' behalf.

Fifty-eight-year-old Philip is the leader of this group of teachers.  He was born in Koinadugu, in northern Sierra Leone. Philip is married and has eight children, three of whom are attending primary and secondary schools. Philip has served in the teaching profession for 38 years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy house building materials (cement, rods, and galvanized corrugated iron) for the construction of a family house.

loans.use: to buy cement, rods, and galvanized corrugated iron for the construction of a family house

loans.name: Gulniso

texts.ru: Гулнисо умная и честная женщина. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет троих детей. Она старается обеспечить своих детей и ради будущих своих детей работает усердно. Она занимается продажей продукты питания. На протяжении двух лет она в этом бизнесе и трудится расширить его день за днем. Гулнисо хотела бы получить займ для покупки нового ассортимента продукта с целью пополнения оборотного капитала. Она заранее благодарна вам за вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en:
Gulniso is a wise and honest woman. She's married and takes care of her three children. All her work is aimed at providing her children with the best possible future. 
She sells foodstuffs and for the past two years she has worked day and night to expand her business. Gulniso is asking for a loan in order to purchase a new assortment of food supplies and increase her working capital. She thanks you ahead of time for your kindness and charity.

loans.use: to purchase additional food supplies and expand her business.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi is 33 years old, single and the mother one school-aged child. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped-in water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. For the last three years, Naomi has earned a living by operating a medical clinic which provides services to her neighbors. Her income is variable, but she dreams of expanding her business in the future. She is applying for a loan for Kshs 80,000 to buy equipment to improve her laboratory. She decided to join Yehu because of the fair terms and conditions under which it provides help to people like her.

loans.use: to buy equipment for a medical laboratory.

loans.name: Agbogbé

texts.fr:
