Agbogbé est une femme  âgé(e) de 24ans. Elle est mariée å un  soudeur . Elle a 02 enfants, tous à l’école. Le premier a 09 ans et le dernier a 05ans.  
Agbogbé travaille comme revendeuse de pains, de riz, de spaguetti depuis 1998. Elle vend de façon ambulante et achéte les pains dans une boulangerie du quartier et les autres produits à Lomé. La difficulté qu’elle rencontre sur le terrain est la concurrence.
Agbogbé a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter plus de marchandises Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Agbogbé voudrait agrandir son commerce. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit intervenir dans l’éducation de ses enfants et avoir une famille heureuse.
texts.en:
Agbogbé is a 24-year-old woman. She is married to a welder and has two children, both in school. The eldest is nine and the youngest is 5 years old.

Agbogbé works as a retail vendor of bread, rice, and spaghetti since 1998. She operates as an itinerant vendor, buying her bread from a bakery in the neighborhood and other products in Lome. The challenge she faces in the field is the competition.

Agbogbé requested her first loan from WAGES to purchase more goods; she wants to reinvest in her business activity.

In coming years, Agbogbé would like to expand her business. She said that the profits will allow her to participate in the children's education and enjoy a happy family.

loans.use: Buy bread, rice, and other products

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en: Ginalyn is 31 years old and married with 7 children. With 5 children in school, she works very hard to provide for them. Ginalyn runs an ambulant vending business (moving from place to place) of fermented shrimps in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell. She has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Ginalyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Roger

texts.es: Roger de 25 años vive en la ciudad de Cartagena y tiene un negocio de prestación de servicios de instalaciones de redes eléctricas a obras urbanas, en el cual trabaja a todo costo. Su idea de negocio nació, cuando decidió estudiar electricidad en el Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje “SENA”, pues veía a su padre como propietario de un almacén de partes, vendiendo todo artefacto en el ramo de la electricidad, lo cual lo entusiasmó y finalmente emprendió él solo su propia aventura de negocios. Su mayor desafío es tener el capital de trabajo suficiente, para estabilizar la unidad de negocios y crecer generando muchos empleos. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, y es justamente un credikiva, con el que  planea comprar materiales eléctricos para suministrar en obras urbanas, que lo tienen contratado. Su éxito en esta inversión radica en hacerla, sobre un contrato prestablecido y responder oportunamente para lograr muchos mas.
texts.en: Roger is 25 years old, lives in the city of Cartagena and has a business of providing network services of electrical installations urban works, in which he works at all costs. His business idea was born when he decided to study electricity in the National Service of Learning "SENA", as he watched his father, as owner of a parts store, selling any device in the field of electricity, which enthused him and then he undertook his own business venture. His biggest challenge is having enough working capital to stabilize and grow business, generating many jobs. Currently he is applying for his first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and it is just a credikiva, with which he plans to purchase electrical materials to supply electricity in urban works, which they have it contracted. His success in this investment is in making it, on a preset contract and responding appropriately to achieve many more.

loans.use: to purchase electrical materials to supply in urban works

loans.name: Maria Josefina

texts.es:
La señora Maria Josefina  ya ha tenido un crédito con KIVA el cual a pagado puntual mente; y el cual lo utilizo para comprara de mercancía. 
Solicita un préstamo para la reparación de su local, ya que tuvo que sacar parte de su mercancía que tenia es exhibición, porque con la humedad por causa de las lluvias se le estaba maltratando y desea reparar las paredes y techo del local, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la mejora, es por eso que esta solicitando nueva mente su cooperación en este crédito y así mejorar su negocio. 
Doña Maria Josefina es quien atiende el negocio y su esposo le ayuda con los gastos familiares con el sueldo de su trabajo, entre los dos están dándole todo lo mejor a sus dos hijos y que tengan el estudio para su futuro.
texts.en:
María Josefina has had a previous KIVA loan that she repaid punctually and that she used to buy merchandise.  She’s asking for a loan to do some repairs to her store because she had to remove some of the merchandise she had on display because the dampness caused by the rains was damaging it and she wants to repair the walls and the roof of the site but lacks the necessary money to do the repairs.  This is why she’s once again asking for cooperation for the loan to improve her business.

María Josefina tends to the store and her husband helps her cover household expenses with his salary from his job.  Between the two of them they are giving their children all the best and seeing that they have schooling for a better future.

loans.use: Mejoramientos al local del negocio

loans.name: Angela Patricia

texts.en:
My name is Angela M. and I produce as well as sell tortillas. I have had my business for 4 years and my daughter helps me to make the tortillas. I have many customers because I sell my product in a market and an eatery. My business generates an income to support my family and my goal is to increase production and with the added earnings I can remodel my home and give a higher education to my daughter.

Mi nombre es Angela M. me dedico a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tengo mi negocio hace unos 4 años y mi hija me ayuda en la produccion de mis tortillas, mi clientela es muy buena ya que mi producto lo vendo a un mercadito y a una cafeteria, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mi produccion y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi casa de habitacion y darle un mejor estudio superior a mi hija.

loans.use:
To purchase cornflour, lime, salt, water, firewood, matches

Compra de harina de maiz, cal, sal, agua, leña, fosforos.

loans.name: Pepe

texts.en: Pepe L. is a 35 year old married woman who has five children. She is a member of the Utulaelae Centre. She was jobless before joining the SPBD program. The loans from SPBD program helped her develop her taro plantation, from which she earns around $200-$300 tala per week from selling 2-3 sacks of taro. Her intention is to get more loans from the SPBD program in order to establish a cattle farm.  She hopes to expand her house a bit more and to assist her family financially.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and fencing materials to establish a cattle farm

loans.name: Mayda Elisa

texts.en:
Mayra is a young and hard working woman with many aspirations. She lives in Escobedo, in the State of Nuevo Leon. Mayra started selling cosmetic goods and facial cleaning products a year ago and has been very well received by her clients due to the high quality of goods that she sells. She has increased the number of clients and her business is growing rapidly.

Now, she would like a credit of $250 that will help her to buy more merchandise to cover the demand of her clients with good service. She is committed to repaying the loan in 3 to 6 months. Mayra's dream is in your hands - you can help her achieve the possible. Do not doubt and help out. Mayra es una joven muy trabajadora y con muchos deseos de superación, ella vive en la localidad de Escobedo, en el estado de Nuevo León. Mayra empezó a vender cosméticos y productos de limpieza facial desde hace un año, y ha tenido gran aceptación entre sus clientes, gracias a la calidad de los productos que comercializa, sus clientes se han incrementado y ha hecho crecer su negocio rápidamente.

En estos momentos necesita de un crédito por $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y ofrecer un buen servicio, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. En tus manos está el sueño de Mayra, tú puedes ayudar a que sea posible, no lo dudes más decídete a apoyarla.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Gavhar

texts.ru:
Хочаева Гавхар, является активным клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» более 3 лет. В сфере предпринимательской деятельностью занимается не менее 3 лет. Она замужем и имеет 3 детей. Свою деятельность начала с продажи детской одежды. За товаром ездит в Бишкек. Ее торговая точка расположена на рынке Панчшанбе. Ей необходимо 300$, увеличение товарооборота и расширения своей точки.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Gavhar H. has been an active client of MLF MicroInvest for more than 3 years. She has been in business for 3 years. She is married and has 3 children. She began her business by selling clothes for children. Gavhar H. personally delivers her goods from Bishkek. Her retail spot is located at a marketplace in Panchshanbe. Gavhar H. asks for $300 loan to increase the volume of the goods sold and grow the size of her retail spot.

loans.use: Increase the volume of goods sold

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Mrs. Esther A. is 45 years old and is married with seven (7) children. She hails from Benin City. She is asking for a loan of US$400 to enable her to buy more provisions and food items for sale. She is a dedicated LAPO client and has been in business since 2004.

loans.use: To buy more provision and foodstuffs

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
Florencia is a native of this area and decided to stay in her birthplace to establish a home and to raise her kids with her husband, her faithful lifelong companion. As a fruit of their great love, they have 10 kids and have always worked together to offer them well-being and to satisfy their needs through farming the land. They have done this work for years as an inheritance from and for the legacy of their parents. Even today they do this exhausting and noble labor to increase their quality of life now that each of their children has left their modest home to pursue other activities and to proviD. their own families with well-being. With the immense desire of progress in each of their minds, each of them has decided to increase the variety of their products this harvest season with wheat and barley because these require less investment and greater profit. In previous years, there were considerable losses because of the terrible cold that whipped their fields and didn't let them make any profits. As a result of this event, Florencia got sick and needs to undergo a costly medical treatment. This is why they are determined to increase their strengh and products with the objective of obtaining quick results and a lot of happiness. Let's give our support to this noble request so Florencia can recuperate her health, well-being, and much happiness.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer.

Florencia es natural D. la zona y decidió quedarse en su tierra natal para establecer un hogar y hacer crecer a sus hijos junto a su esposo, su compañero fiel D. toda su vida, fruto del gran amor que se tienen nacieron sus 10 hijos y siempre han trabajado juntos para ofrecerles bienestar y satisfacer sus necesidades mediante el cultivo D. la tierra a la cual se dedican por años como herencia y legado D. sus padres.Hasta el día D. hoy desempeñan esta agotadora y noble labor para incrementar su nivel D. vida ya que cada uno D. sus hijos migró D. su modesto nido para desempeñarse en otras actividades a fin D. otorgarles bienestar a sus propias familias.Con los inmensos deseos D. progreso en mente ambos han decidido que en esta época D. siembra incrementarán la variedad D. sus productos con el trigo y la cebada por la oportunidad que les ofrece porque requieren D. una menor inversión y otorgan una mayor ganancia.En años anteriores hubo pérdidas considerables por el terrible frío que azotó sus campos D. cultivo y no le permitieron obtener ganancias; a raíz D. este acontecimiento Florencia enfermó y necesita someterse a un costoso tratamiento médico por eso es que están decididos a incrementar sus fuerzas y productos con el objetivo D. obtener muy pronto buenos resultados y muchas alegrías.Solidaricémonos con esta noble petición para que pronto Florencia recupere su salud, bienestar y mucha felicidad.

loans.use: Increase of capital to grow wheat and barley

loans.name: Verónica

texts.es:
Veronica B. is a young woman who is studying. However, her parents do not have enough income to cover her schooling expenses. This is why Veronica decided to start her own business of selling shoes through catalogues and this way she does not need to have a fixed scheduled, since she offers them to her own schoolmates and neighbors. Two years ago she started selling shoes and little by little she has gathered customers who seek her to buy shoes since she sells them on credit to offer her customers the opportunity to pay her back though a longer period of time.

However, because of the Christmas season, the demand for shoes has increased This is why Veronica is requesting a loan for US$475 to be paid in a period of 6 months. With this money, Veronica will be able to buy more merchandise to have a larger variety and offer her customers what they are looking for. With your help Veronica will be able to continue with her business and with the income obtained during this season she will be able to save to pay the registration fees for the next school year.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Verónica B. es una chica que está estudiando, sin embargo sus padres no cuentan con muchos ingresos como para seguir costeando los gastos que le representa la escuela. Es por esto que Verónica decidió emprender su propio negocio al vender zapatos por catálogo y así no necesita tener un horario fijo, puesto que estos los ofrece entre sus compañeros de la escuela y sus vecinos. Hace 2 años comenzó a vender zapatos y poco a poco se ha ido haciendo de clientes que la buscan para poder pedirles zapatos puesto que ella los vende en plazo para que sus clientes tengan la facilidad de pagarle en más tiempo.

Sin embargo por la temporada navideña, la demanda de los zapatos incrementa, y es por esto que Verónica está solicitando un crédito de US $475 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Verónica podrá comprar más mercancía para tener mayor variedad y ofrecerles a sus clientes lo que ellos andan buscando. Con tu ayuda Verónica podrá seguir con su negocio y con las ganancias que obtenga en esta temporada podrá ahorrar para poder pagar la inscripción de su siguiente grado en la escuela.

loans.use: Buying merchandise to sell in the winter (Comprar mercancía para vender en invierno)

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel P., her husband, Rafael Chuquimia, and their two children live with Isabel's parents in the Tembladerani district in the city of La Paz. Isabel sells groceries (rice, sugar, pasta, canned powder milk, etc.) to homes around her area, and her husband works as a city public transportation driver. Isabel's parents gave the family two rooms to live in but they need to build a bathroom and a kitchen so that they can live comfortably. The loan she is applying for will go towards building the bathroom and placing a reinforced concrete floor in the kitchen. This is the third time Isabel has asked for a loan. Reviewing her socioeconomic activity qualifies her to apply for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Isabel P. vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Tembladerani de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposo, el señor Rafael Chuquimia y sus dos hijos. La señora Isabel vende abarrotes (arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche en polvo en latas, etc.) a domicilio en su zona y su esposo trabaja como chofer de transporte publico en la ciudad. Las dos habitaciones que ocupan fueron cedidas por sus padres pero tienen la necesidad de construir un baño y una cocina para comodidad de la familia. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de un baño y loza de hormigón armado para la cocina. Esta es la tercera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: To bulid a bathroom and cover the kitchen floor with reinforced concrete.

loans.name: Gombolola B Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Hellen N.. She is currently in the poultry business and is requesting a loan to pruchase more chicks and buy poultry feed. Hellen is 35 years old and is married. She has three children ranging in age from 3 to 7 years, and they all go to school. Each week, Hellen makes approximately UGX 55,000 in profits and, with the extra help from her loan, she hopes to be able to to build another poultry house.

Hellen is joined in her small group by Ssanyu N., Maureen N., Melisa N., and Gloria N.. Ssanyu N. has a business selling chicken mash and wants to re-invest in her business. Maureen N. is currently operating a business selling clothes and wants a loan to increase stock. Melisa N. operates a retail shop and wants to add stock. Gloria N. is also in the poultry business and is requesting a loan to expand.

loans.use: To buy more poultry feed and chicks, and to expand businesses

loans.name: Meth

texts.en:
Mrs. Meth S., 41, sells dried fish and earns about $3 a day. She is a widow who takes care of four children, one of whom contributes about $2 a day to the family by working in the garment factory, and the rest are students. She now lives with her children in the Bei Village in the Chrung Chumres I Sangkat in Phnom Penh City. Because of her business, she can help her children to go to school and pay her family’s living expenses.

She now needs a loan of $500 to buy a second-hand motorcycle to upgrade her business transportation to be more efficient. She thanks Kiva and promises to be prompt in repaying her loan

loans.use: To buy a second-hand motorcycle to upgrade her fish-selling business transportation.

loans.name: Ni Ketut Wardani

texts.id:
Ketut Wardani has 2 breeding female cows. They are the main source of income for her family. She and her husband collect grass on daily basis to feed their cows for her two children to feeds the cows with.

She bought her first cow 2 years ago. The 2nd one was just bought for IDR 4.5 million (around USD 498) recently after she got the loan. The rest of the money was used to buy the cattle feed. One of the cow is now pregnant.

She wants to use the money she can earn to build a permanent house for her family as now they live in a simple house made of dried leaves.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Dua induk sapi yang dimiliki oleh Ketut Wardani adalah sebagai mata pencaharian tetap yang selama ini digeluti.Melalui Kegiatan inilah kebutuhan Wardani bisa terpenuhi. Dengan semangat tanpa lelah setiap hari wardani pergi keladang memberi minum dan makan sapi peliharaannya. Dengan membawa rumput yang sudah disabit kemarin sore,oleh suaminya.Mereka saling bekerjasama dalam menjalani usaha ini.juga kedua anak mereka kadang yang bergantian untuk memberi makan.Satu sapi memang sudah dimiliki sejak 2 tahun.yang satu baru dibeli karena mendapat modal pinjaman,Seharga Rp 4.500.000,-sisa uang digunakan untuk membeli pakan untuk kedua sapinya.Usaha ini sangat cocok dan sudah kelihatan hasilnya,satu induk sapi wardani sementara ini mengandung.Berarti Keuntungannya akan bertambah.Walaupun rumah mereka sangat sederhana terbuat dari Gedeg tetapi tidak menjadi beban bagi keluarga mereka.Bahkan mereka bertekad dengan keuntungan usaha sapi, mereka akan bisa membangun rumah.

loans.use: To buy cattle feed and breeding/ female cow (Membeli pakan dan Induk sapi)

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Some time ago, we started building two rooms for our daughters. However, we still need to lay the floor. As we do not have enough money to buy the construction material and to pay the workers, we request a loan of 1000 USD.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace algún tiempo empezamos a construir dos cuartos los cuales los queremos para nuestra hijas. Pero nos esta haciendo falto ponerles la losa. No hemos tenido el dinero suficiente para el material y la mano de obra. Es por eso que solicitamos un préstamo de $1,000.00 dlls. Para la comprar de material y poder ponerle la losa a los dos cuartos.

loans.use: To lay the floor in the rooms

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
Ernestina is a seamstress and has experience making women’s hats. Her husband travels to the interior part of the country to deliver her finished products. Her home is located in the Llojeta section of the Tiwiña de la Ladera Oeste neighborhood in the city of La Paz.

This is the ninth time that she is requesting a loan from Impro. The money will be used to buy materials (fabric, lining, jute and thread). Her work and the experience that she has allows her access to credit and her objective for the future is to be able to set up a shop with industrial machinery that allows for the creation of jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Ernestina es costurera y tiene experiencia en la elaboración de sombreros de mujer. Su esposo se dedica a viajar al interior del País para entregar su producto terminado. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Llojeta sector Tiwiña de la Ladera Oeste de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la novena vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, el crédito será destinado para la compra de materia prima (Tela, Forro, Yute, Hilo) Su trabajo y la experiencia que tiene le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que su objetivo para el futuro es poder instalar un taller con maquinarias industriales que le permitan generar fuentes de empleo.

loans.use: Purchase fabric, lining, jute and thread that are the materials needed to make women's hats

loans.name: Delfina

texts.en:
First loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=31732&_tpos=2&_tpg=1

Delfina belongs to the Virgen María Village Bank.

She is divorced, is 55 and has 2 children. She sells different kinds of clothes in the Ayacucho region ferias and also in the Ayacuchan jungle. During the week, she sells clothes in the Nazarenas feria. She purchases her products in Lima.

Delfina needs a 1000 soles loan to buy cardigans.

She dreams about expanding her business, having a permanent store and having economic stability.

loans.use: Buy cardigans.

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr:
Aissatou D., age 51, is married and takes care of one child. She has been a member of the village bank of Vélingara Foulbé for five years. She wants to buy some palm oil, drums, bags, and a refrigerator in order to make ice cream to sell. Her income enables her to help cover family expenses. Aissatou is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Aissatou D., 51 ans,mariée, 01 enfant en charge est membre du banc villageois de vélingara Foulbé 2 depuis cinq ans. Elle veut acheter de l'huile de palme, des bidons, des sachets et un réfrigérateur pour faire des glaces et vendre. . Ses revenus lui permettent de contribuer aux charges familiales.Aissatou sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Commerce in palm oil and ice cream

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola I. is 44 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Ilaje, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells frozen foods and foodstuffs.  Bola is a LAPO client. She needs the loan amount of $1200 to buy more frozen food and foodstuffs for sale. She says thank you.

loans.use: To buy more frozen foods and foodstuffs for sale.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es: Blanca, D. 44 años D. edad, tiene 5 hijos, los mismos que son la  razón D. su vida, es propietaria D. dos motocarros, que son manejados por sus hijos, quienes siempre la apoyan en todo.Aparte D. las motos se dedica a la venta D. frutas en un puesto en el mercado, cuenta con el apoyo incondicional D. su esposo Jorge, quien está D. acuerdo con sus propósitos. Blanca quiere mejorar sus motocarros, para ello requiere comprar repuestos para mandarlos a reparar, ya que es el único sustento que tienen sus hijos.Se ha trazado la meta D. ahorrar dinero para más adelante mediante un préstamo completar para la compra D. un carro, y así asegurar una mejor vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Blanca is 44 years old and has 5 children who are her reason for living. She is the owner of two motorcars which are driven by her children, who always support her in everything she does. In addition to the motorcars she sells fruit in a stand in the market. She counts on the unconditional support of her husband Jorge, who is in agreement with her business plans. Blanca wishes to improve the motorcars, and this requires buying parts to send them to be repaired as these cars are the only means of support her children have. She has devised a goal of saving money for the future through a loan to finish purchasing the car, and thereby ensure a better life for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy parts to repair her motorcars

loans.name: Ni Wayan Werni

texts.id: Ibu Ni Wayan Werni saat ini tinggal bersama suami dan seorang anaknya yang masih duduk di Sekolah dasar. Mereka tinggal dalam rumah yang sederhana namun hal itu tidak membuat mereka berkecil hati tetapi  tetap bersemangat menjalani kehidupan ini.  Untuk membantu suami memenuhi kebutuhan hidup, Ibu Ni Wayan Werni memilih untuk memlihara ternak babi sebagai usaha kecil yang dikelola di belakang rumahnya. Usaha ini ditekuninya sudah cukup  lama yaitu sejak menikah namun usaha ini hanya dikelola dengan cara sederhana sehingga keuntungan yang diperolehnya tidaklah terlalu banyak berkisar Rp 300.000 – Rp 400.000, namun hal ini cukup membantunya dalam memenuhi kebutuhan keluarga termasuk juga untuk membiayai pendidikan anaknya. Saat ini ternak babi yang dipeliharanya dua ekor penggemukan dan rencananya akan menambah jumlah ternak peliharaannya. Ibu Ni Wayan Werni sangat tertarik dengan program ternak babi yang dikelola Dinari dengan jangka waktu enam bulan dengan sistem pembayaran dilakukan diakhir periode dan memilih mengikuti program ini.
texts.en:
Mrs Ni Wayan Werni lives with her husband and child that is currently studying in grade school. They live in a simple house, but it does not make them demotivated. To help her husband earn a living, Mrs. Wayan Werni farms pigs in her backyard. She started the business since she got married, however she could only earn modest profit of $33-$45 with her traditional farming method. This income is enough to supplement her family's income and pay for her kid's tuition. She is currently farming 2 fattening pigs. She plans to purchase more pigs to be farmed. Mrs Ni Wayan werni was attracted to DINARI's foundation pig farm training and financial assistance program. She is currently applying for a 6 month loan.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase piglets and feeds

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.en:
Tomasa C. is 46 years old and married to Edwin C., Sr. They have 6 children and live in Upper Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. Her husband is a daily wage farm worker. In order to help her husband, she sells “bibingka,” a rice cake snack that she bakes herself. Aside from selling rice cakes, she operates a sari-sari store.

In 2002, she became an active member of Paglaum MPC with good credit standing. She wants to obtain financial assistance in the amount of PHP 20,000.00 to purchase more goods for her sari-sari store because selling rice cakes is not sufficient for her daily needs. She plans to send her children to college so that they can help her in the future, and to repair their house.

loans.use: Purchase of goods for her sari-sari store

location.town: Plaridel-Upper Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occide

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is a member of the Ayni II Village Bank.  Teodora is 45 years old and is married, with seven children. Teodora sells firewood from her home, located in the Libertad neighborhood. She also travels to different regional markets to buy various grains, which she then sells in the markets of the city of Ayacucho.  Teodora is requesting a loan of 1050 PEN to buy firewood.  Teodora’s dreams are to educate her children and improve her business. 

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Teodora es socia del Banco Comunal Ayni II. 
Teodora es casada, tiene 45 años y 7 hijos, Teodora venD. leña en su casa ubicada en el barrio libertad. Además viaja a las diferentes ferias D. la región en donD. compra cereales variados y luego lo venD. al por mayor en los mercados D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho. 
Teodora necesita un préstamo D. 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. leña.
Los sueños D. Teodora son educar a sus hijos y mejorar su negocio.

loans.use: Buy firewood

loans.name: Debora R.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is 31-year-old Debora M. from Mbeya. She is married with one child aged 10. Debora has been running a crop-selling business since 2006. Her business is purchasing crops from villages on a wholesale basis and selling them on a retail basis.

She works at the business for 5-8 hours per day, 6 days per week, and is assisted by her husband. Debora currently earns about 200 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 550 USD in order to purchase more maize, rice, and sunflower seeds in bulk. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range of the business inventory. Debora thanks you for your support! ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more maize, rice and sunflower seeds in bulk

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Maria Mercedes pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos” vive en el Jr. 3 de Octubre Nº 351 - 9 de Abril, distrito de Tarapoto, departamento de San Martín. Tiene 37 años y es madre de 1 hija, que depende de ella. Es conviviente su esposo se dedica a la administración y manejo de motokar que han conseguido gracias a su esfuerzo y trabajo. Con el primer prestamo de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de asados, juanes, tamales para venderlos por las tardes. Tiene 8 años trabajando con el banco.

 En la actualidad cuenta con un local de venta de comida, donde atiende todo el día con pensión y platos a la carta a los universitarios, además cuenta con 5 motokar que trabajan todo el día generando ingresos diarios para el pago puntual de las cuotas del banco.

Con este prestamo de S/ 3,000 	que será pagado en 6 meses arreglara un moderno local para un restaurant, comprara sillas, mesas, adornos para colocar en el centro de las mesas y también utensilios de cocina.

Maria refiere estar muy contenta con el banco por el apoyo que brinda a las mujeres que desean trabajar como ella.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Communal Bank called Los Eucaliptos. She lives in the district of Tarapoto in San Martin. She is 27 years old and lives with her daughter and husband. He has a motor taxi business that he acquired thanks to hard work. With her first loan, Maria invested in making grilled snacks and tamales which she sold in the afternoons. She's been working with the bank for 8 years. Today she has a small restaurant where she prepares and serves meals every day. They also count on 5 motor taxis which generate income needed to make regular payments on the loans.

With the new loan, which she'll repay in 6 months, she will fix up her restaurant, purchase chairs, tables and center pieces, as well as cooking utensils. Maria is very content with the bank and the support they provide to working women such as herself.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To set up a more modern location for her restaurant, purchase chairs, tables and cooking utensils.

loans.name: Moul's Group

texts.en:
This loan is being requested by eight borrowers, all of whom are people living in BattambA. Province, Cambodia. The group leader, Mr. S., age 41, who is a Cambodia military policeman, gets a salary of $75 a month. He si married with three children who are still single. His wife's name is Soeum, 39, and she currently earns a living selling local vegetables in the market. S. is asking for a loan for his wife to use as capital to expand their business selling vegetables.

The other seven members who joined the loan are:

S. A. is a military policemen and he requests a loan to cultivate his rice crop.

P. is a rice farmer and she needs a loan for rice growing.

P. is a local rice planter and she asks for a loan to replace her old motorcycle.

S. sells groceries from home and she wants a loan to enlarge her business.

S. is a cultivator and she is applying for a loan to build a stall for raising chickens.

S. is a fish seller and she is requesting a loan to build a cow stall.

S. is a bean grower and she has applied for a loan for her business activities.

loans.use: To expand their business selling vegetable

loans.name: Betty's Group

texts.en: M. Betty is the leader of Tufube group in Jinja. She is a married lady with 5 children as she cares for many relatives. Betty is a poultry farmer rearing layer chickens whose eggs she sells to customers and shop owners in Wanyange and Jinja town. She has included the keeping of broilers just for the Easter season and she hopes to reap big profits from their sales. In addition to poultry, she is also a farmer growing food mainly for home consumption and this helps her not to spend so much on food for her family. Betty needs a loan to help with buying feed for her chickens, since this period is so important for their feeding.

loans.use: Buying more feed for her chicken.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La señora Hilda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Doradinas en Acción”, vive en el Jr. Comercio Nº 436, Distrito de San José de Sisa, Departamento de San Martín. Es casada, tiene 40 años y es madre de 03 hijos, 02 que todavía depende de ella.

Se inicio con un primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 por iniciativa propia, y emprendió su  propio negocio de venta de artículos de plásticos y de uso doméstico.

En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio, ubicado al frente del mercado central, donde los clientes encuentran lo que necesitan en un solo lugar y al mejor precio.
Con el préstamo de S/. 1000.00 que cancelara a un  plazo de 04  meses, lo invirtirá comprando más productos como baldes y bandejas de diferentes tamaños y colores, tazas, platos, también con una parte del dinero invirtirá en la compra de ropa interior, pantalones y blusas y todo tipo de productos variados para mantener contenta a su clientela.

Es ella quien  toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. En lo personal, se siente más independiente, segura y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. 
 
Hilda, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Sra. Hilda belongs to the "Doradinas en Accion" community bank. She lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of San Martin. She's married, 40 years old and the mother of 3 children, 2 of whom still live at home.

With an initial loan of S/.300.00, Hilda started her own business selling plastic household goods. She's still operating the business which is located across from the central market. Her customers go there to find everything they need, at a good price, in one place. With the S/.1000.00 loan, to be repaid in 4 months, she will buy products such as buckets and trays, in different sizes and colors, cups, and plates. She will also buy underwear, pants and blouses and all kinds of products to keep her customers happy.

Hilda makes her own decisions about how to spend the money she earns from her business. It gives her a sense of independence and security. Repaying her loans makes her feel responsible. She's very grateful to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as an entrepeneur and a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Ibra

texts.fr: Monsieur Ibra D. dit Bamba est un jeune homme célibataire qui a commencé  à vendre des poissons.  Pourtant, depuis un an, il a ouvert une boutique sur fonds personnel.  Avec une capitale de 800,000 CFA ($1,600) son activité consiste à vendre des denrées alimentaires.  Actuellement, il a un capitale de 3,000,000 CFA ($6,000).  Avec ce crédit, il va acheter un frigo et divers autres choses pour renforcer son commerce.  Il est célibataire et âgé de 29 ans.  Il habite à Thiès, une ville située à 70 kilomètres de Dakar, la capitale du Sénégal.
texts.en:
Mr. Ibra D., called "Bamba", is a young unmarried man who has started to sell fish. However, a year ago, he opened a shop with his own funds. With 800,000 francs CFA in capital, his business involves selling groceries. Currently, his capital amounts to 3,000,000 francs. With this loan, he's going to buy a refrigerator and various other things to bolster his business. He is 29 years old and lives in Thiès, a city located 70 km from Dakar, the capital of Sénégal.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator and various other items

loans.name: Rozelyn

texts.en:
Rozelyn has been engaged in selling glutinous rice snacks and refreshments for almost two years. She is able to generate an average net income of 800 PHP per week. Her income is used to meet her family’s basic daily needs. She has also been able to save a small amount for her children’s education. She plans to build a village store in the future; thus, she strives hard in her current business.

Rozelyn has a partner who is working in Manila. They are not yet married because of financial problems. They have a son named Isaiah Joery, who is 10 months old. According to Rozelyn, they are planning to get married as soon as they can earn enough money for their wedding ceremony.

Rozelyn is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP from ASKI to use for additional working capital for her snack vending business. With this loan, she will be able to purchase more ingredients. By making more items to sell, she will be able to satisfy more customers and increase her earnings.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make snacks

loans.name: Mahasen

texts.en: Mahasen, an 18-year-old woman living in Ouzai, Mount Lebanon, has been working as a hairdresser for the past two years. Today, Mahasen is hoping to borrow $1,000 in order to buy new equipment to develop her beauty salon.

loans.use: To develop her beauty salon.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel R. is from the town of Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 27 years old. Raquel is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Raquel owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector, operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling ready-to-wear products and peddling dried fish within the community. Raquel has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Raquel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Raquel is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Raquel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue she will generate to improve and expand her business and provide for the needs of the family.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Justo Arsenio

texts.es: El Señor Justo Arsenio J. Hernández tiene la edad de 46 años. La actividad económica de Justo es ofrecer los servicios de transporte. Su autobús hace recorrido de personal de una empresa. Anteriormente él era conductor, de una empresa llamada ENAVIN aquí ofrecía el servicio de transporte y se encargaba de transportar al personal. Por lo que con esto logra establecer su propio negocio. Por lo que ahora solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de repuestos de su camión. Su deseo es ofrecer un mejor servicio para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Justo Arsenio J. Hernández is 46 years old. Justo works offering transportation. His bus has transports the personnel of a business. He was previously a driver for a business called ENAVIN. Here, he offered transportation and was responsible for transporting the staff. With this, he was able to establish his own business. Now he is asking for a loan for working capital to buy spare parts for his bus. His wish is to offer better service to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nouhad

texts.en: Nouhad is a 28-year-old married man living with his wife.  In 2001, he decided to open his own barber shop in his village to begin a new career. After 13 years in the business, he has decided to expand his business by purchasing merchandise for his shop; that is why he is requesting to borrow US$ 800.

loans.use: purchasing merchandise to sell in his barber shop

loans.name: Folashade

texts.en: Folashade A. is 30-years old and married with two children. She makes a living selling bottles of drinks and juice. She is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 in order to purchase more bottles of drinks and fruit juice to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase drinks

loans.name: María Beatriz Adriana

texts.es:
La señora María Beatriz Adrián C. tiene ya más de un año con su salón de belleza el cual es un fuente de ingresos, ya que su esposo el señor  Juan José Salazar trabaja en una compañía de trasporte en el departamento de chofer de camión estos son los ingreso que ellos tiene para  darles lo mejor a su familia.
Al negocio le está haciendo falta variedad de artículos de belleza y acondicionar el local ya que lo tiene establecido en un cuarto de su casa, para no desatender a sus hijos ya que tiene cuatro y están en la edad de la adolescencia y necesitan mucha atención. 
Es por eso que solicita el préstamo y así su negocio crecerá más y con los ingresos que genera el negocio pagara el crédito ya quien se encargara de los gastos familiares será el señor Juan José.
texts.en:
Sra. María Beatriz Adrián C. has been operating her beauty salon for more than a year. Her business helps to supplement the income of her husband, Juan José Salazar, who works as a company truck driver. With their two incomes, they try their best to provide for their family.

Her business lacks a variety of beauty products. It is established in a room in her house because she has a four year old and a teenager, and they require much attention. Sra. María is requesting a loan so that she can grow her business. The income she generates will be used to make her payments. The earnings of Sr. Juan José will take care of the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her beauty salon business

loans.name: Vero

texts.en: Vero is 45 years old and married with five children. She sells sarongs, shoes and bags. She has been in this business for the past five years. She is requesting the loan amount of 70,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more sarongs, shoes and bags to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia Juana, es natural de distrito de Anta, e la provincia de Anta y departamento del Cusco, ubicado a 1 hora y 10 minutos de la provincia de Cusco.

Nuestra socia vive en la comunidad campesina de Inquilpata, ella tiene 40 años de edad, la socia tiene 4 hijos y es casada, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la compra y venta de animales menores, ella los compra de la feria de Inquilpata y los cuida, reproducen y vende, la socia también vende chicha, esta es una bebida a base de maíz fermentado que se tomaba en el tiempo de los incas y hasta la fecha sigue siendo la bebida favorita y natural de los andes de Perú.

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo ella se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

loans.use: Capital de trabajo.

loans.name: Hotam

texts.en:
Hotam is 34 years old. He lives with his wife and 4 children. For eight years, he has earned a living transporting passengers. He considers his family his main inspiration to continue to work hard.

Due to his sound money management, Hotam now owns a minivan. This helps to increase his household income. What Hotam enjoys most about his work is the direct contact he has with his passengers. His business is profitable because he himself is the driver; there is no need to pay an additional salary.

This is his first loan with IMON International. He will use the loan to buy spare parts for his minivan. With this loan, Hotam will be able to improve his large family’s livelihood. Hie wife, children and his parents will all benefit.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. Additionally, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients present a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts

loans.name: Believe In God Group

texts.en: The Believe in God Group is made up of Kadiatu B., Isata J., and Mariatu K.. They are seeking a loan of 1.5 million LE from SMT and Kiva lenders. Kadiatu is the group’s leader, and she has worked for 4 years selling ready-to-wear children’s clothing. She is 29 and married to a businessman with whom she has one young child. With her share of the group loan, Kadiatu is hoping to improve her business and income.

loans.use: Expanding inventory of ready-to-wear clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Hairstylling supplies and equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Motorbike transport

loans.name: Janipher Ngamita ‘S Group

texts.en:
Janepher is a 27-year-old married woman with three children between the ages of 3 - 9 years. All of her children go to school. Janepher takes care of additional family members. She owns a three-room house where she lives with five people. The family has access to electricity and piped water and gets three meals a day.  

Janepher owns a stall in Nakawa Market where she sells second-hand clothes. She works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. She buys the second hand clothes at the Owino Market, so she has to pay to transport the clothes to her stall. Janepher works seven days a week .She receives an average of 30 customers a day and sells retail and wholesale to all types of people. Her greatest monthly expenses include feeding her family, school fees for her children, and rent for her business premises. 

In addition to her clothing business, she also owns a retail shop in the same area. Her major business challenge is the rainy season which makes it difficult for customers to reach her because she works in a muddy place. 

She has been in this business for four years and an MCDT member for two years. She is now requesting her fourth loan. Janepher joined MCDT because it was near her home and was working with poor women. She wants to use this loan to buy more second-hand clothes and merchandise for her retail shop. She wants to see her business grow bigger and start selling wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothes and merchandise for her retail shop

loans.name: Robinson

texts.en:
Mr. Robinson M. is from the village of Lusot, Baliangao Misamis Occidental. He is 57 years old, married and blessed with 8 adult-aged children. He owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been engaged on his business for more than 12 years and earns 4,000.00 monthly from the business. In 2009 Robinson joined PMPC to access the programs and services of the Co-op. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 40,000.00 which will be used to purchase a motorcycle.

About PMPC: 
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.\n\n*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a motor cycle

loans.name: Lesbia Marlene

texts.es:
La señora Lesbia se dedica a la venta de verduras desde hace 20 años en el municipio de Chichigalpa, ella vende tomates, chiltomas, papas, platano. Actualmente ella solicita el crédito para la compra de las verduras tales como compra de tomates, chiltomas, repollos y cebollas.
Es importante destacar que es casada y con 2 hijos los cuales están a su cargo, es el segundo crédito que tiene con Ceprodel y espera que le sea otorgado para continuar con su venta de verduras.
texts.en:
Sra. Lesbia has been selling produce for more than 20 years in the city of Chichigalpa. She sells tomatoes, bell peppers, potatoes, and plantains. At the moment, she is requesting a loan in order to buy more produce such as tomatoes, peppers, cabbage, and onions.

It is important to note that she is married and has two dependent children. This is her second loan with CEPRODEL. She hopes that it will be approved so that she can continue selling produce.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tomatoes, peppers, cabbage, and onions

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina es una mujer que irradia mucha alegría, a sus 40 años está muy dedicada en la atención de su esposo y sus hijos de 20 y 10 años, con quienes vive en su casa propia.

Su buen carácter le permite ganar muchos amigos, por lo que decidió sacarle provecho a ello, iniciando un negocio de venta de ropa, lo cual le resultó muy bien. Desde entonces, ya lleva 8 años con esta actividad y siempre se la ve con su bolso lleno de ropa, pues siempre encuentra el momento para ofrecer sus prendas. Generalmente vende al crédito, prefiere trabajar con esta modalidad porque gana mucho más, aunque inicialmente perdió parte de su capital por la falta de pago, pero gracias al apoyo de su esposo y al pasar de los años aprendió a seleccionar a sus clientes, lo que ha logrado que su negocio sea rentable. 
Cristina está muy contenta con lo que hace, porque tiene clientes fijos y muy puntuales, por ello para el futuro piensa instalar una tienda de ropa en su misma vivienda, pero sin dejar su actual modo de trabajar.

Este es su quinceavo crédito con MFP y promete, una vez más, ser puntual en sus pagos. Asimismo, manifiesta trabajar en plena armonía con su grupo, ya que los integrantes son personas muy trabajadoras y responsables. Con el dinero que esta vez solicita incrementará su capital comprando prendas exclusivas para la estación de verano.
texts.en:
Cristina is a woman who radiates a lot of happiness. Age 40, she is very dedicated to the care of her husband and her children, age 20 and 10 years, with whom she lives in their own house. , Her good character wins her many friends which she decided to build upon, starting a clothes sale business, which has gone very well. She has operated this business for 8 years. She is always seen with her full bag of clothes and therefore she always finds a moment to offer her garments. Generally she sells on credit. She prefers to work in this manner because she earns a lot more, although initially she lost part of her capital from lack of payment. But, thanks to the support of her husband and from experience, she learned to select her clients and make her business profitable. Cristina is very pleased with what she does, because she now has very responsible and regular clients. Because of this, she would like to setup a clothing store in her home in the future, but without abandoning her current way of working. This is her fifteenth loan with MFP and she promises, once more, to be punctual in her payments. Likewise, she plans to work in full harmony with her group, since the members are responsible and very hard-working people. With the money that she requests this time, she will increase her working capital to buy summer garments.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy summer clothing for resale.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
En el municipio de Somotillo, comarca las mariitas el señor Reynaldo M. Vílchez, se dedica a la producción de productos agropecuarios como son el ganado bobino, porcino, y aviar también establece cultivos de subsistencia como yuca, camote, maíz, ajonjolí entre otros, los que le facilitan la mantención de sus hijos y esposa.
El señor Reynaldo M. ha dedicado toda su vida a realizar las actividades agropecuarias realizando jornadas de 7 a 6 de la tarde todos los días de la semana, solicita un crédito para ayudarse un poco con la mano de obra que necesita para realizar la chapea de sus potreros.
texts.en:
Reynaldo raises livestock, including cattle, hogs, and poultry, in the municipality of Somotillo, located in the Mariitas region. He also raises yucca, sweet potatoes, corn, and sesame, among other things. All this helps support his wife and children. Reynaldo has been doing agriculture all his life, making day trips from 7 to 6 in the evening every day of the week. He is asking for this loan in order to help pay for labor that he needs to make the veneer for his gates.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Toos and labor

loans.name: Lilliana

texts.es: La señora Lilliana B. tiene la edad de 47 años, casada, con 3 hijos bajo su cargo, el mayor de estos esta en su último año de la universidad y los otros dos están cursando la secundaria. Ella es Odontóloga General y labora para el centro de Salud Posoltega desde hace 20 años, nuestra institución le ha otorgado 4 créditos desde hace 4 años los cuales ha utilizado los 3 primeros para mejoramiento de vivienda y este último para pagar el título universitario de su hijo.
texts.en:
Lilliana B. is 47 years old, married and has 3 children under her care. Her oldest is in his last year of university studies; the others are in secondary school. She is a dentist and has worked at the Posoltega Health Center for 20 years. Our insitution has granted her 4 loans in 4 years; she used the first three for home improvements and the last one to pay for her son's professional degree fees.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay university expenses.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El  señor es casado, tiene 57 años de edad, el mismo es dueño de una verdulería donde produce infinidades de productos  agricolas en forma artesanal,  situado en la ciudad de Pilar, sobre la Avda.  Federico Shiavon c/ Mbocayaty., en dicho local se comercializa productos variados en general, como ser lechugas, zanahorias, cebollas, frutillas, etc.
Es un importante productor de la zona de este barrio, que desde hace más de 15 años en el Ramo, con gran cantidad de clientes. El Cliente cuenta con casa propia en el barrio Mbocajaty,  donde vive con su Señora, quien es costurera, de ropas.
Solicita el crédito para invertir en la compra de insumos para su  huerta, así como estiércol para utilizarlo de abono, herramientas para uso en la huerta, etc. y así mejorar la calidad de sus productos, para de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos. Agradece a la fundación paraguaya por los buenos servicios que le ha brindado a su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
Mr. T. is a 57-year-old married man who owns a farm in which he grows a number of different types of produce on a small scale. This farm is located in the city of Pilar, on Ferderico Shiavon Avenue c/Mbocayaty. He sells produce like lettuce, carrots, onions, strawberries, etc.

He is a very important grower in this neighborhood, with over 15 years of experience and a large clientele. Mr. T. owns a house in the Mbocajaty neighborhood with his wife, who is a dressmaker. He is requesting this loan so that he can purchase supplies, such as manure (for fertilizer), tools, etc. for his farm. That way, he can improve the quality of his produce and increase profits. He is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the good services they have provided for his business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase agricultural supplies and raw materials

loans.name: Phav

texts.en: Mr. T., 46 years old, has had a small business which the main activity is to fish in and around the river. He and his wife always get up in the morning and head toward the river, where they have always been fishing. This couple has been responsible for five children. All five of the children are students and also assist their parents, when they are free. In the past, T. has rented a neighbor’s boat to fish and right now he wants to own a boat. Because T. has no money, he has decided to seek a loan from Kiva’s lenders, through HKL project. He will buy a boat that he can use to cross the river for his fishing operations. Mr. T. is not in the picture because he was busy at his business when the photo taken, so his wife is pictured instead.

loans.use: To buy a boat.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.es: Anastacia tiene 51 años, vive en su casa propia sola, pues sus tres jóvenes hijos estudian y viven en la ciudad, de vez en cuando la visitan. Cada día ella se despierta con el alba, para empezar con sus labores agrícolas, pues siembra habas, alverjas y papas, es así que todos los días cuida con mucha paciencia sus campos de cultivo. Para ella, la agricultura es un trabajo cansado pues pasa parte de la mañana en cuclillas, vigilando cada planta para que pueda obtener una buena cosecha, generalmente realiza la labor sola y cuando es tiempo de cosecha contrata operarios para que le ayuden a recoger todos sus productos maduros y luego venderlos a los mayoristas de la ciudad. Esta muy satisfecha porque las ganancias que obtiene de las ventas de su cosecha, le alcanzan para ofrecerles a sus hijos una buena educación en la ciudad, ya que su mayor anhelo es que lleguen a ser profesionales. Paralelamente a esta actividad, se dedica a la crianza de reses, en donde sus vacas le brindan varios litros de leche fresca diariamente. Mas adelante planea sembrar en mayor cantidad, tanto en alverja como en habas ya que quiere obtener mejores ganancias con las ventas de estas legumbres. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, además se siente satisfecho con el trabajo de su grupo pues todos los integrantes son muy puntuales en el pago de sus cuotas. Anastacia invertirá el crédito que solicita, en la compra de semillas de habas y alverjas, así como también fertilizantes y alquilar un tractor para que le ayude en  la próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Anastacia is 51 years old and lives by herself in her own home because her three teenage children study and live in the city. They visit her from time to time. Every day she wakes up at dawn to begin her work around the farm. She plants beans, peas, and potatoes and demonstrates great patience with her crops. Farming is tiring work for her because she spends part of her morning squatting and inspecting each plant to ensure she will have a good harvest. Anastacia generally works by herself, but when it is time to harvest, she hires workers to help with gathering all the mature produce that she will sell to the wholesalers in the city. She is very satisfied because the income she obtains from the sale of her crops allows her to provide her children in the city with a good education. Her greatest wish is for them to become professionals. In addition to farming, Anastacia raises cattle. Her cows provide several liters of fresh milk daily. In order to move forward, she hopes to plant more crops such as beans and peas so that she can generate better earnings from the sale of these legumes.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. Anastacia is content with the work of her group because all of the members are very punctual with their loan payments. She will invest her loan in the purchase of seeds for planting beans and peas, as well as fertilizers. Anastacia will also rent a tractor to help with her next planting.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds & fertilizers; pay for tractor rental

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mr. Sok S., 73, is a father who is blessed with three children. Two are married and have already started new homes, while the third is single. One of his children helps the family by working in the garment industry. 

Sok S. owns a medium-sized piece of farmland that he plants rice crops on to earn a living. Also, he assists in his wife's business selling snack food. Sok S. is pursuing a loan in order to improve his farming business.

loans.use: To improve his farming business.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena A. is 24 and married with 1 child (1 year old).  She owns a business providing children's tailoring services to local community members.  Elena has 1 year of experience in this business.  Elena needs a loan of WST$1000 to purchase additional fabrics and materials.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or about US$104 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Elena joined SPBD this year.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Elena's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Sope Seringe Saliou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité « SOPE SERIGNE SALIOU » est créé en 2007, au jour de l’inauguration du Banc Villageois. Il est composé de douze (12) femmes habitant toutes dans le même village et mères d’au moins de 3 enfants. Elles ne sont pas de la même génération, elles sont d’âges différents, entre 25 et 65 ans. Cette différence d’âge ne gêne rien au fonctionnement de leur groupe, au contraire, ça suscite une complémentarité quant aux échanges d’idées et suggestions.  L’activité dominante du groupe est l’embouche, elles engraissent des moutons et des bœufs pour les revendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires des villages environnants. Madame Fatou S., pour des raisons d’assistance à un malade s’est absentée lors de la prise de photo.

La présidente du groupe de solidarité, Madame Téning Mignane N. debout à droit de la photo en deuxième rang, est âgée de 48 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 8 enfants en charge, et en sus elle est tutrice de 07 autres confiés par des parents et des proches. Elle fait de l’embouche bovine et ovine. Elle est très expérimentée dans ce domaine d’activité pour l’avoir menée pendant plus d’une décennie. Avec son nouveau prêt elle va renforcer achat en animaux afin de réaliser plus de bénéfices et de pouvoir contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
The “SOPE SERIGNE SALIOU” cooperative group was created in 2007, on the inauguration of the Banc Villageois. It is made up of twelve women, all from the same village and mothers of at least three children. Not all from the same generation, they range in age from 25 to 65. This age difference does not interfere at all in the functioning of their group—on the contrary, it makes for a complimentary exchange of ideas and suggestions. The main activity of the group is livestock, fattening sheep and cows for resale in weekly markets in surrounding villages. Mrs. Fatou S. is missing from the photo due to caregiving obligations for a sick person on the day the photo was taken. The president of the cooperative group, Mrs. Téning Mignane N. (standing at the right of the photo in the second row) is 48 years old, married and the mother of 8 children in her care. In addition, she is guardian to 7 other children of relatives and friends. She fattens cows and sheep, and is very experienced in this area after more than a decade in the business. With her new loan she will purchase more animals to make more profit and improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Rachel Braff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen and better develop business activities of the cooperative group

loans.name: Miguel Adan

texts.es: Miguel Adán tiene 51 años, a pesar de su edad tiene muchas energías y empeño en su trabajo como es la venta de recargas. Pues dio inicio hace más de 3 años, por lo que siempre le ha gustado su actividad ya que siempre le ha gustado mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia tiene 3 hijos y les proporciona lo necesario para salir adelante. El financiamiento es para la compra de recargas en cantidades grandes para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Sueña con mantener su negocio activo y establecer otro negocio.
texts.en:
Miguel Adán is 51 years old. Despite his age, he has plenty of energy and is a hard worker. Miguel Adán began working as an electronics salesman (specialising in the sale of top-ups for mobile phones) 3 years ago. He has always enjoyed his job, since it has enabled him to improve the standard of life of his family of three children, and given them the means to succeed. The loan will be used to purchase a greater quantity of supplies for his business, to satisfy customer demand. His dream is to keep his business going and establish another.

Translated from Spanish by Cameron Graham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more supplies for his business

loans.name: Fualole

texts.en:
Fualole S. is 61 and married with 6 children (ages 17 - 38).  She owns a business venture, selling food products in the local community.  Fualole has 2 years of experience in this business.  Fualole needs a loan of WST$1500 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Fualole joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Fualole's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375"

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes

loans.name: Aizada

texts.en:
Aizada O. is a resident of Balykchi, a nice town in the Isykul region. She is 24 years old and she is married. She has a three-year-old daughter. 

Aizada and her husband are private entrepreneurs. They started their business activity five years ago with the initial investment of 700 KGS.  Aizada sits at home and accepts ferrous and nonferrous metal, and her husband sells that metal in China. In this way they earn about $650 per month.  That profit made it possible for them to save money and purchase a house, a piece of land in Bishkek and a big truck. 

Aizada applied for the loan because she needs money to increase the turnover in their family business. In the future she wants to give her daughter a good education and build a house in Bishkek. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase more metal to sell

loans.name: Benkadi Iii Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI III est un regroupement de 10 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 3 enfants et vivant dans des familles polygames à N’Gala, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités hivernales. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le petit mil, le pois de terre, l’arachide et le haricot. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne et le prêt précédent a été bien remboursé.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, SIRA S. compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de main d’œuvre pour entretenir environs 1, 2 hectare de petit mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Dioïla et Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser après la campagne, un bénéfice moyen de 40 000FCFA environ.
texts.en:
BENKADI III is a group of 10 married women on average 35 years old, with 3  children, that live in polygamous families in N’Gala, one of the villages of the Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, the second administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso to be able to better organize their winter activities. The crops they cultivate include millet, blackeyed peas, groundnut and beans. This is the group's second loan and the first one had been repaid as planned. With this new loan, SIRA S. plans to buy fertilizer and small tools and hire help to maintain about 1.2 hectares of millet and groundnut. The crops are sold in the cities of Dioïla and Massigui after harvest, to both men and women. The members of the group hope to make a profit of approximately 40 000 CFA.

Translated from French by Loïc Haméon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor costs, fertilizer, herbicide, hoes and small tools

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita O. is from the village of San Luis, Gingoog City. She is 62 years old. Isabelita is married. To make a living, Isabelita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling food and daily-use products in the local community. Isabelita has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2010, Isabelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Isabelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Isabelita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Isabelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

location.town: San Luis, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Eñor De Torrechayoc Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR D. TORRECHAYOC”; este banco está situado en el distrito y provincia D. Urubamba  departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Mery;  La socia es natural D. Calca ella tiene 29 años D. edad y tiene 2 hijos, ella se dedica a la compra y venta D. cristalería y regalos, ella tiene una pequeña tienda en la cual venD. todo tipo D. vasos, floreros, jarras y regalos adornos en vidrio. La socia necesita un capital extra D. trabajo para invertir en la compra D. mercadería. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería.

Los otros socios alternan sus actividades con la atención D. tiendas abarrotes, venta D. verduras y frutas, chofer y artesanía.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Señora Mery is 29 years old, has 2 children and is originally from Calca  .She is also a member of the communal bank "Señor D. Torrechayoc".  The bank is located in the district and province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco. 

Señora Mery buys and sells glassware and gift items for a living.  She has a small store in which she sells all types of vases, jars and glass ornaments.  She needs extra working capital to invest in her business and will use the loan to buy merchandise.                                                                              

The other members have various other jobs such as, attending to grocery stores, fruit and vegetable sales, driver and artisan.  

Señora Mery is grateful and appreciates the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Elsy Marbeli

texts.es:
la joven Elsy Marbeli A. tiene 20 años de edad, vive en la aldea las Cabezas 500 metros al norte de la ciudad de Choluteca. Elsy es una mujer emprendedora y se dedica a la venta de comida y golosinas, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace 2 años.
Elsy tiene dos cualidades que son responsabilidad y honradez.
Elsy tiene clientes fijos que son el personal que trabaja en la empresa Concresur, los alimenta por todo el mes al credito y a finales de mes le cancelan todo lo que le deben.
Todos los dias se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para poder tener lista toda la comida que le piden sus clientes.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas materiales para fabricar sus comidas, desea seguir creciendo con su negocio para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Young Elsy Marbeli A. is 20 years old and lives in the hamlet of Las Cabezas, 500 meters north of the city of Choluteca. Elsy is an enterprising woman who has sold food and candies for two years. Elsy has two qualities, which are responsibility and integrity. 

Elsy has steady customers among those who work for the company Concresur.  She feeds them all month on credit, and at the end of the month they pay off all they owe.  She gets up every day at 5 in the morning in order to have all of the food that her customers request ready.  She will use this loan to buy more ingredients for making her dishes.  She hopes to continue to grow her business in order to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, meat, eggs, tortillas, butter, oil, chicken, cheese, cabbage, potatoes, yucca, tomatoes, onions, garlic, salt, and spices

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more sacks of water and more rice, fish, meat, seasonings, pepper, salt, etc.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden G. is from the village of Nuesa, Roxas, Isabela. She is 38 years old. Eden is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Eden owns & operates a business venture making & selling food.
