While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling fish balls and other dimsums to the local community. Eden has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Eden joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eden has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Eden is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Eden from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly M. is from the town of San Francisco. She is 41 years old. Shirly is married and has 3 children aged 10, 4 and 6 months. To make a living, Shirly owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Shirly does her best to provide her family's needs, pay her dues and improve her business. 

Shirly joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Shirly is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to buy seeds and fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Eleygine

texts.en:
Eleygine B. is from the village of Bantuanon, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 24 years old and is single. Eleygine owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & snack foods. She has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Eleygine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like snack foods & biscuits. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es: Emilio, de 41 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Marlene de 35 años y sus 2 queridos hijos Luis de 13 y Michael de 7 años, quienes son el principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. La actividad a la que Emilio se dedica, es el cultivo de papa y arvejas, Todos los días, muy temprano por la mañana, trabaja en su cultivo, ya que sabe que mientras mejor calidad tengan sus productos, mejores precios obtendrá por sus productos en el mercado mayorista de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses de trabajo han tenido sus frutos, lleva 23 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras, puesto que siempre hay el peligro de que los químicos le causen alguna enfermedad. Con el tiempo, desea comprar más tierras, para sembrar más. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, manifiesta que el dinero del crédito le ayudara mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal, es un socio muy responsable y respetuoso. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará semillas de papa y alverja, ya que en esta temporada son los productos que mejor se venderán.
texts.en: Emilio, 41, is a humble and hard-working man who lives in his own home with his wife, Marlene, 35, and his 2 dear sons, Luis, 13 and Michael, 7.  They are the main reasons that he works so hard.  He is a farmer and he grows potatoes and beans.  Every day he works in the fields from very early in the morning.  He knows that the better quality his crops are, the better prices he will receive in the wholesale market in Tarma.  What he likes most about his work is harvesting his crops since that is when he feels that the months of work show their results.  He has been a farmer for 23 years and what he finds most difficult is fumigating the land since there is always the danger that the chemicals will cause some type of illness.  In the future he wants to buy more land so that he can plant more.  This is his first loan with MFP.  He has shown that the money will help him with the progress of his work.  In his communal bank he is a very responsible and respectful member.  With the 1900 soles that he is requesting, he will buy potato and bean seeds since this is the season when these crops will best sell.

loans.use: To buy potato and bean seeds

loans.name: Roly

texts.es: Roly, de 21 años, es un joven muy jovial aunque todavía no cuenta con su propia casa, pero se esmera por sobresalir para salir adelante.El factor más relevante es “la creatividad y la persistencia continua” manifiesta, a pesar de su corta edad quiere lograr sus metas por si solo y aposto por la agricultura. Gracias al pequeño lote que sus padres le ofrecieron puede sembrar con tranquilidad sus sembríos de coca, café y cacao para poder sostenerse y solventarse sus gastos personales sin necesidad de la ayuda de sus padres. Viene trabajando cuatro años; y  sus cultivos  son muy fructíferos, lo único dificultoso es que no se abastece por si solo en sus cosechas y es indispensable el apoyo de jornaleros. Su planta más favorita es la hoja de coca ya que recibe buenas ganancias; aunque tiene momentos dificultosos por la invasión de las plagas ya que no puede combatirlas y le generan perdidas de granos. Con los ahorros obtenidos de cada año ampliara su lote de terreno con la finalidad de sembrar más productos y así mejorar sus ingresos económicos.Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a cumplir su cronograma de pagos, además agradece a su banco comunal por la confianza depositada.Tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la  compra de insumos y abono, con la finalidad de dar un buen mantenimiento a sus plantas, de esta manera espera continuar progresando.
texts.en: Roly is 21 years old. He is a very jovial young man even though he does not yet have his own home but he strives to excel to succeed. He believes that the most important factors are "continuous creativity and persistence". Despite his young age, he wants to achieve his goals on his own and has placed his bet on farming. Thanks to the small lot that his parents offered him he can peacefully grow his coca, coffee and cacao crops so that he can support himself and cover his personal expenses without help from his parents. He has been working for four years and his crops are very successful. The only difficult thing is that he cannot do everything himself during the harvest and the support of day laborers is essential. His favorite plant is the coca leaf since he can make a good profit. He has some difficult moments because of pest invasions since he cannot fight them and they result in losses of seeds. With his savings from each year he will expand his plot in order to plant more products and improve his income. This is his first loan with field partner MFP which he is committed to pay on time. He also thanks his community bank for their trust. He plans on investing the loan he is requesting on purchasing supplies and fertilizer in order to properly maintain his plants so that he can continue to progress.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer to improve his crops.

loans.name: Marie Rose

texts.en: Marie Rose is a mother of two children, aged between eighteen months and four years. Marie Rose’s husband works with her. Marie has a shop in which she sells beans, bananas, sugar and rice. Marie has done this business for ten years and this business has helped her build her own house. Marie is requesting for a loan in order to buy more beans, green bananas, sugar and rice for sale. With the profits, together with her savings, she plans to buy a piece of land. Currently Marie sells her goods on a retail scale but in the future she plans to start up a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy more food stuffs.

loans.name: Delgersaihan

texts.en:
Delgersaihan, 44, is married and lives with his wife and two daughter in Arhangai province, Mongolia. They live in a house where they have lived for 18 years so far. His wife works as a cook for a cafe and his two daughters attend local secondary school. 

Delgersaihan began a wooden-product making business in 1994. All his family members support his business and now his business has become more stable. In the beginning, he started his business with a working  capital of 50,000 MNT and now it exceeds 580,000 MNT. He is a hard-working and modest person who says,"I am trying to expand my business and save money for my daughters' future studies. I want them to become well-educated people." He is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase more wood for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more wood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Brice Alexandrine

texts.fr:
Cliente de 29ans célibataire sans enfant. Elle débute son activité en 2000.

Ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter des sacs haricots, de riz, d’arachide, de sel, tomate,oignon. 

Sa stratégie est de renforcer sa marchandise à tout moment afin de satisfaire aux besoins des clients.

Elle aimerait être grossiste dans les jours futurs.
Son souhait est de réussir afin de mieux subvenir à ses besoins.
texts.en:
This client is 29 years old, single, and has no children.  She began her work in 2000. 
This loan will allow her to buy sacks of beans, rice, peanuts, salt, tomatoes and onions. 
Her strategy is to build up her stock of merchandise so that she can meet the needs of her customers at all times.  

She would like to be a wholesaler in the future. Her wish is to succeed so that she can better meet her daily needs.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, salt, and  tomato concentrate

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir is married with an 11 year old son named Igor.  Vladimir lives in Kamenka, a predominantly agricultural region of Ukraine.  He runs a greenhouse business and owns two lots of land and five big-arch greenhouses. Vladimir launched his business ten years ago. He has already invested about 80,000 Grivnyas in his business. His annual expenses on seeds and film are 37,000 Grivnyas.  

Vladimir requests a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to construct an additional greenhouse and purchase quality polyethylene film to cover it. One of his plans for the future is to expand his farming business and purchase a machine that prepares compound animal feed. The machine will help Vladimir engage in farm animal production as well as keep his greenhouse business running efficiently.

loans.use: To construct an additional greenhouse and purchase plastic film to cover it.

loans.name: Prosper Development Group

texts.en:
Enterprising people who blaze trails as a means of gaining a new lease on life invariably act as role models for many people in societies across the globe. The same can be said of Uganda, which in recent times has seen many enterprising people set up their own businesses and thereby inspiring others. One such person was an aunt to 35-year-old Cissy K..  Cissy has for the past decade been operating a beauty salon business in Mpigi Town. She credits her aunt with a prevailing pep talk that, at length, led her to open up her own new business horizons.

Cissy says hard work, resilience, courage and constant planning have been her stocks in trade. This mother of 4 was previously operating a restaurant.  In addition to her beauty salon, Cissy also operates a modest retail shop business. Weekly, she says the businesses generates for her 100,000 shillings in profit. With this loan, she  says she is going to purchase another hair dryer and more braids to be used in her salon. Cissy is affiliated with Prosper development Group-Mpigi.

loans.use: to purchase a hair dryer and braids for her salon

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en:
Gertrude N. lives in the Kalerwe neighbourhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school. Gertrude has a business of selling milk. She has been in this business for two years, and she works seven days out of every week. Gertrude sells her products in a retail shop. 

Gertrude has requested for  a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use  to buy more cans of milk. She also generates additional income from a motorcycle for hire. The main business challenges for Gertrude include transportation, thieves and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler and also  to start making her  ghee. 

Gertrude lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and no piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, rent and school fees

loans.use: to buy more cans of milk

loans.name: Ithemba Lomama Group

texts.en:
Thandiwe is 51 years of age and married with seven children between the ages of 14 and 24. She runs a small retail business in Mandini, South Africa. In the photo she is wearing a white shirt and raising her hand.

She's been in this business for three years and sells snacks, airtime, fruits and vegetables from her home. She does not have any other source of income. She says that the main challenges to her business are customers who buy on credit and end up failing to pay, and some just disappear.

Thandiwe requested this loan through Women’s Development Businesses to buy snacks, airtime, fruits and vegetables to resell. She says that extra income from this loan will help her send her children for third level education. In five years time she would like to own a spaza shop (small convenience store).

She appreciates WDB and KIVA for making her life easier by appearing on the website.

loans.use: to buy snacks, airtime, fruits and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Chheoun

texts.en:
Chheoun, age 57, is married and resides with her children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Chheoun sells groceries and vegetables, earning an income of $15 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband, who provides motorbike-washing services, earning an income of $3 per day. Their standard of living has been improved since Chheoun has had this business. 

She is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to stock the store.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.pt:
Natural da Cidade de Quelimane Provincia da Zambezia. Foi a escola ate 9 classe, casado maritalmente e ė Pai de 2 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 13 e 16 anos. 
Actualmente vive e trabalha  na zona turistica da ponta do ouro no distrito de  Matutuine. Do salário que recebe consegue alimentar a sua familia e poupa um pouco no Banco comercial (BCI).
Vem a conhecer a Hluvuku-Adesma apartir de conversas com colegas de serviço e amigos e decide aproximar para ter mais esclarecimentos sobre os procedimentos para ser cliente e beneficiar-se do financiamento para realizar seus projectos.
Vem a tornar se cliente da Hluvuku-Adesema apartir do dia 15 de Maio de 2011.  O primeiro e unico financiamento no valor de 15.000,00Mts foi para compra de cimento para Fabrico de  blocos e pagamento da mao de obra
Tenciona ver  a casa de sua Mãe concluida e para tal conta com a Hluvuku-Adsema para mais financiamento.
texts.en:
Jorge is from the city of Quelimane in the Zambezi province.  He attended school through the 9th grade.  He is married and father of two children, ages 13 and 16.  He currently lives and works in the tourist area of Ponta D'Ouro in the Matutuine district.  His salary provides enough to feed his family and he saves a little at the Banco Comercial (BCI).

Jorge learned about Hluvuku-Adesma through conversations with coworkers and friends and he decided to learn more about the process of becoming a client and how to benefit form loans to complete his projects. He became a client of Hluvuku-Ademsa on May 15, 2011.  His first and only loan was for 15,000.00Mts for the purchase of cement to make blocks, and to pay for labor.  

He is anxious to see his mother's house completed and for that purpose he will rely on Hluvuku-Adesma for additional loans.

loans.use: to purchase cement to make blocks and to pay for labor.

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.en:
Maria is a borrower who lives near San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic, in a rural community. She is the coordinator for her group, named El Progreso (The Progress), a group of Haitian citizens who have made their lives in the Bateyes of Dominican Republic.

Maria, her husband, and their three children live together north of San Pedro in a Bateyes, which is a small rural community built by sugar companies for their field workers. Despite her difficulties, Maria makes the most of her opportunities and she operates a little food market where she sells products such as clothes, shoes, and other goods. Her most difficult business challenge is that her customers do not have enough revenue to purchase the items that she sells. However, she visits other communities during the week, traveling to sell her products.

Maria is requesting a loan to purchase different products to increase her inventory such as clothing for men, women, and children, and to purchase rice, beans, cooking oil, vegetables, meat, and other items. Maria has had five previous loans and she has been able to bring changes to her family’s life.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, and food.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Trinidad has a retail shop that sells candies, biscuits, snacks and canned goods. She has had this business for five years. Trinidad has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy breads, canned goods and snacks.
Trinidad is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy breads, canned goods and snacks to sell

loans.name: Rosa Marili

texts.es:
Rosa, es una persona de familia, vive con sus dos hijos y su esposo, ella se dedica a atender una sala de belleza, tiene año y medio de estar en el negocio, inicio siendo empleada de un salón, luego decidió instalar su propio servicio de belleza a los clientes de la zona.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo ya que desea mejorar el inventario de productos de belleza, comprando tintes para el cabello, tratamientos faciales, maquillajes, con esta inversión pretende mejorar el servicio para los clientes.
Espera que después de la inversión atender un mayor número de clientes, satisfaciendo sus necesidades, su aspiración es ampliar los servicios, capacitarse más, ambicionando un desarrollo económico para su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is family-oriented. She lives with her two children and her husband. She has a beauty salon that has been open for a year and a half. She began as an employee at a salon and later decided to start her own salon for the customers in the area.

Currently she is asking for a loan because she wants to improve her inventory of beauty products, buying hair dyes, facial treatments and makeup. With this investment she will be able to improve the service that she provides her customer.

She hopes that after the investment she will have more customers and meet their needs. Her dream is to increase her services and get more training, with the goal of economic development for her family.

loans.use: to buy hair dyes, facial treatments and makeup for the beauty salon.

loans.name: Hajia

texts.en: Hajia is married and has four children. Her husband is a tailor. She operates a provisions shop at Effiakuama near Takoradi, the Western Region of Ghana. She has been in this business for 10 years now. She helps her partner to educate her children. Her loan will be used to buy additional provisions for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards the university education of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional provisions for sale.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 22 years old and blessed with four children ages 4, 3, 2 and 7 months old. She finished her high school education. Her parents can’t afford to send her in college, that is why she was engaged into early marriage. She is hoping to educate all her children. Marilou strives hard to sustain their needs. She raises hogs and sells them in order to generate income. Sometimes, she also helps her husband in his farming business.

Marilou is requesting a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos to buy hog feeds to ensure good nutrition.

She hopes to develop her hog-raising business to generate more income and save for future expenses.

Someday, she also wants to provide a progressive living for her family.

loans.use: to buy hog feeds.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Jose Manuel es casado, tiene 34 años de edad, estudio los estudios de educación primaria, tiene 3 hijos 2 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la venta de medicamentos, inicio este negocio como trabajador para otra empresa, lleva 20 años de experiencia en la venta de  medicina.

Decide solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de mercadería, medicinas de diferentes denominaciones: capsulas, antibióticos, pastillas, ampollas, jarabes, etc. Espera mejorar su negocio con una farmacia surtida y con una mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Señor Jose Manuel is married and 34 years old.  He is educated to primary school level, and has three children, two of whom are currently in school.

He works selling medicine.  He started in this field as an employee for another business, and has 20 years of experience in selling medicine. 

He decided to ask for a loan, which he will use to buy merchandise, medicines of different types: capsules, antibiotics, pills, ampoules, syrups, etc.

He hopes to improve his business through haivng a well-stocked pharmacy and improved quality.

loans.use: to buy pharmaceutical merchandise.

loans.name: Marielisa Genoveva

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Productivo se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Marielisa, tiene 32 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 9 y 6 años los mismos que estudian en escuela. El marido trabaja en una fábrica en Manta. Ella está desde que se inicio el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios y créditos adicionales que brinda la institución.

Ella es  una gran ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y productos Avon y Lebel (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos días de la semana ya que tiene varios clientes que llegan hasta su casa a comprar sus productos, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada fin de  semana. Tiene cinco años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, nos cuenta que lo que más vende son los cosméticos y las prendas interiores.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa interior.
 
Su sueño es tener una boutique.
texts.en:
The "Productivo" Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the Montecristi canton, which is well known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts which are renowned on a national and international level.  It is where the famous sombreros made from toquilla straw come from.

Señora Marielisa lives here.  She is 32 years old, and lives in a common-law marriage from which she has two children aged 9 and 6, who attend school.  Her husband works in a factory in Manta.  She has been part of the Communal Bank since the beginning, and likes it for the benefits and additional loans provided by the institution.

She looks after the home, and to earn her own spending money, she works selling clothes from a catalog and Avon and Lebel products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories).  She works every day of the week, as she has several customers who come to her house to buy her products.  She offers her products on credit, and collects every weekend.

She has been doing this work for five years, and it is going very well for her.  She tells us that what sells most are cosmetics and underwear.

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and underwear.  Her dream is to have a boutique.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and underwear.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda tiene 47 años, es una valerosa madre soltera que cuida de sus 2 menores hijas: Mabelia y Yelit, en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Caritá. Su trasquilo rostro es producto de la vida sosegada que lleva en el campo, pues ya tiene 21 años dedicándose a la agricultura. En todo este tiempo logró obtener buenos resultados, pues cuenta con sus propios terrenos agrícolas; en el caserío de Huacas. Donde todos los días desde muy temprano sale a limpiar y fertilizar sus cultivos de papa y arveja, de las cuales son vendidos en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Asimismo por las tardes se dedica a la venta de anticuchos a base de corazón de oveja; según cuenta vende un promedio de 50 unidades diarias; eso le ayuda a tener un ingreso extra. Su principal dificultad son los gastos que realiza en los estudios de enfermería de su hija, donde invierte mensualmente. Pero se siente tranquila, ya que hace poco adquirió un auto con lo que hace trasporte público. Sus planes actuales son sembrar en mayores cantidades para poder culminar de pagar su auto. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “progreso carita” y este es el sexto crédito que tiene con MFP, donde se siente muy contenta; pues le apoyan en el desarrollo de su trabajo. Razón por lo que promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Yolanda, piensa sembrar papa de la variedad “yungay” y “única”; por ello de recibir su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcirlos en sus próximos sembríos.
texts.en: Yolanda is 47 years old. She is a courageous single mother who cares for her 2 small daughters, Mabelia y Yelit, in her own house located in the hamlet of Carita. Her serene appearance is a product of a quiet life spent in the fields as she has already spent 21 years farming. During this time she has managed to obtain good results as she has her own farmland in the hamlet of Huacas, where every day from early in the morning she weeds and fertilizes her crops of peas and potatoes. She sells these crops at the wholesale market in the town of Tarma. In the afternoons, she sells kebabs made from sheep's heart. According to her, she says that she sells an average of 50 pieces daily which helps her earn an extra income. Her main difficulty is the cost of childcare for her daughter, which she pays every month. However, she feels assured as recently she bought a car which she uses to provide public transport. Her current plans are to plant in greater numbers so she can finish off paying for the car. She belongs to the communal bank “Progreso Carita” and this is her 6th loan with MFP; she feels very happy as they support the development of her work. For this reason, she promises to be prompt with her repayments. Yolanda is thinking of planting potatoes of the "yungay" and "unica" varieties. As she is receiving support, she will invest the money requested to purchase natural fertilizers to spread over her next crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizers.

loans.name: Las Morenitas Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Las Morenitas está conformado por las señoras Roció, Paula van a comprar con su préstamo alimento para borregos, vacunas y vitaminas, la señora Juana va a comprar Refrescos por caja,  la señora Alma Delia va a comprar  Yogurt natural, vasos y cucharas. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “estamos orgullosos de recibir estos préstamos, gracias por confían en nosotros y no les vamos a defraudar y que nos sigan prestando para crecer los negocios". La señora Juana tiene 44 años de edad, ella es casada su esposo trabaja de peón de albañil ellos tienen 4 hijas mayores de edad ya trabajan, ella vende refrescos y dulces, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar refrescos, chocolates, paletas etc. y una parte para comprar cemento para las cadenas de su casa. Ella inicio su negocio hace cuatro años la necesidad y falta de recursos economicos, su hija se enfemo y no tenia para comprar las medicinas, su negocio es importante porque va saliendo y no falta el dinero, ella se siente orgullosa de que ya está terminado de construir su casa, las ganancias de su negocio las utiliza para comer y para volver a invertir.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Las Morenitas.”  Its members are: Rocío and Paula who will use their loans to buy sheep, vaccines and vitamins; Juana who will buy soft-drinks by the case; Alma Delia who will buy natural yoghurt, drinking glasses and spoons.  The group members want to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad: “We are proud to receive these loans.  Thank you for trusting us.  We will not defraud you.  Please continue lending to us so that we can grow in our businesses.”

Juana, 44, is married.  Her husband works as a bricklayer’s helper.  They have four adult daughters who are employed.  She sells soft-drinks and candy.  She requested the loan to buy soft-drinks, chocolates, lollypops, etc. and part of it to buy cement for the chains at her house.  She started the business four years ago because of need and the lack of economic resources.  Her daughter got sick and she did not have money to buy medicine.  Her business is important because she’s getting ahead and she doesn’t lack money.  She’s proud because she’s finishing building her house.  Profits from the business have provided food to eat and funds to reinvest.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, candy and cement.

loans.name: Jargal

texts.en: Jargal is 66 years old and lives with her daughter and son-in-law in her apartment in the Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Jargal operates a general store. She started her business in 2008 by renting a counter in a local market. She sells items such as napkins, toilet paper and wipes. Her business is now sustainable and she has many regular customers. She got a little break to take a vacation and, due to the vacation, her assets have decreased such that she is unable to continue the business. She is a strong and diligent woman who says, "I like to do my job. It makes me feel alive". She is requesting 500,000 MNT to buy more products.

loans.use: To buy more products

loans.name: Jelly

texts.en:
Jelly is from the town of Clarin. She is 39 years old. Jelly is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Jelly owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector. Jelly has been in her business for over three years and earns 800 PHP a month for these activities. 

Jelly is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She's been a member of GDMPC for three years. Jelly plan to used the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kachwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Jessica has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells items such as sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Jessica has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar and soap for resale, and will help Jessica to generate greater profits and open up another shop that sells clothes. Jessica hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house of her own. 

Jessica is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jessica who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more sugar and soap for resale.

loans.name: Mahammad

texts.en: Mahammad is a 30 year-old man who breeds sheep and cattle as well as cows. Mahammad is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his wife and two children in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He has four years of experience in this field.  He sells milk and homemade yoghurt, as well as sheep for wool and meat purposes and cattle for meat purposes.  His monthly income is 250 AZN. Mahammad chose a very profitable business, and the products he sells in the market are in high demand. He would like to expand his business and purchase more animals. For this purpose he applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN. He will use this loan in order to purchase five sheep and two baby calves.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and calves.

loans.name: C13505 New Life Group

texts.en:
Eric is 35 years old and is married with two children between the ages of 6 and 10. Eric is also the leader of his group, which is called "New Life." He is the first person on the right in the picture. 

Eric employs four people to help him, and he has four years of experience. He works from 7:00 a.m until 6:00 p.m every day. Eric has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business by buying more clothes to sell. With his profits, Eric will reinvest in his business, and he will buy a house for his family.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Eulogio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  ”VIRGEN PURIFICADA DE TUPAC AMARU;  El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Urcos en la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Eulogio;  El socio tiene 47 años de edad, El socio es conviviente, El socio tiene 4 hijos de 17, 12, 10, 1 años de edad; El socio trabaja en el municipio, el socio  también se dedica paralelamente a la crianza de vacuno, el socio desea ahora invertir en la compra de un torete para criarlo y engordarlo hasta que pueda procrear. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de un torete.
El socio agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Sr. Eulogio is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen Purificada de Tupac Amaru” which is located in the District of Urcos in Quispicanchis Province, Department of Cusco.

He is 47 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has four children (ages 17, 12, 10, and 1). Eulogio works in the municipality, but he also raises cattle. He wants to invest in the purchase of a young bull to raise and fatten so that it can be used for procreation. Therefore, he is requesting a loan to invest in a young bull.

Eulogio is grateful for this loan and promises to complete his payments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy a young bull.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric at wholesale

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es: Hugo, de 42 años, convive con Judi de 34 años; viven en casa propia junto a su  querido hijo Cleyvis de 15 años; a quien desean un mejor futuro. La labor que realiza Hugo es de enseñar a sus alumnos en el colegio de Kimbiri; para Hugo atender a sus hijos y enseñar a sus alumnos es algo hermoso que puede sentir. Desde muy temprano se dirige  a su centro educativo. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es enseñar a sus alumnos; lleva 20 años en la actividad que realiza. Hugo cuenta que desde que vive en Kimbiri; los padres de sus alumnos se sienten contentos por la enseñanza que les brinda, gracias a su trabajo llego a comprarse una fotocopiadora para realizar trabajos en el colegio; pero a veces la algunos repuestos de la fotocopiadora que se llegan a gastar por los arduos trabajos que hace y tiene comprar nuevos para seguir laborando con tranquilidad. Es por ello que espera la colaboración de los financistas para que pueda concretar sus planes de comprar nuevos repuestos para su fotocopiadora. Este es crédito numero 05 con MFP, y se compromete a pagar puntual con sus cuotas. Agradece a su banco comunal por dejarle ser parte de su grupo. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, Podrá comprar repuestos para su fotocopiadora.
texts.en:
Hugo is 42 years old and in a common-law relationship with Judi, age 34. They live in their own home with their 15-year-old son Cleyvis and want to provide him with a better future. Hugo’s job involves teaching students at a high school in Kimbiri. The ability to teach students is something beautiful that he is able to feel from within. Hugo must leave early in order to get to the school. He greatly enjoys his work as a teacher and has been in this profession for 20 years. The parents of his students are pleased with what he has been teaching them.

Thanks to his job, Hugo was able to buy a photocopier for doing work at the school. Sometimes he must buy spare parts for the photocopier as a result of using it. Having new parts enables him to continue working without problems. For this reason, he hopes to partner with the Kiva lenders to fulfill his plans of buying new parts for his photocopier.

This will be his fifth loan with MFP and he promises to be punctual with his payments. Hugo is grateful to be part of his Communal Bank. His loan of 1500 PEN will be used to buy spare parts for his photocopier.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the photocopier he uses at school.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio tiene 60 años,  es viudo pero tiene 6 hijos, de las cuales vive solo con una de sus hijas menores en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Antonio es un hombre trabajador, se dedica al cultivo de cacao desde hace 40 años. Nos comenta que con esfuerzo y dedicación, todo se puede lograr en esta vida; algunas veces tuvo caídas de las cuales supo superarse y aprender de ello. Ahora tiene una hija por quien tiene una responsabilidad, pues esta en etapa escolar y por ello es que debe seguir trabajando para ayudarla con su esducación. Por ahora se encuentra de vacaciones, por lo que tiene más tiempo con ella, trabajndo juntos en el campo. Antonio está orgulloso por haber logrado casi todo lo anhelado en la vida, ya que a costa de muchos sacrificios a sabido educar a sus demás hijos. Antonio aparte de dedicarse a la agricultura tiene una tienda de abarrotes que le viene generando buenos ingresos. Este será su segundo credito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas.  Con los 1,000 nuevos soles invertirá en los gasto de estudio de su hija.
texts.en:
Antonio, 60, is widowed but has six children. He only lives with one of them in his house, located in the district of Pichari. Antonio is a hard worker, and has been growing cocoa for 40 years. He says that anything can be achieved in life with effort and dedication. He has had his downfalls but has been able to get over them and learn something from them. 

He is now taking care of his daughter. She is going to school, so he needs to keep working to pay for her education. Right now, he is on holiday, so he has more time to spend with her. They work together in the farm. Antonio is proud to have achieved almost everything he set to do in life. By making a lot of sacrifices, he was able to educate his other children. 

Besides farming, he runs a grocery store which has been generating a good amount of income. This will be his second loan with MFP, so he commits to meet his installment payments on time. He will invest the 1000 nuevos soles in his daughter's education.

loans.use: To pay for his daughter's education.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: Atilio, de 32 años; padre de 02 hermosos hijos Yulisa de 11 años y Jerónimo de 01 año y  esposo de Agustina de 29 años; juntos  residen en su propia casa donde reina la felicidad. Desde muy temprano Atilio, se dirige a su campo de cultivo para  ver el crecimiento y avance de sus plantones de cacao que con mucho esmero logró obtener; esta actividad empezó a realizar durante 12 años y comenta que no lo ha logrado tan fácil  ya que tuvo que pasar por muchas cosas para lograr obtener lo que ahora tiene. Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es que gracias a las cosechas que obtiene puede solventar los gastos de su familia; para él su trabajo le es difícil en las temporadas de lluvia porque es donde no puede ver el avance ni mucho menos realizar el desmonte que aquejan su producción. Con el tiempo quiere obtener grandes producciones, cultivando mas plantas de cacao para que de esa manera llegue tener una buena economía y velar por su familia.  Pero por el momento su mayor prioridad es mantener sanos a sus siembras. Este será su crédito número 01 con MFP, se siente contento por el apoyo que le brindan ya que de esa manera logrará cumplir con sus objetivos. Asimismo se compromete a ser muy puntual con sus cuotas de pago y quedar mal con sus compañeros de su banco comunal. Con los 1.500 nuevos soles podrá comprar funguicidas naturales para realizar el mantenimiento de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Atilio, 32, is the father of two beautiful children: Yulisa, 11, and Jerónimo, 1, and husband of Agustina, 29. They live together in their own house where happiness reigns. 

Atilio heads out to his fields very early to check on his cocoa bean plants’ growth and development which he attains with much dedication. He started this activity 12 years ago and comments that it’s not been easy because he had to go through a lot to obtain what he now has. What he likes best about his work is that thanks to the harvests he obtains he’s able to cover his family’s expenses. 

However, it is difficult during the rainy season because he can’t see the advance or even worse is unable to clear out the weeds that invade his plants. In time he wants to obtain great harvests cultivating more cocoa bean plants so that he can obtain a better economy and watch over his family. But for now, his greatest priority is to keep his crops healthy.
 
This will be loan #1 with MFP. He feels happy for the support he’s being given because he will be able to reach his objectives. He also commits to being very punctual with his installment payments and not disappoint his fellow communal bank members. He will use the 1500 new soles to buy natural fungicides for crop maintenance.

loans.use: to buy fungicide.

loans.name: Santos Eugenio

texts.en:
Hello, my name is Santes and I buy and sell types of bananas, from my a part of my home in the center of my neighborhood. I have several years experience and thanks to the earnings I can cover family expenses and other bills. Now I need to invest more in my business as the demand grows daily and I do not have sufficient capital to stock my business.

Hola Mi nombre es Santos, mi actividad principal es la compra y venta de Bananos, cuento con una bodega ubicada en mi casa de habitación en el centro de mi comunidad, tengo un año de experiencia en este tipo genocio, gracias a los ingresos que persivo de la venta de este producto puedo cubrir mis gastos familiares y otros compromisos, actualmente necesito invertir mas ya que la demanda cada dia crece y no cuento con el capital suficiente.

loans.use:
To purchase plantains and bananas.

Compra de Platanos y Bananos

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en: I am a widow and mother of 5. My husband died of HIV/AIDS. I sell cereals for a living. I will use the money to expand my business and be able to pay school fees for my children.

loans.use: I will use the money to expand my business.

loans.name: Fahima

texts.en: Fahima lives in district 1 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She lives with all members of her family. She is a widow; her husband died during the war against the Taliban. She tries to help her family. She has a son who has a shoe shop. His mother took her 4th cycle group loan and he bought all the new designs of shoes and made a good business. Now his mothers wants to take anther loan so that he can make good commerce and be one of the good business dealers in future.

loans.use: To buy new designs of shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his  newspaper vending business.

loans.name: Seyran

texts.en:
Mr. Seyran B. lives on a small income that is vulnerable. He is 42, married with three children, and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

Mr. B. and his son (he is pictured) run the family business together. Mr. B. sells beef in the Saatli town, while his son grazes cattle. The income they have from cows is too low to support the family. That is why Mr. B. applied to Norwegian Microcredit Saatli branch for a loan of $500 to buy four calves to make his monthly income higher. The price of four calves: $400 The price of breeding: $100 The income from selling four breeded cows in half a year: $2,000

loans.use: To buy four calves.

loans.name: Akessa

texts.fr:
Miss P. Akessa is a 28 year-old tailor. She works from her home since she does not have the means to open her own workshop. She has not yet been able to establish her own clientele and the income from this business is not sufficient to provide for her needs. She is a very dynamic and conscientious woman, and would like to start a jewlery business as well, however, once again, she does not have the means needed for this. WIth the end-of-year festivities approaching, she would like to go and buy new jewels from Ghana but her income is insufficient. In order to accomplish this, she is asking for a credit of $400. This will increase her income and give her financial autonomy.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 28 ans, Mlle P. Akessa, est couturière de formation. Elle exerce son métier à la maison car les moyens ne lui permettent pas d’ouvrir un atelier. Elle n’a pas de clientèle et les revenus de son activité n’arrivent pas à subvenir ses besoins. Très dynamique et soucieuse de son avenir, elle veut se lancer dans le commerce des bijoux mais de moyens non plus. A l’approche des fêtes de fin d’année, elle veut aller acheter des nouveautés de bijoux au Ghana mais ses économies sont très maigres. Pour cela, elle sollicite un crédit de $400. Ceci augmentera ses revenus et lui donnera une autonomie financière.

loans.use: Purchase and sales of jewlery

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah O. is a trader who deals in car spare parts. She is divorced with two children ages 15 and 3 in her custody. Raising two kids single-handedly is not easy for Hannah but she is trying. There is an increase in demand for car spare parts but she is not able to meet the demand. Her shop is located at a very good place near mechanical shops.

She is asking for $1,100 to enable her buy more spare parts for her shop. This loan will enable her meet the demand of her customers and also maximize her profit which will raise her living condition.

loans.use: Buy more spare parts for her shop

loans.name: Asmah

texts.en: Asmah, 35, has two children, 17 and 12. She has a small store where she sells household goods, snacks, etc., earning US$10.5 per day. Her husband, M. H., is a laborer who earns US$3 per day. She is a member of MBK and asking for a loan of US$100 to buy more inventory for her store so she can pay tuition for her children. She will repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her store

loans.name: Wakimese D Group

texts.en:
The leader of this group is Florence A.. She currently runs a retail shop and is requesting a loan to increase stock. Florence is 38 years old and is a single mother of two children, aged 2 and 3. Each week, Florence makes approximately UGX 35,000 in profits and, with the extra help from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy another fridge.

Florence is joined in her small group by Asia M., Mary K., Sarah S., and Faumah L.. Asia M. has a business selling clothes and wants to expand. Mary K. is also operating a business selling clothes and wants a loan to add stock. Sarah S. operates a clinic and wants to buy laboratory equipment. Faumah L. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand retail businesses

loans.name: Ndeeba North C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Betty O.. She is currently in the business of tailoring and is requesting a loan to add to the business. Betty is 36 years old and is a widow. She has 3 children ranging from age 3 to 10 and her children go to school. Each week, Betty makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to construct a house for her children. Betty has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Betty is joined in her small group by Loy A., Mayimuna N., Mirabu N., and Betty M.. Loy A. has a business selling charcoal and wants to purchase more sacks of charcoal. Mayimuna N. is currently operating a business selling charcoal and wants a loan to expand to bulk selling. Mirabu N. operates a business selling matooke and wants to add capital. Betty M. is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to add stock.

loans.use: To purchase more cloth fabric

loans.name: Mayis

texts.ru:
Mayis Q. was born in 1959 in Agsu, where he still lives. He is married. For more than thirty years, he has been working as a tailor. He is a wonderful craftsman. This year, Mayis applied for loan from the Agsu branch of Normicro. He would like to buy new equipment.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer.

Ганиев Маис родился и проживает в городе Ахсу. 1959 года рождения. Женат. Более тридцати лет работает портнойом. Прекрасный мастер. Маис в этом году обратился в Нормикро Ахсуниский филиал чтобы получить кредит. Он хочеть купить нового оборудование.

loans.use: For procurement of equipment

loans.name: Oscar Danilo

texts.es:
Señor Oscar is 26-years-old and lives in the neighborhooed of Héroes and Mártires de Apayal. He is married and has three kids, who are 2, 8, and 5. He works as an assistant in a grocery store. He would like this loan to buy beams and zinc to replace the roof on his house. One of his dreams is to buy his own land since he now lives on his father's land.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

El Sr. Oscar tiene 26 años de edad residiendo en un barrio héroes y mártires de apayal es casado le tienen tres hijos de 2,8 y 5 años de edad, trabaja como asistente de bodega y el préstamo lo quiere para comprar perlines, zinc y cambiar el techo de su casa. Unos de su anhelo es comprar un terreno propio ya que vive en el mismo terreno con su padre.

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of various goods for a small cafeteria.

loans.name: Eseese

texts.en:
Eseese S., age 46, is married with 4 children. She has many years of experience in the farming business. She sells to the general public 3 days per week.

Eseese has taken 3 previous loans from SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 520 Tala (~$216 USD). SPBD loans are Eseese’s only access to capital, because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

Part of her loan will be used to buy tools and chemicals for her farm, and part will pay for her children's school fees. Eseese S. is a very energetic mother who running a farming business. With support from her husband, she is able to maintain their business in good shape.

loans.use: To buy tools and chemicals for her farm

loans.name: Maximiliana, Hermenegilda, And Norma Group

texts.en:
Maximiliana lives with her common-law husband, is 21, and has a child. She has a little grocery store at her home with her mother and takes care of the store. She also works in a poultry farm.

Hermenegilda is married, is 62 and has 8 children. She is a mobile clothes and shoes sales person in a street next to the Ayacucho central market. On Saturdays and Sundays, she travels to fairs to sell her products.

As for Norma, she is a 26-year-old single woman. She weaves pullovers manually at the clients' requests. She also works in a wrought-iron workshop and she is responsible for the clients' reception.

Maximiliana, Hermenegilda and Norma belong to the Morenita Huamanga Village Bank. They need a 400 soles, an 800 soles and a 400 soles loan respectively to buy rice, oil, tracksuits for kids, and wool in different colours.

They dream about buying land, having a stable store, and providing education to their children so that they can be professionals.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, tracksuits for kids, and wool in different colours

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth E. is married and has 5 children. She has never received schooling. Elizabeth sells groceries, sauce pans, and ladies' wear in Cape Coast, which she has done since 2006. Her husband is a librarian.

Elizabeth uses her income to help her husband pay for their children's education. Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase more stock for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to help her husband in putting up a family house.

loans.use: to purchase more sauce pans and ladies' wear for re-sale

loans.name: Nueva Luz Group

texts.es:
Para la formación del comité fue la señora Leonarda O., casada, madre de 3 hijos, se dedica a la venta de Ropa Interior, ella vive en la zona del Km 10 Monday de C.D.E. La señora Leonarda contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité de dicha zona. El comité está constituido por 16 señoras muy activas, son de la misma zona. Ellas tienen actividades diferentes como ser: venta de pantalones, camisas, azúcar, leche productos de limpieza, cadenas, pulseras, hortalizas, huevo, queso y otras que emprenderán una nueva labor y cuentan con un ingreso semanal o mensual.

1.Leonarda O. _ Venta de Ropa 2.Isabel T.– Despensa 3.Emilia Cabaña_Venta de Ropa 4.Carmen Sanchez_ Venta de Copetín 5.Julia Acuña_ Venta de Ropa 6.Edelmira Franco_ Venta de Ropa 7.Magdalena Villaverde_Venta de Verduras 8.Laura Romero_Venta de Comida 9.Deolinda Almada_Venta de Bijouterie 10.Martina Gómez_ Venta de Comidas Típicas 11.Vicenta Almeida_Venta de Comida 12.Tereza Lopez_Venta de Ropa 13.Nilda Saldivar_Venta de Frutas 14.Liz Godoy_Ventas de Frutas y Verduras 15.Maria S. _ Venta de Cosméticos 16.Fermina Osorio_ Venta de Frutas

Las señoras retiran un crédito de 300.000 C/U. El crédito destinaran a la compra de mercaderías y artículo de primera necesidad para su posterior venta.
texts.en:
This group was formed by Leonarda O. who is married and has three children. She dedicates herself to the sale of under garments and lives in the neighborhood Km 10 Monday of C.D.E. Leonarda contacted her friends and neighbors to form this neighborhood group. The group is made up of 16 very active women from the neighborhood. They all have different businesses such as: selling pants, shirts, sugar, milk, cleaning products, jewelry, eggs, cheese and other new businesses. They rely on a weekly or monthly income.

1.Leonarda O. - Sale of Clothing 2.Isabel T. - Sale of Groceries 3.Emilia C. - Sale of Clothing 4.Carmen S. - Sale of Aperitifs 5.Julia A. - Sale of Clothing 6.Edelmira F. - Sale of Clothing 7.Magdalena V. - Sale of Vegetables 8.Laura R. - Sale of Food 9.Deolinda A. - Sale of Jewelry 10.Martina Gómez - Sale of Food 11.Vicenta A. - Sale of Food 12.Tereza L. - Sale of Clothing 13.Nilda S. - Sale of Fruits 14.Liz G. - Sale of Fruits and Vegetables 15.Maria S. - Sale of Cosmetics 16.Fermina O. - Sale of Fruits

The loan will be used to purchase merchandise and necessary items for resale.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing, cosmetics, groceries, fruits, vegetables and other necessary items for resale.

loans.name: Chhorvy

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhorvy V., 30, is a grocery seller working from her house in the Roung Kou Village, Kompong Cham Province, and earning around $5 per day. Normally, Chhorvy buys groceries from her suppliers in town and sells to customers in her village. She has only one son, who is a student in primary school. Her husband, Mr. Houy Khun, 35, is a rice farmer and earns about $2 per day.

For another source of income, Chhorvy now asks for a loan of $1,200 in order to purchase a grinding machine to make "crack cake" for sale and to purchase more grocery inventory. Chhorvy hopes that the loan will improve her family’s living conditions. For her future plan, she wants her son to be a doctor or a businessman.

loans.use: To purchase a grinding machine to make "crack cake" for sale and to purchase more grocery inventory

loans.name: Nhor

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhor S. is a villager in Doun Pen Village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a farmer who earns a little revenue by cultivating rice on her small piece of land. Her husband, Mr. Thoeung Thean, is a recyclable materials collector who uses the money to purchase empty bottles, cans, plastic, etc. to sell to a recycling factory for an income. Since this business is going well, he wants to expand it; so his wife decided to ask for a loan to buy more recycling wastes to sell.

Mrs. Nhor S. is 39 years old and the mother of four children. One child is employed in a garment factory while two others are enrolled in the local school. The youngest child is only four years old. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more recycling wastes to sell.

loans.name: Marcia Argentina

texts.es:
La señora Marcia Argentina M. originaria de la ciudad de León se dedica a su negocio de venta de ropa usada en el mercado la Estación iniciando su actividad desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana todos los días hasta el atardecer.

Atiende a sus clientes en su propio establecimiento donde ofrece todo tipo de ropa como lo es camisas, pantalones, blusas, etc. Hoy en día ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito que le permita la compra de la ropa para comercializarla es por esta razón que espera que su crédito sea otorgado para continuar con su negocio en el mercado.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marcia Argentina Martinez, native of the city of Leon, works selling used clothes in the La Estacion Market. She works each day from early in the morning until dusk. She serves clients in her own establishment, where she offers a variety of clothing such as shirts, pants, blouses, etc. She has now come to Kiva partner Ceprodel for a loan which will allow her to buy clothing for resale, and she hopes this loan will be granted so that she can continue her business in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.es: Lucinda tiene 51 años, vive con su esposo y sus 6 hijos. Desde su juventud se ha dedicado al comercio, y en todo este tiempo ha notado que le resultó un negocio muy gratificante, por ello siempre ha persistido en ello. Entras las actividades que ha realizado, que fueron diversas, está la venta de pan que ella misma elaboraba, pero por el alza del precio de la harina tuvo que cerrar, en otra ocasión vendió abarrotes, en lo que sigue adelante, y ahora planifica dedicarse a la venta de comida de manera ambulante. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo en MFP, por lo que se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos y a participar activamente en el banco comunal al que pertenece. Lucinda está usará este dinero para la compra de platos y demás implementos para comenzar con su negocio de venta de comida, los platos están valorizados en 23 soles la docena, ella comprará docena y media y con el dinero que resta adquirirá los ingredientes necesarios para las comidas que va a preparar (arroz, azúcar, menestras).
texts.en:
Lucinda is 51 years old. She lives with her husband and her six children. She has been in business since her youth and in all this time she has found that business is very gratifying and for this reason has continued in the world of commerce. She has had a number of diverse businesses such as selling bread she herself had made, but the cost of flour has risen too high and she had to close the business. She has also sold groceries, a business which she still has and is now planning to become a street vendor, selling food. This is her first loan with MFP; she is committed to being punctual in her payments and to participating actively in the community bank of which she is a member. Lucinda will use the loan monies to buy plates and other implements to open her food sales business. The plates cost 23 soles a dozen, and she will buy a dozen and a half. With the remaining monies, she will buy the ingredients she needs, such as rice, sugar, vegetable stew, for the dishes she will prepare.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy utensils and ingredients to start a food-sales business.

loans.name: María Estela

texts.es:
La señora María Estela O. se dedica a atender su tienda de venta de productos personales que posee desde hace 20 años en el mercado central de Chinandega.

Como todo negocio, sus inicios fueron muy duros pero gracias a su dedicación al trabajo ha logrado salir adelante y es por esta razón que espera en que Ceprodel le brinde el apoyo crediticio para la compra de mercadería con el objetivo de ofertarla y mejorar sus condiciones. Su negocio se ha venido desarrollando gracias al apoyo de Ceprodel  y es por este motivo que hoy en día continúa esforzándose grandemente.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Estela O. sells personal products at her store, which she has owned for 20 years in the Central Market of Chinandega. As in all business, her early beginnings were difficult but thanks to her dedication to her work she has succeeded. She hopes to receive a loan from Ceprodel to buy merchandise to sell and improve her living conditions. Her business has developed thanks to support from Ceprodel and this is the reason she continues to work untiringly.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Mukaram

texts.ru:
Бобоева Мукарам  1977 года рождения, замужем имеет 3 детей. Она торгует на рынке «Корвон» города Душанбе, материалами по пошиву национальной одежды. Мукарам закупает товар на оптовом рынке «Корвон». Благодаря разборчивости в тканях женской национальной одежды и ее 6-ти летнему опыту в этом бизнесе она завоевала доверие у многих постоянных клиентов. 
Мукарам хочет получить кредит для закупа ворсовых тканей, которые пользуются спросом в весенний период.
texts.en:
Mukaram B. was born in 1977, she is married and has 3 children. She sells fabrics for making traditional clothing at the Korvon market in Dushanbe. Thanks to her understanding of fabrics for traditional women’s clothing and her 6 years of experience in this business she has earned the trust of many regular clients. Mukaram would like to take out a loan for the purchase of velvet fabrics which are in demand during the spring season.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase velvet fabrics

loans.name: Claudia Lissette

texts.es: Claudia Lisette B. Zapata tiene la edad de 29 años, su estado civil es soletera. La Joven Lidia no tiene hijos. La actividad económica de Claudia es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 11 años que se dedica a este negocio. Claudia da inicio principalmente por que necesitaba cubrir los gastos de su hogar. Actualmente ella posee 2 trabajos labora como agente de ventas en una casa comercial y los fines de semana ofrece los productos de cosméticos. Los propósitos de Claudia son de invertir en nuevos productos para atraer la atención de sus clientes. Es por eso que decide visitar Fundación León 2000 para solicitar un financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo ya que así podrá comprar productos como lápiz labial, sombra, rubor y nuevos perfumes. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 6.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Claudia Lisette B. Zapata is 29 years old, and single. This young fighter has no children. Her main work is the sale of cosmetics, which she has dedicated herself to for more than 11 years. She began this work mainly because she needed to cover the expenses of her household expenses. She currently has two jobs: she works as a sales agent for a commercial firm and on weekends, she sells her cosmetic products.

Claudia intends to invest in new products to attract customer's attention. That's why she decided to visit Fundación León 2000 to request financing to be used as capital in her work. That way, she will be able to purchase products like lipstick, eyeshadow, blush, and new perfumes. She is asking for $300.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase new products for resale

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Al señor Alejandro S. tiene poco que le entregaron su casa por medio de un crédito gubernamental. Pero le está haciendo falta las protecciones en las ventanas y puertas, portal motivo está solicitando un préstamo para poder pagar las protecciones y así su familia va estar mas segura cundo el se encuentre trabajando.
texts.en:
Mr. Alejandro S. has a little that was given to him to put into his house through a government loan. But he is lacking gates for his windows and doors. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to be able to pay for the gates and as such his family will be more secure when he finds work.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Put gates on the windows and doors of the house

loans.name: Aissatou Dite Fatou

texts.fr:
Madame Aissatou Dite Fatou N. a commencé le commerce il y a quatre ans.  Son activité consiste à vendre des crèmes et du thiouray (l’insence).  Elle veut se lancer aussi dans le commerce de poissons secs, d’huile de palme, et du miel.  Avec ce crédit elle va acheter ses nouveaux produits et diversifier son commerce.  Elle a l’âge de 39 ans et elle est mariée.  Elle habite à Thiès avec son mari et ses enfants, et avec les revenus de son entreprise elle paye les dépenses de la famille.  
Madame N. sollicite un produit spécial de l’IMCEC.  Le produit s’appelle Kiva Program de Développement de l’Enfant et de la Famille (PDEF), et il sert à aider les parents des enfants pauvres qui sont dans le projet de Christian Children’s Fund, un partenaire de l’IMCEC.  Les clients profitent d’un taux d’intérêt diminué.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aissatou (called Fatou) N. started out in business 4 years ago. She sells cremes and incense. She would like to expand into selling dried fish, palm oil, and honey. With this loan she intends to buy these new products and diversify her business. Mrs. N. is 39 and married. She lives in Thiès wih her husband and children, and with the income from her business, she pays family expenses.

Mrs. N. is requesting a special service from IMCEC. This service is called Kiva Development Program for Children and Families (in French: PDEF) and it serves to help the parents of poor children who are members of the Christian Children's Fund project, a partner of IMCEC. These clients are able to take advantage of a lower interest rate.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of dried fish, palm oil and honey for re-sale

loans.name: Teopista's Group

texts.en:
Teopista K., 50, is a friendly and hard-working lady who has been selling produce from Kabweza Kako Trading Centre since 1974. Purchasing her produce from local farmers and selling from her stall, she is happy with her business but at times faces challenges such as the change in seasons and increased transportation costs which ultimately force her to increase the price of her produce. She is grateful that her customers stand by her throughout these difficulties, an indication of the good relationship she has with them.

Teopista is the married mother of six children, two in secondary school and the rest at the University, each also working part-time. She is now requesting a loan to purchase more produce to increase her earnings. Receiving loans has improved her life and business since she is now able to earn monthly profits ranging from 100,000 – 150,000 shillings. She has dreams of educating all her children to the University level and completing her family house.

loans.use: Buying more produce for sale.

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.en:
Mr. Teodoro T. is 48 years old and married to Cristina Soto, who has been employed as a domestic worker for more than ten years. They have older children, and live in Pilar, in the Ytororo district. They own their own house where they have all the daily necessities.

Teodoro is a businessman, and has been doing his activity for more than seven years. He owns all the basic necessities to develop his business. For work, he travels throughout the county distributing cheese and agricultural products. The credit applied for is to purchase cheese for sale.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his business

loans.name: Nnenna

texts.en: Nnenna, a 34-year-old widow whose life has not been too easy as she takes care of herself and her three children alone, sells drinks in retail to her customers.  Nnenna hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Sebastiana Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Sebastiana del Carmen Sánchez García , tiene la edad de 38 años , habita en el barrio pilas Orientales , ubicado en la cuidad de Masaya , junto a su compañero de vida , ellos tienen tres hijos , el mayor ya está casado y el de 18 y 13 años estudia actualmente y le poyan con los trabajos agrícolas , los planes hacia su familia es poder apoyar siempre a sus hijos en sus estudios , doña Sebastiana desde 15 años se dedica a la agricultura , ella inicio esta actividad con  ayuda de su esposo , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta son las plagas  que espera poder fumigar,  Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para aplicar al cultivo y poder tener una buena cosecha, para vender a buen precio al mercado y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Sebastiana del Carmen Sánchez Garcia is 38 years old. She lives in the Pilas Orientales neighborhood, in the city of Masaya, with her spouse. They have three children, the oldest of whom is married. The other two children, who are 18 and 13 years old, are currently studying and also help with the farm work. The Garcias' plans for their family are to always be able to support their children in their studies. Ms. Sebastiana has worked in agriculture for 15 years. She started this work with the help of her husband. The greatest difficulties that they face are the plagues, which she hopes to be able to fumigate. With this loan, she will buy fertilizers and other inputs that she will apply to her crop so that she can have a good harvest, that she can sell for a good price at the market and earn greater profits.

Translated from Spanish by Leah Karlins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for her crops

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia B. is married and has two children. She has no educational background. Her husband is a mason.

Patricia sells salt at Eno near Elmina, which she has done since 2006. Patricia uses her income to pay her family’s utility bills.

Patricia will use the loan to purchase more salt to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to reinvest in her business and also to save the rest.

loans.use: To purchase more salt to sell

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea C. is 24 years old and resides in Kampong Chhnang Province, about 90 kms from the capital, Phnom Penh, along National Road Number 5, around the area of the Tunle Sap River. She and her husband have two kids who currently live with them.

Chea C. earns a living by making bamboo baskets for sale. Most of her valuable clients need to order a few days or a week in advance. She also buys baskets from other handicraft weavers to better satisfy her customer’s requirements. In this business, her husband assists her in weaving baskets and buying raw materials.

Chea C. will be using the Kiva loan to buy more bamboo in order to continue making baskets for sale.

loans.use: To buy more bamboo in order to continue making baskets for sale

loans.name: Dios De Salvación Group

texts.es:
El grupo Dios de Salvación es originario de la Comarca las flores, está a unos kilómetros de la ciudad de Masaya, y pues se caracterizan como grupo por trabajar en la compra de frutas y verduras en zonas aledañas, a pequeños productores y luego las venden en los diferentes mercados del país.

Katy S. es la coordinadora del grupo Dios de Salvación, a sus 23 años,  ha aprendido de su familia el negocio de la compra y venta de frutas y verduras. Dado que la zona es especial para ese tipo de negocios, ha podido aprender con facilidad el oficio y sacar el máximo provecho de éste.

Su crédito lo invertirá en productos de la temporada como lo son el mamón, el nancite entre otros. Fidelina Del Carmen C. 34 años y Meyling del Carmen G. C. 22 años también trabajan en el mismo tipo de negocio y forman parte del grupo. Las tres distribuyen en diferentes zonas del país.

loans.use: Compra de productos de temporada

loans.name: Esao Andiva

texts.en:
Esao M. is 32 years-old and married to Judith. They have been blessed with seven children. Esao cooks cakes and sells them to customers along Seregeya market centre in Eldoret Town.

Esao was introduced to Kiva partner KADET by an existing member. He has applied for a loan which he intends to use to add more stock, such as unga (flour) and cooking oil, to his business. He wants to maximise his profits by cooking more cakes instead of buying them from wholesalers.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase more cooking supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase shop items for her business

loans.name: Nazren Group

texts.en:
Nazren is requesting a loan for her husband, who has a general store. Ghulam Raman wants to take out a loan for a shop selling vegetables. Pari Gul wants to take out a loan for her husband, who has a shop selling fresh fruits. 

Nazren is the leader of Nazren Group. The three members of this group each want a loan for expanding their businesses. They are requesting a group loan of 42,000 afghanis. They thank Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For a general store

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Don Carlos G. tiene 54 años de edad, vive en Laureles norte, es soldador desde hace diez años el cual inicio con fondos propios, viudo y con siete hijos mayores de edad,  los cuales le apoyan, la dificultad es que el trabajo a veces no le llega, y el dinero se escasea los cuales sus objetivo se no proyectan, debido a las crisis económica que esta pasando nuestro país, lo cual viene a desmejorar la economía, los precios de la canasta básica ha incrementado  y a veces el pan de cada día se hace difícil. Con este préstamo desea comprar materiales de construcción para hacer un muro lateral de su casa ya que en el barrio hay mucha delincuencia lo cual uno vive ala expectativa de ellos ya que con mucho sacrificio uno tiene sus cosas y de la nada se la roban. Es por eso la necesidad de cerrar su casa. Agradece a la institución por la oportunidad de poder hacer posible sus metas.
texts.en:
Mr. Carlos G. is 54 years-old and lives in northern Laureles. Carlos has been working as a welder for 10 years, a business he started with his own funds. He is a widow and has seven adult children who support him. The difficult part of this business is that sometimes there is no work and money becomes scarce, making it difficult to carry out plans. Due to the economic crisis that is happening in our country, that is hurting the economy, the prices of basic groceries have increased and sometimes it is even difficult to put bread on the table. With this loan Carlos would buy construction materials to build a side wall on his house because there is a lot of crime in the neighborhood and it is necessary to take precautions. Sometimes one can sacrifice a lot to earn their possessions and then out of nowhere they are stolen. For this reason it is necessary to close off the side of the house. Carlos is grateful to the institution for giving him the opportunity to make his goals possible.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of stone, cement, iron, and sand to make a side wall on a house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy locks of hair for weaving

loans.name: Julia Liliana

texts.es:
JULIA LILIANA

Soy madre de dos hijos, casada y mi edad es 42 años. Hace más de 3 años que trabajo como microempresaria lo hice por necesidad para apoyar a mi esposo en los gastos de nuestra familia. Antes de tener mi negocio de comida rápida ambulatoria tuve que trabajar vendiendo pan y galletas los fines de semana en los pueblos de la sierra, aprovechaba mi viaje para traer los pedidos que me hacían de queso y tubérculos. Así mismo expendía caldo de gallina en el mercado de Chosica y los ingresos eran para mi hogar, lo dejé posteriormente debido a que estaba descuidando a mis hijos. Entonces aproveché más tarde a vender fuera de mi casa hamburguesas con el carrito sandwichera que me prestó mi hermana, a decir verdad al principio las pocos platos que hacía de alitas fritas y hamburguesas no lo vendía por completo, lo que sobraba lo teníamos que comer, no desistí en vender sabía que con paciencia y perseverancia esto iba a mejorar; así fue con el tiempo mi clientela aumentó.
