Actualmente tengo mi propio carrito que lo obtuve de los préstamos que me hice, compré mercadería de insumos para este negocio, tasas, platos. Recientemente acondicioné un espacio de mi casa para colocar una mesita e instalé una puerta enrolladora. Quiero comprar dos mesitas con sus sillas que me hacen falta; por ello requiero del préstamo además de surtirlo con bebidas e insumos (platos y cubiertos descartables, panes, cremas, hamburguesas, lechuga, pollo) Utilizo la ganancia en apoyar a mi hijo en sus estudios ya que muy pronto egresará y necesitará de un capital para obtener el título en mecánica automotriz; del mismo modo me responsabilizo con algunos servicios básicos y alimentación.
texts.en:
JULIA LILIANA I am a married mother of two. I am 42 years old. For three years I have worked as a small businesswoman. I began out of necessity--to help my husband with household costs. Before having my business selling food to-go I had to work selling bread and cookies every weekend in the hill towns. I took advantage of my trips by bringing their orders of cheese and potatoes. Likewise, I sold chicken soup en the Chosica market, and the profit made went to household costs. I later left the job because it didn't give me enough time to take care of my children. Later I took advantage of selling hamburgers outside my home with the sandwich cart my sister lent me. To tell the truth, I didn't sell all the plates of chicken wigs and hamburgers I made in the beginning. What was left over we had to eat. I didn't stop selling because I knew with patience and perseverance that it would start to get better. With time, my number of customers grew. Recently, I fixed up a space in my house to put a little table. I installed a rolling door. I want to buy two more little tables and chairs. To buy them, I need a loan. I will also use the loan to stock up on drinks and other supplies (disposable plates and silverware, bread, sauces, hamburgers, lettuce, chicken). I will use the profits to support my son in his studies. He is graduating high school very soon and will need the money to get a degree in automobile mechanics. At the same time, I am responsible for basic services and foods.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying tables, chairs, silverware

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly P. lives in the village of San Jose, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 53 years old, married and has one adult-aged child. She makes a living by running a sari-sari (or variety) retail store where she sells a range of different products to people in her local community. She has been engaged in her business for more than four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from her work.

In 2008, Milly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid two loans for 7,000 PHP each from HSPFI. Milly has applied for a new loan of 8,000 PHP to buy new items to sell and expand her product offerings. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to improve her family's living conditions. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy new items to sell

loans.name: Julius Mwangi

texts.en:
Julius is 44 years old, married to Nancy they have two sons and two daughters aged 20, 17, 12 and 10 years old respectively.  Julius does transportation services with his pick-up. 

Julius was introduced to Kadet by an existing client. He has applied for a loan which he plans to use to service his pick-up so that it does not delay his business. 

He intends to buy a bigger vehicle like a lorry for transport in future so that he can be able to transport more goods for his clients. He describes himself as a hardworking businessman.

loans.use: To service his pick-up which he uses for transport business.

loans.name: Golondrinas Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Golondrinas está integrado por tres mujeres muy trabajadoras y esforzadas.  Carolina de los Ángeles P. es una de ellas la cual en sus inicios  comercializaba cosméticos de la marca Avon actualmente además de ello puso una pequeña venta donde comercializa desde granos básicos, papelería, productos de belleza entre otros.

Yamileth de los Ángeles C. comenzó con una pequeña venta de chiverias y refresco con el tiempo y las inversiones la ido surtiendo hasta convertirla en una mini pulpería donde encontraran de todo.  

Rebeca del Rosario D. hacha tortillas en un comienzo era poco pero con los prestamos lo ha ido mejorando actualmente ella invertirá el préstamo para agrandar el fogón  y así hacer más tortillas.
texts.en:
The "Golondrinas" [Swallows] group is made up of three very hard-working women. Carolina de los Ángeles P. is one of them. She started selling Avon cosmetics and now she also has a small business selling basic grains, office supplies, beauty products, and more. Yamileth de los Ángeles C. started by selling snacks and soft drinks, and with time and investments, she has grown her business into a small general store where her customers can find everything. Rebeca del Rosario D. started by selling tortillas, and with her loans, she has improved her business. Now she will invest her loan in expanding her stove so she can make more tortillas.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains, meat, vegetables, spices, office supplies, cosmetics, creams, soap, etc.

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Dora is forty years old. She is married with three children. All children are in school. Dora lives with her family in a rented apartment.  

Dora is a hair dresser. She does both plaiting and perming. She graduated from the apprenticeship training fifteen years ago and has since trained ten young ladies in hair dressing who have started their own businesses. She has her saloon on one of the principal street of her town and business is mostly brisk on weekends when most women style their hair for many occasions.  Dora is requesting for a loan to enable buy assorted hair creams, weavons, shampoo, etc to improve her services to her customers. She hopes to increase her income to enable her save more to support her children education.

loans.use: To purchase assorted hair creams.

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es: La señora Maricela B. es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, ella es propietaria de unos locales, los cuales tiene rentados a diferentes negocio de gran importancia dentro de nuestra ciudad. Ella esta tramitando este crédito para la colocación de poliuretano a su hogar para mayor confortabilidad.
texts.en:
Señora Maricela B. is a very responsible and hard-working person. She is proprietress of several business locations that are rented to various businesses important to our city. She is undertaking this loan to lay polyurethane in her home for greater comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installation of polyurethane

loans.name: María Ángelica

texts.es: María Angélica J. L. es una mujer trabajadora que apoya a su esposo con los gastos; es por ello que opto por poner un negocio para atender a su familia y no estar fuera de casa. Angélica tiene su casa y es amplia solo que desde que puso el negocio se tuvo que reducir para ponerlo en un cuarto.  Es madre de 2 hijos pequeños que desea darle una mejor calidad de vida, confort y un patrimonio. Es el motivo que la lleva a pensar en construir e la planta alta de su casa para que cada de sus hijos tenga su cuarto para que tengan su propio espacio cuando ya sean unos adolescentes.
texts.en:
María Angélica J. L. is a hard-working woman who helps her husband meet household expenses. To do this, she chose to set up a home-based business in order not to neglect her children. Angélica has her home and it's spacious. However, once she installed the business in a bedroom, she gave up some living space. She has two small children and would like to provide them with a better quality of life, more comfort and equity for the future. For this reason she has thought of building a second storey on her house so that each child can have a bedroomroom and their own space when they become teenagers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Fabiola Del Monserrate

texts.es:
Fabiola Rodríguez de 52 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Es divorciada pero tiene 3 hijos que ya se han independizado. 

Fabiola comenzó con una pequeña tienda vendiendo chicles, snack y confites. Poco a poco incremento su tienda con papelería. En la actualidad ella tiene una papelería pequeña no muy surtida pero con cosas dispensables. También vende bebidas y confites para sus clientes. Algunas veces cuando no tiene suficiente dinero tiene que realizar costuras de ropa a sus vecinas. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, carpetas, plumas para la temporada escolar ( en abril hasta diciembre tiene clases las escuelas y colegios). En el futuro quiere poner rejas a su local para más seguridad y vender también helado.
texts.en:
Fabiola is 52 years old and lives in the suburbs of Guayaquil. She lives in a cement home with all basic services. She is divorced and has three adult children. Fabiola started a small store where she sold gum, snacks, and candy. Little by little she began adding paper goods. Now she has a small stationary shop. It doesn't have much variety, but includes some necessary items. She also sells drinks and confectionary items to her customers. At times, she also needs to do some sewing for her neighbors when she needs extra money. She wants to use the money from this loan to buy notebooks, writing pads, and pens for the school year. (Classes run from April to December.) In the future she would like to put a fence up around her home to improve its security. She would also like to sell ice cream.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Notebooks, writing pads, pens for resale

loans.name: Agnes Baluyot's Group

texts.en: "Do your best and God will do the rest," Agnes says. Agnes B. owns and operates a retail store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in her community. She is 44 years old, married and has four school-age children. They are from the village of Sta. Maria Buguey, Cagayan. Agnes has been in her business for over one year and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Agnes joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Agnes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Agnes is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her second loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family. Agnes is the leader of a 9 member group accessing a loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es: Elisa tiene 26 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Jesús de 26 años, que es agricultor y de su hijo menor de edad. Cuando era pequeña aprendió las técnicas agrícolas necesarias, hoy siembra habas y alverjas, junto a su esposo. Según manifiesta, le gusta mucho la labor agrícola pues con las ganancias que obtiene de la cosecha, puede brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos. Cada día junto a su esposo se levanta al amanecer para empezar  a cuidar sus cultivos que se encuentran lejos de su casa. De esta manera los vigila a diario, contra las plagas y los factores climáticos que muchas veces son adversos para la buena producción, eso es lo arriesgado de la agricultura. Sabe que el esfuerzo se ve recompensado cuando vende su producción a los mayoristas. En adelante tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad y variar un poco en la producción sembrada. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, manifiesta que será puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, pues quiere seguir trabajando con su grupo de manera responsable. Elisa tiene pensado invertir el crédito, en la compra de semillas de habas y alverjas, además de insecticidas que necesita para asegurar su siembra.
texts.en:
Elisa is 26 years old and lives with her husband Jesús, who is 26 and a farmer, and her young son in their own house. When she was young she learned basic farming skills and today she and her husband plant broad beans and peas. She says she likes farming very much because with earnings from the harvest she can provide for her children. Each day she and her husband get up at dawn to begin caring for their crops, which are located far from their house. She checks on them daily for pests and weather factors which often are unfavorable and put the crops at risk for a good harvest. She knows that these efforts will be rewarded when she sells her harvest to the wholesalers. In the future she plans to plant a greater amount and variety. This is her second loan with MFP and she says she will be on time with her repayments as she wants to keep working with her group in a responsible way. She plans to use the loan to buy seeds for broad beans and peas as well as insecticides which she will need to take care of her crop

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds for broad beans and peas and insecticides to protect her crops.

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irine is 21 years old and married, with a 2-year-old child. She is a farmer from the town of Kitale in Western Kenya. She has been farming for 3 years with only one employee. Her main products are vegetables, maize and cereals, which she sells to the local market. She also earns income from selling milk and beans to the market.

She has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for KES 31,200 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This loan will help her expand her business since she will earn enough income from the sale of milk, which will reduce her dependency on her husband's salary as it is at the moment. Her main challenges are fluctuations in the prices of cereals and the financial constraints to acquire a productive dairy cow. She intends to acquire more land to accommodate her dairy farming. Her desire is to purchase a piece of land where she will sell her produce.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Rowena M. is from the village of Gosi Sur, Tuguegarao City. She is 35 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Rowena owns and operates a business raising pigs for breeding. She is just starting this business. Rowena joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be her first from ASKI. Rowena plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: God Knows Group

texts.en:
Evelyn T., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called God Knows. She is 41 years old, married, and has four children who range from 6 to 21 years old. She was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to poverty but all of her children are attending school.

For seven years, Evelyn has been selling sugar, milk, coffee, bread, other provisions and water at the Neezoe Market, Paynesville, outside of Monrovia, Liberia.

Evelyn plans to use her 10,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 50,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more sugar, milk, coffee, bread, and other provisions. She describes herself as a friendly person.

Evelyn’s plan is to improve her business and build a bigger shop.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, milk, coffee, bread, and other provisions

loans.name: Maria Del Transito

texts.es: La señora Maria tiene un negocio que es una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, realiza sus compras de contado en Managua y a camiones repartidores, ella compra la mayoría de sus productos en el mercado ya que los precios son más favorables y le generan más ingresos. Sus ventas las efectúa de contado y al crédito. Esta solicitando un nuevo financiamiento para invertirlo en su negocio y hacerlo más productivo, la señora cuenta con los servicios básicos.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria has a grocery store business located in her home. She purchases her goods in Managua with cash, from delivery trucks, and mostly from markets since the prices there are better and generate more revenue. Her sales are made in cash and with credit. She is applying for a new loan to invest in her business to make it more productive and for basic needs.

Translated from Spanish by Susanna Sabahi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Omeka

texts.en:
Omeka N. is 53 and married with 5 children (ages 6 - 25).  She owns a business venture, selling cooked food such as soup, cooked taro, yams, and  esi soup (hearty papaya soup).  Omeka has 3 years of experience in this business.  Omeka needs a loan of WST$1500 to buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Omeka joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.  SPBD's loans are Omeka's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375"

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Ines

texts.es: Inés tiene 38 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Dese hace 3 años, se dedica a la preparación de comida, entre las más solicitadas son: seco a la huachana, ají de gallina, arroz con pollo, tallarín verde y salsa de carne, que son platillos peruanos. Atiende en su casa y a la vez reparte a los diversos puntos aledaños donde vive. Sus clientes son los comerciantes del mercado, que trabajan frente a su casa  y demás personas que transitan cerca. En un inicio su trabajo era  muy agotador; hoy en día le ayuda otra persona a quien le paga diario. Inés, esta  satisfecha por el trabajo que desempeña y lo rentable que le resulta. Para más adelante piensa ampliar su negocio y renovar la infraestructura de su casa. Es el dieciseisavo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y sabe que le es de mucha utilidad para aumentar el capital de su negocio, por lo que se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo. Inés tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de calaminas y cementos, de ese modo cambiar el techo de su cocina, y evitar ser afectada por temporada de invierno.
texts.en:
Inés is 38 years old and is a very hard-working mother. She lives with her husband and their 3 children in their own house. For 3 years she has made a living preparing food. Among the meals she sells are: seco a la huachana [beef stew flavored with cilantro], ají de gallina [chicken with a special sauce], arroz con pollo [rice with chicken], tallarín verde [green noodles], and salsa de carne [meat with a special sauce], all of which are traditional Peruvian dishes. Inés prepares the meals in her home and then delivers them to various places near where she lives. Her customers are the merchants of the market who work in front of her house, along with people who pass through the neighborhood. In the beginning her job was very exhausting, but now she has help from another person whom she pays every day. Inés is pleased with the work she does, and it is profitable. In the future she wants to expand her business and improve her house’s infrastructure. This is Inés’s sixteenth loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she knows that it will be very helpful for increasing her business’s capital. She promises to make all of her payments on time. Inés plans to use the loan she is requesting to purchase corrugated iron and cement, which she will use to replace the roof over her kitchen, and thus avoid being affected by the winter season.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing corrugated iron and cement to improve her kitchen’s infrastructure

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.en:
Gulnara J., age 39, raises livestock in Kadamjai, a town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She started to breed livestock six years ago with an initial investment of 5,000 soms. By selling the sheep she has raised, she makes 3,000 soms per month. Her husband works in Russia and he helps her to cover family expenses. With the money received from the loan, Gulnara wants to purchase four sheep to increase her number of livestock. She will also use part of the loan to purchase building materials to start repairing her house. She has a daughter and a son, both of whom attend school. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious, and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: 
- People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), 
- Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and 
- Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). 
MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in central Asia, please join our Lending Team, "Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance," at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase four sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson K. is 40 years old, and offers transport services with a pickup in Mariakani. Jackson has been a taxi operator for four years and has been able to sustain his family with the income he gets from his business.

Jackson joined KADET LTD recently and is now accessing his first loan. With the money, Jackson plans to renew his taxi licence and do some minor repairs to the taxi in order to bring it back to proper working condition. He is able to currently get a monthly income of Ksh. 47,000 from the transport business.

Jackson hopes to expand and in future own another pickup for transport.

loans.use: To renew his taxi licence and do some minor repairs to the taxi.

loans.name: Ivania Azucena

texts.es: Ivania Azucena tiene 63 años. Su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 16 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que ha sido muy difícil pero ha logrado superar. Cuando inicio necesitaba ingresos para mantener a su familia, siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una persona responsable y que disfruta de su trabajo, sus dos hijos le ayudan en lo que pueden porque saben el sacrificio que ella realiza para proporcionarles lo necesario  este financiamiento es para la compra de mercadería variada y que necesita para ofrecerle a sus clientes. Desea incrementar su inventario y mejorar las condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Ivania Azucena is 63 years old and has been selling general merchandise for 16 years.  It’s been very difficult for her, but she’s managed to be successful.  When she began, she needed an income to support her family.  She has always been known for being responsible and she enjoys her work.  Her two children help as much as they can, because they are aware of the sacrifices that she makes to provide for their needs.  She will use the money from this loan to buy a variety of merchandise that she needs in order to offer it to her customers.  She wants to increase her inventory and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
Alba Luz es una mujer  de 59 años,  madre de tres hijos  mayores de edad que vive en el barrio ciudadela 20 de Julio,  donde se conjugan los negocios, construcciones  multifamiliares y los escenarios deportivos mas importantes del  país,  como el Estadio Metropolitano de Barranquilla cuna del futbol Costeño.
  Alba Luz es una docente  que en su afán de crear alternativas emprendedoras, inició su  negocio de vender mercancía,  al principio dirigido al gremio de profesores, pero gradualmente se ha extendido a otros clientes entre vecinos, amigos y familiares que van refiriéndole nuevos mercados.  Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y planea invertirlo en la línea de perfumes y cosméticos, que son los productos que repuntan en las ventas especialmente a final de año, cuando la gente se prepara para engalanarse es  las fiestas familiares, grados escolares, universitarios etc. 
Con este nuevo préstamo aspira  a aumentar su capital de trabajo y lograr la recuperación de sus cuentas por cobrar mas ágilmente, pues en esta temporada hay mucho dinero circulante y ella puede pedir una cuota inicial. Leopoldina  Inició su negocio en el año 1997 y desde entonces ha visto crecer sus ingresos y logrado más oportunidades de apoyo a sus hijos.  Hoy en día su aspiración es ampliarlo inyectando cada vez que pueda,  capital de trabajo y buscando nuevos  clientes, pero sobre todo  sosteniendo los rentables ofreciéndole un servicio efectivo.
texts.en:
Alba Luz is a 59-year-old woman. She is the mother of three older children and lives in the Ciudadela 20 de Julio neighborhood where businesses, multi-family housing constructions and the most important sports venues such as the Estado Metropolitano de Barranquilla, the cradle of costal soccer, are combined.

Alba Luz is a teacher who, in her desire to create enterprising alternatives, began her business in selling merchandise. In the beginning, it was directed toward the teachers’ association, but it has gradually been extended to include other customers like neighbors, friends and relatives, who refer her to new markets. This is her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she plans to invest it in a line of perfumes and cosmetics, which are the products that pick up in sales, especially at the end of the year when people get dressed up for family, school, and university parties, etc.

With this new loan, she hopes to increase her working capital and be able to recover her accounts by charging more quickly, as there is a lot of money in circulation during this season and she can request an initial payment. Alba Luz started her business in 1997 and since then, she has seen her income grow and has been able to obtain more opportunities to support her children. Today, her hope is to expand her business, adding working capital whenever she can, looking for new clients, and most of all, keeping it profitable and providing and effective service.

loans.use: To invest it in a line of perfumes and cosmetics, which are the products that pick up in sales at the end of the year.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a consignment of drugs

loans.name: Krestellyn

texts.en:
Krestellyn V. is 24-year-old single woman who supports herself by operating a sari-sari (variety) store business. She lives in Purok 1, Barangay 3, Roxas, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her store, she is gradually making her life more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of $494. 

Krestellyn is borrowing 17,000 PHP so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 11th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 15,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Krestellyn hopes to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned their respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Gorret

texts.en:
Gorret N. is 17 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda.  She is single and has one child.  Her child is not currently in school.  Gorret has a business of outside catering, which she has had for 2 years.         

To help expand her business, Gorret has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase cooking oil and flour.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Gorret hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself and her child.  In the future, Gorret hopes to own a shop.   

Gorret is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to use money wisely.

loans.use: cooking oil, flour

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.en:
Consuelo S. is from the village of Sto. Niño. She is 55 years old. Consuelo is married and has 8 adult children. To make a living, Consuelo owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting corn for sale. Consuelo has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Consuelo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Consuelo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Consuelo is requesting a new loan of 32000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Consuelo from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 43 años, convive con Luis, de 55 años. Ambos tienen 6 hijos, pero solo vive con tres de ellos: Martín, de 16, Rosario, de 9 y Luis, de 2 años de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). La constancia y el esfuerza de está pareja, hicieron que obtengan 3 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas. María, se esfuerza mucho por mantener la unión familiar, y apoyar en el mantenimiento de sus cultivos a su esposo Luis, quien afirma que desde que consolidaron una familia, hace ya 20 años; comenzaron a sembrar café y plátanos; hasta hoy el apoyo que obtiene de ella, lo motiva, “ella es muy hábil para la venta”, asegura. María, después de cada cosecha, comercializa su fruto de plátanos en la ciudad de La Merced, pero su grano de café los vende en la cooperativa de que formaron en la comunidad de Alto Palomar, Pero como socios, María, está feliz de poder tener el apoyo constante de su esposo, juntos desean abonar y mejorar los cuidados de sus sembríos, y de esa manera incrementar su producción. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y espera que junto a los integrantes de su banco comunal, puedan salir adelante en el progreso de está asociación. Con el crédito que solicita, planea comprar varios sacos de abono orgánico que esparcirá en sus diferentes cultivos.
texts.en:
María, 43, lives with Luis, 55.  They have six children together but only three of them, Martín, 16, Rosario, 9 and Luis, 2, still live with them together as a family in their own house located in Unión Palomar (Peruvian central jungle).  The constancy and effort of this couple led to their having 3 hectares of farmland.

María works hard to keep the family together and help her husband care for the crops who states that since they formed their family 20 years ago they started planting bananas and coffee and the support he gets from her motivates him to this day.  “She is very skilled at sales,” he assures us.

María sells each banana harvest in the city of La Merced but she sells the coffee beans to the cooperative that was formed in the community of Alto Palomar.  As members, though, María is happy to have her husband’s constant support.  Together they want to fertilize and improve the care of their crops in order to increase production.

This is the first time she’s gotten a loan from MFP and she hopes that together with the members of the communal bank they will get ahead with the organization’s progress.

She will use the requested loan to buy several sacks of organic manure to spread among her various crops.

loans.use: To buy several sacks of manure.

loans.name: Andrea Cristina

texts.es:
La Señora Andrea T. es socia del banco comunal Divino niño Jesús, vive por la comunidad de Paccha, esta comunidad se caracteriza por su gente que es muy trabajadora, la mayor parte se dedica a la cría de animales, mucha de su gente laboran en la ciudad realizando diferentes actividades.

Doña Andrea tiene 20 años y vive en unión libre, tiene una hija de 7 meses de edad. Su esposo labora en la colocación de estucos y pintor de casas, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive en un cuarto pequeño que su suegra les ha prestado.

La Señora. Andrea se dedica por el momento al cuidado de su hija y ayuda a su mamá al cuidado de los animales que también son de su propiedad.

Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada por su mamá, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y también para apoyarle a su esposo a que se ponga un taller de colocación de cielos rasos. Su meta es  superarse junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Andrea T. is a member of the Divino Niño Jesús Communal Bank.  She lives in the Paccha community.  This community is characterized by its very hard-working people.  Most of them raise animals, and some of them work at different business activities in the city .

Andrea is 20 years old, and she is in a common-law marriage.  She has a seven month old daughter.  Her husband works installing stucco and painting houses.  She does not have her own house, so she lives in a small room that her mother-in-law has lent them.

Andrea currently takes care of her daughter, and she helps her mother take care of the animals that they own.

This is her second loan with the communal bank.  Her mother invited her.  She will use the new loan to buy chickens.  She will also use it to help her husband set up a workshop for putting up stucco ceilings.

Her goal is to excel together with her family.

loans.use: To buy chickens and to set up a shop for stucco ceilings

loans.name: Pauline

texts.fr: Pauline N. est commerçante.  Elle a 43 ans, elle est veuve, et elle a 8 enfants entre 8 ans et 23 ans.  Elle a une éducation primaire, et tous ses enfants vont à l’école.  Elle était née à Congo (DRC), mais maintenant elle habite à Nyabugogo à Rwanda.  Elle va utiliser son prêt pour acheter 50 sacs de pommes de terre.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’épargner, et prendre beaucoup de prêts pour être indépendante chez elle.  Elle voudrait avoir un dépôt de pommes de terre, et aussi ajouter les bananes dans son commerce.  Pour sa famille, elle voudrait acheter une maison d’habitation.
texts.en: Pauline N. is an entrepreneur. She is 43 years old, a widow, and has eight children ranging from 8 to 23 years of age. She has primary education, and all her children study. She was born in Congo (DRC), but now she lives in Nyabugogo in Rwanda. She is going to use her loan to purchase 50 bags of potatoes. Her business strategy is to save money and to keep taking out loans in order to be financially independent. She would like to have a warehouse for potatoes, and also to add bananas to her business. For her family, she would like to buy

loans.use: Purchasing potatoes for resale

loans.name: Beth

texts.en: Beth is a thirty-one year old single mother with two children living in Kyenjojo Uganda. She is a salary earner. She wants to have a good life and better education. Beth wants a loan to pay her tuition.

loans.use: Pay her tuition fees

loans.name: Mecxintle Group

texts.es: OLGA P. C. INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO MECXINTLE, (CUYO NOMBRE SIGNIFICA LUNA),RECIBIÓ SU TERCER CRÉDITO EN LA INSTITUCIÓN, EN LA CUAL ELLA ESTÁ MUY AGUSTO, DE HECHO HA REALIADO BUENOS PAGOS. EL CRÉDITO HA SIDO DE GRAN BENEFICIO YA QUE GRACIAS A ELLO A REALIZADO LA COMPRA DE MÁS MERCANCÍAS (GARRAFONES DE BARRO PARA ENFRIAR EL AGUA, COMALES PARA LA TORTILLAS CAZUELAS DE DIFERENTES TAMAÑOS, FIGURAS DECORATIVAS (SOLES). LA SEÑORA SE SIENTE MUY AGRADECIDA CON ESTE TIPO DE PPROGRAMAS POR QUE GRACIAS A ELLO HA MEJORADO LA SITUACION ECONOMICA FAMILIAR. LAS OPORTUNIDADES DE COMERCIALIZAR SU MERCANCIAS SON MAS AMPLIAS YA QUE PARA ESTAS SEMANAS SALDRÁ A AMECAMECA EDO DE MEXICO PARA IR A LA FERIA Y VENDER ALLI SUS PRODUCTOS.
texts.en: Olga P. C. is a member of the Mexintle (Moon) Group.  She has received her third loan through this institution and has been a very good loan client, always making her payments on time.  The loan has been of great benefit to her and she has been able to buy more merchandise (clay pitchers for cooling water, different sizes of comales for tortillas, and decorative sun figurines).  She is very thankful for this type of program that has helped improve her economic situation at home.  She has a lot of opportunities to sell her products and in the coming weeks will go to Amecameca in Mexico state to go the fair and sell her products.

loans.use: To buy materials for clay water pots

loans.name: Banju

texts.en:
Banju is a married man with seven children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are school fees and paraffin.

He has been operating a business for one year, selling goats to butchers on a wholesale basis. Banju faces a major challenge in the seasonal nature of his business. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 of his loan, he wants to purchase goats for resale. He decided to join Yehu in order to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase goats for resale.

loans.name: Twitezimbere Number 4 Group

texts.fr: Theogene N. est commerçant de boutique, et membre du groupe Twitezimbere no 4.  Il a 39 ans, il est marié, né au Rwanda, et il a 2 enfants entre 3 mois et 3 ans.  Il a une éducation d’école primaire, et ce crédit est son premier cycle avec ACB.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter des articles(riz, savons, haricot, l'huile,...) a revendre pour son commerce de boutique, et sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de bien accueillir les clients.  Il voudrait augmenter son chiffre d’affaire, et scolariser tous ses enfants.
texts.en: Theogene N. is a shopkeeper and member of the group Twitezimbere Number 4.  He is 39 years old, married, a native of Rwanda and has two children between the ages of 3 months and 3 years.  He has a primary school education and this loan is his first cycle with ACB.  He will use his loan for his shop and his strategy to increase business is to really welcome the customers.  He would like to increase his net revenue and educate both of his children.

loans.use: To buy rice, soap, beans, and oil to retail in his food store

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es:
El señor Feliciano F., tiene 78 años de edad, es separado, vive en  la ciudad de Caacupe, distante a unos 60 kilómetros de la ciudad capital Asunción. Tiene 4 hijos y 2 hijas, todos sus hijos  son mayores de edad e independientes.
El Señor Feliciano vive en el barrio San Blas y en su domicilio cuenta con taller y local de venta de sus productos de artesanía en cuero desde hace más de  15 años.
Por más que el señor Feliciano tenga 78 años es fuerte y sigue trabajando en la artesanía con su hijo mayor. Solicita el crédito para la compra de cuero para fabricar más y  poder cumplir con un pedido grande que tiene.
Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva porque si obtiene el crédito será de gran utilidad para su actividad ya que mediante ello podrá satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y a la vez aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Señor Feliciano F., age 78, is divorced. He lives in the city of Caacupe about 60 kilometers distant from the capital city of Asunción. He has 4 sons and 2 daughters. All his children are adults and independent.

Señor Feliciano lives in the San Blas neighborhood. For more than 15 years he has had a workshop and store in his house selling his handcrafted leather products. Although Señor Feliciano is 78 years old, he is strong and continues working leather with his oldest son.

He is applying for the loan in order to purchase leather for making more products and to be able to fulfill a big order that he has. He is thankful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva because if he obtains the loan it will be very useful for his business since it will give him the means to be able to satisfy the demand from his customers and, at the same time, increase his income.

loans.use: to purchase cured leather.

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en:
Philomena is 53 years old and married to Wesley Tai. They have three children who are 22, 19 and 13 years old.  She practices dairy farming where she supplies milk to the local residents. She has been in the business for a period of 15 years, earning a monthly income of KES. 18,000.

She has borrowed a loan of KES. 50,000 from KADET LTD. This is her fourth loan, after repaying her previous loan successfully.  She plans to use the loan to improve the farm by planting napier grass and fencing the farm.  

The profits will be used to educate her children and add more livestock on the farm. She hopes to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To plant napier grass and build a fence

loans.name: Yrma

texts.es:
Yrma de 45 años de edad, vive en casa propia sola, cuenta solamente con servicio de luz, ubicada en el caserío el Totoral a unos 10 minutos de distrito de Tambgrande  y a  40 minutos del  departamento de  Piura.  Todas esta zonas se dedica ha la actividad agricola,  ganadera y turismo.

Yrma ha implementado en su domilcilio su tienda de productos de primera necesidad (leche, azúcar, arroz, azúcar, todo tipo de golosinas, etc.) y utensilios de uso doméstico,  para seguridad y comodidad de ella y de algún modo pueda atender a cualquier hora a sus  clientes, en la cual  encuentran todo lo que necesitan para su uso diario, con el negocio que a colocado trata en lo posible de que sus clientes estén satisfechos. Otra actividad que realiza también es la crianza de algunas aves de corral, con las ventas de ambos negocios trata de tener una mejor calidad de vida.

A creido conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa adquirir un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles para abastecer su tienda de diversa mercadería (productos comestibles y utensiliosde uso doméstico) y así pueda satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, con la finalidad de incrementar  sus ingresos para pagar su préstamo y mejorar su negocio.  Yrma es concocida en su caserío por ser una persona amable, alegre y muy trabajadora, siempre con ganas salir adelante.
texts.en:
Yrma is 45 years old, and lives alone in her own home and only has electricity. It is located in the Totoral hamlet some 10 minutes from the district of Tambogrande and 40 minutes from the department of Piura. Most of the inhabitants in the area are farmers, cattle breeders and in handicrafts.

Yrma created in her home a small grocery store where she sells basic household goods (milk, sugar, rice and all types of candy, etc.) and household utensils. For her security and comfort she takes care of her customers whenever they need anything and they find everything they need for their daily use and are satisfied. Yrma also breeds certain farmyard fowl. With the sales of both businesses she tries to have a better quality of life.

Yrma went to Edpyme Alternativa to get a loan of 1500 nuevos soles to supply her store with different merchandize (foodstuff and utensils for domestic use) to meet the needs of her customers, this will help her increase her earnings to pay her loan and improve her business. Yrma is known in her town as a nice, happy and very hardworking person who always has the drive to get ahead.

loans.use: buy more merchandize to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Rondon

texts.en:
Rondon is now 33 years old and married with one infant-aged child. He is a farmer working in the Philippines who earns PHP 6,000 per month. 

Rondon is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase seeds and fertilizers for his vegetable farm. Rondon has been managing his vegetable production for almost six years.

In the future, Rondon hopes to strengthen their sources of income to give their children a better future. He believes that with the continuous support and assistance of the Kiva lenders, he can have a general store to be managed by his spouse.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for his vegetable farm

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI 2 est un regroupement  de femmes du village MORIBILA  KAFONO, qui  est composé de 10 femmes toutes mariées ayant  en moyenne 34 ans et au moins 7 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies. Leur village est situé dans la sous préfecture de Kimparana,  région de SÉGOU. 
Elles cultivent essentiellement de l’arachide. Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 4 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur quatrième  prêt de campagne.
MAWA, deuxième debout au milieu, compte utiliser son prêt actuel pour acheter, des semences d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles pour la culture,  au grand marché de Kimparana ville. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Kimparana et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe  comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 80 000 à 95 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en: Benkadi 2 is a group of women from the village of Moribila Kafono, which is made up of 10 women, who are all married, 34 years old on average with at least 7 children.  They live in large traditional families.  Their village is situated in the Kimparana sub-prefecture, a region of Segou.  For the most part, they cultivate peanuts.  With the intention of making their agricultural concerns profitable, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit program four years ago.  After having fully repaid their previous loans, they are on their fourth country loan.  Mawa, the second person standing in the center, expects to use her current loan to purchase peanut seeds, light equipment and agricultural fertilizers for cultivation at the big market in Kimparana city.  After the rainy season, the harvests are stored for a certain amount of time so that they gain value before being sold at the big market in Kimparana and at surrounding markets at retail (or often wholesale) for cash to a customer base generally coming from the big cities.  The members of the group expect to each make a profit of 80,000 to 95,000 FCFA after the harvest of their agricultural products, which will be used to pay the interest on their loans and their families' current expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and light equipment.

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.en: Lucinda lives in the Choluteca region of Honduras with her husband and two children. For the last 8 years, Lucinda has run a small convenience shop, selling basic foodstuffs and household items. She is requesting a loan of HNL 6,000 to purchase meats, cheeses, fruits, vegetables, snacks, beverages, basic grains, salt, butter, cooking oil, basic household cleaning products, and personal hygiene products for her shop. In her spare time, Lucinda enjoys attending church.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her shop

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 46-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She is living with her husband and three school-aged children. 

She has owned a candy shop since 1993. She sells large quantities of sweets, chocolates, etc, as well as baby clothes. She also works upon request of the clients who ask for special orders designed for exceptional events and occasions such as weddings, baby showers, etc. 

Today, she is asking to borrow $1300 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to strengthen her business operation by increasing her store's inventory and adding shelves to better display her merchandise. This will be her second loan and she's certain that it will allow her to further develop her business.

loans.use: to strengthen her business operation by increasing her store’s inventory and adding shelves to better display her merchandise

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angelica  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Medalla Milagrosa”, ubicado en el distrito D. Pomata, provincia D. Chucuito, departamento D. Puno, tiene 72 años D. edad, es viuda y tiene 2 hijos independientes. Estudió hasta 5to D. primaria.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace nueve años,  el préstamo anterior  D.          S/ 200.00 nuevo soles lo invirtió en su negocio D. venta D. abarrotes.  Actualmente se dedica a la compra y venta D. chanchos, mantones y colchas.
Con éste nuevo préstamo D.  S/  2000.00 nuevo soles, comprará seis chanchos, cuenta que a veces los compra regulares y pequeños para su engorD. por tres meses.  También trabaja a crédito.  
Su sueño es seguir con el negocio y mejorar sus ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo, el compañerismo y la ganancia D. sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Angelica is a member of the communal bank "Medalla Milagrosa," located in the Pomata district of Chucuito province in the department of Puno.  She is a 72 year-old widow who has 2 grown children.  She has a 5th graD. education.

Angelica has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos organization for 9 years.  Her previous loan was for 200 Peruvian soles, and she invested that money in her grocery store business.  Now she has a business buying and selling pigs, shawls and bedspreads.

With this new loan of 2,000 Peruvian soles she will buy 6 pigs.  She says that at times she buys regular and small sized pigs to fatten for 3 months.  She also works on credit.

Her dream is to continue with her business and improve her income.

What she likes most about her communal bank are the easy terms on the loans, the camaraderie amongst the members and the interest she earns on her savings.

loans.use: to buy 6 pigs

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua operates a provisions shop at Elmina. She is a widow taking care of eight children. Efua has been selling provisions for 18 years. The income she makes from her sales is used to pay school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more provisions to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: to buy more provisions to sell.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena, 56, is married, has six children and is from Maligaya Echague. For almost ten years she has owned a small, home-based sari-sari store. Her husband contributes the salary he earns as a carpenter to the household expenses.

Elena is asking for a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy inventory such as rice, sugar, oil, biscuits and soft drinks. She wants to use this loan to keep the store well-stocked and to meet customer's demands. This small loan she is requesting will help her improve her income and support her child in college.

loans.use: to buy inventory such as rice, sugar, oil, biscuits and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Genesis Noelia

texts.es: La Sra. Génesis es soltera, no tiene hijos; ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes (azúcar, arroz, aceite, fideos, etc.) con esfuerzo y ahorro pudo aperturar su tienda; ya lleva en el negocio más de 2 años. El crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abarrotes para surtir más su tienda y una congeladora; su principal sueño es terminar de construir su casa y tener una gran tienda. La Sra. Génesis está muy agradecida por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en: Génesis is single and has no children.  She sells groceries (sugar, rice, oil, beans, etc.).  With effort and savings she was able to open her store, and has been in business for over 2 years.  She will invest the loan in buying groceries to stock her store and a freezer.  Her main dream is to finish building her house and have a great store.  Génesis is very appreciative of the loan granted.

loans.use: to buy groceries and a freezer.

loans.name: Katy

texts.es: Katy tiene 41 años, es una mujer alegre y muy emprendedora, esta casada, fruto de su matrimonio nacieron tres hijos, quienes ahora tienen 16, 14, y 07 años. Juntos viven en casa de su suegra. El trabajo de Katy consiste en la costura de disfraces, debido a que es socia de dos amigas, cuyo negocio es la venta de piñatas, disfraces y animaciones. Ella realiza este trabajo en un local que es alquilado, dentro de un concurrido mercado de la ciudad. Lleva recién tres meses en este trabajo y le esta yendo bien, y junto a sus amigas están haciendo crecer este negocio. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo para estar a lado de sus amigas y puede ver su inversión de manera directa junto a las demás. Ella tiene muy buenas ganancias ya que siempre tiene clientes, pues el acabado de sus trabajo es implecable por ello tiene mayor demanda. Espera continuar con su trabajo ya que espera ampliarlo. Este será el primer préstamo que tendrá, por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes. Tiene muchas ganas de ser una socia puntual, además sabe que el grupo que conforma son muy responsables e intentará seguirles los pasos para no quedar mal ante ellas. Con el monto solicitado, lo utilizará para comprar materiales como tela de diversos colores, así como hilos, ya que al comprar al por mayor reduce costos y se genera más ganancias.
texts.en:
Katy is 41 years old.  She is a happy woman who is very entrepreneurial.  She is married, and the fruits of this marriage are her three children who are now aged 16, 14 and 7.  They live together in her mother-in-law's home.

Katy's work consists of sewing costumes, as she is in partnership with two friends.  Their business is selling piñatas, costumes, and various diversions.  She does this work in some rented premises inside a busy market in the city.  What she likes about her work is that she gets to spend time at her friends' side, and can see her investment working alongside theirs.  She has very good earnings and always has customers; the quality of her work is impeccable so it is in great demand.  She hopes to continue with her work and hopes to expand.  

This will be her first loan, and so she hopes for the support of each and every one of you.  She has much desire to be a member who is punctual in her repayments, as she knows that the women in her group are very responsible.  She intends to follow in their footsteps so that they don't think badly of her.

She will use the requested amount to buy materials such as different-colored fabrics and thread.  She will buy at wholesale to keep her costs down and generate more profits.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Walberto

texts.es: Walberto es un joven emprendedor de 22 años; vive en la casa propia de sus padres. Cuenta que comparte cuarto con su hermanos menores: Ronaldiño y Liz; aunque es muy joven se ha propuesto en apoyar  y ayudar en los gasto del hogar; ya que tiene varios hermanos. Desde niño apoyo en los trabajo agrícolas. Es por eso que desde los 15 años adquirió 3 hectáreas de terreno, donde siembra alverja, papa, olluco y habas. Su principal dificultad son sus hermanos pequeños que tiene muchas limitaciones, por eso decidió trabajar con esmero. Cada vez que tiene tiempo disfruta mucho del campo, ya que también trabaja como transportista, cubriendo la ruta Huaricolca – Acobamba, que es un lugar turístico; según cuenta obtiene una ganancia de S/. 50 soles diarios. Eso le ayuda en sus ingresos, además de comercializar sus cosechas en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Ahora tiene sembrado papa de la variedad “andina” y alverja en gran cantidad; asegura obtendrá buenas ganancias en la cosecha que será dentro de pocos días. Su mayor aspiración es poder estudiar una carrera universitaria. Él pertenece al banco comunal “San Jerónimo de Queta” y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde es un cliente muy gracioso e ingenio, que arranca la sonrisa a los demás integrantes. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Walberto, sembrará papa de la variedad “andina” por ello de recibir su apoyo. Invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir en su próximo cultivo.
texts.en: Walberto is a young entrepreneur, age 22, who lives with his parents in their own home.  He shares his room with his younger brothers: Ronaldiño and Liz.  Although he is very young he wants to support and help with the household expenses since he has several siblings.  Ever since he was a boy he has helped in the agricultural work.  When he was 15 he acquired three hectares of land where he grows peas, potatoes, olluco (a root vegetable) and lima beans.  The main difficulty he has are the limitations of his small brothers, so he decided to work hard himself.  Whenever he has time he enjoys going to the country because he also works as a transport driver and covers the route between Huaricolca - Acobamba which is a tourist spot.  He makes about 50 PEN a day.  This helps with his income.  He also sells his crops at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma.  He is now growing the "andina" potato variety and large volumes of peas.  He is sure he'll get a good profit from the harvest in a few days.  His greatest goal is to study a university degree.  He belongs to the communal bank "San Jerónimo de Queta" and this is his seventh loan through MFP.  He is a gracious and ingenious member who always makes the other members laugh.  He is committed to paying back the loan on time.  He plans to use the loan to buy natural fertilizer for the next planting season.

loans.use: To buy bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora Guadalupe tiene 41 años de edad está casada con el señor José desde hace 26 años de dicho matrimonio nacieron tres hijos, Omar de 22 años que aun está estudiando la universidad, Alicia de 18 años ya no estudia, Elizabeth de 10 años está en sexto año de primaria.

La señora Guadalupe y su esposo son comerciantes desde hace tiempo ella desde hace 20 años y su esposo desde hace 30 años, venden todo tipo de artículos de licuadoras, ellos salen a vender 3 o 4 días ala semana lunes viernes y domingos, son los días en que más vende. Venden caminando en las plazas de los mercados.
Esta vez ella ha solicitado el crédito para comprar vasos aspas, empaques, roscas, tapas no puede dar una cantidad exacta ya que no todos los artículos tienen el mismo precio. el desafío que presenta su negocio es la baja venta que hay en unos días, cuando los placeros no dejan vender a gusto, y sobre todo cuando llueve eso nos impide vender en la calle.

La meta que tiene doña Guadalupe es que su hijo termine de estudiar su carreara de contabilidad y que el negocio suba de ganancias para poder cumplir con los pagos.
“ Mando saludos a las personas que nos prestan el dinero ya que es de gran ayuda para mí y para mi familia”
texts.en:
Mrs. Guadalupe is 41 and has been married to José for 26 years.  They have three children, Omar, 22, who is at college, Alicia, 18, who no longer studies, and Elizabeth, 10, who is in 6th grade.

Guadalupe and her husband are merchants and have been in business for several years: Guadalupe, 20, and her husband, 30 years.  They sell all kinds of blender articles.  They go out three or four days a week, and Mondays, Fridays and Sundays are when they sell the most.  They are street vendors in the market plazas.

She is requesting a loan to buy pitchers, blades, seals, coils, and lids although she cannot specifiy an exact amount because not all of the articles have the same price.  The challenges for the business now are the slow sales volume, difficulties created by plaza business owners, and especially the rain, which keeps them from going out to sell.

Guadalupe's goal is for her son to finish his accounting degree and for the business to increase its earnings so it can meet its payment obligations.

"I send a greeting to all the lenders because the loan is of great help to me and my family."

loans.use: To buy blender pitchers and accessories.

loans.name: Ma. Guadalupe

texts.en:
Ma. Guadalupe is married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Guadalupe is 43 years old and has one child who is in school.

Ma. Guadalupe has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fabric for her tailoring business.

Ma. Guadalupe has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more fabric for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Edita Emelda

texts.es: Edita Emelda de cincuenta y siete años de edad vive con su hija en casa propia. Ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas y pupusas en el lugar de su residencia es muy conocida en la zona pues prepara las tortillas y pupusas más ricas, con material de calidad y a un buen precio y el servicio es excelente despacha a la clientela en el menor tiempo posible; Edita es una mujer emprendedora con ganas de salir adelante para ella es con la motivación y la sabiduría como se abre el camino del éxito, Edita quiere abrir ese camino es por eso que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz mayor, queso, chicharrón, frijoles entre otros. Edita Emelda tiene la confianza que con su arduo trabajo lograra llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Edita Emelda, 57, lives with her daughter in her own home.  She works selling tortillas and "pupusas" [corn tortillas stuffed with cheese, meat, or beans] in her house.  She is very well known in the area since she makes the best tortillas and pupusas, with quality ingredients at a good price.  The service is also excellent, and she takes care of the customers in the least amount of time possible.

Edita is an enterprising woman who wants to get ahead.  For her, it is motivation and wisdom that lead to the road to success.  Edita wants to take this road.  This is why she decided to ask Integral for a loan that would allow her to buy corn wholesale, cheese, pork rinds, and beans, among other products.

Edita Emelda is confident that with her hard work she will manage to bring financial security to her home.

loans.use: to buy corn, cheese, pork rinds, and beans

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, vive con su esposo y tres hijos de 17, 10 y 8 años de edad, ella aprendió el negocio de la elaboración de tortillas por su familia, ya que necesitaba tener un ingreso para poder colaborar con el esposo.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales, pues está construyendo un ranchito donde venderá las tortillas, ella necesita laminas, madera, teja, para poder instalarse en un lugar donde los clientes fácilmente puedan comprarle las tortillas.
Su aspiración es que el negocio mejore, ser buen cliente con pagos frecuentes y sobre todo mejorar los ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Maribel works selling tortillas.  She lives with her husband and three children who are 17, 10 and 8 years old.  She learned the tortilla making business from her family since she needed to earn income to help collaborate with her husband.

She’s asking for a loan to buy building materials because she’s building a small stall to sell her tortillas in; she needs metal sheets, lumber and roofing tiles to install herself in a place where customers can easily buy tortillas from her.

Her goal is that the business improves, to be a good client making frequent payments and, above all, to improve her family’s income.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets, lumber and roofing tiles.

loans.name: Yunise

texts.en:
Yunise is a 38-year-old married woman who has three children aged between 5 and 15. She has run a business selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan for two years.
Yunise has requested this loan through Kiva partner BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal for resale. She will use her extra income to pay school fees in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah sells cooked rice and stew in Besease near Elmina. Hannah has been into this business for the past 10 years. She is married to a teacher and has six dependents. Hannah supports her husband in paying their children's school fees. 

She will use her loan to purchase bulk rice and fish. With the new profit, Hannah plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bulk rice and fish.

loans.name: Ever

texts.es: Ever, necesita Comprar materiales y herramientas para el negocio, por eso solicita un préstamo e invertirlo en hierro, electrodos, aparatos de soldadura, para tener su taller más fortalecido, mejorando la capacidad de respuesta a los clientes y ejecutándolo  de una mejor manera. Éstos préstamos le han permitido mejorar su trabajo tener mejores condiciones y satisfacer las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
Ever needs to buy materials and tools for his business.  That is why he is requesting a loan to invest in iron, electrodes, and soldering apparatus so that his workshop is strengthened.  This way he will be improving his ability to respond to his customers and to carry out his work in a better way.

These loans have allowed him to improve his work, to have better conditions, and to satisfy his family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy iron, electrodes, and soldering apparatus.

loans.name: Alba Arely

texts.es: Alba Arely de treinta y seis años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus hijos. Ella posee una tienda en el lugar de su residencia donde vende productos de primera necesidad, es muy conocida por las personas de la zona, pues siempre encuentran ahí lo que necesitan, además el negocio está muy surtido de productos de excelente calidad y los vende a muy buenos precios; Alba es una mujer muy trabajadora le gusta estar siempre adelante de su competencia, sus más grandes secretos son la constancia y la dedicación solo así podrá alcanzar el éxito, quiere ver crecer su negocio y no le importa los riegos es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, pan, producto instantáneo, bebidas entre otros. Alba Arely tiene la confianza que de esta forma logrará darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Alba Arely is thirty-six years old. She lives with her life partner and their children. She has a store in the place where she lives, where she sells basic goods. She is well-known among the people of the area, since they always find what they need in her store. In addition, the business is well-stocked with products of excellent quality, and she sells them for very good prices. Alba is a very hard-working woman who enjoys always being ahead of the competition. Her greatest secrets are perseverance and dedication; only in this way will she be able to achieve success. She wants to see her business grow, and she is not worried about the risks. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow her to buy staple foods, snacks, bread, instant products and beverages, among other items. Alba Arely is confident that in this way she will be able to provide her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy staple foods, snacks, bread, instant products and beverages.

loans.name: Graciela Cecilia

texts.es:
Graciela Cecilia, es una mujer muy segura, luchadora y sobre todo que no se rinde ante nada, tiene 42 años de edad y tiene 2 hijas, una se llama Antuanett y la otra se llama Olenka, es separada, vela por sus hijas sola y lo ha hecho muy bien  ya que sus hijas están muy orgullosas de ella. 

Ella es muy fuerte y es una madre emprendedora,  ha trabajado de todo, para poder llevar dinero a su hogar, ha trabajado vendiendo pollo en el mercado, también ha trabajado como empleada de limpieza en otras casas y es que ella no tiene vergüenza de trabajar con tal que sea un trabajo honrado siempre es bueno, Graciela se dedica actualmente a su negocio de venta de hamburguesas y golosinas en horas de la noche a las afueras de una empresa desde hace 6 años, como es tan luchadora, trabaja por las mañanas en una empresa pero haciendo las labores de limpieza, se que se preguntaran como hace para tener 2 trabajos a la vez y es que ella nos dice que sus hijas son la fuerza que ella necesita para seguir y es lo único que la mantiene en la lucha por salir adelante.

Graciela está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva porque con la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar más mercadería para poder tener más variedad de producto que ofrecer a sus clientes, con esta mejora podrá tener más ingresos y ahorrar para tener un negocio más grande, para así  poder cumplir su más grande sueño:” ver a sus hijas profesionales “
texts.en:
Graciela Cecilia is a very secure woman, a fighter and above all, does not give in to anything.  She is 42 years old, separated, and has 2 daughters, Antuanette and Olenka, whom she cares for alone and has done very well since her daughters are very proud of her.

She is very strong and is an enterprising mother who has worked all over to bring money home. She has worked selling chicken in the market, and also as a cleaner in other homes and she is not ashamed to work provided it is honest work.  Graciela is in the business of selling hamburgers and snacks in the evening outside a company for 6 years now, as she is a fighter, she works in the mornings at a company, but doing the cleaning, she wondered how to do to 2 jobs at once and she tells us that her daughters are the strength she needs to continue and is the only thing that keeps her in the struggle for get ahead.

Graciela is very grateful to KIVA lenders because with the help they have given her, she will purchase more merchandise to have more variety of products to offer to her customers.  With this improvement, she may have more income and save for a larger business so that she can fulfill her greatest dream: "to see her daughters become professionals"

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise (hamburgers).

loans.name: Henry Richard

texts.es:
Henry tiene 23 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo, él nació en la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado pero vive en la ciudad de Cusco y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. Henry trabaja en el terminal terrestre de la ciudad  del Cusco en una de las agencias de viajes en el área de venta de boletos. Ya son cinco años que trabaja en el terminal terrestre y le va muy bien. Henry y su esposa tienen un pequeño negocio familiar de venta de golosinas, tortas, café, jugos y mates. En esta oportunidad Henry requiere el préstamo para comprar productos como por ejemplo tortas, azúcar, harina, gaseosas y otras cosas más.

El banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza” está conformado por personas responsables y trabajadores que sacan adelante a su familia. La mayoría de los socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco y donde realizan sus actividades económicas. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Henry is 23 years old and he lives in a common-law marriage, from which he has one child. Henry was born in the city of Puerto Maldonado but he now lives in Cusco, where he carries out his economic activities. Henry works in the bus station of the city of Cusco in one of the travel agencies in the area of the ticket booths. He has been working there for the past five years and it is going well. Henry and his wife have a small family business selling candy, cakes, coffee, juices and mate. This time Henry needs a loan to buy products such as cakes, sugar, flour, sodas and other items.

The communal bank "Nueva Esperanza" consists of responsible, hard-working people who help their families get ahead. The majority of its members live in the city of Cusco, where they carry out their economic activities. Cusco is renowned for being a tourist and commercial area, for its traditional celebration of Inti Raymi and because it is located near to one of the seven wonders of the world "Machupicchu".

loans.use: to buy products such as cakes, sugar, flour, sodas and other items.

loans.name: Catherine's Group

texts.en:
Catherine  is a member of this group in Busia District.  She is pictured here in a group of 4 One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 28 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Catherine has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with her hand raised.  She and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation.							

Catherine  is married and has 7 children.  She is 44 years old and is known as friendly, hardworking, reliable, trustworthy, and an experienced farmer.  She is active in her community in groups such as the women's group, savings group, prayer group and burial committee.  Catherine  has been a farmer for 20 years.  Catherine's harvest was not with One Acre Fund last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  							

Catherine first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2013 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Catherine  joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, get new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, earn enough to feed family and send her children to school.  She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she likes being a leader, and as an active community member, she wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  Catherine  plans to use the money that she earns from his next harvest to send her children to school, repair their home, save for the future, and buy a cow.  She notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Catherine’s own life was improved because she has more profits from harvest, has more farm training, has more farm group support, was able to save money, and was able to feed the family.

Catherine and this group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.
