With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.
							
The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to allow farmers the opportunity to buy cost efficient maize, millet, and sorghum seeds

loans.name: Saul Antonio

texts.es: jhgjhghjmvjgbhhlkjjjjjjjjjjjjjjjjjjjjjjjjjjjjjjjjjjjghb
texts.en: jhgjhghjmvjgbhhlkjjjjjjjjjjjjjjjjjjjjjjjjjjjjjjjjjjjghb

loans.use: To produce organic coffee

loans.name: Dorcase Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DORCASE est composé de trois  personnes qui sont dans le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Nafissatou Véronique est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Nafissatou Véronique n’a pas fréquentée l’école mais a appris la coiffure, activité qu'elle exerce depuis sept ans dans sa région. Nafissatou Véronique est âgée de 34 ans et vit au Bénin. Nafissatou Véronique est mariée à un certain Jean. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Nafissatou Véronique vend également des produits cosmétiques et des mèches ; ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face au besoin de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Nafissatou Véronique s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Nafissatou Véronique ensemble avec les membres du groupe DORCASE, sollicite un deuxième  crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit antérieur a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter des produits cosmétiques et des mèches.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is 27 years old, single and supports a family of four people. He has been operating in a posho mill for two years and earns KES 7,000 per month. 

Justine has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy spare parts for his posho mill for faster and more efficient processing. He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and open a retail shop in the area.

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his posho mill for faster and more efficient processing.

loans.name: Adolat

texts.ru: Адолат 55 летняя жительница маленького городка Турсунзаде. Город назван в честь талантливого писателя и героя таджикского народа Мирзо Турсунзаде. Адолат гордится, что живет в этом городе. Ее муж с двумя детьми живет в другом городе, Адолат с сыном - школьником живет в родном краю. Адолат опытная швея. Уже более 10 лет она работает в этом направлении. Адалат столь время работала не прерывно и вот этой швейной машинке. Адолат хочет сделать себе подарок и создать себе условия работы. Она планирует купить себе новую модернизированную швейную машинку. Ее собственных средств не хватает, и она решила обратиться за кредитом. Она верит, что ей помогут.
texts.en: Адолат 55 летняя жительница маленького городка Турсунзаде. Город назван в честь талантливого писателя и героя таджикского народа Мирзо Турсунзаде. Адолат гордится, что живет в этом городе. Ее муж с двумя детьми живет в другом городе, Адолат с сыном - школьником живет в родном краю. Адолат опытная швея. Уже более 10 лет она работает в этом направлении. Адалат столь время работала не прерывно и вот этой швейной машинке. Адолат хочет сделать себе подарок и создать себе условия работы. Она планирует купить себе новую модернизированную швейную машинку. Ее собственных средств не хватает, и она решила обратиться за кредитом. Она верит, что ей помогут.

loans.use: Для приобретения швейной машинки

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor lives in Sabinas Hidalgo, Nuevo Leon; he has a small groceries store which started since 10 years ago with the purpose to have an income and cover all his family expenses like, foods, house and studies. He considered by himself an entrepreneur and very disciplined person. He has demonstrated the kind of person who he is for many years and at the moment his small groceries store is the unique way that provides him an income and a job; so his business has allowed him to cover all the basic necessities from his family as well.

Victor needs a loan of $475 USD to purchase merchandise and he could have a greater variety of products and have a bigger capacity of sales. Victor and his family require your support and generosity.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Víctor vive en Sabinas Hidalgo Nuevo León; tiene una tienda de abarrotes la cual inicio hace 10 años con el propósito de tener un ingreso y cubrir los gastos de su familia, principalmente la comida, una casa y estudios. Se considera así mismo como una persona emprendedora y muy disciplinada. Esto ha demostrado Víctor desde hace muchos años, ya que actualmente su pequeña tienda de abarrotes es el único medio de trabajo para el y este le ha permitido cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia.

Víctor necesita de un préstamo de $475 USD para comprar mercancía y de esta forma el puede aumentar la variedad de productos en su tienda y tener una mayor capacidad de ventas. Víctor y su familia requieren de tu apoyo y generosidad.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Peres

texts.en: I am a widow, a mother of 6. I sell cereals to earn a living. I will use the money to expand my business to other quarters in order to meet the demands of my family.

loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela has 6 years of experience running her business. She started it using some savings that earned from selling plastic goods. She started sales just by walking through neighborhoods. She got a loan from the bank and then was able to start her business out of her home. Little by little, she was able to make money and buy house goods and was able to provide basic products to sell in her business. Currently at her store she also sell jewelry, clothing and children's clothes. She works every day of the week from 7am to 10 pm.

Adela wants credit in order to augment the number of products sold in her store. She would also like to buy more clothes and jewelry to sell.

Adela is a single mother. She is 29 years old. She has 3 children who are all attending school. She has been seperated for 3 years, and she has pushed herself and children to continue to work hard and achieve. Her work has allowed her to support her children's education. Her hope is to have a store full of products which will increase her profit and help her family.

Adela tiene una experiencia de 6 años con su negocio. Se inicio con unos ahorros que tenia comprando artículos plásticos. Comienza a vender ambulante por su sector. Hace un préstamo al banco y con este adecua su casa poniendo un local. Poco a poco con sus ganancias comienza a comprar víveres y de esta manera lograr surtir su local con productos de primera necesidad. Actualmente en su local también vende productos de bisutería y ropa interior y de niños. Trabaja todos los días de la semana desde las 7 a.m. hasta las 10 p.m.

Adela desea el crédito para surtir en su tienda en víveres. Además desea comprar más ropa y productos de bisutería.

Adela es madre soltera. Tiene 29 años. Tres hijos los que estudian. Esta separada 3 años de su esposo lo que ha ella la ha impulsado a seguir adelante por sus hijos y con sus hijos. Su trabajo le ha ayudado para darles una buena educación a sus hijos y también surtir su negocio. Su deseo es tener su tienda llena de productos lo que le dejara más ganancia.

loans.use: Augment her business with home products, clothes and jewelry

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 25 years old and has a small shop in the Kirkuk market to sell shoes. He wants to get $1000 from AL-Aman to bring more goods. He has a lot of responsibilities. His father and mother live with him, and he has two kids and a wife. He is responsible for all of them.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase more goods

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Mrs. Vivian O. is 41 years old and hails from Benin City. She is a married mother of seven children who sells provisions, drinks and recharge cards for all networks in Nigeria. She is asking for the loan amount of $400 to boost her business and buy more drinks and recharge cards. She is a dedicated LAPO woman. She has been with LAPO for 2 years.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, drinks and recharge cards

loans.name: Ayda

texts.es:
Florencia is a hard-working woman. Each day she works the land which she has been doing since she was a little girl. She grew up farming. She is originally from Casacacha. She was raised there, and now she lives with her husband who has always been there for her after so many happy years of marriage. It's just the two of them for now since they're done raising their kids whom they made sure were well-taken care of and were happy growing up. Each day, Florencia and her husband work very hard in the field. For them this is more than an obligation, but also a distraction. They farm 'mashua' and 'olluco' which are native to the land, corn, wheat and barley to later sell them to local stores in the area.

They both have decided to improve their harvest by purchasing fertilizers. Let's contribute by making their wish come true by helping these well-deserved farmers achieve a better living condition.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Florencia es una mujer que cada día labra la tierra con sus manos y viene realizando esta actividad desde que era muy niña porque creció viendo y viviendo las actividades agrícolas a lo largo de su vida. Ella es natural de Casacancha, allí creció y ahora vive al lado de su esposo que siempre la acompaña tras muchos años de feliz matrimonio y ahora ambos viven solos pues ya han cumplido su labor y durante la etapa de crecimiento de sus hijos les procuraron bienestar y felicidad.Día a día Florencia y su esposo trabajan arduamente en el campo y para ellos esto se ha convertido más que una obligación en una distracción; cultivan mashua, olluco, maíz, arvejitas, trigo y cebada para comercializarlos en la época de cosecha al por mayor. Ahora ambos han planeado mejorar esta cosecha y para ello compraran abono y fertilizantes. Contribuyamos con este noble deseo para sigan incrementando su bienestar estos dedicados agricultores.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Mayram

texts.en: Mayram A. is the mother of four children and has been a Microinvest client since 2004. Over the last few years, she has used several loans to increase the size of her business and win many new clients. Because the unemployment rate is high in Tajikistan, Mayram is her family's sole means of support. She has come to us for a loan to expand her business and improve her family's income and living standard.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in more merchandise

loans.name: Editor

texts.en: For a woman to excel in the hardware business for 16 years, she needs determination and hard work, just like B. Editor. She is a widow of 30 years with 6 children (2 in secondary school and 4 in primary school) and caters for 3 dependents. She has been running a hardware shop selling building materials like iron bars, cement, and wall paints in Kazo town for 16 years with the help of money from loans, and now her monthly sale is $355. She has benefited by paying school fees for her children, as well as buying cows that she keeps at home. Her dream is to increase stock in her hardware shop from $1760 to $4680 to enable her to continue paying school fees, as well as buy more cows that provide milk for her family. She needs a loan of $600 for her dream to come true.

loans.use: Bagumire Editor intends to increase stock in her hardware shop from $1760 to $4680 to enable her to continue paying school fees, as well as buy more cows that provide milk for her family.

loans.name: Fausta

texts.en:
Fausta is 32 years old and a single woman. She has a timber sales business she started in 2004. Everyday, she works from 6am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

In the past, Fausta has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu is 30 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 12 and 15. Zainabu is a cloth seller who started out in this line of work in 2000. Every day, she works from 8am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business inventory.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To diversify the products she sells in her business

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr:
Amy Diémé, aged 64, is a widow with three children to look after, and has been a member of the Manguiline Santhiaba Village Bank in Bignona for seven years. Her business consists of buying dried fish, lemons and palm oil in Kafountine and selling them on in Bignona. She replenishes her stock twice per cycle. She uses her earnings to take care of the family expenses and save for future investments. The loan she is requesting will be repaid after six months in one installment.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Amy Diémé, 64 ans, veuve 03 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Manguiline Santhiaba à Bignona depuis 7 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter du poisson sec, du citron et de l’huile de palme à Kafountine et revendre à Bignona. Elle renouvelle son stock deux fois par cycle. Avec ses revenus elle assure les charges de sa famille et épargne pour faire des investissements dans l’avenir. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Food retail

loans.name: Eseta

texts.en: 21 year old Eseta P. has two years of experience working in her general store. Open to the public seven days per week, she earns a weekly net cash flow of approximately 450 Tala (~187 USD).  SPBD loans are Eseta’s only access to capital because she has not qualified for a loan with the traditional banks. She has received three previous loans from SPBD.

loans.use: To re-stock and expand business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a large variety of clothing for her small business

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en: Kehinde A. is 42 years old and is married with three children. She sells hair extensions and she also weaves and braids hair for her customers. Kehinde was weaving her customer's hair when our team came to snap her picture. Kehinde also sells kerosene. Beside her is a drum of kerosene and on top are containers for measuring it out to customers. Kehinde has been in this business since the year 2000. She needs the loan amount of $425 to buy more hair extensions and kerosene for sale. Kehinde says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more hair extensions and kerosene for sale

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: El domicilio de señora Rosario, se encuentra ubicado en la populosa zona de Villa Victoria de la ciudad de La Paz, Bolivia, donde vive en alquiler. La señora, se dedica al comercio de chompas, mochilas y chalecos desde hace tres años; por lo que este crédito será destinado a la compra de mercadería, esto debido a que la época de invierno ha pasado, por lo tanto tiene que proveerse de mercadería de época. La señora Rosario es madre soltera, tiene un niño pequeño que depende de ella por lo cual hace el papel de padre y madre a la vez. Es cliente de nuestra institución desde hace 2 años, solo trabaja con nosotros y la moneda con la que trabaja es el boliviano. Indica que realmente le gusta trabajar con Emprender.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosario lives in the populous area of Villa Victoria in La Paz, Bolivia, where she rents her home. Rosario has been selling coats, jackets, and bags for 3 years. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase merchandise. Since winter has come and gone, she needs to purchase and provide appropriate seasonal merchandise. Mrs. Rosario is a single mother of a young boy who depends on her, which is why she plays the role of father and mother at the same time. She has been a client of our financial institution for 2 years. She only works with us and the money with which she works is Bolivian. She tells us that she really likes working with Emprender.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Kosar

texts.en: Kosar Baji is married to N. A. and lives in Kot Radha Kishan, a small town near the city of Kasur, Pakistan. Kosar Baji has been living there for the last 25 years. She has two sons and two daughters: her elder son is in the 10th grade, while the younger one doesn’t yet go to school. Her daughters stay at home and help take care of the household. Kosar Baji’s husband earns income running a shop where he sells milk to people from the local community. He has been in this profession for the last 30 years. Kosar Baji herself is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of the family. She is currently asking for a loan to buy an additional buffalo for her husband’s milk sales business.

loans.use: Purchase of an additional buffalo for a milk sales business

loans.name: Sryrith's Group

texts.en:
This three-member loan group is led by Mrs. Sryrith C., 23, a mother of one and a public gardens maintainer for a small private company in Battambang Province. She currently earns a salary of $80 per month while her husband, Mr. Sokha Ly, 26, works as a motorcycle taxi driver. Sryrith is seeking a loan of $400 to buy a grocery store for sale and a motorcycle to replace the old one.

The other two members are: Mrs. Ret T., a 54-year-old public gardens maintainer who is requesting a loan of $300 to buy groceries for her daughter to sell;

Mr. Hout P., 56, a construction worker who is applying for a $150 loan to purchase construction materials for use in his work.

All three borrowers live in Battambang Province.

loans.use: To buy a grocery store

loans.name: Maribel Del Carmen

texts.es:
La venta de ropa es un negocio que constantemente requiere inversión por lo que los clientes buscan variedades y estilos y por este motivo la señora Maribel R. ha buscado la manera de surtir su negocio mejorándolo cada día para mantener su clientela y evitar que se vayan a otra tienda.

Su negocio está ubicado en el sector de las ropas en el mercado La Terminal de León y acá atiende a sus clientes muy amablemente. La razón por la que ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito que le permita la compra de la ropa para exhibirla y venderla en su negocio que tanto necesita de inversión en este momento.
texts.en:
The sale of clothing is a business that constantly requires reinvestment because clients look for varieties and specific styles, and for this reason Maribel Rodriguez has looked for a means to supply her business, bettering it each day so that she can maintain her clientele and prevent them from shopping at other stores. Her business is located in the clothing sector in the market La Terminal de León and there she assists her clients nicely. The reason that she has come to Ceprodel is to ask for a loan that will allow her to buy clothing to show and sell in her business, that truly needs a reinvestment of capital at the moment.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is married with two grown children and a two-year-old granddaughter. Her family of five lives in Kamenka. She runs a business selling clothing, leather cloth goods, dishware and cosmetics in a spacious kiosk located in a busy market. Galina has been in business for twelve years.   

Galina is constantly looking for new ideas and products that would make her business more profitable, and she is consistently growing and developing as an entrepreneur. She values every customer and tries to do her best to meet their needs. Galina has gained a reputation as a committed and responsible market vendor among her clients. She has promptly repaid 20 loans to Nadiya Ukraine without any delinquencies. Galina would like to receive a loan .of $1150 to purchase additional retail items for the winter season. She is planning to purchase the seasonal clothing in bulk so she will have plenty to attract new customers. Galina works even harder now to earn more profit so she can spoil her precious little granddaughter. It should be mentioned that besides all her business virtues, Galina is also an experienced gardener growing delicious fruits and vegetables in the yard of her small house.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal inventory

loans.name: Juana Susana

texts.es: La señorita Juana Pérez tiene 20 años de edad, es Soltera de oficios tejedora, “Elaboración de cortes típicos para mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 3 telares, habita junto con sus hermanos menores que ella, se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 3 años de elaborar cortes en su residencia que se encuentra ubicada en la Aldea Vásquez, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima ya que de esa manera podrá aumentar sus ventas y mejorar su condición económica.
texts.en:
Juana Pérez is 20 years old. She is single and lives with her younger siblings. Juana and her siblings are tailors and make traditional women's clothing. They have three looms and 2 employees working for their business. They have been making traditional garments for 3 years from their home in the Vásquez Village, located in the Totonicapán district in Guatemala.

Although customer demand has increased, the current economic situation makes it difficult for them to increase their capital. For this reason, Juana has turned to the Asociación ASDIR to request a loan in order to purchase raw materials. With this loan, she hopes to increase her sales and improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Crafts (to purchase raw materials)

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en:
Lubov is divorced and has two children. She sells women's shoes at the local market. Her average net income is 2,500 UAH per month.

Lubov started this business 11 years ago. At that time her husband left her and she had to raise two children herself. Lubov is a very disciplined person and pleasant to talk to. She believes that these two qualities have helped her to develop her business and become successful.

Lubov would like to get a loan of 5,000 UAH to purchase spring shoes. The additional income would be used for the family needs as well as for further business development.

loans.use: To purchase spring inventories

loans.name: Ileana Matilde

texts.es: La joven Ileana vende productos de higiene, granos básicos, gaseosa, es un pequeño tramo de abarroteria que tiene desde hace seis años, tiene 25 años de edad, reside en el barrio san pablo en la capital de Managua, con dos hijos de 2 y 5 años de edad, su esposo trabaja de supervisor de supermercado la unión. Ella inicio solo vendiendo golosinas con ayuda de su esposo ha ido vendiendo otros productos. Con esta solicitud que esta haciendo es para comprar productos variados y aumentar su inventario en la compra de granos básicos, productos enlatados, leche, cosméticos y otros que cubra las necesidades diarias de sus clientes. Sus metas a corto plazo es poder incrementar más su tramo.
texts.en:
Ileana sells cleaning products, basic grains, and soft drinks. This is a small grocery store that she has had for six years. She is 25 years old and lives in the San Pablo neighborhood in the capital, Managua, with her two sons, aged 2 and 5. Her husband works as a supervisor for the the La Unión supermarket. She began by only selling snacks. With the help of her husband she has been selling other products. The loan she is requesting is to buy a variety of products and to increase her inventory of basic grains, canned goods, milk, cosmetics and other things for the daily needs of her customers. Her short term goal is to expand her store.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains, canned goods, and cleaning products

loans.name: Efaraima

texts.en: Efaraima M., 24, is single and has no children. She has one year of experience in the ice cake business. She sells to the village people and the public six days per week. This is her first loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (about $125). SPBD loans are Efaraima’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use her loan to buy plastic plates, cups, sugar, and other items for ice cake sales.

loans.use: To purchase items for ice cake sales.

loans.name: Khare

texts.fr: Madame Khare N. est une femme mariée qui est âgée de 33 ans, elle habite au quartier Hersent de Thiès. Elle fait le commerce depuis des années. Son activité  consiste à vendre  des tissus, habits pour bébé et divers autres marchandises. Elle est à son deuxième  prêt et a bien remboursé son premier crédit. Avec ce prêt elle envisage d’acheter des tissus pour les revendre a ses clients habituels, et compte réaliser ainsi un bénéfice de 50 000CFA ($100) avec lequel elle peut rembourser les intérêts de son prêt  et le reste le réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. Khare N. is a married women who is 33 years old. She lives in the Hersent district of Thiès. She has been working in commerce for years. Her business involves selling fabrics, clothing for babies, and various other merchandise. She is on her second loan and has repaid her first one. With her current loan, she envisions buying fabrics to resell to her usual customers. Thus, she plans to realize a profit of 50,000 francs CFA with which she can make loan interest payments and invest the rest in her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics to sell

loans.name: Wilder Antonio

texts.es: El señor Wilder R. C., tiene la edad de 40 años, casada, tiene dos hijos de 14 y 16 años de edad, cursan la secundaria, su esposo vende productos lácteos. Su negocio es una pulpería pero vende también frutas y verduras, también cuenta con alquiler de video. Inicio con ahorros y vendía ambulantes verduras, con este préstamo es su segundo ciclo el cual va invertir en la compra de granos básicos y comida para cachorros que se vende bastante. Sus planes es poder hacer crecer su inventario cada día ofertando a sus clientes la variedad de productos. Sus metas como padre es poder dar a sus hijos una buena educación para que sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Wilder R. C. is 40 years old, married and has two children aged 14 and 16 who attend secondary school. His wife sells dairy products.

He started up with his savings selling vegetables as a street vendor. Now his main business is a grocery store, but he also sells fruits and vegetables and offers videos for rent.

This will be his second loan cycle; he will use the money to purchase basic grains and puppy food, which sells well. His plans are to be able to increase his inventory every day so that he can offer his customers a variety of products.

His goal as a father is to be able to provide his children with a good education so that they grow up to be good people.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains and puppy food

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela G., es viuda desde hace 15 años tiene 4 hijos ya todos son mayores de edad, ella tiene 46 años de edad, y se dedica a vender verduras en el mercado municipal, ella  vende tomates, cebollas, papas, y una de sus hijas le ayuda a vender.  Ella necesita su crédito para ampliar su negocio, el cual estaría a cargo de su hija.  Adela desea tener una mejor condición económica y de vida, para ella y sus hijos.  Ella también se dedican a crianza de pollos y marranos en sus tiempos libres ya que la verdura la vende los días de mercado que son los días domingo, martes y jueves, sus sueños son que sus hijos puedan seguir estudiando y se prosperen en la vida.
texts.en:
Adela G. has been a widow for 15 years and has 4 children, who are all adults. She is 46-years-old and sells vegetables in the city market. She sells tomatoes, onions, and potatoes. One of her daughters helps her sell. She needs this credit to expand her business, which her daughter would be in charge of. Adela hopes to improve the economic situation of both herself and her children. She also raises chickens and pigs in her free time since she sells vegetables all day on Sundays, Tuesdays, and Thursdays. Her dreams are to have her children continue with their education and that they prosper in life.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand her business of selling vegetables at market

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: sewing

loans.name: Genine

texts.en:
Genine V. is from the village of Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 19 years old. Genine is married and has no children. To make a living, Genine owns and operates a transportation business. She provides pedicab transport  to local community members. Genine has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Genine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Genine is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP that she will use to renovate the business. This is Genine's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and  Misamis  Occidental. Its membership consists mostly of farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To renovate the business

loans.name: Malahka Group

texts.en:
This is Mohamed S., Yeabu K. , Isatu K. and Aruna I. K.. They are small-scale businesspeople in Magburaka town. They are requesting a loan of Le 800,000 each to help them develop their businesses. With the help of this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, make better profit, and consequently improve on their standards of living.

Mohamed S. (right) is the leader of the group. Mohamed is twenty-five years of age. He was born in Makeni but now lives and sells in Magburaka together with his wife and two children. One of Mohamed's children is in class four and the other is in class one. Mohamed sells watches, phone accessories, radios and a lot more. He has been a businessman for five years now.

loans.use: To invest in his business

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée sans enfant. Elle exerce le commerce de produits alimentaires, à savoir l’haricot et des condiments de cuisine de toute variété. Elle exerce cette activité depuis 2006. Elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES parce qu’elle a des difficultés financières pour renouveler son stock. Ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter un sac d’haricot et plusieurs condiments. Son commerce se situe dans le quartier d’Agoè Plantation à Lomé.
texts.en:
This is a married woman who has no children.  She does commerce in food items, namely beans and condiments of all kind.  She has been in this business since 2006.  She is requesting a WAGES loan because she has financial difficulties renewing her inventory.  This loan will enable her to buy a sack of bean and several condiments.  Her business is located in the Agoè Plantation district in Lomé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sack of beans and condiments for cooking

loans.name: Bernarda Santiaga

texts.es: Doña Bernarda es originaria del Canton Patzarajmac del municipio de Totonicapán es es casada con dos hijos su actividad principal es el bordado manual  ya que dicha actividad lo aprencio de su querida madre hace ya mas de quince años con los ingreso que obtiene ha podido darles estudio a sus hijos y6a que en dicha comunidad su principal fuente de ingreso de la poblacion es el bordado manual  traje esclusivamente para damas, ella necesita un credito  para ampliar su capital ya que para la elaboracion de un Güipil tarde en el bordado mas de un mes por lo tanto necesita de suficiente capital.
texts.en:
Bernarda is a native of the community Canton Patzarajmac, municipality of Totonicapán, Guatemala. She is married with two children, and her primary activity is embroidering by hand, a craft she learned from her beloved mother more than 15 years ago. With the money she makes, she has been able to provide for her children's education. In her community, the main source of income comes from manually embroidering dresses exclusively for women. Bernarda is requesting a loan to increase her capital to make a Güipil, a traditional regional gown that takes more than a month to complete, and to do so she needs sufficient funds.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth sells sarongs and baby things like flasks, diapers, powder, etc. She is 49 years old and married with 7 children. She hopes for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more sarongs and baby things to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and baby things to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve quality of her business place

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn D. is from the village of Lilingayon, Valencia City. She is 55 years old. Merlyn is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Merlyn owns and operates a specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling books to customers. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Merlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Merlyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana (37 años) es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos; uno estudia en el colegio y el otro es un pequeño de 2 añitos.

Ella es muy buena en la elaboración de zapatos para damas, los mismos que adorna con bijouteria (piedras, perlas, cintas, y otros). Esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 2 años de manera continua, pero adicionalmente es profesora (hace 16 años) de nivel primario y trabaja en una institución educativa a 15 minutos de su casa.
Lo que le gusta a Ana de su trabajo es elaborar los zapatos porque se entretiene, le gustan las manualidades y espera satisfacer los gustos de sus clientes, quienes son muy detallistas. Por otro lado, considera que sus negocio le es muy rentable porque sus zapatos los vende a sus compañeras de trabajo, madres de familia y sus vecinas, quienes no dudan en hacerle pedidos, los cuales Ana cobra al contado o al crédito. 
Para más adelante le gustaría tener una tienda de ropa, donde también venda los zapatos que confecciona.

Este es su 7mo créditos con MFP, y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es todos sus compañeros son responsables y se llevan muy bien. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más suelas de zapatos y materiales para decorarlos (piedras, perlas, telas, etc.), así seguirá incrementando sus ventas.
texts.en:
Ana is a 37 year old single mother of two children; one is a high school student while the other one is only two years old.

She is very skilled at making ladies shoes, adorning them with various decorations (jewels, pearls, ribbons, and other items). She has been engaged in this activity for 2 years, but she has also been working as an elementary school teacher for 16 years. She teaches at a school that is 15 minutes from her house.

Ana likes making shoes because it keeps her entertained. She enjoys crafts and hopes to satisfy the tastes of her retail customers. Ana considers her business to be very profitable because she is able to sell shoes to co-workers, working mothers, and neighbors. They do not hesitate to place orders, which Ana accepts with cash or on credit. In the future, she would like to open a clothing store where she can sell the shoes that she makes.

Ana is receiving her 7th loan with MFP. She like the fact that all the members of her Communal Bank are responsible and get along well with one another. With the loan she is requesting, Ana will purchase shoe soles and decorative materials (stones, beads, fabric, etc.) so that she can continue to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making shoes

loans.name: Luisa Petronila

texts.es:
La Sra. Luisa Petronila G. H. tiene 51 años de edad, su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en Panamericana Sur Km. 297 – Subtanjalla – Ica. Actualmente es un modulo de madera ya que con el terremoto su casa fue afectada y aún no logran construirla.
Vive con su esposo y con sus tres hijos; de los cuales dos son mayores de edad y el último tiene 14 años en edad escolar.
Se dedica a la venta de chanfaina (Comida) de lunes a sábado por las mañanas de 7:30 am. a 11:30 am. Y por las tardes asiste a un Centro de Educación Ocupacional donde aprende a realizar trabajos manuales que le permite venderlos y obtener una ganancia.
Es una mujer muy emprendedora y luchadora, su esposo apoya en el negocio y también se dedica al campo ya que ellos tienen una pequeña chacra.
Los Sres. tienen buenas referencias de parte de los vecinos quienes dicen que son personas muy trabajadores y de esa manera han sacado adelante a su familia.
Está solicitando el apoyo para poder invertir mas en sus manualidades ya que es algo que le rinde y le ayuda para cubrir otras necesidades familiares y mas ahora que se acerca la campaña navideña.
texts.en:
Luisa Petronila G. H., 51, lives along the Panamericana Sur highway, Km. 297 marker, Subtanjalla, Ica, in a wood modular unit because her home was damaged by the earthquake and they haven't managed to rebuild it yet. She lives with her husband and three children, two of whom are adults and the youngest is 14 and still of school age. She sells chanfaina (a type of stew traditionally made from the less-noble parts of the animal - offal) from Monday through Saturday mornings from 7:30 to 11:30. In the afternoons she attends an Occupational Education center where she learns to make handicrafts which she can then sell to make a little profit. She is a hard-working, enterprising woman; her husband supports her in her efforts and also is a farmer since they have a small farmstead. They also have good references from their neighbors who say they are hard-working people who have gotten their family ahead in life through their work. She is seeking funding to invest in more handicrafts since this is something that produces income and helps her meet household expenses and more so now that the Christmas sales season is near.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the Christmas season sales.

loans.name: Sandra Beatriz

texts.es: La Sra. Sandra tiene 37 años de edad y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad de 9 y 4 años en edad escolar. Ella es conviviente. Su conyuge se encuentra trabajando en la ciudad de Lima. Cuenta con casa propia de material noble aun sin acabados.  Está ubicado en el Distrito de la Tinguiña. Sandra se dedica al cuidado de niños en su propio domicilio. Ella se dedica a esto hace 3 años. Sandra tiene muchos objetivos y metas uno de ellos es poder hacer un jardin de estudios para niños. Con el dinero que solicita invertirá en mejoramiento de su vivienda.  Gran parte de la casa ya está construida pero sin acabados, y quieren mejorar el piso de la vivienda para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sandra is 37 years old and is the mother of two children ages 9 and 4 who go to school. Her partner works in Lima. She has her own house but it's not finished. It's located in the Tinguina District. Sandra has been a stay-at-home mother for the past 3 years. She has many goals and dreams and one of them is to build a studying yard for her children. She's asking this loan in order to make improvements to her home. Big part of the house is yet to be built, and she wants to improve the flooring in order to have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita D. is from the village of Gumbil, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old. Rosita is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Rosita owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosita is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Rosita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Samson

texts.en: Samson is 40 years old and married with 2 children. He is a LAPO (Lift above poverty organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. He sells machine parts at retail prices to his customers. He lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. He is requesting a loan amount of NGN 150,000 to purchase more machine parts to sell. He hopes to expand his business. He says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more machine parts to sell.

loans.name: Wilmer Antonio

texts.es:
Wilmer Antonio tiene 54 años de edad. Nació en Barranquilla, pero proviene de una familia de zapateros de origen paisa (del departamento de Antioquia). Vive en el barrio Soledad 2000 con su esposa, pero trabaja en el barrio La Concepción al norte de la Ciudad de Barranquilla. Su negocio es la zapatería; en él ofrece el servicio de arreglar calzados, pero también  compra bolsos y zapatos para venderlos a sus clientes, con ello ha sostenido siempre a su familia y ha logrado adquirir vivienda propia. 

Aunque es la primera vez que recibe un préstamo de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, está muy expectante y contento con este nuevo financiamiento; se enteró de esta entidad  porque un amigo se la recomendó y así mismo él recomienda a muchos más personas para que como él se beneficien.  
Su sueño es que su familia avance y que cada integrante de ella logre sus metas particulares;  planea cambiar el techo de su kiosco y mejorar la imagen de su negocio pintándolo, si como también   surtirlo de bolsos y calzados especialmente para la época de carnavales donde ocurre un incremento en las ventas, para ello solicita financiamiento por valor de $ 1.500.000 para comprar bolsos y zapatos ya elaborados.

Wilmer, en su negocio trabaja con su hermano en un kiosco al lado de una iglesia ubicada en  una esquina en el barrio La Concepción donde se ubica desde hace 18 años. Aunque tiene muchos parientes zapateros, empezó trabajando en una empresa de calzado como mensajero. Después su hermano le enseñó la zapatería—que aquél había aprendido de su abuelo—y Wilmer empezó trabajando como zapatero. Durante 4 años caminaba por las calles con maletín y caja gritando “¡Zapatero!”, hasta que el sacerdote de la iglesia le ofreció a él y a su hermano el espacio que ahora tienen. Desde el principio le gustó porque no había otro puesto de zapatería y ahora tiene a más de 800 clientes y esta satisfecho de sus buenas referencias y cartas de recomendación de ellos que le sirven para acceder al crédito. Su Kiosco está ubicado en una zona muy comercial, cerca de un supermercado y de muchos almacenes; sus clientes vienen de todas partes, dejan sus zapatos con Wilmer y hacen sus compras mientras Wilmer los arregla. Cuida la calidad de los arreglos que hace, por ejemplo cuando pone una tapa en un zapato siempre añade tintilla y lustra el calzado para que no se note la diferencia, porque sabe que los clientes contentos son los que vuelven y ellos quieren tener su calzado usado como si fuera nuevo, por eso buscan a Wilmer. Normalmente le vienen 20 clientes y a veces hasta 30 y en estos meses entre noviembre y febrero se encuentra muy ocupado porque el nuevo año está empezando para los estudiantes y los colegiales.
texts.en:
Wilmer is 54 years old. He was born in Barranquilla, but he comes from a family of shoemakers of Paisan ethnicity (from the department of Antioquia.) He lives in the Soledad 2000 neighborhood with his wife, but he works in the La Concepción neighborhood to the north of the City of Barranquilla. He is a cobbler; he offers the service of fixing shoes and in addition he purchases purses and shoes to sell to his customers. With this work he has always supported his family and has managed to acquire his own home. Although this is the first time that he is receiving a loan from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, he is very hopeful and happy with this new financing. He found out about this organization because a friend recommended it and likewise he recommends it to many more people so that they can benefit like him. His dream is to advance his family and that every member of his family will achieve their particular goals. He plans to replace the roof of his kiosk and improve the image of his business by painting it. In addition he will restock his supply of purses and shoes, especially for the carnival season when sales increase. To do this he requests a loan of $1,500 to buy ready-made purses and shoes. Wilmer works with his brother in a kiosk at the side of a church located on a corner in the La Concepción neighborhood where he has been located for 18 years. Although many of his relatives are cobblers, he started working in a shoe company as a messenger. After his brother taught him the skills of shoemaking and repair, that he himself had learned from his grandfather, Wilmer began working as a cobbler. For 4 years he walked the streets with a small case and a box shouting "Cobbler!" until the priest of the church offered him and his brother the space that they now occupy. From the start he liked it because there was no other cobbler stand and now he has more than 800 customers. He is satisfied that his good references and letters of recommendation from his customers will serve to help him access credit. His kiosk is located in a commercial zone, next to a supermarket and many other stores. His customers come from all parts; they leave their shoes with Wilmer and make their purchases while Wilmer fixes them. He is careful with the repairs that he makes. For example, when replaces the heel on a shoe he always adds stain and polishes the shoe so that you can't tell that it's been repaired, because he knows that satisfied customers are the ones that will return. They want to have their used shoes look like new, and for this reason they seek out Wilmer. Normally he has 20 customers, and at times even 30. In these months between November and February he is very busy because the new year is starting for the students and the schools.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy purses and shoes to sell at retail

loans.name: Teresa Natividad

texts.es:
Teresa es socia del Banco Comunal Sonrisa.
Teresa es casada, tiene 52 años y 4 hijos, Teresa tiene un puesto en el mercado artesanal de la ciudad en donde vende artesanía variada, además Teresa se dedica a la producción de artesanía en piedra de huamanga.
Teresa necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de retablos.
Teresa sueña con aumentar su mercadería y equipar su taller.
texts.en:
Teresa is a member of the Sonrisa Communal Bank. She is 52, married, and has four children. Teresa has a stand in the handicraft market in the city. She sells various handicrafts. Teresa also devotes herself to the production of handicrafts from alabaster. Teresa needs a loan for 1,000 PEN to buy “retablos” (small, brightly painted wooden altarpieces depicting scenes of traditional Ayacuchan life). Teresa dreams of increasing her merchandise and equipping her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy “retablos” (small, brightly painted wooden altarpieces depicting scenes of traditional Ayacuchan life)

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.en:
Mrs. Zoraida B. is one of the members of PAGLAUM MPC. She is 44 years old and married with six children. She owns a rice field and her husband also supports it. Mrs. B. earns 7,000 PHP monthly from her rice field but she has other sources of income.

She joined PMPC to gain access to financial support and to engage in other business activities. She successfully repaid her previous loan of 8,000 PHP borrowed from PMPC. The purpose of that loan was to expand her rice field and to purchase other rice seedling. For now, she has a new loan of 9,000 from PMPC and the purpose of that loan is to buy fertilizer for her rice field.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raúl tiene 24 años, está casado con Hermelinda de 23 años y tienen un hermoso e inquieto hijo de 4 años; ellos viven en su casa propia.  

Con perseverancia y esmero logró adquirir sus terrenos agrícolas que lo llenan de orgullo, los mismos donde ahora siembra papa, arveja y algunas verduras. Esta actividad la realiza junto a su esposa, ambos llevan 4 años dedicándose a la agricultura, siendo su pequeño hijo el motor que los impulsa. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es proteger sus cultivos de las plagas, las inclemencias del clima y mantenerlos limpios para conseguir una cosecha productiva, sin embargo lo que le incomoda es trasladar hacia los mercados los pesados sacos de tubérculos que oscilan entre 60 y 70 kilos. Por ello viene ahorrando celosamente para que más adelante pueda comprarse una camioneta que le facilite el transporte de sus productos.                    

Este es el cuarto préstamo que tiene con MFP y le entusiasma continuar trabajando con su banco comunal porque está integrado por personas responsables y muy solidarias. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará varios sacos de fertilizantes para cuidar el crecimiento y desarrollo de sus cultivos de arveja.
texts.en:
Raul is 24 years old. He is married to Hermelinda, 24, and they have a beautiful, rambunctious 4 year old son. They live in their own home. With perseverance and meticulousness, he was able to acquire his farmlands, which makes him very proud. He now cultivates potatoes, peas and some vegetables. He does this together with his wife and they have been farming for four years. Their little boy is the engine that drives them. What they like the most about their work is protecting their crops from plagues, the weather, and keeping everything clean in order to have a productive harvest. What he doesn't like is having to carry the heavy bags, that weigh between 60 and 70 kilograms (130 and 155 lbs) of tubers to the markets. He is saving jealously so that he will be able to buy a van in the future. This will facilitate the transportation of his products. This will be his fourth loan through MFP and he is enthusiastic about being able to work with his communal bank because it is made up of united responsible people. He will use the money from this loan to buy sacs of fertilizer that he will use to maintain his pea crop.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Giovanna

texts.es: Giovanna tiene 43 años, es separada y tiene cinco hijos, los tres mayores ya tiene su propia familia y elL. vive con los dos menores y su madre, en un populoso barrio en el cono sur D. L. ciudad D. Lima. L. historia D. Giovanna se inicia una tarD. cuando sentada en L. puerta D. su casa, junto a su madre, tejía las chompas D. sus hijos pequeños porque no tenía dinero para comprarles. Entonces pasó por allí una mujer extranjera y se enamoró D. sus tejidos. DesD. entonces pactaron que elL. le daría L. lana y los modelos y Giovanna se encargaría D. tejer. Lleva 15  años tejiendo juntamente con su madre en un sofá D. su casa cuidando que los hilos no se ensucien, ya que las prendas serán exportadas a Italia. Le va muy bien y está muy contenta con lo que hace, ya que con esas ganancias mantiene y educa a sus hijos, asimismo con los excedentes viene invirtiendo en L. compra D. productos D. belleza, ya que su finalidad es incrementar sus ingresos económicos para cubrir L. educación D. sus hijos en el futuro. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, donD. hace el compromiso D. pagar puntualmente sus cuotas y cumplir todos los acuerdos D. su grupo, ya que su anhelo es contar con posteriores préstamos. Con el dinero que solicita, comprará agujas D. tejer en diversos números y con el resto adquirirá más productos D. belleza.
texts.en:
Giovanna is 43 years old, separated and has five children. The three oldest have their own families and she lives with the two minors and her mother in a highly populated neighborhood in the southern part of Lima. Giovanna's story begins one afternoon when she was sitting in the doorway of her home with her mother. She was knitting sweaters for her young children because she didn't have the money to buy them instead. Then, a stranger passed by and fell in love with her knitting. Since then, they agreed that she would give her yarn and patterns and Giovanna would take care of the knitting. She has spent 15 years knitting with her mother on the sofa in their home, making sure the thread does not get dirty, since the garments will be exported to Italy. She feels good about her work and is content with what she does, since these earnings help proviD. for her children. Likewise, she invests the surplus in the purchase of beauty products, since her goal is to increase her income in order to pay for her children's education in the future. This is her first loan with MFP, and she has promised to pay on time for her knitting needles of various sizes and she will buy more beauty products with the rest of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy knitting needles and beauty products.

loans.name: Sary

texts.en: Mrs. Sary S. is 40 years old and a villager who lives in Si Sla village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 2 hectare field to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Ly Ouk, sells ice cream and also does construction work, making a small income to support the family. In order to increase their income to improve the family's standard of living, Mrs. Sary S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. This couple has four children who all are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Amigas Unidas Group

texts.es:
Las Señora Nancy H. integrante de la Asociación Comunal Amigas Unidas, que a su vez pertenece al Centro Focal Santiago II,  tiene el negocio de elaboración de joyas hace 12 años, entrega sus productos al interior, viajando a Cochabamba y Santa C. donde tiene mayor demanda y necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos.

Las demás integrantes de ésta Asociación tienen diferentes negocios como la venta de verduras, comida, perfumes, papa, ropa, jugo de quinua y la atención de un taller de chapería.

Todas esperan culminar el ciclo con éxito y resposabilidad y aseguran que invertiran el préstamo en sus negocios, algunas comprando mercadería, otras comprando insumos.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the community association "Amigas Unidas", which in turn is part of the "Centro Focal Santiago II". She has been in business making jewelry for 12 years. She takes her products to the interior of the country, to Cochabamba and Santa C., where there is greater demand. She needs the loan in order to buy materials. The other members of this association have different businesses such as selling vegetables, food, perfume, potatoes, clothes, quinoa juice, and a metal working shop. They all want to complete the loan cycle with success and responsibility and assure you that they will invest the loan in their businesses, some buying produce to sell and others buying business supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Dick Otoniel

texts.es:
En el barrio los Girasoles y sus sectores aledaños no hay quien no conozca a Dick Gutiérrez M., es un reconocido líder comunitario  proactivo y un comerciante  muy bien entrenado; que desde antes de iniciar su negocio participó en capacitación para aprender a viabilizar sus proyectos de inversión, muchas veces repitió los cursos microempresariales para tener todo claro, y eso es lo que lo ha hecho que se sostenga en el mercado.
Conoció a la Fundación Santo Domingo en sus oficinas de servicio al cliente en Bancoldex, este es su segundo crédito que invertirá en la compra de un computador, porque su negocio ha crecido y quiere controlarlo mediante esta herramienta de informática y de una vez poder acceder a la tecnología de la información. 
Dick Gutiérrez afirma “los créditos me han permitido crecer y se me han abierto las antenas de las oportunidades para seguir adelante y he logrado apreciar el valor del dinero, pues cuando era empleado lo derrochaba”, cree que antes perdió mucho tiempo y no ahorró, pero esas son cosas del pasado y ahora tiene unas metas muy claras y una directriz  de trabajo: él quiere tener un gran almacén  muy reconocido, pues es el sueño de  toda su vida, por eso su desafío es no desperdiciar esfuerzos, trabajar en su negocio y reinvertirle todo lo que pueda.  
Vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 13 y 18 años, que lo inspiran para avanzar en esta época de cambios, como es un gran emprendedor, conciente de las oportunidades de negocio, que vende mercancía variada mediante catálogos, impuso a su cónyuge, una mujer  que  goza de su admiración y su apoyo y  que es madre comunitaria,  a que también lo hiciera,  ahora ella con esta actividad adicional  genera importantes ingresos para el hogar y para su negocio y ambos comercializan muchos productos.
texts.en:
In the Girasoles (Sunflowers) neighborhood and surrounding areas everyone knows Dick Gutiérrez M.; he is a well-known proactive community leader and very well-trained merchant. Long before opening his business he took part in training programs to learn how to make his investment projects viable. Often he repeated micro entrepreneurial courses in order to really be clear on the information; all of this has made it possible for him to succeed in the marketplace. He became aware of Fundación Santo Domingo through its customer service office in Bancoldex. This will be his second loan which he’ll use to buy a computer because his business has grown and he wants to manage it through this IT tool and once and for all have access information technology. Dick Gutiérrez states: “the loans have made it possible for me to grow and have opened antennas to opportunities to continue forward; I have managed to appreciate the value of money because when I was an employee I tended to waste it.” He feels that he lost a lot of time before and didn’t save. But these are things of the past; now he has very clear goals and work direction. He wants to own a well-known store; this has been his life-long dream. His challenge, therefore, is not to waste efforts, to work at his business and reinvest all he can into it. He lives with his wife and two children who are 13 and 18 years of age; they inspire him to continue forward in these changing times. Because he is a great entrepreneur, conscious of business opportunities, who sells an assortment of catalogue merchandise, he urged his wife-a woman who has his admiration and support and is a mother to the entire community-to do the same. Now she too generates additional income for her family and business with this new activity; both spouses sell lots of products.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a computer.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Mrs. Hong K. is a 29-year-old married woman who lives in Tuol Svay village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Boeun Kil, are farmers who own one hectare of land on which they cultivate rice. 

Aside from being farmers, they are also wine makers who earn a small income to meet their family's needs. In support of the farming crop, Mrs. Hong K. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline to support her farming venture. 

This couple has three children; two are attending the local school, while the youngest one is too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline

loans.name: Dennis Arnaldo

texts.es:
Denniss de 21 años vive en una zona periurbana de Guayaquil, el tiene un puesto de comida y bebidas en su casa, gracias a sus padres que le heredaron el negocio. 

Cuando el era pequeña sus padres tuvieron un negocio de comidas y el siempre observaba como trabajaban y cocinaban, cuando creció sus padres decidieron darle el negocio de venta de comidas y bebidas. Ahora vende almuerzos y meriendas con jugos todos los días, se levanta muy de mañana para hacer la comida,  pero para tener mas ingresos el quiere readecuar el local comprando con el préstamo una cocineta, cilindro de gas, mesas y sillas para mejorar el negocio. 

En el futuro quiere tener su propio restaurante y tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Dennis is 21 years old and lives in the outskirts of Guayaquil. He runs a stand selling food and drinks out of his home, thanks to his parents who passed the business down to him. When Dennis was young, his parents had a business selling food and he always observed how they worked and cooked. When he grew up, his parents decided to give him their business. Now he sells lunches, snacks, and drinks every day. He gets up early in the morning to prepare the food, but to increase his income, he would like to refurbish his workspace. He would use this loan to improve his business by buying a kitchenette, a gas cylinder, tables, and chairs. In the future, Dennis hopes to have his own restaurant and his own house.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a kitchenette, tables, and chairs

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn A. is a 39-year-old married woman who supports her family with her fishing business. She lives in Brgy Lakawon, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental with her husband and their 5 children who are between 9-25 years old.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fishing business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP).

Evelyn is now borrowing 21,000 PHP for her fishing business. This will be her 7th loan cycle from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 18,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Evelyn aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional capital for fishing

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina C. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 40 years old. Marcelina is married and has 7 adult-aged children. To make a living, Marcelina owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buy and sell charcoal  in the local community. Marcelina has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marcelina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marcelina is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marcelina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional charcoal to sell

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Veronica Marina

texts.es:
Veronica Marina P. G. tiene 24 años.  Vive en unión libre el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Veronica es una socia de la ventanilla rural El Placer, que está ubicada a tres horas de Chillanes. Son 19 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz y cacao. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Verónica cria chanchos. Realiza sus compras y ventas en Mata de Cacao. Los chancos se venden en la casa. 
Solicita el préstamo para comprar mas animales. Su sueño es trabajar y seguir adelante. 

En su tiempo libre arregla la casa y ayuda a su esposo a sembrar cacao.
texts.en:
Veronica Marina P. G. is 24 years old. She lives in a civil union in the Chillanes district, Bolívar province. Veronica is a member of the rural communal group El Placer, which is located 3 hours from Chillanes. There are 19 members in total, and the majority work growing maize and cocoa. This is the first loan that they are seeking from Cooperativa San José. Veronica breeds pigs. She makes her purchases and sales in Mata de Cacao, and also sells them at home. She is seeking a loan to purchase more animals. Veronica's dream is to continue working and improve her situation. In her spare time Veronica tidies the house and helps her husband to plant cocoa.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens and pigs

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace A. is currently in the business of selling bread, fried fish and tomatoes at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more fresh fish and tomatoes to sell.  Grace is 20 years old and is single.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent out.

loans.use: Stock more fresh fish and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Sope Serigne Babacar Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOPE SERIGNE BABACAR est né le 05 décembre 2007. Il est composé de 15 femmes toutes issues du même quartier. Elles ont formé leur groupe par affinité et par voisinage. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de NDIABOOT.

Madame MBAMOUSSE K., debout à droite de la photo, les bras croisés et tenant son livret d'épargne et de crédit entre les mains, est responsable du groupe de solidarité. Elle est âgée de 44 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants en charge. 

Elle fait du commerce d'arachide et de pastèque. Elle mène cette activité depuis environs 05 ans.

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de renforcer son niveau d'approvisionnement en marchandises ci-dessus afin d'augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire. 

Son objectif est de renforcer son épargne et participer à la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
The Sope Serigne Babacar solidarity group was created on December 5, 2007. It is composed of 15 women all living in the same neighborhood. They are friends and neighbors who decided to form a group together. The group belongs to the Banc Villageois of Ndiaboot. Mrs. Mbamousse K., standing on the right in the photo, with her arms crossed and holding her bank book, is the group’s leader. She is 44 years old. She is married and the mother of six dependent children. She sells peanuts and watermelons. She has been doing this for about 5 years. Her new loan will allow her to bolster her level of merchandise stock in order to increase her profit margin. Her goal is to grow her savings and to contribute to the family budget.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing peanuts and watermelons

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca A. is from the village of Mimbunga, Gingoog City. She is 41 years old, married and has 6 school-aged children. Rebecca owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Rebecca has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Rebecca joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rebecca has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Rebecca is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to increase working capital. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Rebecca from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and to increase working capital

loans.name: Crispin Andia

texts.es: El Sr. Crispin Andia E. P. de 47 años de edad, vive junto a  esposa e hijos.Tiene casa propia la cual se encuentra ubicada el el distrito de Pachacutec. Se dedica a la labor de campo en una empresa de la zona. Su esposa trabaja como ayudante de cocina en la misma empresa. El Sr. crispin es una persona muy emprendedora que gracias a su esfuerzo a logrado construir parte de su vivienda. Requiere el crédito para terminar de construir dicha vivienda. El Sr. Crispin está muy agradecido por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a tráves de este financiamiento.
texts.en: El Sr. Crispin Andia E. P. is 47 years old, and lives with his wife and children. He has his own home which is located in the Pachacutec district. He is dedicated to field work in a local business. His wife works as a kitchen helper in the same business. Mr. Crispin is a very entrepreneurial person that thanks to his efforts has managed to build part of his home. He requests this credit to finish building this home. Mr. Crispin is very grateful for the support that we can provide him for this financing.

loans.use: Improvement of home

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a 43-year-old mother of three who lives with her husband and children in Siquirres, located near the Caribbean coast of Costa Rica. She runs a business selling merchandise such as children´s games, cutlery, household products and decorations. Her clients are mostly family members, neighbors, friends and acquaintances who live in her community. This loan will be used to finance the purchase of such merchandise. Sonia wakes up every day at 5:00 AM. After carrying out domestic tasks (preparing breakfast and lunch, cleaning) she goes to work producing bread (another product she sells). In the afternoons, she heads into her community to make sales, collect payments from clients and deliver her products. Her goals are to expand her business and to one day own a central location where she would be able to sell her merchandise (to avoid having to travel so much). 

The loan consultant who has been working with Sonia describes her as a hardworking, amicable, energetic entrepreneur with the ability and inclination to develop and expand her productive activity in an effort to improve her living conditions. Sonia is a dedicated mother and businesswoman.  She makes decisions, for the family and at work, in cooperation with her husband. This will be her second loan with Fundación Mujer. Sonia plans to re-invest her earnings into her business. She says that one of her main obstacles has been the high level of competition that exists in her neighborhood. Sonia is confident that by catering to the specific needs of her clients, and focusing on customer service, she will be able to retain current clients and attract new ones.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise such as cutlery, decorations and household products.

loans.name: Mario Martin

texts.es: El señor Mario Martin es casado de oficio guarda de seguridad en UPONIC encargado de vigilar el edificio de su empresa es el primer desembolso que CEPRODEL le otorga y lo utilizara para reparar una habitación de su casa. Agradece a CEPRODEL su ágil atención.
texts.en: Sr. Mario Martin is married and works as a security guard at UPONIC (Universidad Popular de Nicaragua) where he is in charge of patrolling the business administration building.  This is the first loan he has received from CEPRODEL and he will use the funds to repair a room in his home.  He is grateful to CEPRODEL for its prompt attention.

loans.use: Purchase materials needed to repair a room

loans.name: Ruqqiya's Group

texts.en:
Ruqqiya has applied for a loan for the 6th time from Kiva partner Asasah. This time she has acquired a loan to financially assist her husband in his jewelry business. He is a goldsmith by profession and operates his shop in the market. He sells costume as well as gold and silver jewelry to his clients. With the loan, he will buy costume jewelry sets because gold has become very high in price and people can only afford to buy costume sets to wear.

She lives in a 3-room brick house with her family in a small city named Kot Radha Kishen which is located in Punjab, Pakistan and famous for its dairy industry. Her home is located in Kot Mianiayaan which is a residential area of the city. She is the mother of a son and a daughter. Both of them are getting their education. Her daughter is studying in 7th while her son is in the 10th class. 

She is 52 years old and is married to A. A.. A. has been in this business for more than 10 years and keeps himself updated about the latest and most fashionable jewelry designs in the market. Ruqqiya is hopeful that her husband will be able to make positive changes to his business by investing money in his business.

loans.use: To buy costume jewelry sets to resell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou E. is from the village of Cabuan, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 44 years old. Marilou is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Marilou owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.
