While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling bananas & vegetables like eggplants & onions in the local community. Marilou has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marilou joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilou has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional vegetables to buyand sell. Marilou is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Marilou from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn T. is from the village of Maribucao, Gingoog City. She is 39 years old. Marlyn is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Marlyn owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling coconuts for copras in the local community. Marlyn has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marlyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional coconuts to buy and sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Marlyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconuts to buy and sell

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie C. is a 45-year old married woman who supports her family by operating a butcher shop.  She lives in District 1, Brooke's Point, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her butcher shop, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average income of PHP 20,000. Tessie is now borrowing PHP 29,500 to fund operations. This will be her 20th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Tessie aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: To fund the operation of her butcher shop

loans.name: Roso Alexander

texts.es:
Roso tiene 25 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola y comercial que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra situada a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio, allí el ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos de uso diario entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. Su negocio cuenta son mucha acogida debido a la calidad de productos que ofrece y a la buena atención que suele brindar. Los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades los utiliza para solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar al desarrollo económico de su familia.

Roso desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda con la que cuenta actualmente. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su meta.
texts.en:
Roso is 25-years old, single, and lives with his family in the district of Olmas, a agricultural area that belongs to the province of Lambayeque, which is located about an hour and half from the city of Chiclayo.

He has a small general store installed in his house. He offers his clients a variety of daily products including snack foods and first aid materials. His business has been well received because the quality of products he offers and the good service he provides. He uses his businesses profits to pay for his personal expenses and help his family's economic situation. 

Roso hopes to grow his business by buying popular products that will meet his current demand. To fulfill this goal he has applied for a loan of 2,000 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: Increase the quality and variety of products in his store

loans.name: Celestin

texts.fr: Célestin M. est célibataire, et  Il a une éducation primaire.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter la farine pour préparer les baignés, et acheter les œufs, car son commerce est le détail de ce deux produits.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’épargner pour augmenter l’activité et apres avoir travailler longtemps et ayant la capacité, il souhaite se marier.  Il voudrait acheter une vielle maison et la réhabiliter.
texts.en: Célestin M. is single. He has a primary education. He is going to use his loan in order to purchase flour to prepare beignets, and also eggs, since his line of business is retailing these two types of food products. His business strategy is to save money in order to expand his business and be able to get married. He would like to have a house and furnish it.

loans.use: Purchasing beignet flour and eggs for resale

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie O. is from the village of Cabalantian, Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 43 years old. Tessie is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Tessie owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing "motorela" or "habal-habal" motorcycle transport services (with her husband as the driver) to local community members. She also buys and sells fish like sardines & milk fish. Tessie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 11,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Tessie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tessie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase tools needed to expand services provided. Tessie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the transport service. This will be the 8th loan taken out by Tessie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools needed for maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase merchandise for his store

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 52 years old and married with one child.  She has been selling detergent and clothes since 1999.  She has managed to educate her child with the funds she gets from Faulu Kenya.  She hopes to expand her business premises and add more clothing stock in the future. With the 50,000 Kes, she will buy chemicals to make detergent, and clothes for resale.

loans.use: To buy chemicals to make detergent, and clothes for resale.

loans.name: Laura Clara

texts.es:
Laura de 67 años, una mujer trabajadora que empezó hace 11 años en su mini tienda para poder apoyar a su esposo en lo económico.

En la actualidad trabaja diariamente en todo el día. Con el préstamo ella quiere comprar mercadería como atún, azúcar, etc. Una de sus metas desea ponerse en su domicilio un restaurant.
texts.en:
Laura, 67, is a hard working woman who opened her minimart 11 years ago to help her husband economically.

She currently works all day, every day.  She will use the loan to buy merchandise like, tuna, sugar, etc.  One of her goals is to open a restaurant in her home.

loans.use: to buy tuna and sugar.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice J. is a single woman of twenty-seven years.  She has two children and they live in Kaplelach in Eldoret.  She does maize farming in the area.   She has been doing this for two years now and gets a monthly income of four thousand shillings.

This will be Loice's second loan with KADET LTD.  She plans to use the entire loan to buy maize seedlings and fertilizer.  With the income that she will get, she plans to start a retail shop. 


In the future, she wants to continue farming and also to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy maize seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Jhon Sebastián

texts.es:
Aunque Jhon Sebastián C. A. siempre quiso entrar a la universidad, sus recursos económicos no le alcanzaron para lograr este sueño, por eso, desde hace algún tiempo se dedicó a trabajar en una ferretería, allí aprendió el oficio de elaborar llaves y otras manualidades propias de la cerrajería, fue entonces cuando vio la oportunidad de crear su propio negocio. 

En un pequeño espacio en su casa, Jhon Sebastián adecuó su indumentaria de trabajo y aunque su negocio es pequeño sus ganas de progresar son enormes, por ello, sueña con crecer su negocio hasta convertirlo en una ferretería reconocida que le permita mejorar su calidad de vida. 

Actualmente este emprendedor necesita de un préstamo para comprar una máquina duplicadora de llaves lo que le permitirá agilizar su trabajo y ser más productivo.
texts.en:
Although Jhon Sebastián C. A. always wanted to enter the university, his economic resources were not sufficient for him to achieve this dream. For this reason, he began some time ago to work in a hardware store. There he learned to make keys and other manual skills related to locksmithing. It was then that he saw the opportunity to create his own business.

Jhon Sebastián has arranged his working tools in a little space in his house, and although his business is small, his will to progress is enormous. He dreams of expanding his business until he converts it into a well known hardware store, which will permit him to improve his quality of life.

Now this entrepreneur needs a loan to buy a machine that duplicates keys, which will allow him to speed up his work and become more productive.

loans.use: to buy a machine that duplicates keys.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.es: El señor Iván trabaja como chofer en el sindicato Eduardo Avaroa. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material de construcción ya que construirá una nueva habitación en su casa. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Cosmos 79 de la ciudad de El Alto,  es soltero y  no tiene hijos. Es primer crédito con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en: Iván works as a driver for the Eduardo Avaroa union.  He needs the loan to buy construction material as he will build a new room in his house.  He lives in his own home located in the Cosmos 79 zone of the city El Alto.  He is single and has no children.  This is his first loan with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a new room in his house.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 40 years old, married, and has four children.  To earn a living, she sells timber.  Her business is only two years old and she has employed two people.  She also grows crops and rears chicken for extra income.  Previously, she was selling cow-lick salt to earn a living.  Through Faulu Kenya, she has been saving her money.  She wants 20,000 Kes to buy more timber.

loans.use: To buy more timber.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 27-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and one sibling. He has six years of experience working with mobile phones. Then he opened his own store four years ago. With his loan requested of $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. he will be able to increase his merchandise selection of new mobile phones and purchase prepaid telephone cards to sell. He notes that both his income and business productivity will be increased as a result of the loan. In the future, he is looking to further expand his business and increase his capital.

loans.use: increase his inventory of new mobile phones and purchase prepaid telephone cards.

loans.name: Hilda Elizabeth

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mi Mundo Natural.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Hilda, tiene 31 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de  12, 8, 3 años y una bebé de siete meses, los  dos mayores estudian en colegio y  escuela. El marido es comerciante.
 
Ella tiene un local en el cual se dedica a la venta de arreglos florales (floristería), vende arreglos de varias formas, tamaños, colores y precios.  Nos cuenta que son muchos los clientes que todos los días realizan obsequios con sus productos. Trabaja todos los días desde las 7h00 hasta las 18h00. Las flores le mandan desde la sierra especialmente las rosas, es un comerciante mayorista quien le surte en su local tres días a la semana. Lleva con su negocio por 12 años y le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar flores. Lleva en el banco comunal 8 ciclo y le gusta porque con los créditos su negocio ha crecido cada vez más.
 
Su sueño es tener un local propio ya que actualmente arrienda.
texts.en:
The members of the “Mi Mundo Natural” (My Natural World) communal bank meet every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo, known since colonial times as the City of the Royal Tamarinds.

We met Hilda, 31, here.  She’s in a relationship and they have four children who are 12, 8 and three years old and a 7-month-old baby girl.  The two oldest go to secondary and elementary schools.  Her husband’s a merchant.

She has a locale where she sells floral arrangements (flower shop).  She sells arrangements in different shapes, sizes, colors and prices.  She tells us that many customers make daily gifts of her products.  She works every day from 7am until 6pm.  The flowers are sent to her from the mountains, especially the roses, by a wholesaler that stocks her locale three times a week.  She’s been in business 12 years and has done very well.

This loan is to buy flowers.  She’s been in the communal bank for 8 cycles and she likes it because her business has grown a bit more with each loan.  Her dream is to have a locale of her own because she currently rents.

loans.use: to buy flowers.

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en:
Pascal is 27 years old and is married. 

He sells shoes. He has a year of experience and he currently employs two people to help him. He works from 7 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day except Saturday. 

Pascal has requested his first loan from Kiva partner via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more shoes for resale. With his profits, Pascal will reinvest in his business and save for his future.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Efigenia

texts.es:
Efigenia  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Virgen de la Asunción”, ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos (2 independientes).  Efigenia estudió solo la primaria.
Desde hace tres  años trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de  S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su anterior negocio de venta de comidas rápidas.  Actualmente se dedica a la confección de casacas.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de  S/ 2000.00 nuevo soles, comprará cuatro rollos de tela de todo color para elaborar tapices.  En el negocio trabaja junto con su esposo que se dedica a la costura, ella se encarga de venderlos en la ciudad de Cusco y Juliaca.
Su sueño es seguir operando en el negocio y tener más ingresos económicos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones, la puntualidad y la ganancia del ahorro.
texts.en:
Efigenia is a member of the communal bank "Virgen de la Asuncion" and it is located in the district and the province of Yunguyo, in the department of Puno. She is 45 years old, married, and she has 4 children (2 are independent). Efigenia went to primary school.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement (Kiva Field Partner) for the past three years. Her first loan was in the amount of S/500 nuevos soles and she invested the funds in her previous business, selling fast foods. Currently she produces jackets.

With this new loan, amounting to S/2000 nuevos soles, she will purchase four rolls of textiles of all colors to make hangings. She works on her business together with her husband. He is a tailor. She is in charge of selling the products in the city of Cusco and Juliaca.

Her dream is to keep managing her business and to earn more income.

She appreciates her communal bank, especially the meetings, the timeliness, and the interest earned on their savings.

loans.use: to purchase four rolls of textiles in all colors.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: These jerrycan containers are being used by Ekua to store palm oil. Ekua is a palm oil extractor. She also sells beans and "gari" (cassava couscous), which she has done for 12 years. She is married and has seven children. Her husband is a farmer. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Ekua will use the loan to purchase more palm fruits to process for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to reinvest for further growth.

loans.use: to purchase more palm fruits to process for sale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 26 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are in school. She has a business selling beauty supplies and clothes to her customers in Kator branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for six years. Jane requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She will use the profit for her business to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store and to pay for repairs to her husband's motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a sewing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years. Evelyn earns more income from a variety store. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase various tools for her sewing business.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase various sewing tools.

loans.name: Livinston Jahir

texts.es:
Livinston Jahir tiene 24 años, Es soltero vive con los padres en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. No tiene  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JOSE DE LOS AMARILLOS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Amarillos, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul, etc.

Livinston se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandúl. Compra sus productos en Comercial Murillo y los vende en la misma localidad.
El crédito anterio le a ayudado mucho para sembrar más hectarea de terreno y poder suplir las necesidades  al momento de veneder los productos y poder aportar para la alimentación y medicación de los padres.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas de maíz, arroz, frejol gandúl y compra de insumos, fertilizantes para los cultivos.   El crédito será de mucha ayuda para sembrar más hectarea de terreno y poder suplir las necesidades económicas al momento de veneder los productos y poder aportar para la alimentación y medicación de los padres y poder culminar los estudios. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima.
Su sueño es superarse y trabajar con dinero propio.

Le gusta andar en moto y disfrutar de las festividades del cantón.
texts.en:
Livinston Jahir is 24. He is single and lives with his parents in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios province. He has no children.

The 'San José de los Amarillos' community bank is located in Amarillos community, in Ventanas canton. The members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice, gandul beans, etc. Livinston is a farmer who grows corn, rice, and gandul beans. He buys and sells his products in the Murillo shopping area.

His previous loan helped him greatly in sowing more hectares of land and covering his needs until sale. It helped him to be able to provide food and medicine for his parents.

He is requesting this loan for buying corn seeds, rice, gandul beans, supplies, and fertilizers for his cultivation. This loan will be a great help for him in sowing more hectares of land and covering his needs until sale. It will help him to provide food and medicine for his parents, and to finish his studies. He faces challenges in his business such as insect infestations, plant disease and changes in the weather. His dream is to get ahead in life and to work with his own money.
He enjoys going for motorcycle rides and taking part in the canton's festivities..

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, rice, gandul beans, and to buy supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Portia

texts.en: Portia moves around to sell drinks, bowls, utensils and ladies bags in Elmina. Her husband is a driver. She responsibly takes care of her home. Her loan will be used to buy utensils and bags to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop.

loans.use: to buy utensils and bags to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a father of four who are between 13 and 6 years old and all schooling. He lives with his family in Kitale, Western Kenya where he carries out farming and produces milk and maize for the local market. He also runs a butchery business for additional income.

Joseph has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow that will help him boost his milk production and get income to make life better for his family members. He is focusing on running a farm of five dairy cows.

He too laments the high costs of feed and animal diseases as the major challenges in farming business.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Chantha (in the photo) and her husband, Nguon, have been married since 1979 and have six children - three sons and three daughters. One is married and lives outside the family home, three are garment workers and the other two are in school. The family lives in a village about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Chantha is a rice farmer and raises pigs at home. She has now quit the tailoring business. Her husband is a fisherman and also assists his wife on the farm. She is asking for another loan of $1,200 to purchase additional pigs to raise. She will also use another part of the loan to assist in her rice farm by buying seed and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy additional pigs to raise and to assist in her rice farm by buying seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Vilma Doris

texts.es: Vilma, se ha decidido a obtener otro crédito, debido a la necesidad de aumentar en sus ventas y porque se acercan las fiestas patronales y comprara: pollo, carne, chicharrón, verduras, el propósito de ella es vender más por las fiestas y obtener mejores  ingresos. Los préstamos anteriores le ayudaron mucho pues ahora tiene mejores ingresos y su familia vive en mejores condiciones que antes.
texts.en: Vilma has decided to obtain another loan because she needs to increase sales and because the local patron saint day festivities are approaching.  She will buy chicken, meat, fried pork, vegetables.  Her intention is to sell more because of the festivities and earn higher income.  The previous loans helped her much because now she has improved income and her family lives in better conditions than before.

loans.use: to buy chicken, meat and fried pork.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
Basilia es socia del Banco Comunal Señor D. Huanca, tiene 56 años, es madre D. 7 hijos, es socia D. Finca Peru desD. hace 1 año, anteriormente ella ya era socia D. Finca estuvo 3 años pero por problemas familiares se retiró.
Basilia tiene una Panadería en su casa, cuando hay ferias rurales va a vender su pan, gracias a los préstamos que Finca le da paga los gastos D. estudio D. sus hijos que están en la Universidad, le gusta las capacitaciones sobre todo el cuidado D. la familia a parte que aprenD. a ahorrar, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. harina, azúcar, manteca, levaduras y pasas para hacer wawas en estas fiestas próximas. Su meta es equipar su panadería y seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Basilia is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor D. Huanca”. She is 56 years old and the mother of seven children. Basilia has been a member of FINCA Peru for the past year. She previously was a member of FINCA for three years, but decided to leave because of family problems.

Basilia has a bakery in her home. Whenever there are rural fairs being held, she takes the opportunity to sell her bread. Thanks to the loans from FINCA, she has been able to pay for her children’s educational expenses at the university. Basilia enjoys the training seminars that focus on taking care of the family and learning how to save.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of flour, sugar, butter, yeast, and raisins so that she can make bread dolls for the upcoming festivals. Her goal is to equip her bakery and continue growing.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, butter, yeast, and raisins.

loans.name: Yorlady Aide

texts.es: La señora Yordaly a sus 37 años de edad, presta desde la sala de su casa servicios de juegos y entretenimiento desde hace dos años. Este negocio surgió cuando la señora Yordaly detectó en el sector la necesidad de este tipo de negocio. El conocimiento para esta idea de negocio lo adquirió de su anterior trabajo. La señora Yordaly desea comprar un equipo para juegos y dos televisores, lo que le permitirá tener mayor capacidad para atender más clientes e incrementar sus ingresos y posicionar su negocio. Con lo anterior, la señora Yordaly podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. La señora Yordaly sueña con colocar un local donde preste servicios de Internet y pueda brindar mejores servicios a sus clientes.
texts.en: Mrs. Yordaly, 37, has a room of her home for games and entertainment services for the past two years. This business came when Mrs.Yordaly detected the need for this type of business in her neighborhood. She acquired the knowledge for this business idea from her previous work. Mrs. Yordaly wants to buy game equipment and two televisions, allowing her greater capacity to serve more customers and increase her income and position her business. With that, Mrs. Yordaly will be able to improve the quality of life for her family. Mrs. Yordaly dreams of installing a facility that provides Internet service and can provide better service her customers.

loans.use: to buy x-box and two televisions.

loans.name: Clara Lourdes

texts.es:
Clara de 29 años, empezó hace 10 años atrás con un pequeño préstamo que le dio su familia y con estableció su negocio que con la ayuda de Dios fue creciendo.

Trabaja todos los días, empieza a las 6 de la mañana y termina por la noche. Su única dificultad es la delincuencia ya que el sector donde realiza su trabajo es muy peligroso.

Es madre soltera y con su esfuerzo sale adelante con sus 2 hijos de 8 y 5 años que estudian en escuelas fiscales.

Su meta es poder terminar de construir su casa y que sus hijos puedan terminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Clara, twenty-nine, started out ten years ago with a small loan from her family.  She opened her business, which, thank God, has been growing.

She starts work every day at 6 in the morning and stops at night.  Her one difficulty is crime; it's very dangerous in the area where she works.

Clara is a single mother, and with her own effort is succeeding with her two children, aged eight and five, who are in public school.

Her goal is to be able to complete construction on her house and for her kids to be able to complete their education.

loans.use: to buy clothing, jewelry, and nail polish.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo de 34 años, hace 5 años unió su vida a Medalit, la madre se sus 2 hijos Jean y Manuel. Wilfredo y su familia viven en la casa de su madre, en la localidad de Alto Sanchirio, en el distrito de San Luis de Shuaro, en la provincia de Chanchamayo. Trabajador y constante, Wilfredo se dedica a la agricultura. En sus 3 parcelas de terrenos productivos tiene sembrado café y plátanos. Las faenas en la selva son intensas, ya que las malas yerbas crecen con rapidez, es así que tiene que limpiar constantemente sus sembríos. De igual manera, el abonamiento lo hace 4 veces al año, llegando a invertir como 1000 soles en cada fertilización. Wilfredo ama su trabajo. Desde pequeño aprendió a desenvolverse muy bien en el campo. Ya lleva más de 10 años en esta actividad y ha tenido que afrontar problemas como las plagas, el mal tiempo y la baja de precios. Pero aún así continúa laborando. Deja atendidos sus cultivos para luego hacer los viveros de café, de los que gana como 400 a 500 por millar. Wilfredo es un hombre incansable. En sus ratos libres hace labores de carpintería como pulir maderas, y ayudante en construcciones. Es así, que piensa adquirir un carro de segunda mano para movilizarse desde su localidad hasta la ciudad de La Merced. Éste sería su préstamo número 5, que obtendrá de MFP. Se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Se siente contento y satisfecho con su banco comunal “Aroma de café”. Invertirá el dinero en la compra de bolsas de abonos orgánicos para la elaboración de viveros de café.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is 34 years old. Five years ago he joined his life with Medalit, the mother of his two children, Jean and Manuel. Wilfredo and his family live in his mother’s house, in the town of Alto Sanchirio, in the district of San Luis de Shuaro, in the province of Chanchamayo. 

He works arduously in the field of agriculture. On his three parcels of productive lands he has planted coffee and bananas. The chores in the jungle are intense, as weeds grow rapidly, and so you have to constantly clear the sown fields. He also has to fertilize four times a year, spending 1,000 soles each time. 

Wilfredo loves his work. From the time he was young he learned to get around in the field. He has more than ten years in this activity and he has faced problems such as pests, bad weather and low prices. But even so he continues working. He is clearing out the tended crops so that later he can make a coffee nursery, which earns 400 to 500 per thousand.

Wilfredo is a tireless man. In his free time he does carpentry work such as burnishing wood and helping out in construction work. So, he is thinking of getting a secondhand car so he can get about from his town to La Merced.

This will be his fifth loan through MFP. He promises to be punctual in his monthly payments. He feels happy and satisfied with the communal bank Aroma de Café. He will use the money from the loan to buy bags of organic fertilizers for the preparation of coffee nurseries.

loans.use: to buy bags of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza” está conformado por personas responsables y trabajadores que sacan adelante a su familia. La mayoría de los socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco y donde realizan sus actividades económicas. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”. 

Yanet tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera, ella nació en la provincia de Cusco departamento del Cusco y vive en la hermosa ciudad donde nació. Yanet es cosmetóloga y tiene un salón de belleza. En esta oportunidad Yanet requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como tintes, champús, peines, colorantes y otras cosas más.
texts.en:
The “Nueva Esperanza” (New Hope) community bank is made up of responsible and hard-working people who provide for their families.  Most of the group's members live in the city of Cusco and this is where they carry out their business activities.  Cusco is known for being a very touristy and commercial area.  It is also known for its traditional Inti Raymi festival and because it is home to one of the seven wonders of the world - Machu Picchu.

Yanet is 24 years old and single.  She was born in Cusco province, in Cusco department.  She lives in the beautiful city in which she was born.  Yanet is a beautician and has a beauty salon.  On this occasion, she needs a loan to buy work materials such as hair dyes, shampoos, combs, etc.

loans.use: to buy work materials such as hair dyes, shampoos, combs, etc.

loans.name: Daysi Elizabeth

texts.es: Daysi Elizabeth de cuarenta y cinco años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo; ella posee una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad granos básicos, pan , huevos, jabones, además vende producto típico como choco bananos y charamuscas; está ubicada en su residencia y tiene varios años de tenerla, se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en las ventas y ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque la tienda es la más surtida del lugar con producto de primera calidad, a muy buenos precios, pero sobre todo con un servicio excelente se caracteriza por su amabilidad con los clientes; Daysi es una mujer dedicada a la labor, emprendedora, siempre dispuesta a buscar nuevas oportunidades que le permitan superarse; uno de sus más grandes sueños es ver crecer su negocio, quiere invertir en insumos porque ya tiene mucha demanda pero no posee del capital suficiente por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, producto instantáneo, golosinas, pan, bebidas, choco bananos, jabones, etc. Daysi es muy responsable con una moral intachable, sabe que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: granos básicos, producto instantáneo, golosinas, pan, bebidas, choco bananos, jabones

loans.name: Maria Santiago

texts.en:
I have worked in the fabrication and sales of corn tortillas for five years. My customers are my neighbors who like to eat their meals with warm tortillas. My business has grown and my earnings have been sufficient to help pay for my childrens\' education and other family expenses. My idea is to start selling to other nearby communities, but I need to investment capital to hire others to help me in the production and distributing of the tortillas. Now, in the holiday season, people buy large quantities of tortillas and because of this I need to invest more capital.

Tengo cinco años de dedicarme a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas de maiz, mis vecinos son clientes ya que ellos prefieren comer sus alimentos con tortillas calientes. Mi negocio ha crecido y mis gancias han sido de bastante ayuda para pagar los estudios de mis hijos y los gastos de la familia. Mi idea es abarcar con ventas otras colonias cercanas a la mia, pero necesito capital para contratar otras personas que me ayuden a elaborar y entregar tortillas. Ahora en epoca navideña las personas compran tortillas en grandes cantidades es por eso que necesito invertir mas capital.

loans.use:
To purchase cornflour, water, firewood and other items

Harina de maiz, agua, leña y otros

loans.name: Yanti

texts.en: Yanti is a 31 year old mother of 2 children; a 9 year old girl and a 2 year old boy. She sells instant noodles, cigarettes and ice using a table in front of her house. Her husband, Aang, is a truck driver with irregular income. He usually earns $10/week. She really hopes to earn more income for her children’s education and to expand her business.

loans.use: Capital

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: H. Seng, 23 years old, is self-employed as a photographer and lives with his wife in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. He typically makes around $5/day from the business. Seng H. hopes the loan will assist him in the purchase of a camera and film for his new photography shop.  He hopes to use the money he makes in his new shop to send his children to university.

loans.use: To purchase a camera and film

loans.name: Luz Bella

texts.en:
Luz Bella is 27 years old, married, and 4 months pregnant. She lives with her parents in a neighborhood of the city of Caaguazú. She sells milk.

Her work days start at 4 AM, when she gets up to milk her cows. Starting at 6 AM, she goes out to sell milk to the homes and stores in the neighborhood and town. She distributes her milk using her bicycle, driving around all morning long. She owns 7 milk cows, and they produce around 40-50 liters of milk per day. The demand for her product is growing every day more.

Luz wants to buy a motorcycle that will allow her to get around easier, as with the passage of time, her belly will grow and it will be more difficult to distribute her product by bicycle. She is requesting a loan of $300 that she will use to buy the motorcycle.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer

Original loan description in Spanish:

Luz Bella, tiene 27 años, está casada y tiene 4 meses de embarazo, vive con sus padres en un pueblo de la ciudad de Caaguazú. Ella se dedica a la venta de leche de vaca.

Sus días laborales empiezan a las 4 de la mañana, cuando se levanta a ordeñar sus vacas, y a partir de las 6 sale a vender su leche a todas las casas y despensas de la zona y la cuidad. Ella reparte su leche montada en su bicicleta, y recorre toda la mañana. Posee 7 vacas lecheras, que producen aproximadamente entre 40 y 50 litros de leche por día, y la demanda de su producto aumenta cada día.

Luz desea comprarse una moto que le permitirá desplazarse mejor, ya que a medida que avance el tiempo y crezca su panza se le hará más difícil repartir su producto en la bicicleta. Ella solicita un crédito de $ 300 que lo utilizará para comprarse la moto.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Hana

texts.en: Some people think that only men can be farmers.  Hana proves this belief wrong. She is only 31 years old and joined SPBD when she heard about it from other ladies. Initially she bought vegetable seeds from the agriculture shop and started growing a garden. After three months, she started taking her vegetables to the market to sell and that is how she gets money to support her family.

loans.use: To buy chemicals and fertilizers

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty is 46 years old and sells fruits and vegetables in the Rodriguez market in La Paz, Tuesdays through Saturdays.

For the past 7 years Betty has lived in her brother-in-law's home, located in the Ballivián neighborhood, on the corner of Founier and Jose Chacón ro 550. She has two children that attend school. Betty's husband died 10 years ago.

Betty has worked in this business for 4 years. Previously she worked with other people, and this year she is independent. There is quite a bit of competition in the selling of fruits and vegetables, even within the same market. Betty is able to depend on her own customers, because of her excellent customer service she has been able to earn her customers' loyalty. She is now a supplier to Frigolin (an ice cream company).

The current loan is for the purchase of merchandise. The prices of fruit and vegetables depend on the season, quality, and demand. Betty doesn't have any negative credit history in the finance system. Please note that the photograph was taken at her place of business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Betty es una persona de 46 años de edad que se dedica a la comercialización de frutas y verduras en el mercado RODRIGUEZ de la Ciudad de La Paz, desde los martes hasta los sábados.

Betty vive desde hace siete años atrás en la casa de su cuñado, el inmueble se encuentra ubicado en la Zona Ballivián, Calle Jose Chacón ro 550 esquina Founier, tien dos hijos que asisten a la escuela, el esposo de Betty falleció hace 10 años atrás.

Betty trabaja en este rubro desde hace cuatro años, antes trabajaba junto a otras personas este año ya cuenta con su puesto independiente. Si bien existe bastante competencia en el rubro de comercialización de frutas y verduras, inclusive dentro el mismo mercado, Betty cuenta con clientela propia, ya que por su excelente trato logró consolidar la fidelización de sus clientes, ahora inclusive es proveedora de la Empresa Frigolin (helados).

El presente crédito es para la adquisición de mercadería, los precios de la fruta y la verdura dependen de la temporada, de la calidad y de la demanda de las mismas. Betty no tiene antecedentes crediticios negativos en el sistema financiero. Se hace notar que la fotografía sólo fué tomada al puesto de venta.

loans.use: Purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Makhmadsaid

texts.en: Makhmadsaid Alovaddinov lives in J.Rasulovsky. He is married and has four children. From an early age he spent a lot of time working in the Dehkan farm. He has worked in the business sphere for over 10 years and has a good education. Currently, he is the holder of a private business which fattens heavy animals. Makhmadsaid is guided by the principle that  work should bring both pleasure and financial support.  He would like a loan to help purchase more livestock.

loans.use: livestock purchase

loans.name: Olga's Group

texts.en:
Olga and Maria Alejandra have been part of the community bank “Solución” for the past four and three years respectively.  Olga is 34 years old and has seven children, meanwhile Maria Alejandra is 54 years old and has five children.  Both Olga and Maria Alejandra are single mothers.  They commented that in their community bank they have learned to save, to care for their families, to educate their children, to run their business, and how to bring in clients.  
Olga has sold desserts in the Nery Garcia public market since she was very young.  With this job Olga has been able to care for her children.  On the other hand, Maria Alejandra travels every Sunday to the market in Vinchos, a small town about an hour away from the town of Huamanga by bus.  There she sells fish, rice, sugar, fruits and vegetables.  Sometimes Maria Alejandra prepares and sells fixed meals at the market.  During the week she runs a business washing laundry.  
Both Olga and Maria Alejandra have requested loans of 600 soles with which they will buy, gelatin, sugar, cups, plates, fish, vegetables, fruits, and other types of grocery items.  
Olga is waiting to use her savings and build an adobe house.  Maria Alejandra will use her savings to par for medical care for her youngest son.  Eventually, she hopes to save enough to buy a minibus that her other son will drive.  
Olga’s dream is to start a new business selling plastic wares, the same as her sisters.  On the other hand Maria Alejandra dreams of buying a house in the center of the city where she can open a grocery store.  Where she lives now is far away and not a good place for a business.  Also, she would like to buy a small piece of land where she can grow vegetables.

loans.use: Both Olga and Maria Alejandra have requested loans of 600 soles with which they will buy, gelatin, sugar, cups, plates, fish, vegetables, fruits, and other types of grocery items

loans.name: Kireka A1 (Ii) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Fatuma M.. She currently runs a retail shop and is requesting a loan to increase stock. Fatuma is 37 years old and is married to a business man. She has 4 children ranging from age 21 to 1 and her children go to school. Each week, Fatuma makes approximately UGX 200000 in profits and with the increased profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a piece of land. Fatuma has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Fatuma is joined in her small group by Victo M., Sulaimah N., Zainah M., and Florence K.. Victo M. has a business in timber selling and wants to expand her business. Sulaimah N. is currently runs a charcoal sales business and wants a loan to purchase more bags of charcoal. Zainah M. operates a grocery store and wants to purchase more groceries. Florence K. is currently in the business of soda depot and is requesting a loan to purchase more crates of beers.

loans.use: To increase inventory in retail shop

loans.name: Busanzi East F Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Fatuma K.. She is currently in the business of running a restaurant and is requesting a loan to purchase more food and furniture. Fatuma is 35 years old and is married. She has 5 children ranging from age 3 to 20 and her children go to school. Each week, Fatuma makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy building materials. Fatuma has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 600000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Fatuma is joined in her small group by Jane N., Perepetwa K., Melisa N., and Mariam N.. Jane N. has a business running a hardware shop and wants to add stock. Perepetwa K. is currently operating a business in tailoring and wants a loan to purchase more cloth fabric. Melisa N. operates a restaurant business and wants to add to the business. Mariam N. is currently in the business of selling farm produce and is requesting a loan to boost business.

loans.use: To add working capital to restaurant business

loans.name: Asha's Utulivu Group

texts.en:
Asha is 35 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 14 and 18 years old. She and her husband also take care of 2 other children, ages 10 and 15 years old. Asha owns a small food vendor store, which she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 6am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Rhoda, who also has a business dealing in food vending.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Improve the site where he attends his clients

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina launched her business after her father-in-law became afflicted with a prostate ailment and needed money to pay for the treatment. She saw that natural remedies improved his health, and so she began to distribute these products.

That was February of 2001. Josefina became a distributor, hanging posters announcing not only that she was selling these products, but that she had witnessed their effectiveness. Today, she runs a support center out of her house, where she trains and prepares people interested in using the remedies and shows video testimonials of patients whose health has been improved by her remedies. She also travels to rural communties to promote her products.

Josefina needs a $400 loan, which she will repay in 4 months, to acquire more products. She will sell them in nearby municipalities, where her sales are highest. With your help, Josefina can continue to expand her business.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Josefina inició el negocio debido a la enfermedad de su suegro, ya que se enfermó de la próstata y necesitaban dinero para su tratamiento, fue así como se convertieron en distribuidores de estos productos naturistas.al constatar que su suegro comenzó a tomar dichos productos y tuvo mejoría en su salud.

Comenzó febrero de 2001, como distribuidora colocando posters donde anunciaba que además de ser distribuidores eran testigos de los beneficios de dichos productos. En la actualidad ya tiene un centro de apoyo en su casa donde capacita y preparo a la gente que se a iniciar y en donde organiza juntas con sus promotores y les muestra videos de testimonios de la gente que ha mejorado su salud; también recorre comunidades rurales en donde promociona los productos.

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $400 que pagara en 4 meses para adquirir mas productos y venderlos en municipios cercanos, ya que le han funcionado mejor las ventas en esos lugares. Con tu ayuda Josefina seguira haciendo crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Buy natural remedies

loans.name: Aniva

texts.en:
Aniva F., 33, is married with 2 children. She has many years of experience in the Samoan cocoa business. She sells to the public and villagers 3 days per week. She expects her weekly net profit to be 250 tala (approximately 104 USD).

She has one previous loan with SPBD. SPBD loans are Aniva’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She plans to use the loan to pay for her children's school fees and to buy cement and wood for home improvements.

loans.use: Pay children's school fees and buy cement and wood for home improvements

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Before joining the TYM Fund, rice farming was her primary focus and raising animals was secondary because she lacked the proper funds. Her husband, a military M., was also stationed far from home and her children were young and still attending school.

She joined the TYM Fund in 1994 and borrowed 200,000 VND for her first loan to purchase pigs for rearing. There was no profit from the first year of rearing pigs because she did not own many pigs. But the following year, with the help of money from the TYM Fund, she expanded the pig pen and purchased more pigs. Each herd of pigs she raises consists of 25 to 30 pigs and each year she raises 3 herds for income after operating expenses of about 25,000,000 VND. In this way, her family has been able to improve their financial situation - she has been able to purchase household items for her family and specially has even been able to purchase a piece of land (100 square meters) right on street 131, which will be convenient for business and trade in the future.

Currently, she is still raising pigs and chicken to further improve the family’s financial situation. In the pen, there are about 30 pigs preparing for economic conversion. Her husband is now stationed closer to home and receives a salary of 3,000,000 VND, which also provides a lot of support for her. Because of that, they are able to repay weekly rather successfully.

She wants to continue to participate in the Fund for a long time to raise money to improve economically. For this loan, she would like to raise 19,000,000 VND to invest in her animal rearing business. The family’s average income is 5,000,000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer.

Trước khi chưa tham gia Quỹ chị làm ruộng là chủ yếu còn chăn nuôi nhỏ lẻ vì không có vốn đầu tư chăn nuôi, hơn nữa chồng chị là bộ đội lại xa nhà, các con còn nhỏ và đang đi học. Năm 1994 chị vào quỹ và xin vay số tiền ban đầu là 300.000 đồng để mua lợn giống về chăn nuôi, năm đầu tiên thu nhập từ chăn lợn không có lãi là bao bởi số lượng chăn nuôi nhỏ. Những năm tiếp theo nhờ có đồng vốn của quỹ chị đã mạnh dạn vay với mức cao để mở rộng chuồng trại, mua thêm lợn giống về nuôi, mỗi lứa chị nuôi từ 25-30 con lợn và một năm nuôi 3 lứa cho thu nhập sau khi trừ chi phí khoảng 25.000.000 đồng. Nhờ đó mà gia đình chị ngày càng phát triển, chị đã mua sắm được nhiều trang thiết bị đắt tiền cho gia đình và đặc biệt chị còn mua được một mảnh đất 100m2 ngay mặt đường 131 rất thuận lợi giao thông và kinh doanh buôn bán sau này. Hiện tại chị vẫn chăn nuôi lợn gà để phát triển kinh tế gia đình, trong chuồng luôn có khoảng 30 con lợn chuẩn bị xuất chuồng. Chồng chị nay được đóng quân gần nhà và hưởng lương 3.000.000 đồng nên cũng hỗ trợ nhiều cho chị, do vậy việc hoàn trả tiền tuần rất thuận lợi.

Chị mong muốn tiếp tục tham gia quỹ lâu dài để vay vốn phát triển kinh tế. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 19.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình 5.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Rearing Pigs

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda is 48 years old, separated from her husband, she lives with her two children Ruth and Jhon. With great effort and many years Hilda opened a shoe shop and she has had this business for 12 years, and in that time she has learned the tricks of the trade, so to speak. The shoes that Hilda produces are sold in different markets throughout the city of Juliaca. The work is tiring, she works all day to produce the quantities that are needed, and thank God, she tells us, she can count on the support of her children and an assistant, to provide the help in making and distributing the shoes. What Hilda enjoys the most is creating new models, the most difficult is finishing the shoes on time for the orders that she has. Ruth and Jhon, her children, are the most important people in her life, the reason she gets up every day and works so hard to provide them a better life. With the money from the loan she will buy material that she is missing to produce greater quantities of shoe and in this way, with time she hopes to have a great shoe store.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Hilda tiene 48 años, está separada de su pareja, vive con sus dos hijos Ruth y Jhon. Con mucho esfuerzo y varios años de trabajo Hilda puso un taller de producción de calzado y se ha venido dedicando a este negocio desde hace 12 años, tiempo en el cual ha aprendido los gajes del oficio.Los zapatos que produce Hilda son vendidos en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad de Juliaca, el trabajo es cansado, trabaja durante todo el día para producir las cantidades que son requeridas, gracias a Dios, nos dice, cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y con un ayudante, el cual la ayuda en la elaboración y distribución de los zapatos.Lo que más le gusta a Hilda, es crear nuevos modelos, lo más difícil es terminar los zapatos a tiempo para los pedidos que le realizan. Ruth y Jhon, sus hijos, son la razón más importante, por la cual se levanta todos los días y trabaja a favor de darles una vida mejor. Con el dinero del préstamo comprará el material que le está faltando para producir más cantidades de zapatos y así, con el tiempo tener una gran tienda de calzado.

loans.use: Buy materials to make shoes.
